title: When a user is created we will create an object in Fedora to act as the users personal collection space.
description: As per the IR requirements when a user logs in they should see their personal collection.  To enable this we will create an object in Fedora everytime a user in Drupal is created (assuming if a user in Drupal is deleted we will keep the objects in Fedora???).   Using Drupal's hook_user we should be able to create the object in Fedora if Drupal is using LDAP or drupal based authentication.  We will have to create the collection using a user that is allowed to create collections so we will add an admin user text box to the admin interface.  This user will have to have the Drupal administrator role.

title: Create a script to install Islandora demo objects
description: Create a script to install some demo Objects.  These objects would include Collection Policies/Collection Views/Content Models etc. that Islandora module knows about.  This would be the first step in easing the install process of the islandora module (longer term it may be nice to have a installer script that installed Fedora/Drupal and the objects).  Currently a user has to install the module and then ingest and configure objects.  Adding the Collection Policy and Content Model objects/streams seems to be a sticking point for users after the module is installed.

title: Port to Drupal 6
description: Port the Islandora core code to Drupal 6.

title: update the Islandora drupal form api code to work with Drupal 6
description: update the Islandora drupal form api code to work with Drupal 6.  Drupal 6 has modified the Form API in non backwards compatible way.  Update Islandora code to work within Drupal 6

title: Update the Islandora drupal menu/path array's to work in Drupal 6
description: None

title: Clean up current code base (specifically IR stuff) and update Fedora Commons Islandora svn.  We will then use the Fedora Commons svn as the home for all Islandora code.
description: None

title: Ingesting Refworks item via the module breaks Refworks item format
description: Ingesting a Refworks item through the Drupal module creates a differently-formatted Refworks record than batch ingest. It doesn't strip the XML prologue, where batch ingest does.  This breaks the item view as the Refworks section is ont showing up.

title: view and edit by role xacml policy template file does not lock down api-m
description: The vew and edit by role xacml policy template will limit who can see the object but does not limit who can modify it.  Need a section for api-m in the policy template file.

title: Apply rules when adding a datastream to an object.
description: Modify the add datastream method to check for and execute methods specified in the content model.  For example, to generate a new TN datastream when a new PDF datastream is added to an object.  Similar behaviour to the ingest rules function, and using the same method and parameter XML specification format.  The thumbnail generation specification will look like this:          <datastream id="OBJ">             <allowed_mime_type>application/pdf</allowed_mime_type>             <add_datastream_method>                 <file>plugins/ImageManipulation.php</file>                 <class_name>ImageManipulation</class_name>                 <method_name>createThumbnailFromPDF</method_name>                 <modified_files_ext>jpg</modified_files_ext>                 <datastream_id>TN</datastream_id>                 <parameters>                     <parameter name="width">100</parameter>                     <parameter name="height">120</parameter>                 </parameters>             </add_datastream_method>         </datastream>

title: Add file extension to the end of datastream labels.
description: When ingesting an object or adding a datastream, the datastream label should contain the file exxtension that maps the mime type of the datastream, so that when the user downloads the file it will be named properly on their local file system.

title: Update ingest for to prompt for roles/users allowed to view/edit this object.
description: Update ingest for to prompt for roles/users allowed to view/edit this object.  Once we have a list of users and roles we can add them to the xacml policy template and then add the POLICY stream to the object

title: When a user has no roles in drupal the drupal servlet filter breaks
description: If a user in drupal does not have any roles in the drupal database the servlet filter will deny all access to objects in Fedora.  Maybe we should give them the same rights as an anonymous user.

title: When trying to add a datastream and Fedora says access denied we are not showing an error in Drupal
description: If the drupal user does not have the correct permission in Fedora to add a datastream there is no error message showing up in Drupal.  It seems like the stream was added.  In reality the stream has not been added.  We should give some sort of feedback to the user.

title: If the drupal servlet filter is configured to hit more then one database it may lock out users if even one of the databases are not available.
description: If the drupal servlet filter is configured to hit more then one database it may lock out users if even one of the databases are not available.  Even if the database is not the one your user is a member of.

title: Warning displayed when adding a datastream if there are no add datastream rules present in the content model
description: There is a foreach call that loops through the add datastream rules defined in the content model.  If there are no rules present PHP will generate a warning message, but the datastream will still be added.

title: modify/refactor edit_qdc_form and edit_qdc_form_submit to read the content model and call/build the appropriate form
description: modify/refactor edit_qdc_form  to read the content model and call/build the appropriate form.  Also modify the edit_qdc_form_submit function to read the content model so it can call the appropriate form handler function.

title: create a refworks edit metadata form.
description: need a form and form handler to edit the refworks stream.

title: Add documentation to the fedora commons wiki page.
description: None

title: In Fedora 3 Our itql query now returns more then one result for objects that have more then one CModel.  We want only one result  for the list
description: Our itql query now returns more then one result for objects that have more then one CModel, we get a row for each CModel associated with the object.  Since all Fedora objects now have a hasModel  of  info:fedora/fedroa-system-3.0 plus any others that are defined this is an issue for all objects.  We are basically only checking the CModel to see if it is a collection.  If it is a collection we create a different url then we do for plain objects.

title: In our sparql results we removed the xml namespace and create xslt to match.  We should put the namespace back and modify the xslts
description: In our sparql results we removed the xml namespace and create xslt to match.  We should put the namespace back and modify the xslts.   thsi would make the xslt more standard in relation to other sparql transforms

title: change links in SmileyStuff-COLLECTION_VIEW so that one will bring up the larger image (by clicking on the thumbnail) and the other goes to the details page.  Also remove <html><head><body> etc. from the xslt
description: change links in SmileyStuff-COLLECTION_VIEW so that one will bring up the larger image (by clicking on the thumbnail) and the other goes to the details page.  Also remove <html><head><body> etc. from the xslt.  these tags are already part of the page output

title: When ingesting an object with a relationship different then the defined relationship of isMemberOfCollection we need to specify this in the content model somehow
description: When ingesting an object with a relationship different then the defined relationship of isMemberOfCollection we need to specify this in the content model somehow.  For instance if we ingest an object into the demo:SmileyStuff collection now it will get the RELS-EXT of isMemberOfCollection to demo:SmileyStuff.  the QUERY stream in demo:SmileyStuff uses isMemberOf in the query so it will look like the newly ingested object did not go through correctly.  It will be in Fedora but the query will not find it.

title: Item views should include a link back to the object's collections.
description: Currently the item view does not show what collections an item belongs to, and the user must hit 'back' to get back to the collection.  If the user just went directly to an item they now need to look at the rels-ext to view an object's collections.  There should be a list, possibly in breadcrumb form, of each collection that the object is a member of.

title: error message on add datastream
description: error message generated when adding datastream (latest fedora3 branch as of this date) REVISON 244  error generated is "Error getting Datastream for fedora-system:FedoraObject-3.0 and ISLANDORACM"  opening Detailed List of Contents and hitting "ok" clears the error  Datastream upload seems unaffected by the generated error  minor bug

title: Make first ingest object form page optionally skippable.
description: Since the 'Audience' field should be removed, and the file chooser dialogue is not necessary for certain implementations, like MNPL and potentially refworks single record, there should be a way to bypass the first ingest screen  If the content model is pre-selected, perhaps from a drop-down menu on the collection page, or sidebar menu item to ingest only one type of object, then islandora should go straight to the second ingest form page.   This can be done by removing the label parameter to the ingest function and replacing it with an optional content model parameter.  If the content model is incorrect just display the first page as normal. If it is correct, and there is no need for a file chooser (specified as a flag in the content model) then skip the first page and increment  the form step variable.  If a correct content model is given as the menu item parameter but the file chooser dialogue is still necessary, hilight the specified content model as the default choice in teh content models drop-down on the item ingest form page 1.  Show a drop-down of available content models next to the 'ingest object into this collection' button when displaying a collection.  if content model has variable "display file chooser" set to true   display choose file dialogue   if first form has no elements   increment form_state['step']   call form_rebuild

title: ObjectHelper->fedora_repository_access doesn't use $account parameter.
description: The function fedora_repsitory_access in the file fedora_repository.module takes $account as its third parameter. This would allow it to check permissions for users other than the currently logged-in Drupal user.  However, it calls ObjectHelper->fedora_repository_access which does not have $account as a parameter and just gets the global $user variable instead.

title: Create FOXML definitions for initial demo objects
description: These demo objects should be able to be ingested into a fresh Fedora install by Islandora in PHP code or a command-line script.  They should include:  Top-Level Collection   - Demo Objects Collection Islandora:collectionCModel Content Model  Other example content models such as image, pdf, etc.

title: integrate islandora with the biblio module.
description: integrate islandora with the biblio module.  When a user wants to add a full text document to a biblio node it would be great if there was an option to ingest into fedora.  Chris Moyer from mobot would be interested in something like this.

title: allow batch ingest of files using Islandora
description: In some cases users may want to ingest several files at once.  In some cases these would be one object with multiple streams and in other cases each file may be an object of its own with minimal metadata created for the group of objects.

title: Change Djatoka Servlet Filter to check session key instead of password hash.
description: Currently the Drupal Servlet Filter checks the username and hashed password against the Drupal database. This change will use the less-sensitive session key, also stored in the Drupal database, instead.   It may be more worthwhile to look at the FeSL components to the servlet filter code that Mark Roy made and see if it's better to do that.

title: api class needs to check drupal permissions and catch errors
description: The fedora_item.php class does not check to make sure the user ingesting, purging etc. actually has the correct roles etc to do this.  Also the soap call should be wrapped in a try catch so we can give a better error message if something fails.

title: make itql paging smarter.
description: the current itql query just asks for all the results and then pages through them.  We should only ask for the results we need for that view.  The larger the resultset the more of an issues this will become.

title: Add Drupal permission checks to API SOAP calls
description: Right now calling the fedora_item class's soap_call function can result in a thrown exception that must be handled by the caller.  This should be changed so that the soap_call function surrounds the actual SOAP request with a try {} catch block, and reports an error using Watchdog and Drupal's standard error reporting, without throwing exceptions back into the Drupal code.  Also, the soap_call procedure should handle checking whether the current user has permissions within Drupal to perform the requested operation, and report an error if they do not.

title: Add Dublin Core handling to the API
description: Create a set of functions to more easily manipulate Dublin Core datastreams of Fedora objects.  - It should be able to read in and write out to XML, but use an associative array data structure internally for easier manipulation by API users.  - The API user should easily be able to add and remove elements from the DC structure.  - It should preserve blank DC fields for the sake of Islandora's metadata edit form generation functionality.

title: Create standalone tagging / comments module
description: Take the tagging code from the image rotator code and put it in its own module.  Then call drupal_get_form from the image rotator if and only if the current user has permission to add tags.  This should also be the place to put comment capabilities, hopefully responding to a drupal hook for viewing a fedora item.

title: Book module installer requires properly set-up Fedora connection
description: The islandora book module needs to add some content model objects and disseminators to the repository in order for it to function properly.  This means that it can't simply be enabled along with the Fedora_Repository module. The Fedora_Repository module must be installed first, and the site administrator must then configure the fedora connection before the Islandora Book module can be enabled.  The installer for the book module should check for a valid Fedora connection and if there isn't one, report an error and abort module installation.

title: Allow authenticated users to view repo content by default
description: Drupal administrator should enable permissions for users to view the fedora menu item and repository content.  "view" permissions should be enabled by default for authenticated users in the .install file.

title: Replace "ingest new object" icon with text
description: The ingest new object icon is not obvious at all - this should be a text link or a tab at the top of the page.

title: PDF thumbnail generation broken in MAMP
description: The PDF content model's code to generate thumbnails on ingest does not work on a default Mac OS X MAMP setup that doesn't also have ImageMagick installed.

title: Ensure default namespace for file attach is valid
description: Attaching a file with fedora attach seems to use a namespace of "default" which is not listed in the "allowed namespaces" list so default behaviour won't allow the creator to see the item after uploading.  UPDATE: There should be a separate text field in the admin settings form that lets the site administrator specify a specific pid namespace for items uploaded as node attachments.  This value should be automatically added to the list of namespaces users are permitted to see.

title: Create a generic content model and collection policy
description: If you create a new collection and don't specify a specific collection policy right now the collection object is created with no way to ingest new objects into it within Islandora.  We should make a new collection policy and content model that will allow any type of file to be added to the collection so people can use Islandora more flexibly.

title: Create a SimpleTest suite for Islandora basic functions
description: Create Drupal Simpletest test wrappers for basic Islandora repository functions like ingesting objects using various collection policies, adding and removing datastreams, testing roles and privileges to make sure user can't modify objects they don't have rights on, etc.  Progress so far:  Test wrapper sets up user with account pre-existing in fedora-users.xml file, so we can bypass the Drupal Filter. This is necessary because SimpleTest uses database prefixes and the drupalfilter isn't written to handle this case and would try and authenticate against the actual live site.  A new collection object is then created below the top-level collection, and verified that incorrect file types are not accepted.,  Subsequently a valid collection policy is ingested and then a PDF is ingested.

title: Minor warnings in imagemanip module
description: Notice: Undefined index: op in fedora_repository_image_manip() (line 36 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/fedora_repository/plugins/fedora_imageapi.module). Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in imageapi_image_close() (line 401 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/imageapi/imageapi.module). Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in imageapi_toolkit_invoke() (line 162 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/imageapi/imageapi.module). Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in imageapi_toolkit_invoke() (line 167 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/imageapi/imageapi.module).

title: MimeTypes: Files with extension .tif not being detected as "image/tiff"
description: Using the Slide CModel and derived content models, when attempting to upload a TIFF image with extension .tif the process will fail with error "Error following content model rules". Mime type detection is broken for this file extension.  Including "image/tif" as well as "image/tiff" as a workaround isn't working.

title: Minor warnings when adding a datastream to an existing object.
description: Go to an object that as a missing datastream and add the datastream. The following notices display after the datstream is added:  Notice: Undefined index: op in fedora_repository_image_manip() (line 36 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/fedora_repository/plugins/fedora_imageapi.module). Notice: Undefined index: submit in add_stream_form_submit() (line 264 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/fedora_repository/fedora_repository.module).

title: Fatal error when ingesting very large image
description: convert: sites/test.islandlives.ca/files/0001-132x52cm insert-58.5x26cm-lot1 no4-2.tiff: wrong data type 7 for "RichTIFFIPTC"; tag ignored. `TIFFReadDirectory'. convert: sites/test.islandlives.ca/files/0001-132x52cm insert-58.5x26cm-lot1 no4-2.tiff: Bogus "StripByteCounts" field, ignoring and calculating from imagelength. `TIFFReadDirectory'. convert: sites/test.islandlives.ca/files/0001-132x52cm insert-58.5x26cm-lot1 no4-2.tiff: Read error at scanline 2868; got 15676 bytes, expected 49680. `TIFFFillStrip'.  Fatal error: require_once() [function.require]: Failed opening required 'sites/test.islandlives.ca/modules/fedora3/' (include_path='.:/usr/share/php:/usr/share/pear') in /var/www/drupal/sites/test.islandlives.ca/modules/fedora3/fedora_repository.module on line 139

title: Minor warnings in IR module
description: The following warnings appear when going to the fedorair/ir page:  Notice: Undefined property: stdClass::$profile_name in IrClass->browse_by_name_form() (line 1964 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/ir/IrClass.php). Notice: Undefined property: stdClass::$profile_name in IrClass->browse_by_name_form() (line 1964 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/ir/IrClass.php). Notice: Undefined variable: output in IrClass->browse_by_department() (line 1996 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/f3/sites/all/modules/ir/IrClass.php).

title: confusing wording on step 1 of ingest form
description: On step one of the ingestform it says " A Content Model defines what is allowed in a collection and what to do with a file when it is uploaded (An example may creating a thumbnail from an image.)."  "what is allowed in a collection" isn't quite correct, since that is handled by the collection policy. I'm doing up some slides on what the various additions Islandora makes to Fedora's concepts of content models and collections and this text doesn't quite fit.

title: update documentation to include version of php required
description: Some users have experienced errors when installing Islandora on centos.  Centos installs an older version of php by default so we should mention the version of php that is required in the docs.

title: Create separate API module
description: To make it easier to get a presence on Drupal.org we should create a minimal functional module that is a wrapper for the Fedora API-A and API-M functions - this will also hopefully become a base for other people who want to use Drupal with Fedora without having to adopt all of our other customizations and serve as a base standard for using Fedora with Drupal.  Code is available from UPEI's svn at http://137.149.66.238/repos/fedoradrupalmodule/fedora_api

title: Fatal error when Fedora is not running
description: Fatal error occurrs when trying to access /fedora/repository page if Fedora is not running.  Should display a status message and be generally more helpful.

title: update documentation mentioning that there maybe a ulimit problem on sites that have a lot of searches.  This is related to quering gsearch.
description: gsearch may cause tomcat to crash with to many open file errors (ulimit errors).  Upping the os's open files limit can stop this.  This should be mentioned in the docs.

title: Undefined variable $action in ObjectHelper.inc
description: The following notice-level error message appears multiple times when viewing a fedora object:  Notice: Undefined variable: action in ObjectHelper->create_link_for_ds() (line 203 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/fullaccess/sites/8888.f3.local/modules/fedora_repository/ObjectHelper.inc).

title: Datastream labels contain URL-encoded characters
description: When ingesting a file with special characters in the file name, such as {}, the filename gets escaped to safe URL format, however this makes for ugly-looking datastream labels.  Perhaps they should only be escaped if they are pargt of an HREF, and unescaped (or left as-is) when being displayed on the screen.

title: Purge and replace datastream icons should be in separate table cells
description: In some Drupal themes the icons for replace datastream and purge datastream appear on top of one another instead of side-by-side.  This happens because they are in the same table cell, and the table row has been stretched to two lines high due to the length of one of the datastream labels.  These icons should be put into separate table cells each flushed to the right of the datastream list.

title: Content model methods need to specify module+file+class+function
description: The way content models specify a method to be run on display and ingest and edit metadata form creation lets you specify a file, a class name, and a function name. We also need to be able to set a module name, so that modules that don't live inside the fedora_repository folder structure can be specified.  The format should look like this:    <datastreams>     <datastream dsid="JP2">       <display_method class="IslandoraBook" file="book.inc" module="fedora_ilives" method="showFieldSets"/>     </datastream>     <datastream dsid="TN"/>  When parsing this markup the content model rules processor should then be able to specify the file to load by calling drupal_get_path('module', 'fedora_ilives') as the base of the file's path.

title: Ingest forms need to match new calling convention
description: The calling signature of buildIngestForm has changed, with the form_values parameter being dropped and only form_state being used.  Content models that have their own ingest and edit metadata forms need to be updated to match.

title: Add items to default allowed namespaces
description: In the admin settings form, defined in formClass.inc, change the default value for the list of allowed fedora pid namespaces to include values that the user may come across, especially islandora: demo: test: ilives: vre:.

title: Drupal variables not set on install
description: Variables like fedora_base_url are created when you go to Administer -> Site Configuration -> Fedora Collections List. However when the module is first installed these variables should be set to what we expect the default values to be, e.g., http://localhost:8080/fedora for fedora_base_url instead of just having them be blank.

title: Install guide should be aware of Fedora 3.4
description: The install guide should include a version of the install steps that correspond to Fedora 3.4's installer.  Also, a link to the Fedora 3.4-specific version of the Drupal Servlet filter should be included in a prominent place in the install guide so that users aren't trying to use the wrong / old servlet filter when installing the Drupal module against a Fedora 3.4 repository.  This ticket will be resolved when a user can follow the steps of the install guide using either Fedora 3.3 or 3.4 and successfully set up a repository site.

title: Document content modeller and staging area functionality
description: Please create a user-friendly document focused on how to enable and use Mark Roy's features that were added to Islandora.

title: Ensure all content models work with updated code
description: Ensure that all of the content models to ship with the next release work with the updated module code.

title: Create permission for detailed list of content
description: As discussed in committers meeting 09-02, we want to allow the administrator to hide or show the detailed list of content to specific users.

title: Update Islandora Guide for Sep 21 release.
description: The islandora guide should be compatible with the code slated for release on Sept. 21.  A user should be able to follow the guide end-to-end and end up with a working Islandora repository, including collections and content models.

title: Test run Islandora guide
description: Follow the Islandora guide from start to finish and ensure its correctness.

title: Clean up out-of-date source files
description: Go through the source files and directories and remove any files that are out of date and / or unused.

title: Move mnpl code out of module directory
description: Remove mnpl source code from the module directory as it exists in Subversion.   Determine the best place to store it and update once this is decided.  The MNPL module should be its own Drupal module so that it can be deployed in any directory.

title: Create simple README file
description: Create a simple README file in the Drupal module source tree that points to the Islandora guide and other documentattion.

title: Create communications related to the release
description: Put together documentation and other material related to the September release.  Also develop a plan for how to communicate to various mailing lists and other publications.  This should also include creating a download page on Islandora.ca and updating the Duraspace WIki page for Islandora to make the download link prominent.

title: Check that Fedora is running on each page load
description: Right now when Fedora is not running and a user visits a Fedora collection or item a lot of SOAP error messages are displayed.  The module should, before requesting any collections or Fedora datastreams, check that it can connect to Fedora and if it can't it should display a helpful status message to indicate that Fedora is unavailable.

title: update the drupal filter to work with a Drupal postgres backed database
description: Art Rhyno has update the drupal filter code to work with postgres.  He has sent us the files he has changed.  We need to do a diff and create a patch to apply to our code base.    I'll provide a link to Art's code whenever I can get back into groupwise (its down again).

title: Missing icons in content modeller
description: The icons used by the content modeller are not in the source tree.

title: Prepare download package
description: Package up the Drupal module code, DrupalFilter .jar files, ant script, README and documentation and make it available somewhere where we can inspect it before the release.

title: Clean up mime type handling
description: There are two mime classes, we should ensure that all references are to the newer one, MimeClass.inc. We should be able to delete mimetype.inc eventually.

title: when using the replace stream function for an ISLANDORACM stream get a white screen and stream is not updated
description: when displaying the detailed list of content and then choosing to replace a datastream it allows you to choose a file but then you can't add the stream (this maybe limited to inline xml streams have tried others yet).  This was down in a fairly new install so will check configuration but ingesting a new object works

title: Updated fedora_repository.module and ObjectHelper.inc to generate appropriate drupal breadcrumbs.
description: The fedora_repository_get_item method now calls ObjectHelper->getBreadcrumbs($pid) to get an array of breadcrumbs to send to drupal.   the ObjectHelper method does this by recursively calling the resource index to query for the parent items PID, and the title of the current PID.    It will recurse upwards until it hits  islandora:top (or whatever the fedora_repository_pid drupal variable is set to).

title: Refactor $pid function parameters to Fedora_Item
description: Currently when one function calls another the usual way to pass a reference to the Fedora object being manipulated is by pasing the PID.  A function that operates on this item will often have to do many similar operations, such as checking that the item exists and getting a list of datastreams.  We should change the function signatures in the chain of calls for retrieving a content model, finding the display / edit / update functions, etc. so that an already-instantiated Fedora_Item object is passed instead of just the PID.

title: Create release notes
description: Under the "What's new in this version" section of the README file and possibly also the download page we should outline the features that hae been added to the codebase recently. E.g., content modeller, datastream revisions, solr block.

title: Added a check for COLLECTION_POLICY in ObjectHelper.inc to display objects as a collection.
description: ObjectHelper now checks for a collection policy when displaying an object.   If a policy is found it is displayed as a collection.   Also eliminated the "Collection Description" fieldset which is redundant.  Also set the object list fieldset to not be displayed if it is empty.      If no COLLECTION_VIEW datastream is included in the object, then there will be no object list fieldset and the only discernible difference in how the object displays is the addition of an Ingest button which is useful for compound object models.

title: take advantage of fedora 3.4 now returning the correct filesize for managed content
description: Fedora 3.4 now returns the correct file size for managed content.  Create a new function get_datastream_info in fedora_item.inc and then call that from ObjectHelper make object so we can get the mimetype, size etc. with one soap call.  This fixes a long standing issue with quicktime and audio where quicktime would only play the first few seconds.

title: Edit metadata on DC stream causes a white screen on save
description: If you click on the edit metadata button in the description area of an object that has standard DC or QDC metadata, such as a strictpdf content model object, with no special metadata handlers defined in the content model, when you save the edits Drupal will whitescreen with the error:  Fatal error: require_once(): Failed opening required 'sites/test.islandlives.ca/modules/fedora_repository/' (include_path='.:/usr/share/pear:/usr/share/php') in /var/www/html/drupal/sites/test.islandlives.ca/modules/fedora_repository/ContentModel.inc on line 1134  It looks like the code in ContentModel.inc that checks if there is a custom handler, and if not calls the QDC handler, is not determining correctly that there is no custom handler and trying to load an empty file.

title: Add purge rules to the content model.
description: I was thinking it would be useful to add the option of including purge rules in the content model.   This would be handy for situations like if you were purging a book and wanted to recursively purge its pages or if you wanted to add a simple rule that would go through and remove it from the search index before purging, etc..  Let me know if you all think this would be a useful feature to add.  Mark

title: facets with special characters (such as ()) as part of the field name would not return results.
description: if a facet field name was something like Subject (Personal) it would not return results.  We are escaping the search words but not the field names.  Updated to escape the field names including the space character (we don't escape spaces in the striings we are searching for though).

title: Show "Performed conversion" message only to site admin
description: The message "Warning: XMLDatastream performed conversion..." is displayed on every page load when using the repository. This should either be hidden in a watchdog message or displayed only to the site administrator, as most users of the repository don't know what that means and can't do anything about it.

title: adding a datastream to an object fails.
description: It seems the the dsid is getting set to the index of the array instead of the value.  So all we are sending to Fedora is a number instead of the dsid we want.

title: Create a separate,generic book workflow from an iLives specific book workflow.
description: Create a separate,generic book workflow from an iLives specific book workflow.

title: Purging an object should go back to a node
description: If a fedora object is associated with a node, when an object is purged currently it goes back to a fedora collection view.  The redirect should go to the node that the object was purged from.

title: Change 'Ingest Object" icon text to "Ingest An Object"
description: When you are looking at a collection object, and have the rights to, you will see two icons: "Ingest Object" and "Purge Object".  There is a bit of an annoyance here - for 'purge object', the word 'object' refers to the collection object itself, but for 'ingest object', 'object' refers to a new object.  This doesn't feel right since the tow icons are next to one another.  I'm going to wait for feedback before implementing this. Please leave comments below.

title: when installing and setting up fedora the admin form can report a successfull connection to Fedora even if php soap does not exist.
description: As the module exists now a lot of the functionality still relies on soap calls.  Reporting a successful connection here is misleading as nothing else will work except this one page.  Most of the other sections white screen.  We probably should try a soap and rest call to make sure both types of connections work

title: MIME Type restrictions in collection policy not being enforced
description: IF you have a content model that restricts the MIME Types of objects that can be ingested into it, and you try to ingest an un-allowed object, the collection policy is not enforced.  For example, you can ingest a PDF object into the default top-level collection, who's collection policy only allows objects of type islandora:collectionCModel, e.g., text/xml.  This also causes a filed test in the module's Simpletest suite.

title: Allow site admin to enable / disable namespace restriction
description: Right now every Islandora instance enforces a restriction that the site's users can only view items whose PIDs have a namespace that is in the list of allowed PID namespaces in the site settings.  This causes problems with viewing of existing repository content, as well as breaks the content modeller functionality if you create an object with an 'unallowed' name.  The site administrator should have a check box, located just above the PID namespaces list, to globally enable or disable PID namespace enforcement.  Then where ever the check is done when viewing an object, before checking the list of namespaces, check if the site is doing this enforcement and if not, just allow the site to display any content.

title: PID Field shows top-level collection if empty
description: If the PID field is left blank on a node that has this as one of its CCK fields, the node display will still call the fedora/repository function to get the content to display.  The fedora_repository.module's default behaviour is to show the top-level collection if no parameter is specified.  In this case we don't want to do this - instead if the PID field is blank we should not show anything.

title: Add theming class naems for SOLR module
description: None

title: Add Ingest Form Interface
description: User should have the ability to ingest directly into a node.

title: /plugins/ImageManipulation.inc - error when ingesting using islandora:slideCModel and/or islandora:mapCModel
description: When ingesting using the slideCModel or mapCModel ... error is thrown.  I'm working with the "Souris Trawler Fleet" content.  Not sure if this is a fix, but I edited the ImageManipulation.inc file - line 101 - and change that line from this:    exec("convert {$file}[0] -thumbnail x2000 -thumbnail x450  -resize '450x<' -resize 50% -fuzz 1% -trim +repage -gravity center -crop 200x200+0+0 +repage -format jpg -quality 100 $file-tn.jpg", $output, $returnValue);         to this    exec("convert \"{$file}\"[0] -thumbnail x2000 -thumbnail x450  -resize '450x<' -resize 50% -fuzz 1% -trim +repage -gravity center -crop 200x200+0+0 +repage -format jpg -quality 100 \"$file-tn.jpg\"", $output, $returnValue);      That seemed to take care of the error. Could a developer review?

title: Convert old-style content model and collection policy streams
description: There are some .xml and foxml files in the module's source code that follow the old-style schemas. These should all be found and replaced with the equivalent new-style schema-based documents.  The way to do this is to load in a file, either ingesting the foxml file directly, or creatinga  new collection object and attaching a COLLECTION stream or by creating a new object and attaching the file as the ISLANDORACM stream..  Then navigate to the object in Drupal and if you see a message like   "Warning: XMLDatastream performed conversion of 'islandora:61/COLLECTION_POLICY' from old schema. Please update the datastream. The new datastream contents are here."  For a collection policy object you will see the message when you try to ingest a new object into the collection.  Click on the link and copy the code in the pop-up.  Then replace either the ISLANDORACM or COLLECTION_POLICY stream content with the new string you just created.  Then save the updated file in the source tree and check in the result.  If it came from an foxml file then you will need to export the object using the fedora admin client and replace the foxml file in the source tree.

title: Problems with bypassing SOAP
description: In ObjectHelper::makeObject there is a new setting which sends a request directly to fedora on port 8080 if the user is not logged in and there is no variable set to override the behaviour (forceSoap).  This does improve performance but there is no way to know on the drupal site if the Fedora server is firewalled off from the outside world, which would cause all of these requests to fail.  We should change the default value in the function signature from FALSE to TRUE then we can still improve performance on most public sites while not affecting behaviour on existing VREs and other sites with greater security needs.

title: Migrate scholar module to Solr
description: Right now the scholar module uses Lucene / Gsearch for its search function.  We should do whatever steps need to be done to replace this back-end component with Solr.  This will enable things like simpler RSS syndication of search results, and enable faculty to put feeds onto their own sites, etc. using an RSS stylesheet and Solr's built-in XSL plugin.

title: Orphaned nodes found and presented to user for setting to delete/purge
description: Through a view, users access all orphaned objects and can set them to delete (or purge them?)  Is a separate admin permission. Needs discussion.

title: When uploading a file with an & in it ... ingest breaks
description: The ingest file names need to be URL encoded...

title: Solr module: config page help documentation
description: The help text for the form element labeled "The fields to use for facets" indicates it wants a space-separated list of facets.  This is WRONG.  It should be a comma-separated list.

title: Multi-word field-specific queries
description: Multi-word field-specific queries aren't being constructed correctly in the solr module.  We need some preprocessing of search terms.  Example Query: Field: Full Text Query: Rock the Common  the solr module constructs a query with q="dsm.text:Rock the Common"  We can add solr's debugQuery option and see how the query breaks down:    "rawquerystring":"dsm.text:Rock the Common",   "querystring":"dsm.text:Rock the Common",   "parsedquery":"dsm.text:rock dc.description:common",   "parsedquery_toString":"dsm.text:rock dc.description:common"  in this case,  -the first word "rock" was queried against the selected field -the second word "the" was recognized as a stop-word and cut -the remaining term was not assigned a specific field, and was therefore queried against dc.description because that field is indicated as the <defaultSearchField> in our solr's schema.xml.  I think we should pre-empt this default break-down by exploding query terms except where quotation marks are used.

title: Quotation Marks not handled correctly in Solr module
description: Quotation marks are not being handled correctly in solr queries.  Quotation marks would be used to do multi-word phrase queries, but they appear to be getting doubly URL-encoded in query string rendering them "inert".

title: Enable boolean-OR junction in solr search module
description: This was never done.  Though there are some comments in the code suggesting this'll take a lot of legwork, I'm convinced it's actually quite simple now.

title: Deliver SOLR results in Media RSS format
description: We want to be able to display Fedora content using third-party image galleries, such as CoolIris among others. Most of these programs consume an RSS feed of items and display them using Flash or HTML 5.  We should be able to generate Solr search results in Media RSS format, using the TN for the image at minimum, or for specific content models we could make assumptions about other image or sound or video datastreams being present.  The PHP Solr library can be used to generate these results in much the same way we generate HTML results at the moment.  It could even be a mere format=rss parameter attached to the search results page.  An example of Media RSS format is here: http://www.cooliris.com/developer/reference/media-rss/

title: Search Term Highlighting
description: Build in support for search term highlighting.  Highlighting parameters are here: http://wiki.apache.org/solr/HighlightingParameters  Basically thinking  -make highlighting a boolean option (ht=true),  -a form element for highlight field list (hl.fl=<field1>,<field2>),  -require field match (hl.requireFieldMatch=true),  -probably set the html element in which to wrap the highlighted elements (hl.simple.pre/hl.simple.post),  -and also probably merge contiguous fields (hl.mergeContiguous=true).

title: Solr Results Sorting
description: Incorporate support for basic resultsset sorting.  This would involve a configuration option requesting a list of sortable criteria, plus a boolean option to sort, or not to sort.

title: Facet exclusion
description: For any potential facet value, it should be possible to require its *exclusion* as well as its inclusion.  Presently we link to facet values for their requisite inclusion.  A new way would involve plus/minus symbols for inclusion/exclusion respectively.

title: Move warning messages to system status page
description: Messages about things like Fedora not being available, ImageMagick / Kakadu not being installed or available, the openlayers image viewer not being available, should be displayed in Drupal's system status page. That's the page you go to when Drupal reports "one or more problems have been detected with your Drupal site."  This keeps an administrator aware of these problems without presenting them to the user, e.g., on every page load.

title: Make Collapsed Collection the Default
description: At the top of every collection view, the "Collection Description" fieldset is expanded by default.  Could it be collapsed by default?

title: Create availability check for SOLR in hook_requirements
description: Create a function that implements hook_requirements in the SOLR search block module, following the format of the fedora_repository_requirements() function in fedora_repository.module and fedora_ilives_requrements() in ilives/fedora_ilives.module.  Note that if you want to include requirements that can stop the install process, the function needs to be placed in a .install file.  See documentation for hook_requirements() here: http://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/developer--hooks--install.php/function/hook_requirements/6

title: Consolidate large image support into single module
description: Right now the core Islandora code has the large image content model available to it, but the user may not want to deploy the iiv viewer or djatoka.  Also it's harder to discern responibilities for content models and service definitions and deployments if we aren't sure that the basic ones are installed or not.  We should make a separate module that can ensure that djatoka, kakadu, etc. are available, installs the viewerSdep, etc. Fedora objects, and must bee present to enable any other module that depends on the large image viewer, e.g. the book module.

title: build_solr_search_form() has unused and non-working code
description: The function build_solr_search_form() -- which creates the field-specific query form -- has code attempting to pre-populate the form with values from the current search.  But this code depends on arguments which we never pass.  Moreover, it doesn't work anymore, following changes to the query structure.  IslandoraSolrResults.inc:269

title: Explicitly specify Drupal 6.x in docs
description: Now that Drupal 7 is out of beta drupal.org has switched to guiding users to download the 7.x version of Drupal.  We need to explicitly state in our install docs and the guide that they should download the latest version of the Drupal 6.x branch.

title: Create the first basic image collection module
description: Take Smiley collection, strip smiley stuff,  then add support for additional image formats on ingest. Needs to be packaged for convenient use

title: Eliminate getStream calls to non-existant datastreams
description: We've been discussing the large size of the Fedora logs and one of the causes of this is Fedora's behaviour where it will print a stack trace when a request for an object or datastream that doesn't exist is received.  There are some places in the code where getStream is called to retrieve collection QUERY, QDC, COLLECTION_VIEW, COLLECTION_POLICY streams, and if the datastreams don't exist the code just checks for 'null' and moves on.  Instead it should instantiate a Fedora_Item object, and check in the list of datastreams for the desired datastream, and only if it is there should it get the stream's contents.

title: update datastream via gui fails on datastreams that aren't inline
description: Attempting to update/replace a datastream that is NOT inline content fails with the following error ..... fedora.server.errors.GeneralException: Only content of inline XML datastreams may be modified by value. Use modifyDatastreamByReference instead.  May be a fairly simple fix placing a conditional with a call to the additional function.   There is also an error with the label being blank or just a file extension after update

title: Servlet filter installer breaking
description: Installer has broken three times Peter Lux has tried to use it. I don't have the error message for the break, but would like to know if we should strip the installer out of the zip on islandora.ca, or if this is an easy fix.

title: Object with just 1 datastream breaks showStreamInFieldSets
description: If you create an object, which gets a DC stream by default, but add no other datastream, the page rendering will show what appears to be three blank datastreams with no labels, which go nowhere.  Adding another datastream makes the object display as normal.

title: Update ObjectHelper.inc to remove getStream and getMimetype methods
description: This is a ticket moved from RedMine since it belongs here. --- After Alex did the merge, I updated ObjectHelper removing much of the functionality that was available in the API (in fedora_item.inc).  Optimally, there should be no soap calls outside of the API.  All references to ObjectHelper::getStream and ObjectHelper::getMimetype should be replaced with Fedora_Item::get_datastream_dissemination and Fedora_Item::get_mimetype_of_datastream There is a fairly extensive list of places where these methods are still called, which is why I did not update them myself when I was updating ObjectHelper.  Once the function calls are updated to use the API throughout Islandora, these methods should be removed from ObjectHelper.  I opened this ticket so that if somebody were feeling adventurous they could make the updates. I may still do it myself if/when I have time next week.  Mark Roy

title: Default collection query hides objects with no content model
description: I sent this as an e-mail earlier but am putting it in as a ticket since others confirmed that it should be treated as a bug.  I noticed that the getrelateditems query will only return items that have a content model attached to them  If I run the following commands   # Create a new blank object with pid test:100  curl --user fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin -i -X POST localhost:8080/fedora/objects/test:100?label=test  # Add an isMemberOfCollection relationship to test:100 pointing at islandora:demos  curl --user fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin -X POST localhost:8080/fedora/objects/test:100/relationships/new?subject=info%3afedora%2ftest%3a100\&predicate=info%3Afedora%2Ffedora-system%3Adef%2Frelations-external%23isMemberOfCollection\&object=info%3afedora%2fislandora%3ademos\&isLiteral=false   This item will not show up in the collection view of islandora:demos.  However if I add   # Add a content model relationship to test:100 curl --user fedoraAdmin:fedoraAdmin -X POST localhost:8080/fedora/objects/test:100/relationships/new?subject=info%3afedora%2ftest%3a100\&predicate=info%3Afedora%2Ffedora-system%3Adef%2Fmodel%23hasModel\&object=info%3afedora%2fislandora%3acollectionCModel\&isLiteral=false  Then it will show up.  Is this what we want?  I don't remember discussing making this explicit. It's nice to have access to the content model of an object from within the collection view, for sure, but how can we get around the case where the query won't return?   The default collection query if none is attached to the collection object is now:  select $object $title $content from <#ri>                              where ($object <dc:title> $title                              and $object <fedora-model:hasModel> $content                              and ($object <fedora-rels-ext:isMemberOfCollection> <info:fedora/islandora:demos>                              or $object <fedora-rels-ext:isMemberOf> <info:fedora/islandora:demos>)                              and $object <fedora-model:state> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#Active>)                              minus $content <mulgara:is> <info:fedora/fedora-system:FedoraObject-3.0>                              order by $title  Which produces the results:  "object","title","content" info:fedora/islandora:largeimages,Large Images Collection,info:fedora/islandora:collectionCModel info:fedora/islandora:pdf_collection,PDF Collection,info:fedora/islandora:collectionCModel info:fedora/test:100,test,info:fedora/islandora:collectionCModel with test:100 not included in the results if it doesn't have a content model relationship.  -------    While could be a useful feature to know the content model of a collection item when viewing that item, e.g., for sound preview widgets, etc.,no shipping collection view does anything with this information.  It presents an unnecessary confusion to the user that the object they just added to a collection is still not showing up in that collection.  It is perfectly reasonable to create a custom collection view which does make use of the member objects' content model, but in that case a custom QUERY stream can be attached to a collection along side the custom COLLECTION_VIEW, while not affecting the default behaviour of the interface, which is to more or less reflect what a user has in their repository - fleshed out or not.

title: Fix alignment of datastream download button
description: The datastream version drop-down and the Download button in the Detailed List of Content view are not vertically aligned the same way as the other cells in the table, making it look awkward.  The HTML generated by the ObjectHelper::get_formatted_datastream_list function should be tweaked to fix this.

title: book installer breaks if fedora_repository not already enabled.
description: ilives_enable assumes that fedora_repository module is already enabled.  However the chain in which modules are enabled in Drupal doesn't take into account the order that modules are dependent on one another. The only assumption made is that both modules will be available once the install process has completed.  We need to remove any code in the fedora_ilives.install file that depends on Fedora.

title: Merge zacho/islandora_solr_search and with ajstanley/islandora_solr_search
description: Merge zac's UI improvements and code fixes with Alan's admin refactoring.

title: Override namespace restriction in settings.php
description: While there will now be the option for a Drupal site admin turn off namespace restrictions, we should have a setting in settings.php that will block this option from being changed.  So in the admin settings page, we need to set the 'enabled' status on the checkbox widgets based on this variable not being there.

title: Re-examine CHILD_SECURITY and canIngestHere
description: The canIngestHere function needs to look for CHILD_SECURITY and restrict if a user can ingest into a collection depending on this policy.  Ensure that the various use cases for ingesting, and editing of collections are all available and that the end-user (e.g., repository builder) has a clear understanding of what is going on.   ______  Update: Instead of using a policy stream as a template, we should include a list of roles that can ingest the items into the collection in the COLLECTION_POLICY.  Probably something to add to the content modeller as well.

title: Add collection bulk operations
description: Convert collection view to a tabs-based view. Then add an edit tab where the items in a collection are displayed as a list instead of using the collection view xslt. Then add checkboxes and operations for performing an operations on multiple objects, e.g., delete, purge, etc.

title: Override or filter resultset field list
description: It would be nice to be able to excise values from the output field list set in the request handler (typically).  Typically we're been setting an exhaustive return field list in the request handler.  (These would be the untokenized fields related to a given project).  Users and site administrators might want to change or reduce that list.  For instance, it's required that we have PID as a returned field in order to construct links to fedora objects, but we don't necessarily want to display these.  Possible solutions include: * post-processing of results against a configurable list. * overriding the "fl" param in the solr query.

title: Separate content modeller, workflow, and FeSL module from Islandora tree
description: We should move the .module and ContentModeller folder out of the Islandora folder structure so that it can be downloaded and installed separately.

title: update documentation to add information on how to configure the drupal filter when using fesl authn
description: None

title: update sample drupal filter xml file so that the sql is correct.
description: The sample file in git hub has incorrect sql

title: adding List/table view tabs to Solr search results
description: We'll need more comments from Peter Lux on this. Thinking about showing search results on tabs.

title: Enhance admin page in our solr module to test url validity and repopulate the requesthandler dropdown without having to save form first.
description: The admin page currently checks url validity, and populates the requestHandler dropdown based the saved variable values.  The page should update dynamically, allowing the user to determine the validity of his or her choices before submitting and saving their values.

title: Remove solr url field from Fedora Admin
description: Since the solr search has been moved to an external module, the fedora_solr_search_url variable is no longer used in our core code. It should be removed from our admin page.  Since the change is very small, this would be a good time to get rid of the many lines of code which have been commented out.

title: We use the get call from the old rest api in a couple of places.  One is makeObject.  These should be updated to use the new rest api.
description: We use the get call from the old rest api in a couple of places.  One is makeObject.  These should be updated to use the new rest api.

title: Consolidate Islandora guide, training guide, any other documentation into a master
description: Decide which of the two guides is a better starting point, based on trying to go through them and follow the steps, and then incorporate the most useful parts from the other into a single master document.    Then establish a mechanism to keep the guide updated when changes are made to the module.

title: Change 'content modeller' et. al. to US spelling
description: The Drupal coding guidelines say to use US spelling in code and documentation. We should update the Islandora code to reflect this, most prominently this shows in the name of the islandora content modeller module, so we should start there.  http://drupal.org/coding-standards

title: Warning message appears when ingesting an object.
description: When navigating to: http://jira-issues.dev/fedora/ingestObject/islandora:largeimages/Large%20Image%20Collection  The following warning is generated:  Strict warning: Non-static method DOMDocument::loadXML() should not be called statically, assuming $this from incompatible context in CollectionPolicy->convertFromOldSchema() (line 232 of /Users/nbanks/Sites/Drupal/sites/jira-issues.dev/modules/fedora_repository/CollectionPolicy.inc).

title: Error displayed when enabling Islandora Modules.
description: The following error is displayed when a user enables all the Islandora Modules.  Steps to repo: 1. Enable all required modules required by Digital Repository. (Will take multiple submits) 2. Submit. 3. Enable Digital repository. 4. Submit. 5. Enable the following modules simultaneously:  Fedora Attach  Fedora ImageAPI Islandora Book Islandora Content Modeller Islandora Form Elements Islandora NMLT PID Field   6. Submit. 7. Notice the reported Error.  Error: "The following modules must be enabled for this import to work: pidfield. Exiting. No import performed."

title: PHP Fatal error when domain name is unresolvable by fedora
description: When I was installing Fedora I setup Fedora and Drupal on a virtual machine and put the virtual machine IP address in my hosts file as vm0. When I tried to ingest the demo objects I got the "white screen".    In my Apache log:  [Mon Feb 07 11:18:06 2011] [error] [client 192.168.56.1] PHP Fatal error:  Call to a member function appendChild() on a non-object in /var/lib/drupal6/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc on line 149, referer: http://vm0/drupal6/admin/settings/fedora_repository/demoobjects  In Drupal after the white screen:     * Error trying to call SOAP function addDataStream. Check watchdog logs for more information.     * warning: DOMDocument::loadXML(): Empty string supplied as input in /var/lib/drupal6/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc on line 137. title: When Fedora startup aborts, Islandora will report it as running
description: If Fedora start fails for some reason, e.g., can't connect to the database, when you navigate to the fedora web interface, e.g. http://localhost:8080/fedora/, The Fedora servlet will be running but will print an exception.  The mechanism Islandora uses to detect if Fedora is running, used to print a status message in Drupal, will load this faulty page and assume Fedora is running.  We need a more sure-fire way to detect that Fedora is running properly.

title: Breadcrumb breaks on top-level collection
description: If a collection has no parents it will cause the breadcrumb display to show multiple separators and then the object at the end.  There is a problem where it is looping, not finding any parent objects, but printing the separators anyway.  It needs to properly show the top-level collection. Also the 'Home' link goes to the Drupal site's home page, without a reference to the top-level collection when looking at sub-collections. The link to the repository root should appear in the breadcrumb list.

title: Make solr pager a real drupal-esque pager
description: Our basic Solr results pager is, well, basic.  Purpose of this ticket will be to determine the work involved in building a fully drupal-esque pager to replace the simple prev and next buttons, and either implement or determine it's not worth the work.  This also relates to the still-open ticket ISLANDORA-129 - to add drupal-ish css classes to our solr output.

title: Package the Newspaper Collection Module (Enhanced)
description: Please provide a time estimate for packaging the Islandora Newspaper Collection Module (Enhanced) and enumerate potential issues.

title: Add ingest functionality to the newspaper collection module (enhanced)
description: The current newspapers:pageCModel and newspapers:issueCModel do not support the ingest of new objects into newspaper collections within the UI. To fully flesh out this content model, ingest needs to be added.

title: Create documentation for the Islandora Newspaper Module (Enhanced)
description: Once Alexander has packaged the Islandora Newspaper Collection Module (Enhanced) it will have to be documented. I have attached preliminary documentation about the current newspaper functionality. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

title: Pull out old modified *DisplayResults() functions and insert them into modular configuration profiles
description: Under the new solr configuration profile model, all those content-model-specific displayResults customizations are no longer available.  Better to pull them out and wrap them in plugin modules so they may be accessible as configuration profiles.

title: solr search form (and perhaps the original search too) errors out if the first input box doesn't have a term
description: When a user only inputs a search term in the second input box, but nothing in the first input box ... the search errors out.   Screen shot attached.  Donald

title: Using Doxygen Style Comments in our Code
description: I would like to see us try to use Doxygen style comments in the code as we move forward. They aren't too hard to create when developing a new piece of code, and they allow up to date documentation about our code. There is some code that is currently using a little bit of doxygen commenting, but it would be nice to have it standardized. Perhaps something doesn't get committed unless its documented.  I started a bit of a wiki page about the documentation here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA/Coding+Standards+and+Commenting+*draft*  I took api/dublin_core.inc and marked it up using Doxygen comments. The comments aren't all accurate, since I wanted to use @throws to show how to denote exceptions and other features.   I have included the dublin_core.inc file. The doxygen configuration file Doxyfile. A tar with the generated HTML documentation, and a PDF of the generated documentation.  I also attached refman.pdf which was generated using our current code base using the option in doxygen to try to extract as much information from undocumented files as possible.

title: Adding support for Druapl Private file systems
description: In adding Islandora to the existing JWA drupal we ran into the issue where Islandora doesn't support private filesystems.   It would be a nice feature to be able to support private drupal filesystems and I don't think it would be that hard, we would just need to call file_create_url to get a publicly accessible file url to ingest into fedora. I haven't looked into the code though, so I'm not sure there may be something I'm missing.

title: Treat collections as content models
description: This is a requirement of ISLANDORA-171, because that ticket required giving the user the ability to view other aspects of a collection besides just looking at an XSLT-rendered view of its items. We needed a new view of the items that could allow _alter hooks to slip in their own options in an analogue to Drupal's Views Bulk Operations module.  The current approach, which treats every object like it might be a collection, has caused several long-standing problems.  - QUERY and COLLECTION_VIEW datastreams were requested on every page load, whether an object was a collection or not. This fills up Fedora's error log with stack traces and is an unnecessary couple of server-side http requests for the majority of objects in a collection  - Book objects, which have related page objects, but we normally don't want to look or act like collections, will still show a grid of page thumbnails below the proper book view interface.  This is ugly and required us to create a special ilives_book_viewer menu item for the ilives project, when we could have just used the standard content model ShowFieldSets workflow.  - Detailed List of Content, Add Datastream forms, purge and ingest buttons, DisplayFIeldSets output and collection items all appear vertically on the page, some in collapsed fieldsets, and some not. This makes for a cluttered interface.  Adding yet another function related to collections into this current framework would have just compounded the ugly look and feel of such an item view.  Required changes are:   - Turn CollectionClass.inc into a full-fledged content model, with a DisplayInFieldsets function that performs the collection query and COLLECTION_VIEW rendering.   - Allow a content model to contribute one or more tabs to the final rendering of an item. This way we can have one tab for the standard view of a collection, and another tab for the manage / bulk operations view required by ISLANDORA-171.   - Create a class, FedoraObject, that is a content model class for effectively every Fedora object. This will create a tab where we will put the Detailed List of Contents, purge, etc. buttons, and Add Datastream form. Typically this tab will only be visible to users with elevated privileges, and be the equivalent to a Fedora Admin Client view of an object.  This has the added nicety of removing yet another special case that we've had to work around - having to ignore some content model relationships and not others.

title: Create hook so solution pack modules can declare required fedora objects
description: We have had problems in the past when pushing through changes to content model streams. It was necessary to manually check if a particular repository had an older version of an ISLANDORACM stream attached to its content models, and if so to manually replace the stream.   There should be a hook invoked by the core module, hook_required_fedora_objects, that asks any solution pack modules if they specifically need any objects to be present in Fedora in order to function properly.  If they aren't there the user should be given a link to the install demo objects tab of the admin setting spage, where they can install or update the missing object(s).  Modules that implement this hook can optionally include a version number in their return array,.  Islandora will then alert the user if a particular object has an out-of-date ISLANDORACM or COLLECTION_POLICY stream.  This functionality is required for properly functioning solution packs

title: Standalone newspaper drupal module
description: Requirements are:  Take the existing Newspaper.inc file, which defines the newspaper content model, and add .module and .install files to make a place for a fedora object install hook and any other cutsom code relating to newspapers.

title: the default collection view breaks when dealing with diacritics
description: When working with a collection of digital objects that include diacritics (french), the collection view didn't render properly.  I loaded another collection view used by another project and that 'solved' the display problem. I think the default collection view xslt ( https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/master/xsl/sparql_to_html.xsl ) needs to be updated.    They are slightly different.  For example in the default xslt there is this code ...  <xsl:attribute name="alt"><xsl:value-of select="$newTitle" disable-output-escaping="yes"/></xsl:attribute>  but in the xslt that works (I have attached it to this ticket) I have this code instead ...  <xsl:attribute name="alt"><xsl:value-of select="$newTitle"></xsl:value-of></xsl:attribute>  Likewise ... there is this in default         <xsl:variable name='OBJECTURI' select="s:object/@uri"/>         <xsl:variable name='CONTENTURI' select="s:content/@uri"/>         <xsl:variable name='CONTENTMODEL' select="substring-after($CONTENTURI,'/')"/>         <xsl:variable name='PID' select="substring-after($OBJECTURI,'/')"/>  but the collection_view I'm using has ...          <xsl:variable name="OBJECTURI" select="s:object/@uri"></xsl:variable>          <xsl:variable name="CONTENTURI" select="s:content/@uri"></xsl:variable>          <xsl:variable name="CONTENTMODEL" select="substring-after($CONTENTURI,'/')"></xsl:variable>          <xsl:variable name="PID" select="substring-after($OBJECTURI,'/')"></xsl:variable>

title: Drupal Servlet Filter (non_FeSL) does not work
description: After 2 hours of testing with Alan, it was confirmed that the following jar files on GitHub do not work in a non-FeSL environment:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora-dist/blob/master/servlet_filter/DrupalFilter3.3.jar (tested to ensure that 3.4 and 3.3 files weren't mixed up) https://github.com/Islandora/islandora-dist/blob/master/servlet_filter/DrupalFilter3.4.jar  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora-dist/blob/master/servlet_filter/fcrepo-drupalauthfilter-3.4.2.jar  This testing was conducted on both a 3.4 and a 3.4.2 fedora. All files blow-up Fedora.  The fcrepo-drupalauthfilter-3.4.2.jar was not tested in a FeSL environment.  Please rectify this issue as non_FeSL users currently do not have a working servlet filter available to them.  Note: An old (2010 Q3 or Q4) version of the DrupalFilter3.4.jar did work.

title: plugins/QtFormBuilder.php requires /images/qtThumb.jpg, but image isn't present
description: When implementing the islandora:audioCModel it failed because the default thumbnail called from plugins/QtFormBuilder.php wasn't present in the /images directory.   Here is the line from the plugins/QtFormBuilder.php file that calls for the qtThumb.jpg  $createdFile = drupal_get_path('module', 'Fedora_Repository').'/images/qtThumb.jpg';  The thumbnail should be pushed up to the github (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/tree/master/images) and the image listed as a requirement when installing the Audio / Video solution pack. I've attached the audio thumb that we are using for a current project.  As a suggestion ... perhaps we could associate the mime type with a default icon should the image requested not be present ... so from the Crystal set for mimetypes audio/ http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Crystal_Clear_mimetype_sound.png  for mimetypes video/ http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Crystal_Clear_mimetype_video.png

title: Improve our handling of the php-solr-client library
description: Currently we do not include the library in our islandora_solr_search module, but it seems there's no reason we couldn't.  The solr-php-client library contains a copyright notice which *explicitly permits* redistribution provided the copyright notice isn't discarded.  (More recently the project website indicates it will be under a BSD license going forward.)    One of the only things we *do* throw away in our production environments is the copyright notice.  We pull the SolrPhpClient/Apache/Solr directory directly into the module directory and usually throw the rest away (including the copyright notice).  Because we expect the copyright notice to be thrown away, we've been unable to include it in our distribution.  Because we're unable to include it, we've had to write tests to see of the library is present.  With that in mind, I'd like to go do two things:  1. Stop expecting islandora_solr_search/Solr and start expecting islandora_solr_search/SolrPhpClient/Apache/Solr.  This way we can just unpack the library and go.  There's no benefit to requiring modification of a package before it can be used.  2. Do one of the following a) Include the whole (unpacked) library in our module code b) modify our library check to download and unpack the library if it isn't present.  The solr-php-client library hasn't been updated since September 2009.

title: underscores in class attribute of div.
description: The get_formatted_datastream_list method of the ObjectHelper class returns a div with a class of 'fedora_datastream_content'.  Underscores are illegal characters in  css, and should be replaced by hyphens.

title: Drupal Filter should combine username and site identifier
description: Right now the Drupal servlet filter will attempt to authenticate against every Drupal database defined in the filter-drupal.xml file on every operation that hits fedora.  This adds the security hole that someone with a username on one site that is the same as a username from another site may be able to access all of that other user's content.  We should change the authentication scheme so that the username is generated as a product of a site name and the username. For example, if the site's URL is "mnpl" the username could be "mnpl:plux" for the plux user.

title: Bad parsing of key~value facet field list
description: There's a bug in our parsing of "machine_name ~ Human Readable Name" pairs in the solr module.  bug is in the preg_split, which is essentially inserting blank facet fields into the query between desired ones. The effect has no bearing on output, but it is still wrong.    Attaching a PDF of some dumped vars related to facet.field in the query parameters.
