title: Enable transformation of PBCORE datastream to DC using the form builder module
description: Need to enable the transformation of PBCORE datastream to DC. Requirements: - a PBCORE Document - a pbcore_to_dc.xsl - edit related .inc file(s).

title: Reflect tab selection in URL
description: When a user selects a tab - eg. the Description tab ... is there a way to reflect that in the URL so that a user can link directly to that view of the content?

title: display the object's title in the <html><head><title> element
description: Would it be possible to use the digital object's title (eg. dc.title by default) as the HTML title? It would improve SEO of content and improve a bookmarking experience.   For example every bibliographic view of a book in the IslandLives collection has an HTML title of Book view.  This is an issue across all the repos.  Alan you've got the most recent experience with this content.  Let me know what you think.

title: Deliver SOLR results in KML format when location data exists
description: Being able to display fedora content in 3rd party mapping applications such as OpenLayers or Google Maps would be a major improvement. Most mapping applications consume KML files to display location markers and popups using javascript.   We should be able to generate KML from SOLR search results, using lat/long data stored in metadata. Currently, we store lat/long information in the DC coverage field for Herbarium project http://vre2.upei.ca/herbarium/ which uses the islandora:herbCModel but there may be better ways of doing this.   Another project that does something similar with a KML API, that takes SOLR input and outputs KML is noted here: http://numishare.blogspot.com/2011/04/world-of-numismatic-data-at-your.html

title: Take a look at integrating the cheesebarrons changes to Drupal Filter
description: Tomasz Cielecki has done some great work with our drupal filter.   We should review his code and then bring it in. See the github below and the thread on the list.  https://github.com/Cheesebaron/Islandora_Drupal_Filter http://groups.google.com/group/islandora/browse_thread/thread/2d89b62aa1c9efb

title: No error is displayed when a PID doesn't exist.
description: When a PID doesn't exist islandora used to display an error. Something like: "Object not found in low level storage exception". I'm not sure this was the right approach, but its better then nothing. I think ideally we would return the Drupal 404 page. Currently when I go to a non-existent PID it renders the display but gives some soap warnings. See the screenshot.

title: We need to enable security on the STOMP message protocol
description: When we are setting up the STOMP listener for fedora microservices, we aren't using security. I was able to post the the ActiveMQ without any security. It should really be using username and passwords from fedora I think. We will have to investigate if this is a fedora issue, or a islandora issue and act appropriately.

title: Refactor Fedora Microservices to remove Fedora Listener
description: I think the Fedora Listener part of the fedora microservices stack is unnecessary is conceptually confusing. We can refactor the microservices so that this listener is rolled into the content model listener. This ticket rolls into a related ticket about renaming the content model listener.

title: Ingested data not being added to Index in VM
description: Data added to the VM is not being added to the index to be searched. We should include this as well as the fill text of pdfs. This makes a much more impressive demo. Perhaps use wildcards in the solr config.

title: Breadcrumbs
description: Breadcrumbs are broken in many instances. We need to figure out a more robust method of generating breadcrumbs, where we don't fail in a bad way if:  1) The parents have no label (maybe make it configurable) 2) If the collection doesn't have parents (many objects / collections don't) 3) On some admin pages

title: Integrating the new Form Builder
description: We need to integrate the new formbuilder properly, so that the edit and add metadata links always go to the new formbuilder. They are rendered as tabs right now which makes this really hard, but it has to be done, and I like the tab interface, so I think formbuilder will need to change.   We also need to discuss what will happen if the formbuilder module is disabled.

title: Remove all handwritten HTML/XML from Islandora
description: We should remove all the handwritten HTML from islandora, and instead be using theme functions or creating our own theme functions. This would make the islandora core much more readable and help out with theming.

title: WYSIWYG editor breaks the SOLR module
description:
The solr module configuration page has some textareas that are used for configuration. When the CKEditor we use all over the place is enabled, it adds markup to these fields. This breaks the solr module. We should fix it somehow so we don't get these fancy textfields on the configuation pages. Perhaps there is a property we can apply. For instance when you enter: dc.title ~ Title dc.subject ~ Subject You actually get:

dc.title ~ Title

dc.subject ~ Subject

title: Zero Solr Results for Every Search in the VM
description: With the standard handler, we get zero results for every search in the VM. It works on demo though. Why?

title: Should return the correct string when there are no search results
description: When we get zero search results we display  Results 1 - 0 of 0  This is sort of confusing, we should test for the case and say no results or something.

title: The VM doesn't properly set paths
description: The paths in the init script for the islandora virtualmachine don't have export before them, and then sudo doesn't use sudo -E so the paths are never properly set. This is not disastrous, but it does slow down Fedora.

title: Change to rules in strictPDF content models
description: We should talk about this work from Donald and determine where to put it:  "it is simply the addition of a new datastream to the islandora:strict_pdf cmodel ... FLEXPAPER ... and the creation of an .inc file to create the FLEXPAPER ds on ingest of a pdf (using an ingest rule in the cmodel) ... and the display of the FLEXPAPER ds (an swf) using the viewer... simply embedded it in the ShowStreamsInFieldsets.inc file  this work is all in the test.cairnrepo.org site ... I could ship Jonathan the code if that would help ... I'm thinking for the creation of a solution pack ... we may want to have a strict_pdf.inc file that gathers all of the existing bits of code together into 1 .inc file ... I'd be interested in hearing what J.'s thoughs were on that."

title: Modify Islandora Core to Conform to Drupal Coding Standards
description: In implementing CI, I would like to have all new code automatically run through the coder module. In order to be able to do this we need the current codebase to pass the coder module. I think this is a good excercise to make sure our coding is up to standards. If we maintain our code to be up to the coding standards we could possible host at drupal.org in the future.   I also want to run the coding tests with internationalization on since we will eventually be translating islandora.  At the beginning of this project we are on commit: 5242573c41af919efb10  And the results are: Coder found 1 projects, 76 files, 841 normal warnings

Modules Enabled (Besides default)  Digital Repository 6.x-11.1.1 ImageAPI 6.x-1.10 ImageAPI GD2 6.x-1.10 ImageAPI ImageMagick 6.x-1.10  Tabs 6.x-1.3  jQuery UI 6.x-1.4 jQuery Update 6.x-2.0-alpha1

title: module.install should check for PHP libraries
description: I was installing the simpletest module on a new site today, and I didn't have the php5-curl package installed. When I tried to enable the module it warned me, and then didn't install. I think we should be being this with the php5 packages we require, that drupal doesn't. php5-curl being one, php5-xsl being another. Currently if these aren't installed islandora just whitescreens. Here is some of the magic: {code} $has_curl = function_exists('curl_init'); $has_hash = function_exists('hash_hmac'); $has_domdocument = method_exists('DOMDocument', 'loadHTML'); $requirements['curl'] = array( 'title' => $t('cURL'), 'value' => $has_curl ? $t('Enabled') : $t('Not found'), ); if (!$has_curl) { $requirements['curl']['severity'] = REQUIREMENT_ERROR; $requirements['curl']['description'] = $t('Simpletest could not be installed because the PHP cURL library is not a vailable.', array('@curl_url' => 'http://php.net/manual/en/curl.setup.php')); } $requirements['hash'] = array( 'title' => $t('hash'), 'value' => $has_hash ? $t('Enabled') : $t('Not found'), ); if (!$has_hash) { $requirements['hash']['severity'] = REQUIREMENT_ERROR; $requirements['hash']['description'] = $t('Simpletest could not be installed because the PHP hash extension is dis abled.', array('@hash_url' => 'http://php.net/manual/en/book.hash.php')); } {code} I think we can basically borrow most of their tests, maybe adding on php5-xsl

To fix this we need to update the following xslt: .../modules/islandora/xsl/convertQDC.xsl and change this line to this ... so that it would launch a solr search instead of the old search method...

Are there others we should be concerned about? dm

title: Document or automate the proper Form Builder Ingest Form file/class/method selections for functional plugins
description: As of v11.1.1, I do not see an obvious choice for the MODS form builder method from the ModsFormBuilder class in plugins/ModsFormBuilder.inc (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/6.x/plugins/ModsFormBuilder.inc) when I am attempting to setup the a MODS Ingest Form for my Content Model. It seems that buildQDCForm from plugins/FormBuilder.inc (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/6.x/plugins/FormBuilder.inc#L319) seems to work, but that seems very unintuitive.  Is there currently existing documentation that documents the Form Builder API as far as classes and methods that can be used to implement working ingest or edit metadata forms? If not, I think some clarification, at the very least in the source code, could be beneficial until it is possible to have the Content Modeler UI automatically detect the available Form Builder classes and pick-up the correct methods without manual configuration which should be the desired user experience in a near-future of the Content Modeler.

title: Formbuilder: "PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught exception 'DOMException' with message 'Namespace Error'"
description: This bug report applies to the older version for formbuilder.   Specifically the Coalliance/JWA version. It may apply to future versions as well, so I am posting here.   When running older versions of formbuilder on PHP 5.2 you get a whitescreen, the underlying error being:  [Tue Jul 12 13:00:34 2011] [error] [client 24.224.174.106] PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught exception 'DOMException' with message 'Namespace Error' in /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/FoxmlForm.inc:75 Stack trace: #0 /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/FoxmlForm.inc(75): DOMElement->setAttributeNS('http://www.w3.o...', 'xmlns', 'info:fedora/fed...') #1 /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/FoxmlForm.inc(67): FoxmlDocument->createRootElement() #2 /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/builders/JWAIngestFormBuilder.inc(282): FoxmlDocument->__construct('', 'JWA:14', 'MODS', 'jwa:audioCModel', 'jwa:audioCollec...', 'isMemberOfColle...', Array, Object(ModsDocument), 'sites/jwa.org/m...') #3 /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/IngestFormBuilder.inc(282): JWAIngestFormBuilder->submitForm(Array) #4 /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/islandora_form_builder.module(103): IngestFormBui in /home/web/drupal6/sites/jwa.org/modules/islandora/islandora_form_builder/FoxmlForm.inc on line 75, referer: http://dg.jwa.org/formbuilder/ingest/jwa:audioCollection  This is caused by this PHP bug:  https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=49463 Which was fixed in PHP 5.3.2.

title: Solr client giving false negative when detecting Solr URL in CentOS 5.4
description: In the Islandora Solr Search Module detection of solr is done here:  islandora_solr_search.admin.inc:205: $test = @fopen($path, "r");  This relies on fopen being able to open a URL, which is a setting in the php.ini.  ; Whether to allow the treatment of URLs (like http:// or ftp://) as files. ; http://php.net/allow-url-fopen allow_url_fopen = On  This is on by default in Ubuntu, but is disabled by default in CentOS 5.4, so the solr client always reports that solr is unaccessable. I wonder if there is a better way to test this? Or if the whole module relies on fopen being able to access URLs, we should perhaps check phpinfo() and warn the user.

title: After cloning a content model and successfully ingesting it into the repo, it does not appear with auto complete in Form Associations

Would be great if new content models appeared.   Tried several things to see if it would show over time (cleared cache, etc.) to no effect.

title: PDF thumbnail creation fails on certain PDF's on CentOS
description: Summary: There are issues with pdf CM relating to certain pdf's and certain versions of ImageMagick. The issue affects CentOS servers especially. Ubuntu servers are not currently affected due to the version of ImageMagick they are running.  Problem: PDF's created by some applications e.g. Adobe Illustrator and Indesign are failing to create TN datastreams and producing a variety of errors on varying servers. This is most pronounced in CentOS 5.4 and 5.5. The result is that the ingest usually completes with errors but has no TN to display in the views.  Solution: CentOS 5x by default is running Imagemagick 6.28 and uses Ghostscript 8.15. Downloading ImageMagick-6.7.1-0.x86_64.rpm for centos 5 from http://www.imagemagick.org/download/linux/CentOS/x86_64/ImageMagick-6.7.1-1.x86_64.rpm , removing the current ImageMagick packages with yum, and installing the downloaded rpm will partially address the issue. It appears you also need to upgrade ghostscript as a minimum by using yum upgrade ghostscript which should bring you to a minimum of version 8.7.  These steps will get thumbnail creation working but this version of Imagemagick will produce thumbs with a black background if the pdf is transparent. Adding a -alpha Off paramater to the convert syntax in our module function (plugins/ImageManipulation.inc -- function createThumbnailFromPDF) will get the pdf transparency work properly for jpg pdf's.  Tests run on Ubuntu which is running ImageMagick 6.6.2-6 and Ghostscript 9.01 work out of the box on the pdf's in question but also run fine with the additional -alpha Off parameter in the module convert command and suffer from no transparency issues in either configuration.  I would be more comfortable with Ghostscript 9.01 running on CentOS as well but have not located a reliable package at this time and am reluctant to advise a compiled approach as a solution for what is already a tedious upgrade path for our stack. The upgrade path described here for CentOS is relatively simple and seems to resolve the issues albeit requiring a minor code change in a basic module function. Note that the issue the code modification addresses is one created by the version of ImageMagick which is a later release than Ubuntu's package may indicate that is a positive step to take in any case.  Attached file(s) can be used to test as an example of a file that a) fails to build a thumbnail and (tnfails.pdf) b) fails on transparency without the -alpha Off switch (transfails.pdf) should you want to test output at various stages.  To Do: 1) It would be nice to upgrade Ghostscript on CentOS 5x to see how that impacts this from the code/module perspective although that is more work than the minor code fix 2) We could also check on CentOS 6x to see if the IM and GS versions have caught up 3) Move the -alpha Off switch in the convert functions in question in Imagemanipulation.inc pending approval at committers  Questions:  1) Do we apply to a) tagged relase v11.1 as well as master or  do we apply at all 2) This has prompted discussions re the TN dsid in terms of standard size and possibility of  3) should the function in play here (createThumbnailFromPDF) be using conditionals there currently or just assume our base server stack (LINUX)

title: Islandora Fails to install Solution Packs when installed on OSX with MAMP 2
description: An exception occurs when the the first created object attempts to add the relationship data stream.  This is cause by the tmp directory not being writeable.   The function sys_get_temp_dir() is used to get the temp directory in fedora_item->add_datastream_from_string. This returns the default system path for OSX (TMPDIR) which is generated randomly on each log in (Apparently for security reasons). Perhaps we should use the Drupal tmp directory instead of the system one, so that the solution pack installer works on OSX with MAMP as well as other linux boxes. Perhaps as part of the status check islandora can see if the tmp directory is writeable.  System Info: OS: Mac OSX 10.7 MAMP: 2 PHP: 5.2.17  Exception generated:  Error Trying to call SOAP function addDataStream: SoapFault exception: [soapenv:Server.userException] org.fcrepo.server.errors.GeneralException: Error with http://cityofhope.local/sites/cityofhope.local/files//Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22 : [DefaultExternalContentManager] returned an error. The underlying error was a org.fcrepo.server.errors.GeneralException The message was "Error getting http://cityofhope.local/sites/cityofhope.local/files//Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22" . in /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc:681 Stack trace: #0 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(681): SoapClient->__soapCall('addDataStream', Array) #1 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(102): Fedora_Item::soap_call('addDataStream', Array) #2 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(71): Fedora_Item->add_datastream_from_url('http://cityofho...', 'RELS-EXT', 'Fedora object-t...', 'text/xml', 'X', NULL) #3 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(113): Fedora_Item->add_datastream_from_file(false, 'RELS-EXT', 'Fedora object-t...', 'text/xml', 'X', NULL) #4 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/cityofhope.local/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(131): Fedora_Item->add_datastream_from_string(' add_relationship('hasModel', 'fedora-system:C...', 'info:fedora/fed...') #6 [internal function]: fedora_repository_batch_reingest_object(Array, Array) #7 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/includes/batch.inc(189): call_user_func_array('fedora_reposito...', Array) #8 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/includes/batch.inc(105): _batch_process() #9 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/includes/batch.inc(33): _batch_do() #10 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/modules/system/system.admin.inc(1829): _batch_page() #11 [internal function]: system_batch_page() #12 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/includes/menu.inc(349): call_user_func_array('system_batch_pa...', Array) #13 /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/index.php(17): menu_execute_active_handler() #14 {main}

title: FOR DISCUSSION: Bulk Ingest - Current .zip method does not support large file uploads.
description: I was speaking today with Peter and Gervais - the current .zip ingest method (built by Alan) fails on large zip files. Attempts to address the problem with a longer window for server requests and permitting larger sizes are untenable. In the short term, this means that CAIRN books cannot be successfully uploaded at present because of their size. However, the larger issue is one of bulk ingesting items into Fedora. It's been over a year, and we still don't have a good tool for builk ingest.  After talking with Peter and Gervais, I agree that an immediate thing that we need to do is to put file checking on the .zip file, so if a .zip file is too large (they are playing with this now and should be able to give us a good ballpark size) the file is rejected. There is another piece here - an empty .zip file should also generate a meaningful error to a user.   In the longer term, we need a real bulk upload solution. I believe Peter was suggesting that if a .zip file is too large, the ideal thing would be for it to be automatically unzipped and then the files ingested individually. I may have that wrong. So, this may be two tickets rolled into one: 1. File checking on .zips in the current model, 2. A sustainable way for users to upload big files, and directories (bulk) into Fedora.    Can you please take this forward into discussion in our next committers meeting? We need a plan!

title: Push your file checking stuff to core
description: As per our discussion in this morning's management meeting - file checking on the .zips that are empty or TOOO big. Peter or Abraham should be able to tell you how big is too big, in case you want to know.

title: Terms in Solr Facet Block Displaying Incorrectly
description: I tested the newest version of Solr on http://vre2.upei.ca/cap and the facet block is displaying terms incorrectly. There are basically two problems:  1. Terms are being arbitrarily cut-off at different lengths, and in some cases letters are being replaced (e.g. "industry" is displayed as "industri").  2. Collections (and possibly other terms) with more than one word are being split into separate terms (e.g. "Grand Tracadie Collection" displays separately as "grand", "tracadi" and "collect". Each term has the same number of results).  Kirsta asked me to assign this to you with 'Blocker' priority. Please see the screenshot for an example, and feel free to Skype me for details.

title: Would having a standard method for naming metadata datastreams make sense?
description: For discussion. Thinking about how we currently use metadata datastreams in our content models and in Islandora.  Would it make sense to standardize on something like:  DESCMD for all forms of descriptive metadata in an object regardless of the schema.  So MODS, PBCORE, QDC, DARWINCORE, etc would become DESCMD. You would create a common framework around displaying the DESCMD ds ... there would be work determine the type of metadata and a method to display it.  You could follow a similar patterm for other forms of metadata as well ... eg EXIFTOOL, MIX ... would become TECHMD.

Warning: fclose() expects parameter 1 to be resource, boolean given in MimeClass->system_extension_mime_types() (line 344 of /Applications/MAMP/htdocs/drupal-6.22/sites/test.local/modules/islandora/MimeClass.inc).

title: Collection Objects with special characters in the title create bad URLs
description: Collection object URLs are formed using a combination of the PID and the title given to the object, e.g. http://vre2.upei.ca/cap/fedora/repository/cap:afton/-/Afton%20Collection.   If the title of the collection object contains special characters (e.g. colon, semi-colon, slash, quotation marks, etc.) these characters get added to the URL. In some cases this causes the URL to break, while in others the object fails to display at all.

title: on View tab, at the bottom of the display there is a Tag input box.  Attempting to enter a tag generates an error message. Tag is added.
description: This is the error message generated when adding a tag to http://137.149.200.61/fedora/repository/image%3A22/-/Sample%20Page  FYI ... am logged in as admin.

title: Audio Solution Pack is not creating a thumbnail when new object is ingested
description: This is still a problem in the latest version of the Audio Solution Pack. The thumbnail image (audio-TN.jpg) is in the correct directory, though the code lists the mimetype as PNG (see attached image).

title: If Fedora's resource index search component is missing or mis-configured a cryptic error message is displayed.
description: If the resource index search component of Fedora (risearch) is not installed or if the URL is incorrect in the Islandora configuration (Drupal configuration module) then the following error message is presented at the top of home page (the Digital Repository page in Drupal): "Error getting parent objects String could not be parsed as XML".

title: after installing the large image solution pack can't ingest.  Ingest form won't build.
description: Ingest form won't build and we get a white screen.  When we go back to a drupal page and refresh the drupal error is warning: DOMDocument::loadXML(): Empty string supplied as input in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/default/modules/islandora_xml_forms/builder/XMLFormDatabase.inc on line 43.  I had a previoius version of xml_forms and content_model_forms so reinstalled both in case the db schema change but i get the same error after reinstalling.

title: fedora_repository.install file requirements checking is a bit over zealous, for instance we can't install islandora if we don't have kakadu installed on the same server.
description: some of these checks should be removed from the fedora_repository.install file and put in the solution packs install file.  We should also be careful with REQUIREMENT_ERROR and use REQUIREMENT_WARNING unless it is absolutely needed.  For instance we can view an image collection without imagemagick but we can't create derivatives (unless we use microservices) so I think we would use REQUIREMENT_WARNING not REQUIREMENT_ERROR (in the install phase of the check).  So we can still install and view.

title: I've cleaned up the islandora:bookCModel content model as part of the Book SP deployment.
description: The islandora:bookCModel had a bunch of legacy code in it.  I've cleaned it out and have attached the resulting cmodel to this ticket.

title: cleaned up the large image SP cmodel
description: i cleaned up the large image solution pack cmodel. Run it by Alan for an ok.

title: Viewing any collection with namespace filtering off spews errors to log
description: Introduced in b5f1a87 [https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/b5f1a87d30f6dfa3bb7de8afb0f5153ae8227638/api/fedora_utils.inc#L196].  In api/fedora_utils.inc get_content_models_as_option_array() a risearch query is executed to find a list of content models, which is then filtered to the allowed pid namespaces.  If namespace filtering is off, content models in the fedora-system namespace are allowed and get_datastream_dissemination('ISLANDORACM') is called on those objects, producing the errors.  Also the description of the aforementioned function is copypasted from another function header and does not match its functionality.  Error trying to call SOAP function getDataStreamDissemination: SoapFault exception: [soapenv:Server.userException] org.fcrepo.server.errors.DatastreamNotFoundException: [DefaulAccess] No datastream could be returned. Either there is no datastream for the digital object "fedora-system:ServiceDeployment-3.0" with datastream ID of "ISLANDORACM " OR there are no datastreams that match the specified date/time value of "null " . in /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc:871  Stack trace: #0 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(871): SoapClient->__soapCall('getDataStreamDi...', Array) #1 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(353): Fedora_Item::soap_call('getDataStreamDi...', Array) #2 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_utils.inc(225): Fedora_Item->get_datastream_dissemination('ISLANDORACM') #3 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/CollectionClass.inc(672): get_content_models_as_option_array() #4 [internal function]: collection_creation_form(Array, 'islandora:root') #5 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/form.inc(377): call_user_func_array('collection_crea...', Array) #6 [internal function]: drupal_retrieve_form('collection_crea...', Array, 'islandora:root') #7 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/form.inc(103): call_user_func_array('drupal_retrieve...', Array) #8 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/CollectionClass.inc(541): drupal_get_form('collection_crea...', 'islandora:root') #9 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/ContentModel.inc(1471): CollectionClass->showFieldSets(NULL) #10 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/fedora_repository.module(970): ContentModel->displayExtraFieldset('islandora:root', NULL) #11 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/fedora_repository.module(1033): fedora_repository_get_items(NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL) #12 [internal function]: repository_page() #13 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/menu.inc(349): call_user_func_array('repository_page', Array) #14 /var/www/drupal-6.22/index.php(17): menu_execute_active_handler() #15 {main}

title: When the COLLECTION_POLICY lists more than content model, the Form Builder only displays the for associated with the cmodel 1st on the list.
description: COLLECTION_POLICY lists two content models.  When attempting to add content to the collection, only the form associated with the first content model is listed. When the alternate content model is selected, the form associated with that content model is not displayed.

title: Default Thumbnail when creating book object
description: add thumbnail to book creation. Let me know if the attached file is inappropriate!

title: when we purge datastreams we should check rels-int for relationships involving that datastream.  Need to discuss best place to do this php api or microservices.
description: when we purge datastreams we should check rels-int for relationships involving that datastream.  Need to discuss best place to do this php api or microservices.   We have some php code to do this that we can add to the api but should this also be done in python microservices (we may have functions there that do this already?)  proposed function: static function remove_relationship_internal($pid,$dsid){     module_load_include('inc', 'fedora_repository', 'api/fedora_item');//if this is in the api we can remove this     $item = new Fedora_Item($pid);     $ds_list = $item->get_datastreams_list_as_array();     if (empty($ds_list['RELS-INT'])) {      return TRUE; //nothing to remove as no RELS-INT but we don't want to flag an error so return success     }      $rels = $item->get_datastream_dissemination('RELS-INT');      if (substr($object, 0, 12) != 'info:fedora/') {       $pid = "info:fedora/$pid";     }     $attr = $pid.'/'.$dsid;//this is the value of the rdf:about attribute we are looking for     $relsxml = simplexml_load_string($rels);     $relsxml->registerXPathNamespace('rdf', "http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#");     $nodes = $relsxml->xpath('//rdf:Description[@rdf:about="'.$attr.'"]');     $nodes_to_remove = array();     foreach($nodes as $node){       //if there are issues when we have a one datastream in more then one rels-int statement we may have to look at the comment below       //$nodes_to_remove[] = $node;//put the nodes in an array so we can remove them see this post http://stackoverflow.com/questions/262351/remove-a-child-with-a-specific-attribute-in-simplexml-for-php       $dom=dom_import_simplexml($node);       $dom->parentNode->removeChild($dom);     }     return $item->modify_datastream_by_value( $relsxml->saveXML(), 'RELS-INT', "internal Relationship Metadata", 'text/xml');    }

title: Add default thumbnail to objects created with the harvester module
description: Ideally, the harvester would be able to take a thumbnail based on mime type (I think) so PDFs would produce PDF icons, etc. However, I think the folder would be fine as a starting point. If it's reasonable to add a check for mime type, let me know because I'd like to make the set more coherent (so that everything matches).

When adding another entry for the Temporal field, the following error is generated: warning: array_shift() expects parameter 1 to be array, null given in /var/www/drupal/includes/form.inc on line 1338.  See the attached screen cap.

If you then try to edit the metadata of an object that does not already have a datastream with that DSID you get the following Drupal errors:  warning: DOMDocument::loadXML() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/XMLDocument.inc on line 128.  recoverable fatal error: Argument 1 passed to Namespaces::addNamespacesAttributesTo() must be an instance of DOMElement, null given, called in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/XMLDocument.inc on line 131 and defined in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/Namespaces.inc on line 98.

description: The AutoComplete function for selecting a content model on the Form Associations screen fails to suggest any existing content models. The following Drupal errors appear:  recoverable fatal error: Object of class AutoCompleteFilter could not be converted to string in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_content_model_forms/islandora_content_model_forms.module on line 350.  warning: array_filter() [function.array-filter]: The second argument, '', should be a valid callback in /var/www/html/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_content_model_forms/islandora_content_model_forms.module on line 350.  This occurs with PHP version 5.2.17

title: Tabbed collection & object views do not display correctly in Opera
description: Opera 11.51 for Linux.  Islandora a277544f889df849ce6d06415032c5c4a1e35c41.  The Tabs module's examples do not behave like this.

title: URL Escape Characters in Solr search path
description: Due to URL escape characters in solr searches, Drupal does not respect 'Page specific visibility settings' for blocks. This is a very important feature for site-building / theming, especially when solr searches are frequently being used as collection displays.   example: 'islandora/solr/search/%2A%3A%2A/atm_type_s%253A%2522Compositores%2522'  using: 'islandora/solr/search/*' will display (or remove) a block on every page that path is valid on  using: 'islandora/solr/search/%2A%3A%2A/atm_type_s%253A%2522Compositores%2522/*' will never display, even if this path is valid

title: Problems with the Cm associated with the Large Image SP
description: Donald found: it looks like it has the whole foxml for the object stuffed into the ISLANDORACM databastream for the object

title: Solr result CSS classes col-first, col-last, row-first, row-last
description: In FJM, Adam was able to get col-first & col-last classes into Solr result table tds, this made theming result views much easier, such as removing borders on the last row in a list, resizing thumbnail tds (which are usually the first column), etc  Lines 426-434 should outline usable code to implement this elsewhere https://github.com/discoverygarden/islandora_fjm/commit/2c3116888139baac22a2932cbf9ae9234aad2865  Great improvements would be col-first & col-last classes for all TD elements and row-first & row-last classes for all TR elements.

description: Change XML Form Builder to not use symlink for including the extjs library. As it breaks on windows.

description: The "Save & Preview" and "Save" button don't work.  in Edit.inc, "TRUE" needs to be changed to "true"

description: After editing metadata of an object, it returns to "View" tab, but not "Object Details" tab.  It makes users confused about whether the modification is successful or not.

(Server) Server shutdown complete  It turns out this is because they had the newest Spring framework installed (3.1.rc1) in order to run the listeners. They are on fedora 3.4.2. After moving the version of spring framework back to version 3.0.5 (the version that ships with fedora 3.4.2) then everything is fine.   I have a thread going about this on the fedora mailing list: http://sourceforge.net/mailarchive/forum.php?thread_name=CADQQ8TMv44HD2JQeHxOz_SrHS2QURtrnFAbqMPCQHSFVdKMDwQ%40mail.gmail.com&forum_name=fedora-commons-users  We will need to change the readme so that it tells what version of the spring framework to install for each version of fedora. I'm asking on the list if there is a better way to include the activemq stomp stuff.

title: After purging all pages from a book object, the user should be redirected to the description tab of the book object
description: Currently, when a user purges all pages from a book object, they are redirected to the top level of their repository.  The user should be redirected to the description tab of the book object, because they are likely to want to add new pages or delete the object.

title: Clean up the Book Solution Pack distribution
description: There are a number of items that need to get cleaned up in the Book Solution Pack.   Not sure if these files are used by the solution pack. If not they should be removed.   - searchTerms.xml ... is this file used ? if so there are elements in it that don't match up with the SP -- https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/searchTerms.xml  - ilives_jp2Sdep-pageCModel.xml ... is this depreciated for this SP? -- https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/xml/ilives_jp2Sdep-pageCModel.xml   - there are multiple book forms in https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/xml ... which form is the correct one? -- https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/xml/islandora_book_default_mods.xml -- https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/xml/mods_book.xml -- https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/xml/mods_upload.xml  - https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/6.x/book.inc ... check the relationships getting created. -- line 94 - function book_add_pages_form(&$form_state, $pid, $page_cmodel = 'islandora:pageCModel', $relation = 'isMemberOf') { -- line 212 - function ibook_create_page_objects($pid, $image_list = array(), $page_cmodel = 'islandora:pageCModel', $relation = 'isMemberOfCollection', $tmpDir) { -- line 260 - function ibook_add_single_page_object($book_pid, $page_file, $page_num = 1, $page_title = NULL, $page_cmodel = 'islandora:pageCModel', $relation = 'isMemberOf') {  - lines 31-33 ... are they needed ? Do they have a function ? --  module_load_include('inc', 'fedora_repository', 'plugins/tagging_form'); -- module_load_include('inc', 'fedora_repository', 'plugins/DarwinCore');  thanks, Donald

title: Default solution pack collections should all use the 'islandora' namespace
description: The default collections created by the solution packs should all use the 'islandora' namespace. The objects created in these collections should use the same namespace (currently these collections use different namespaces, e.g. 'audio', 'image').
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Book Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack

title: Google PDF Viewer only supports PDFs smaller than 12MB
description: I recently discovered that the Google PDF Viewer (used by the Islandora PDF Solution Pack) only supports PDFs smaller than 12MB or so - anything larger returns an error or just hangs with no results. This is likely a limitation imposed by Google, but we should take this limitation into consideration since this is the default viewer for the PDF Solution Pack.

title: Fold in generalized RSS functions (Solr module)
description: Hi Alan - following up on our discussion, can you generalize the work you've completed on RSS functions for Solr results, and fold that into the module? This is a fix that a lot of people have been waiting for. Please let us know if this would cause any problems for people using earlier versions of the Solr module. Once this is done, we'll have to document it as well. I've indicated an estimate based on what you thought it would take, but please feel free to change that!

title: The 'View Full Size' link for basic images returns a Page not found error
description: Objects created using the Basic Image Solution Pack provide a link to 'View Full Size' image, but this link returns a Page not found error. The link resolves to 'FULL_SIZE.jpg' which does not appear in the list of Datastreams.
component: Basic Image Solution Pack,Batch Ingest Module 6.x (Deprecated)

description: An XML form gets created and associated with a content model.  The form gets deleted, but the association that had created continues to be listed in the Form Associations. I'm thinking that if a form is deleted, any form associations that had been created to that form should be removed. Maybe I'm wrong.

See code below ... namespace="islandora:1" and namespace="leg:1" ... seems to take the first occurrence when adding a book.  <collection_policy xmlns="http://www.islandora.ca" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" name="" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.islandora.ca http://syn.lib.umanitoba.ca/collection_policy.xsd">   <content_models>     <content_model dsid="ISLANDORACM" name="Islandora Collection Model ~ islandora:collectionCModel" namespace="islandora:1" pid="islandora:collectionCModel"></content_model>     <content_model dsid="ISLANDORACM" name="BookCModel Content Model" namespace="leg:1" pid="islandora:bookCModel"></content_model>   </content_models>   <search_terms></search_terms>   <staging_area></staging_area>   <relationship>isMemberOfCollection</relationship> </collection_policy>  If you create a book object ... it gets assigned an islandora: pid. dm

The operation still completes successfully.

See the attached screenshots for an example of the broken form and an example of the form being rendered correctly.   I have tried flushing the site cache but the problem persists.  Alan suggested checking the Java version on the server - have you looked into this, Alan?

Our version of tesseract did not accommodate for the orientation change.  I'm not sure which version we are using but Tesseract 3.1 has a switch that will automatically detect script and orientation.   An improvement would be to add this detection piece into the workflow.

Key: 000000002e9425e100000000c1d5d8ba Path: /*[local-name() = 'mods'][1]/*[local-name() = ''][1]' in /var/www/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/NodeRegistry.inc:89 Stack trace: #0 /var/www/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/XMLDocument.inc(94): NodeRegistry->restore(Object(DOMDocument)) #1 [internal function]: XMLDocument->__wakeup() #2 /var/www/drupal/modules/dblog/dblog.admin.inc(250): unserialize('a:2:{s:3:"@fn";...') #3 /var/www/drupal/modules/dblog/dblog.admin.inc(80): _dblog_format_message(Object(stdClass)) #4 [internal function]: dblog_overview() #5 /var/www/drupal/includes/menu.inc(349): call_user_func_array('dblog_overview', Array) #6 /var/www/drupal/index.php(17): menu_execute_active_handler() #7 {main} thrown in /var/www/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/NodeRegistry.inc on line 89  Nigel suspects it has to do with an error retrieving the form information stored in the session between requests.

title: Document Sanitization (PDF)
description: We should pass documents through a commandline utility to sanitize them prior to ingest.   PDF's specifically can create a lot of problems.. the two most important problems being:  1. Non conforming pdfs cause a failure to ingest (image magick not creating thumbs, or solr not indexing), 2. Security issues; They can carry malicious javascript or launch actions to trigger their payload, or to allow the exploitation of vulnerabilities.  There is no way we can have every user conform to a particular pdf format, use an early enough compatibility, use a restricted set of fonts, embed fonts, remove all invalid links, check for malicious javascript, etc.   We *could* make a simple change and convert every incoming pdf to pdf/a format, it will drop all JavaScript, encryption, audio/video, external links, etc.   Or, we could use another sanitization processes such as (but limited to) a python commandline utlity called ExeFilter http://www.decalage.info/exefilter

title: after a user deletes a page object using the book sp, the user is returned to the object they deleted and it reports an error
description: what I said in the summary. Ideally the user would be returned to the parent object. I don't know if this is book or collection manager related.

title: Collection can be created within itself
description: I have noticed that it is possible to create a collection that exists within itself. I'm creating an ir:top collection on installation of the module and when the fedora repository pid is set to islandora:root this works fine. Later I change the root url to ir:top so that only the objects in ir:top are visible. If I then reinstall the ir:top collection I have it set to be created in the fedora repository pid collection, which is now ir:top. When I view ir:top I can see the collection ir:top along with the child collections. I'm surprised this doesn't break that badly, so far I've only noticed that the breadcrumbs go a bit crazy. This situation could lead to unpredictable behaviour and at the very least it's confusing. There should be a check when creating a collection to ensure that it isn't being made within itself.

Alan will have to provide the bulk of the information here. I suggest interviewing him as a starting point. (This is kind of a ticket for both of you). Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

title: discussion: utilizing tesseract to output encoded text (hocr) and creating text based PDFs
description: This touches on many solution packs and I just wanted to get some notes down from some experiments I've doing.  The result is the creation of a text embedded PDF that will be indexed and made searchable.  We can do this with our ABBYY software, but have not yet provided this functionality with tesseract.  In the book sp we do not have any fulltext search options at the book level as only the pages contain OCR.  When conducting a fulltext search, no faceting is available as the the page as no metadata is present.  Having a PDF at the book level that is text based and index will help create a more robust search.    Installing Tesseract 3.01 (and packages) I used the instructions found here to download and compile the latest version of Tesseract for macOSX.   Compiling SVN Tesseract on OSX http://mousecradle.wordpress.com/2011/05/17/compiling-svn-tesseract-on-osx/   Following the install of the software I had to download two additional packages : English Training Data http://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/detail?name=eng.traineddata.gz  Orientation & Script Detection Data for Tesseract 3.01  http://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/detail?name=tesseract-ocr-3.01.osd.tar.gz  put these in your tessdata directory...  Embedding Text into your PDF At this point you should be able to create an encoded output called HOCR.  Here's the command line ... tesseract test.tif test_output -l eng hocr This should result in a new file called test_output.html   To create a text based PDF ... you need to install a utility called hocr2pdf which is part of exact-image  sudo port install exact-image  http://www.exactcode.de/site/open_source/exactimage/hocr2pdf/  To embed the hocr into the TIFF image you issue this commandline (the -r 150 is the resolution of the pdf ... this may be needed to save on bytes if the pdf produced is acceptable)  hocr2pdf -r 150 -i test.tif -o test.pdf <test_output.html  Some scripting would be needed to redo existing book based PDFs.

title: Improvements to the Book Solution Pack Module
description: Alan has added a couple new improvements to the Book Solution Pack Module:  Collection Membership: Users can assign additional 'isMemberOf' collection relationships to book objects by selecting from a list of available collections. The option to remove this relationship will appear when a book is a member of more than one collection, so books will also be a member of at least one collection.  PDF Regeneration: Users can now generate a new PDF for the book - this will prove useful if pages are added, modified, or removed after the initial PDF is generated.  I will let Alan fill in any other relevant details before resolving this issue.

title: Cannot purge collection object even after all members of the collection have been purged
description: New logic that prevents a user from deleting a collection when doing so would orphan members of that collection is malfunctioning. Even after purging all members of a collection the system still prevents the user from purging the collection object itself (see attached screenshot).

description: I zipped audio, basic image, and PDF files with associated MODS XML files and the resulting objects had colons after their titles. The MODS Datastreams were created correctly, but the colon appears in the DC metadata (and in the collection view).  In the object view, the title appears as the original filename (instead of the title specified in the DC metadata).
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Batch Ingest Module 6.x (Deprecated),PDF Solution Pack

description: When adding audio, basic image, or PDF files via bulk ingest (without including XML files in the ZIP) the MODS datastream does not get created. If the user then tries to edit the metadata form they get the following error:  Fatal error: Call to a member function setAttribute() on a non-object in /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/Namespaces.inc on line 100
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Batch Ingest Module 6.x (Deprecated),PDF Solution Pack

The changes do get crosswalked to DC, but when I re-open the MODS form the changes are not present. Submitting the form also generates an error (see screenshot).

description: When a user clicks the edit tab on a PDF object and chooses the metadata form to edit, they are returned to the view tab and must then click the edit tab again to view the form. They should see the form immediately after choosing a form to edit.

title: Title field is not saved in the Large Image MODS Form
description: The title field in the default Large Image MODS Form does not save input. When the user goes back to edit the form this field appears blank.  This was a difficult bug to catch since the crosswalk to DC is working as intended, so the title does appear in the object's metadata View.

title: PDF 'View Document' link fails on batch ingested PDFs
description: PDFs added via batch ingest use a different DSID for the PDF, so the 'View Document' link fails to find the PDF and displays a 'Page not Found' instead.

title: View/Edit metadata links should only appear under Object Details tab for PDFs
description: Objects created using the PDF solution pack display the metadata and View/Edit links under both the Description and Object Details tabs. Ideally, these should only appear under the Object Details tab - similar to the way book objects are currently setup.

title: Can't replace RELS-EXT, DC, or MODS Datastreams under Detailed List of Content
description: If I try to replace the RELS-EXT, DC, or MODS Datastreams under an object's Detailed List of Content the operation fails and throws the following error:  Error Trying to call SOAP function modifyDatastreamByReference: SoapFault exception: [soapenv:Server.userException] org.fcrepo.server.errors.GeneralException: Inline XML datastreams must be modified by value, not by reference. in /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc:871 Stack trace: #0 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(871): SoapClient->__soapCall('modifyDatastrea...', Array) #1 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/api/fedora_item.inc(797): Fedora_Item::soap_call('modifyDatastrea...', Array, false) #2 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/fedora_repository.module(708): Fedora_Item->modify_datastream_by_reference('http://137.149....', 'RELS-EXT', 'Fedora Object-t...', 'text/xml') #3 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/form.inc(781): fedora_repository_replace_stream_form_submit(Array, Array) #4 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/form.inc(421): form_execute_handlers('submit', Array, Array) #5 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/form.inc(120): drupal_process_form('fedora_reposito...', Array, Array) #6 /var/www/drupal-6.22/sites/all/modules/islandora/fedora_repository.module(622): drupal_get_form('fedora_reposito...', 'islandora:925', 'RELS-EXT', 'Fedora Object-t...') #7 [internal function]: fedora_repository_replace_stream('islandora:925', 'RELS-EXT', 'Fedora Object-t...') #8 /var/www/drupal-6.22/includes/menu.inc(349): call_user_func_array('fedora_reposito...', Array) #9 /var/www/drupal-6.22/index.php(17): menu_execute_active_handler() #10 {main}  This doesn't occur very often, but users way want to alter these Datastreeams without using the Fedora Admin client, so they should be able to replace them this way.

title: ISLANDORA_PDF_SP_MODS_FORM_NAME needs to be removed from the Islandora release
description: ISLANDORA_PDF_SP_MODS_FORM_NAME gets installed along with Islandora PDF MODS Form, but the former is just a copy of the latter. We need to remove ISLANDORA_PDF_SP_MODS_FORM_NAME from the release so only Islandora PDF MODS Form gets created.

title: Adding new fields or tags to a form initiates file upload
description: If a user attaches a file to a form and then adds multiple fields or tags (for example, multiple creators or subjects) the attached file gets uploaded to the server each time a new field or tag is added. For large files this can take a considerable amount of time, and in any case the file should only be uploaded when the user hits the Submit button.

title: Form builder fails to print path to schema in warning message when NAT is disabled
description: This is a bit of an edge case, but it came up while testing the Islanda VM Image with the NAT network adapter disabled.  If you save a schema locally and then specify the correct location in the form properties, you still get a warning message that the schema could not be found. This is due to the fact that the schema imports two other schemas from online sources (xml.xsd and xlink.xsd) and without an internet connection these two schemas cannot be found.  However, in this case the warning message prints out a blank string (rather than the path specified in the form properties):  Failed to Find Schema. ''  The expected string should be printed out in the warning message.

title: Solr Search should support wildcard searches
description: Solr currently escapes wildcard searches through the advanced search block - * is changed to /* . Most users who are used to database searching will expect to be able to do a wildcard search, so Solr should be configured to handle this.

title: Permissions not set for Collection Manager, Book/Page Manager, and Batch Ingest
description: Permissions for the Collection Manager, Book/Page Manager, and Batch Ingest modules are not currently functional - anonymous users can manage collections, books, and pages, and batch ingest files even when permissions for those functions have not been granted to anonymous users.
component: Batch Ingest Module 6.x (Deprecated),Book Solution Pack,Collection Manager 6.x (Deprecated)

title: Collection header is not updated when collection is renamed
description: If a collection is renamed (Object Details > Edit) the header displayed above the Object Details tab is not updated - it continues to render the original title of the collection. The same is true of the title displayed in the header of whatever browser is being used.   When viewed in the Fedora Admin client, the collection object's label also fails to update - it retains the original name of the collection.

title: Book Manager ignores namespace restrictions when listing other collections a book may be added to
description: The Book Manager produces a list of available collections that a book may be added to. However, this list ignores namespace restrictions and lists every collection in the repository (you can see this behaviour in CAIRN). This list of possible collections should only include collections within allowed namespaces.

title: Solr module does a module load include and then checks if a class exists
description: This might be legacy code and there may be more examples of it in the module.    From islandora_solr_admin_settings(&$form_state) in islandora_solr_search.admin.inc   //checks for existence of PHP Solr client.   module_load_include('php', 'islandora_solr_search', 'SolrPhpClient/Apache/Solr/Service');   if (!class_exists('Apache_Solr_Service')) {     drupal_set_message("This module requires the " . l('Apache Solr php client', 'http://code.google.com/p/solr-php-client') . '.       Please install the client directory in the root directory of this module before continuing.');     return;   }  I think this will fail on the load_include before running the class_exists.  But asside from that, should it be checking for code that is included in the module?  I've been told the apache solr service didn't used to be included.  Perhaps we should either clean up the code or remove the solr service from the module.

title: The default solr admin fields do not follow the convention that is set out
description: From islandora_solr_admin_settings(&$form_state) in islandora_solr_search.admin.inc '#default_value' => variable_get('islandora_solr_search_block_facets', 'dc.subject ~ Subject,dc.type ~ Type'),    these should be line not comma deliminated

title: The title of a book object should only appear once when viewing the object
description: Currently, book titles are displayed both under the breadcrumb trail and under the Description tab. The title should be removed from the Description tab to bring the book display in line with other object displays.

title: Solr Basic Search block only searches dc.description
description: The Solr Basic Search block is only searching dc.description fields. This has been tested on CAIRN, sandbox, and the most recent VM. I'm not sure what fields Basic Search was originally designed to search, but it should at least pick up dc.title and probably some other fields as well.

title: Harvester module does not respect namespace restrictions
description: The Harvester module produces a list of collections that you can harvest metadata into. This list should only display collections in allowed namespaces, but instead it displays a list of all the collections in the repo.

title: PDFs created by the convert process in Book Solution Pack are large bytewise
description: In the book content model a PDF is created by concatenating all of the TIFF images using imagemagick's convert program. The result PDF is large ... can we look at methods for optimizing the creation of PDFs?  Would something like help?  convert -density 150 -compress ZIP big.pdf notsobig.pdf

title: possible Object Description and/or Documentation improovements
description: A client sent feedback on their site including this:  "4. Metadata  4.1. The Description page for an object is not populating the Date field at all. It should take the date from the MODS <dateCreated> element.  4.2. Clicking on a hyperlinked field in the metadata (Description page) does not generate any hits. But I found that if you lop off the following from the end of the URL...  " AND dc.type:collection AND dc.type:ingested"  the search works fine."  I should note that these books were ingested manually.  This mostly illustrates the need for dev docs and/or a unified batch ingest framework.  Though I'm not sure we should be making the assumption that users do not wish to see the page objects as mentioned in 4.2.

title: Islandora Virtual Machine Demo Networking Issue
description: Virtual Box Version 4.1.8 r75467.  O/S Windows XP 32bit. Islandora v 11.3 Ubuntu 32bit vm v1  Imported VM as per instructions.   VM Would not start because the "host only adaptor" (Adaptor 1) name was invalid. Disabled Adaptor 1.   Started the VM successfully however no IP address was assigned and the Islandora instance was not accessible. Shutdown the VM - Re-enabled Adaptor 1.  Different name assigned.   Re-started the VM.  IP assigned as expected.   Assigned IP now works.  Documentation needs revision to help less technical users resolve the issue.

It looks like the first pdf/mods file gets processed (an object gets created), but no others.

title: FOR DISCUSSION: Should we use the Internet Archive Viewer for books instead of IIV?
description: Jason showed me a demo of the Internet Archive Viewer, and it looks like a much better book viewer than IIV. It get called from an iFrame, so it shouldn't be a huge problem to swap one for the other. There may be some upgrade path issues for current users that we'd need to discuss, however.  Cool Internet Archive Viewer features:  - Scrollable page timeline at the bottom - Single and double page view - Slick page-turning animation - Autoplay  There may be some other cool features I'm missing, but we should discuss whether or not we want to use this viewer for the book solution pack.

title: Islandora should test for Drupal Filter
description: We should test to see if the drupal filter is installed correctly during the islandora install or in the config.

title: XML Forms can clobber 'future' versions
description: I had added some additional elements to a form, and had it working.  I happened to have another instance of the 'Edit form' page open though, which still had the form as it had been...  Being a bit inattentive, I went ended up in the old one, making a small change and hitting 'Save', thereby wiping the 'newer' changes...  Would likely also encounter behaviour like this if multiple users were trying to edit a form.  It seems like this could be easily handled by adding in a timestamp to the form definition (date of last edit), which is posted back on save.  You could then prompt the user if they're sure they want to save, if the timestamp being posted is smaller/before the one in the DB with the form definition--essentially returning a bit of JSON from the xml_form_builder_edit_save which is 'Form to be saved is based on version older than version currently in database: Force save y/n?'.  This would have saved me a bit of effort of recreating the changes, and doesn't carry quite have the same space concerns as my initial thought of versioning the form in the DB itself...  Food for thought?

title: islandora path aliases
description: I'm not sure if this has ever been brought up, but a client was wondering if the url /fedora/repository/pid:123 could be changed. I've been thinking about this as well. Especially on public sites this could be useful.  Drupal has a core module called path, which you can use to create path aliases for any existing path. It also has a contrib module called pathauto in which you can set paths per node type, user or taxonomy combined with token placeholders. All path aliases created by the path module (manually) or pathauto (automatically) are being stored in the same table. I've been playing around with it a bit and we can provide aliases for our objects. We should be able to create, update and delete path aliases on CRUD function calls.  Important to know about path aliases is that the original url's (fedora/repository/pid:123) are still used by all islandora modules and so they should. It only provides an alias, it doesn't replace the original url.  I'm not sure if we can hook into pathauto for this, but it should be fairly easy to create this ourselves. We don't have token placeholders for fedora objects. In drupal you can create your own tokens, but I haven't tried it. If we can't hook into the token module, it shouldn't be difficult to create a few basic tokens ourselves. We could create a placeholder for PID, dc:title and content model for example.  Main obstacle here are the links we create in collection objects. In order for links to use the path alias instead of the original url, links need to be processed with the drupal l() or url() function. I've tried and aliases work fine in drupal menu's or breadcrumbs, but not in collection objects because links here are generated directly to html as <a> elements. Php function calls in xslt are possible, but I also understand that nobody gets excited by that thought.  So we need to do a few things: 1) Create an interface define aliases with placeholders, if not leveraging pathauto, then custom made. 2) See if token support is possible, if not leveraging token module, then custom made. (if we are able to create fedora object tokens, this will come in handy in other scenarios as well.) 3) Update the path alias table on CRUD function calls 4) Get rid of xslt to create collection views or perform php function calls from the xslt. (or on page load use jquery/ajax to update all the urls, but that's a very ugly hack :)

title: when adding items to the select options through the XML Form Builder, use is unable to select item after a number of items have been added.

I've attached a couple of screenshots to illustrate the issue. In the first view (selectlist.png) you can see that the scrollbar is at the bottom of the view ... can't scroll down anymore ... but there are items below that. If you edit the item and then tab you can see the Update button and the item that was 'below the fold'. Clear as mud.

title: Fedora SOAP management URL in Islandora Configure / Fedora Collection List - Fedora 3.4 >

The default link to the Fedora SOAP management URL should be updated if you are using Fedora 3.4 or greater.  At the moment the default in the /admin/settings/fedora_repository is this:   http://localhost:8080/fedora/services/management?wsdl  but for Fedora 3.4> it should be:   http://localhost:8080/fedora/wsdl?api=API-M   The related documentation is here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/FEDORA34/API-M#API-M-WSDL

title: leading zeros in page number relation
description: I've been discussing the changes to the book solution pack with Jason and have a concern.  The old book solution pack had leading zeros in the pid.  The new one has them in the RELS-EXT.  If possible I would like to remove the leading zero convention in the book solution pack.  It complicates back end ingest scripts, requiring them to implement this convention(which has not always been documented).  This may have been used for sorting before, but with how the archive org book viewer uses explicit indexes pid=book[page] this is no longer necessary for the viewer.  Also, the 'pages' tab can be eliminated because the functionality can is present in the archive org viewer. Since an upgrade path is currently in the works, now is the ideal time to do this.

I've updated the cmodel on the upei VRE site and have tested it and it works. I've attached the modified version of the ISLANDORACM datastream for review/inclusion in audio solution pack.  dm

title: Zoom with thumbnail for context.
description: A DGI client wants to be able to zoom into a image in a viewer and see a thumbnail somewhere else on the page that shows them which part of the image they are zooming in on. It's a particularly useful feature for really detailed images, such as maps. It's a function that is used in the zoomify flash viewer. An example can be seen here:  http://images.library.pitt.edu/cgi-bin/i/image/image-idx?view=entry;cc=maps;entryid=x-116e1932

title: Viewer documentation

A DGI client asked me to convey his wish for more visible documentation on available viewers (ones that will work with Islandora without customization) and their capabilities. The client would like it to include info on the iiv viewer and the IA viewer.

title: Default sort function
description: In a few meeting with DGI staff and clients it's come up that Islandora doesn't have a default sort feature. I've heard from Paul that collections cannot sort with descriptive metadata fields that repeat and how it can break the feature.   A DGI client came up with a possible solution. I'm not sure if it's do-able or not:   "One strategy for us would be to make sure that there is a single title and creator element designated as "main" (or similar) by attribute for use in these situations.  A simpler approach, if it is possible, would be to make new solr fields, e.g. "sort_title", "sort_creator", and populate them with an xpath statement that only gets the first instance of each from the metadata. For example, the xpath for the general title field is:  /mods/titleInfo/title but to ensure we only get a single value for a "sort_title" field, we could modify that to:  /mods/titleInfo/title0 ...and do the same for creator. Thoughts on that approach?"

title: Stats/ Reporting functions for IR (scholar module)
description: I heard there's a new statistics module that's working with the scholar module (with Google analytics). A DGI client would like something similar. Not sure if it needs to be generalized or if it's good to go.   Also, clients have requested per item statistics (in an IR). UPEI is doing it in beta. See description below of how they're doing it:   "The current reporting function for the IR module exists as a submodule within the IR code but works independently, I've just not had the time to separate it into its own repo. It's also designed specifically for the IR module and so I didn't want to give people the wrong idea by presenting it as a standalone module. At the moment the module records every citation view and every datastream download from the citation view in the database. When a citation is viewed a piece of code writes the details to a database table, recording the pid and time that it was accessed. I wrote an intermediate page for the datastream download which is transparent to the user but also records when the datastream is accessed and the pid associated with it. The module allows for certain IPs to be ignored when collecting data so that developers testing the site don't artificially increase the hits on any of the content. There is also the option to clear the counts for certain pids or for the whole site. The main focus of this functionality was to give the users of the site some idea of how popular it was and so convince people that it's worthwhile participating in. While we wanted to be able to display the statistics for a specific object we also wanted to report site-wide statistics such as number of citations viewed or number of full-text articles downloaded. This was the main reason that I chose to store the information in the database rather than in a datastream associated with each object. While the datastream solution would allow for the reporting of statistics on an individual object it would be very time consuming to get a report on all of the objects in the site. That would involve reading the datastream for every object and adding together the number of times each object had been viewed. This is something that would have to be done an a periodic basis (daily) whereas a database query can be done on-the-fly to give the user up-to-date statistics."   Would love to have both available to use on other projects.

title: duplication of datastream content in large image solution pack
description: When adding an object to the large image solution pack collection the following datastreams are generated: RELS-EXT OBJ (the original tiff) TIFF (another tiff??) JP2 (compressed JP2) LOSSLESS_JP2 (archival JP2) JPG (web jpg) MODS DC  I'm thinking that we can dispense with the TIFF and LOSSLESS_JP2 datastreams as the OBJ has the archival TIFF? So it seems to me that the TIFF ds the lossless JP2 ds seem redundant if we've got the original tiff file stored in the OBJ datastream.  dm

title: convert syntax for TN missing quotes large_image.inc
description: line 58   exec("convert \"{$file}\"[0] -thumbnail x2000 -thumbnail x450  -resize '450x<' -resize 50% -fuzz 1% -trim +repage -gravity center -crop 200x200+0+0 +repage -format jpg -quality 100  $file-tn.jpg", $output, $returnValue);  variable $file-tn.jpg   should be \"$file-tn.jpg\"  just as it is in line 51 for the medium jpg  The existing format will work in most instances but some nastier file names break the current format.   This may of course be current in other solution packs where convert is creating a TN.   This also highlights a great need to sanitize filenames where possible or at least notifying the user when a naming convention breaks.   Example of nastiness....  #61 - (11) - I.H.tif  adding the quotes is extremely minor, checking over all longer, actually santizing filenames further may be a bigger issue requiring more thought

title: Drupal module uses deprecated API-A Lite API
description: The ObjectHelper.inc file uses the deprecated API-A Lite API, i.e. localhost:8080/fedora/get/{pid}/{dsID}  This causes problems when XACML policies are in place that require access to certain datastreams based on fedoraRole. Basically, despite sending accurate credentials in the GET request, the fedoraRole is not recognized by fedora's AttributeFinderModule, and a user cannot access a particular datastream. The protected datastreams, however, are viewable in Fedora's admin console (while using the same credentials) since that uses the REST API.  This can be fixed by replacing line 126 in ObjectHelper.inc like so:  -      $url = variable_get('fedora_base_url', 'http://localhost:8080/fedora') . '/get/' . $pid . '/' . $dsID; +      $url = variable_get('fedora_base_url', 'http://localhost:8080/fedora') . '/objects/' . $pid . '/datastreams/' . $dsID . '/content';

title: Large image solution pack, Servlet Filter, APIA Auth, Djatoka = Password Prompt

title: UX and theming improvements
description: This is a general ticket to address 2 issues. I'm assuming that these 2 issues aren't new to anyone, so they might be more of a reminder.  1) The lack of drupal theme layer integration. All markup from modules should be rendered through theme functions or template files. I would suggest checking core drupal theme functions in the drupal API overview, so these are not repeated. A few that are used often are theme_table() (<table>) and theme_item_list() (<ul>). I know many of us want to take this into consideration, but often we have a lot of time pressure on our projects so it's easy to overlook these 'details'. For core Islandora modules (anything hosted on the Islandora Github account), there shouldn't be any excuse though.  2) The lack of well thought out UX in islandora. The user interface of islandora is often very confusing or just plain wrong from a UX standpoint. I don't often manage objects, but I took a look today and it's pretty bad. (To modify or delete datastreams you have to navigate to the 'view' tab instead of the 'edit' tab ??) This might not be important from a developer's perspective, but really if you look at the total picture of the project this is like having a bunch of recoverable fatal errors in your code and do nothing about it.  I don't have any straight answers for these issues (yet), but I think it's a good idea not to accept any pull requests anymore with markup that's not rendered through the theme layer. On top of that all code should be able to pass the code review of the coder module. Our code should be able to pass the drupal.org code tests, which is a minimum requirement to be able to host any project on drupal.org.

title: Query Parsing in islandora_solr_search
description: Islandora Solr folks,  I believe there's a fairly important bug in the islandora_solr_search module (at least as of 11.3.1) that involves all multi-term Advanced Search queries.  In a nutshell, when in Islandora Solr Advanced Search, you pick a field called "subject" and type in "United States", the module builds a solr query like this:  q=subject:United States  Solr percieves the "Statues" as unattached, and breaks this down to  subject:united \ [default_field]:states.  Solr identifies a default field I believe from the Request Handler. In one project I'm currently helping with, Solr's default field is dc.description.  So when I explicitly select the Subject box in Advanced Search and enter, say, United States Steel Corporation, what Solr ends up with is:  subject:united \ dc.description:states \ dc.description:steel \ dc.description:corporation  i.e. the majority of my field-specific query is happening against the wrong field.  The solution is to wrap search terms in parentheses before executing a query, like this:  q=subject:(United States)  which Solr knows to break down to:  subject:united \ subject:states  Parenthesis wrapping won't affect quoted strings.  That is to say:  q=subject:("United States")  will break down to  subject:"united states"  i.e. not at all.  (Note: There is an implied OR between all search terms, and I'm not showing the tokenization that happens against text fields.)  I remember discovering this some time ago, and I really thought I'd incorporated a fix, but that would have been pre-git and I don't have a record of it.  Outwardly it seems that the islandora_solr_search implementation on islandlives.ca does correctly wrap solr search terms in parentheses, which suggests to me that a fix might have been un-fixed at some point in the past year or so.

All other parameters would be handled as additional parameters as ?foo=bar etc.  One of the suggestions is to use the exact same parameter names and value structures and pass everything to solr.
