Renders a basic item_list (unordered list), surrounded by pagers. Since https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/commit/4182bfac277a280473c06371efc409f347d5d29b (Already in core; should never be used, because sparql_to_html.xsl exists)  Upcoming, is the allowance for the specification of the thumbnail URI (that is, pid/dsid) in the query (defaulting to 'TN' on the current object, if not provided), in https://github.com/adam-vessey/islandora/commit/ee4427910b6fe44e8540c3302f968b3feab686b1

title: Install additional FFMpeg codec libraries to support more video/audio codecs
description: We need to support more codecs for the video solution pack. The compiled version of FFMpeg we're using already includes a lot of codecs, so in the short term we just need to install more libraries to support these codecs. This will also involve testing files that fail to convert to see what codecs they're using.

title: Improve error reporting when video conversion fails
description: When a video fails to convert due to an unsupported codec, we should display a message to the user indicating which codec failed so they'll know that it's not supported. To start, we can do this after the file gets uploaded by extracting the technical metadata using EXIF (this is already happening). Can we then grab the codec info from EXIF and display it to the user?

title: DC to MODS crosswalk produces undesirable results with repeated fields
description: I used the Harvester to create a bunch of objects using a CSV file with DC metadata. Several of the fields are repeated (multiple subject fields, etc.). This looks fine in DC, but when I try to edit the metadata using the relevant MODS form, the repeated fields cause problems:  # Multiple subject terms end up in the same field instead of split up as tags. ## The subject fieldset still gets repeated (after the submit button) with the same information in both fieldsets. # dc.format information gets lost - it doesn't appear on the MODS form at all. ## Despite this, the Physical Description fieldset repeats twice after the submit button (but appears empty). # dc.source information gets lost.  I'm not sure what the solution is here - maybe the Harvester should map records to MODS instead of DC and do the crosswalk in the other direction?

title: Hitting the 'Enter' key while entering a new CSL style deletes the first style in the list
description: If you hit the 'enter' key while entering a description for a new CSL style (whether or not a CSL file has been attached) the top style in the list gets deleted (instead of the new style getting added).

title: latest code as of May 9 2012 breaks the book solution pack (this is not an issue in the latest release)
description: The book solution pack ends up with a CollectionClass with a null internal collectionObject and whitescreens.  we need to add a check for a null collectionObject to prevent this.

title: Islandora solr search theming improvements
description: The solr search page layout and the default primary display profile are now rendered through the drupal theming layer. For both elements (page layout and default search results) a template file has been created.  Template files are intended to be copied to the theme if needed and to be modified there. Do not modify the template files in the module folders.  This change will hopefully make the prototype module islandora_solr_custom obsolete. Use of that module is strongly discouraged. Please override the new default template file instead (islandora-solr-search.tpl.php)

title: Islandora solr search drupal_set_title()
description: Setting the title now for the search results page using drupal_set_title(). This is the drupal way of setting titles. It's a bit more semantic too and it sets a more descriptive browser window title (<title>) . Small consequence is that visually the title moved up a little bit in the markup. It's rendered above the page content, instead of in it.

title: Islandora solr search reordered admin buttons
description: Changed the order of the admin save/reset buttons. They were set in a wrong order, often making users hitting 'reset' instead of 'save' by accident.

title: Created new form builder element 'pages', 'page'.
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/30  Related to https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-601  These two new form elements are used to section off parts of the form to make it easier for users to fill out a very large form. Basically works like tabs except the tabs appear on the left hand side.   A 'pages' element should contain two or more 'page' elements.  The user is presented with a next button to go to the next page, when this is pressed the current page will be validated, if errors exist the user will not be allow to progress to the next page. Kinda like a install wizard.  @todo Document and include in the next islandora release.

title: Breadcrumbs are repeated in Sandbox
description: http://sandbox.islandora.ca/fedora/repository/islandora:sp_basic_image_collection/-/collection  Take a look at the breadcrumbs on that page. It appears the collection name is repeated twice. This should be looked at. It could be fixed in the most recent version of Islandora, since Adam has done some work with breadcrumbs, but we should verify its fixed.

title: call to get related items should include ObjectHelper.inc, in some cases we can get to that call with objectHelper already being loaded.
description: In Some cases we get Class not found OBJECTHELPER.  Adding a module_load_include to the getRelatedItems function fixes this.

title: Remove ingest form information from SP content models
description: Most solution pack content models have legacy ingest form information included at the bottom of the XML documents. I don't think this is being used anymore since we build forms with XML Form Builder, but I wanted to check with everyone just in case. If it's cruft, I can remove it.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Book Solution Pack,Large Image Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack

title: Book Solution Pack should save and extract ZIP files to a temp directory
description: The 11.3.1 version of the Book Solution Pack uses the 'files' directory for temporary file storage. Temporary files should be stored in a temp directory within the files directory so it can be periodically wiped (to get rid of files leftover from failed operations). This will help save on disk space.

title: OAI Date format and Date Range Harvesting
description: The OAI module was providing dates with fractions of seconds attached to them. The OAI protocol doesn't allow this, so they are now rounded to the nearest second.   The module also didn't support harvesting with FROM and UNTIL dates, and only supported dates if they were provided with seconds. OAI now accepts dates in all the formats specified in the OAI spec and allows them to be passed as FROM and UNTIL arguments.

title: XML Form Builder changes booleans to uppercase and adds 'NULL' to blank fields when any changes are made to a form
description: This ticket is mostly a reminder to ask Nigel about this issue. Whenever you make any changes to a form in XML form builder and export the form, booleans get changed to uppercase (e.g. true becomes TRUE) and NULL gets added to any blank fields (which previously used closed tags (e.g. <update /> becomes <update>NULL</update>.  This doesn't seem to have any effect on the form's functionality, but it would be good to know why this is happening.

title: Islandora Books MODS Form contains extra whitespace that prevents fields from populating correctly
description: The default Books MODS form somehow ended up with a bunch of whitespace added to many of the field values. This is causing a couple problems; specifically, the 'By Statement' and 'Language' fields on the book description tab are not populating based on the form metadata.

title: Add support for JPG display in book solution pack
description: We currently use the IA viewer to display JP2 images for book pages, but the viewer supports a variety of other image formats. We have a use case for a collection of books that use JPGs instead of TIFFs (so no JP2s) and Alan was able to quickly add support for JPG ingest and display. Essentially, the viewer looks for a JP2 and displays it if it's there, but if not it falls back to JPG.  This solution could be useful for other users, and it wouldn't be difficult to implement.

title: XACML Editor should provide descriptive messages when user tries to perform a prohibited action
description: In some cases a user without permission to perform certain actions (based on XACML policies) will still see those actions as options on their screen due to Drupal permissions. For example, if a user has Drupal permission to use the XACML Editor, but a XACML permission prohibits them from editing a certain object, they may still be able to see the XACML editor for that object. However, when they try to save any changes made on the editor screen it fails (correctly) due to XACML policy enforcement.  This is all working as intended, but when such an action fails the user gets a generic Fedora error message (can't modify Datastream, etc.) instead of a relevant message about XACML permissions. We should provide more relevant information to the user in this case so they will know that their action failed due to XACML policy enforcement rather than a Fedora error.

title: Block Caching Can Cause Problems with Solr Facet Block
description: If block caching is enabled, and a search is done with no facets, that block can be disabled by the cache forever-more. We should see if we can disable block caching for this particular block.

title: Associate objects with more than one collection
description: This functionality was requested by a couple members of the Islandora community. The Collection Manager already allows objects to be migrated from one collection to another, but we should also allow objects to be associated with more than one collection (without removing the relationship from the current collection).

title: Add support for OAI-MODS harvesting
description: The Harvester currently supports OAI-DC harvesting, but we should also support OAI-MODS. Here's a sample request: http://memory.loc.gov/cgi-bin/oai2_0?verb=GetRecord&metadataPrefix=mods&identifier=oai:lcoa1.loc.gov:loc.gmd/g3791p.rr002300

title: Make default template file more semantic and add thumbnails by default.
description: Make default template file more semantic and add thumbnails by default.  This work has been done by Kris.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/45

title: large image solution pack has an incorrect service deployment and is missing required files in distribution
description: I enabled the large image solution pack and added an image.  It produced a Fedora error message. Investigating further discovered that the islandora:viewerSdep-large_image_sp was pointing to a different content model. I've corrected that and have attached the revised Sdep to the ticket.  The Sdep was calling the viewer /iiv/largeImageViewer.jsp ... it didn't exist in our existing install.  The /iiv/largeImageViewer.jsp also calls /iiv/js/largeImageViewer.js. I've also attached those additional files to the ticket.  They should be added to the solution pack as dependencies. This error was also reported in the islandora google group - https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/islandora-dev/y-N5MEc2G-0/-ie2NOTg1YcJ   Donald

title: Namespaces aren't consistently added to repeatable form elements
description: When updating a object, repeatable form elements aren't consistently getting the correct namespace.  When ingested I got this <mods:identifier type="local"></mods:identifier>  on the first update i got <mods:identifier type="local">id1</mods:identifier> <mods:identifier type="local">id2</mods:identifier>  2nd update i got <identifier type="local">id3</identifier> <identifier type="local">id4</identifier>  3rd update <mods:identifier type="local">id5</mods:identifier>  On the 2nd update, the namespaces weren't added. This problem has occurred numerous times over the last couple of days. I was able to re-create the same problem on the sandbox.

title: Hover tooltips for tabs in XML Form Builder
description: Previously, tabs would process only text fields to populate on the hover over effect. Furthermore, when there was no text enter it would display "Empty". Changed such that text areas populate the hover and no hover effect occurs when a tab is empty. Originally, requested for changes by Colorado.  My fork here as there is an issue currently with the 6.x branch of XML Forms.  https://github.com/jordandukart/islandora_xml_forms/tree/jordan. Tabs.js is the only file changed.

title: Hover tooltip effect for XML Form Builder Non-functioning
description: In the current 6.x branch of XML Form Builder located at https://github.com/islandora/islandora_xml_forms, the hover effect is not present. Tracing backwards the last commit where it worked correctly is located at https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/commit/54b1de574334033d1e393515cf8043c0308a8b48.

title: diacritics / character encoding often breaks the default collection view
description: When you have diacritics in your label or metadata, it will often break the default collection view.  What I think is happening is that the original markup is encoded as iso-8859-1 and when processed through the existing xslt, dumps out characters that break the display/xslt view.  Something that seems to be working for me is including this element near the top of the xslt  <xsl:output method="xml" encoding="UTF-8"/>  So for this file   /islandora/xsl/sparql_to_html.xsl   I changed this <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:s="http://www.w3.org/2001/sw/DataAccess/rf1/result" version="1.0" xmlns:php="http://php.net/xsl" exclude-result-prefixes="php">   to this  <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" xmlns:s="http://www.w3.org/2001/sw/DataAccess/rf1/result" version="1.0" xmlns:php="http://php.net/xsl" exclude-result-prefixes="php"> <xsl:output method="xml" encoding="UTF-8"/>  It fixed my issue. Would be useful to get this tested elsewhere.  dm

title: Administer Form Associations permission should not be required to select a content model on ingest
description: Currently, a user needs the 'Adminster Form Associations' permission to select a different content model when ingesting an object. If the user lacks this permission they get a popup window with an 'Error 403' message. Users should not need this permission to select a content model on ingest.

title: Run Coder on Core
description: We need to run coder on the core code and make sure we meet the coding standards.

title: Port PDF solution pack to drupal 7
description: Port the PDF solution pack to work with the Drupal 7 version of Islandora

title: Solution pack object status screen.
description: It might be nice to have a solution pack screen like we had in the old core.   Required object status: installed, out-of-date, missing.   This requires versioning of content models. We could do this with the RELS-EXT.

title: Create solution pack functions
description: Pull the functions used in the .install files out and generalise them in the solutionpacks.inc file.

title: Conversion scripts for ISLANDORACM
description: Create conversion scripts to convert the ISLANDORACM datastream to DS_COMPOSITE

title: Collection Creation in Formbuilder
description: The collection solution pack should hook the ingest functionality of the formbuilder so that new collections can be created using the formbuilder.

title: Update Solr module documentation
description: Create DOxygen comments for Solr module documentation.

title: Add database prefixes to drupal filter
description: Add database prefixes to the drupal filter to allow multiple secure islandora installations in a multisite.

title: Templates for  Table Display
description: We should be using template files to draw the solr table display.

title: Investigate drupal class autoloading
description: Investigate using drupal class autoloading

title: Document installation of latest GSearch and Solr
description: Document the installation procedure for GSearch 2.4.1 and Solr 3.6.

title: Review collection policy xsd
description: Review the xsd governing collection policies and remove ISLANDORACM

title: Discuss merging PHPLib
description: We should discuss merging phplib into form builder or islandora core, depending where it belongs so that we can call the functions and we don't have everything depending on it.

title: Make sure Form Builder 7.x passes code tests
description: We need to make sure Form Builder the Drupal 7 version of Islandora passes the same code tests that the Form Builder used in the Drupal 6 version of Islandora passed.

title: Adapt AHAH use for D7
description: The XML form elements module is heavily dependant on AHAH and needs to be enitrely reworked to make sure it works with D7. This work has been started by Richard.

title: Handle form associations better
description: Currently a message is displayed when you try to ingest content but no form is associated with the content model. This message should include a link to a documentation page detailing how to add form associations.

title: Clean up XML Forms dependencies
description: The XML Forms suite of modules has many interconnected dependencies. We need to clean these up so they form a hierarchical tree rather than a web.

title: Document configuring Solr to search both Drupal and Fedora
description: Solr is capable of searching content in both Drupal and Fedora. We need to document this configuration.

title: Extend Solr PHP Client instead of hacking it
description: Extend solr php client don't hack it. We currently hack the solr php client and ship our own version. It would be nice to fix this.

title: Fix snippets/highlights
description: Fix snippets/highlights

title: Allow additional/replacement of all content groups.
description: In addition to the usual inline XML and managed streams, redirect and externally managed streams may now be added, as of commit https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/commit/c3ccdec4  This functionality can be enabled in the "Advanced" Islandora configuration.

title: Add page parameter to invocation of islandora_tabs
description: The was a bit of a divergence in the functionality between the IslandoraCM hook and islandora_tabs; IslandoraCM was instantiatied with a PID and then the function called with what was often considered a page number...  islandora_tabs was only being called with a PID (in addition to the list of content models).  I just added the "page" parameter onto the end of the "module_invoke_all('islandora_tabs'...)", to facilitate some code migration.

title: Create function to render image markup
description: Wanted to try using imagecache_external in a number of places, but didn't want have to write work-around code everywhere...  Led to writing a function to produce the markup, which falls back to trying to use the basic theme('image').  I ended up with a couple of functions: fedora_repository_render_image (which takes a pid, dsid and an imagecache preset, and calls the second function) and _fedora_repository_render_image (which takes a URL and an imagecache preset).  https://github.com/adam-vessey/islandora/commit/7749a2f39f2f86aac5dd85ae66897a0d39e5e0e9

title: Removing solution pack objects in islandora core
description: From Paul:  I think we need to be very careful in the installers to not do anything to fedora objects that exist.  I think Richard mentioned that he removes object if you disable or uninstall a module.  We may not want to do that, I'm thinking of multi site installs.  We may not want the bookviewer in site A so we decide to remove it but there could many other sites that still have the bookviewer installed and would still want or need the cmodel in fedora.  We are not as dependent as we used to be on cmodels but we probably still want to leave them there.  I think this is a fairly important thing to discuss, so I'm adding it a jira ticket here so we don't lose it.

title: Collection Management ... child collections don't have islandora:collectionCModel
description: Just noticed that when you are in the Basic Image Collection on the codesprint server and manage the collection ... you can't add a child collection because the islandora:collectionCModel is missing from COLLECTION_POLICY. This is probably associated with Richard's ticket re: collection_policy.xsd.  What role does the COLLECTION_POLICY ds play in 7.x?   dm

title: Cange how the Tuque library is loaded in D7
description: We need to be able to package tuque with islandora.

title: ownerid disappears after editing image metadata
description: When an object is created through the online interface, the fedorda ownerid is assigned the value of the operator's userid, e.g.:  <foxml:property NAME="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#ownerId" VALUE="fclakevin"/>  In Large Image and Basic Image (but not in Books, and I have not tested the other Solution Packs) the ownerid is assigned properly on Ingest, but if the metadata is edited and updated through the online form, the owner id disappears:  <foxml:property NAME="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#ownerId" VALUE=""/>  This may or may not be related to a second problem, that Large Image and Basic Image objects loaded through the Batch Module do not have ownerid values in the foxml.  This may be something specific to the Batch Module, or it may simply be a case of the ownerid being lost when the object is edited; if you look at an object loaded through the Batch Module, the audit trail shows that it is loaded and then updated several times.
component: Basic Image Solution Pack,Large Image Solution Pack

title: Batch upload with metadata does not add fedora identifier
description: This applies to Large Image and Basic Image, may apply to others as well but I haven't tested those.  When you ingest an image and create metadata online, the fedora identifier is added to the metadata.  When you use the Batch Module to ingest an image with no metadata, it will create stub metadata with a dc.identifier containing the Fedora identifier.   However, when you use the Batch Module to ingest an image WITH metadata, the metadata is not updated to include the Fedora Identifier.

title: Batch ingest does not provide ownerid to foxml
description: For Large Image and Basic Image (and possibly others, I have not tested), when an image is ingested through the Batch Module, the fedora ownerid value is not supplied.  This may be related to bug 655.  I am recording this and 655 as "major" priority because our security / permissions will be partially based on ownerid.

title: Large image ingest fails with XML form error
description: After enabling the 12.2.0-RC1 version of the Large Image solution pack and trying to ingest a TIFF I get a white screen with the following error:   Fatal error: Call to a member function getRegistered() on a non-object in /var/www/html/drupal-6.25/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/XMLFormProcessor.inc on line 188  The new object does not get created.

title: Large Image Tags do not work properly
description: The Large Image SP is the only SP that allows the user to add tags. Adding tags seems to work, but clicking a tag produces the following error (Islandora 12.2.0-RC1):  Repository advanced search The indexName DemoOnLucene is not configured.

title: Date range faceting
description: For islandora solr D6 I created the ability to add date faceting. For now the admin settings include the following: - textarea to add one or multiple date fields with human readable names (timestamp ~ Timestamp) - textfield for start value (NOW/YEAR-20YEARS) - textfield for end value (NOW) - textfield for gap (+YEAR) - textfield for php date formatting (Y)  Limitations: - multiple date fields possible, but use same settings - textfield settings are a bit advanced, but most flexible. In the future this could be dropdowns with advanced textfield option - no checks in place to make sure the filled out fields are really date fields - should the order of the date fields be reversed, starting with most recent first?

title: Solr Breadcrumbs Incorrect when there is a space in the advanced search
description: When you put a space in the advanced search block solr leaves extra characters in the breadcrumb. https://skitch.com/jongreen/ey6q9/search-results-releasetester.islandora.ca

title: Should metadata XSLTs be associated with a Datastream rather than a form/content model?
description: Currently, XSLTs are associated with a particular form/content model combination in the Form Associations interface. One of the consequences of this setup is that manually replacing a metadata Datastream in the Object Details tab does not crosswalk the changes to the DC Datastream.  Should we instead associate an XSLT with a Datastream (e.g. mods_to_dc.xsl gets associated with the MODS Datastream)? One issue to consider in this case would be that only 1 XSLT could be associated with a Datastream, so you couldn't have 2 different mods_to_dc.xsl transforms for 2 different MODS forms, but I'm not sure if this would ever be a problem for anyone.   To be discussed at the next committers meeting.

title: Book SP configuration does not properly validate Djatoka URLs
description: When configuring the Book SP (6.x-12.2.0), you can enter any URL into the Djatoka path field and it will appear to be valid. This field should properly validate URLs.

title: "Tree" checkbox has no effect
description: The "upload_element" cannot be parsed as a tree structure; therefore it is necessary to disable the tree setting in the form (just on the upload_element)...  The "tree" checkbox in the advanced settings has no effect--should set "#tree" => TRUE/FALSE accordingly, on the currently selected element.

title: Create warning messages if the PHP File Upload Limit is Less then Filesize
description: Right now when you try to upload a file, and the file is larger then the file upload limit, we just don't upload the file and display some warnings about using the properties of a non-object. I think we can probably make these messages more helpful.

title: Using a DC form causes the DC Datastream to get updated twice
description: When associating a DC form with a content model we still need to use an XSLT (in this case dc_no_transform.xml). This causes the DC Datastream to get updated twice whenever the form gets submitted (the form updates the DC Datastream and then the XSLT updates the Datastream). We should eliminate the redundant update in this case.

title: Allow metadata Datastream to be created on-the-fly if none exists
description: If a user associates a metadata form (e.g. MODS) with a content model and tries to edit the form for an object that does not already have the relevant Datastream, the operation will fail with an error. In this case, the relevant Datastream should simply be created when the user first submits the form.

title: Option to create datastreams as Managed
description: In both D6 and D7 we are currently defaulting to creating metadata datastreams as inline xml. This makes gsearch indexing easier, but it can create performance problems. Fedora starts to choke when the foxml gets over 30 to 40kb. With inline metadata and versioning, this can happen quickly.  We should maybe give the user an option for inline xml, or managed when we are creating the form association. Or maybe we just use managed. This should be discussed at committers.

title: Disable form submission when enter key is pressed on tagged fields
description: When entering data into a tag field in form builder, can we disable form submission if the user hits the enter key?

title: Redirect to an object within a collection when ?destination is set in the URL fails.
description: When Drupal tries to redirect to an object within a collection it strips part of the url such that a link such as http://jordanvm-03.dgi/fedora/repository/islandora%3A109 becomes stripped to http://jordanvm-03.dgi//repository/islandora%3A109. This behaviour does not happen when ?destination is set to redirect to a collection.  Ran into this when trying to redirect back to an object page when using drupal_get_destination(). May be related to how drupal_goto handles destinations: http://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes!common.inc/function/drupal_goto/6.  This can be replicated on a VM where you are on an object as an anon user and you login and a redirect to return to the previous page attempts to take place. Alternatively, if you have the devel module enabled and try to clear the cache this behaviour happens while on an object within a collection.

title: Highlight permutations of search term when searching inside book
description: Currently, text highlighting only works for the information stored in the hOCR Datastream, so word permutations are not highlighted. For example, searching for "call" will not highlight "called" or "calls" (though these permutations will still be picked up by Solr).   It would be a good idea to look into improving text highlighting to support word permutations.

title: Collection Views Don't Filter on Namespaces
description: When you are viewing a collection that contains objects that are in a restricted namespace, you can see those objects, but they have broken thumbnails, and when you click on them they display an access denied screen.   This seems tricky to handle, post query filtering maybe?   This should be discussed at committers.

title: Solr Date Faceting Throwing Timezone errors
description: We need to take a look at this in D7.   We should also take a look at other solutions. Leaving this open so we remember to discuss.

title: Fedora Image API dependencies for Large Image SP Large Image Display
description: Large image display is looking for this image <site>/fedora/imageapi/islandora:212/JPG/JPG.jpg But should be requesting this. <site>/fedora/islandora:212/JPG/JPG.jpg

title: IIV viewer doesn't work with fedora 3.5 due to a change
description: Fedora 3.5 has a security policy that blocks unauthenticated access to the risearch. This is blocking the large image viewer from working...  Work around is to edit /usr/local/fedora/server/config/spring/web/security.xml and commenting out the line: <security:filter-chain pattern="/risearch*" filters="ChannelFilter,AuthFilterJAAS" />

title: Dynamically adding new fields to metadata form triggers *.js download in IE7/8/9
description: If a user ingests or edits an object and tries to dynamically add a field to the metadata form (by clicking one of the plus buttons) in IE7, 8, or 9 a download of a .js file is triggered (see screenshot). Adding the new field fails.

title: djatoka doesn't like small images
description: If an ingested image is too small, IIV or openseadragon won't display it. There looks to be a merged pull request regarding this issue, but it's still broken.  https://github.com/Islandora/iiv/pull/3
component: Islandora Image Viewer (Deprecated),Large Image Solution Pack

title: Form sections duplicate
description: A number of form issues have been reported on a few projects recently. The problem often involves sections of a form duplicating and the submit button appearing somewhere in the middle of the page. TJ and Jason have both dealt with this.   Is there something systematic that's causing these problems with the forms?

title: Audio Solution Pack Path error
description: $pathTojs = "/sites/all/libraries/mediaplayer4/jwplayer.js";  Should read      $pathTojs = "sites/all/libraries/mediaplayer4/jwplayer.js";

title: Tabs to manage a book collection do not appear if Optimize JavaScript is Enabled.
description: Had an issue on multiple new setups. After much poking around, it seems that Drupal Performance option Optimize JavaScript files needs to be disabled. (Thank you Paul!)  Found here: http://myFavourite.islandora.ca/admin/settings/performance  When enabled, Tabs do not appear. At the very least we need to document this.

title: OAI module no longer works with PHP 5.2
description: The module used to expose Fedora content to OAI harvesters no longer works with PHP 5.2. When installed the site whitescreens and the error reported is from line 828 of islandora_oai.module where there is a call to a static method which PHP 5.2 doesn't like.

title: Islandora Harvester Module - no permissions associated?
description: Make harvester module permissionable? Can't find any harvest permissions in Berkeley permissions page. Permissions associated with the batch ingest module might be misleading to some users.

title: Replacing the OCR Datastream for books saves the path instead of the text itself
description: If a user replaces the scanned text (OCR) for a book page (under Object Details) the new TXT file contains the path to itself on the server rather than the text it would normally contain.

title: Tuque contains drupal references
description: The tuque api contains some drupal refertences in FoxmlDocument.inc. We should pull them out.

title: Islandora 7 Broken with Clean URLs turned off
description: The collection list and grid view links are broken unless clean urls are turned on. We should fix this. There isn't any reason we should require clean urls.

title: ~slsh~ not replaced with a / in the filter parameters generated from the URL
description: When passing in filter parameters generated from the URL ~slsh~ does not get replaced to /.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/63

title: collection manager is causing slow load times
description: The collection manager adds two forms to the "Manage This Collection" tab to batch move or batch delete objects.  For large collections these forms become massive and increase collection view load times by about 7x.  Some large collections (8400 objects) can take 30+ seconds to load because of these forms alone.  Can we move/remove them or convert them to ajax?

title: modify_datastream_by_reference fails when the external url begins in HTTPS
description: The modify_datastream_by_reference function fails when attempting to access an external URL beginning in HTTPS. This was rectified similarily in the add_datastream_from_url  function by changing the URL variable to access the file via HTTP.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/150  Committers discussion:  The comment on add_datastream_from_url states: "Fedora has some problems getting files from HTTPS connections sometimes, so if we are getting a file from the local drupal, we try to pass a HTTP url instead of a HTTPS one."  On sites with only HTTPS access, is there a viable solution to facilitate this?

title: add a note in drupal 7 docs that you will not be able to ingest unless you install and enable the formbuilder module
description: add a note in drupal 7 docs that you will not be able to ingest unless you install and enable the formbuilder module or another module that implements the ingest registry hook.

title: Dimensions for IA Book Viewer
description: With diverse page sizes in a book, stretching can occur due to the different aspect rations.  Getting dimensions on-the-fly is slow, so it would be best to store them and provide them along with the PIDs, in a more complete "book structure" to pass into the viewer.  For FJM, I currently having it generate the dimensions on-the-fly (via Djatoka's "metadata" call), but this is prohibitively slow.  It would probably be best to get dimensions for every derived image put into the RELS-INT for the given page objects so they can all be selected in a single query.  Alternatively, we might be able to leverage Solr to obtain the list of pages instead of dealing with RDF/RELS-INT.

title: make sure proper forms and form associations are being created by existing drupal 7 module installers.
description: make sure proper forms and form associations are being created by existing drupal 7 module installers.

title: iabookviewer and possibly all solution packs that depend on djatoka may fail if islandora is configured to use https to access fedora
description: iabookviewer and possibly all solution packs that depend on djatoka may fail if islandora is configured to use https to access fedora  when not configured using https the book viewer tries to use this url http://192.168.56.195:8080/adore-djatoka/resolver?url_ver=Z39.88-2004&rft_id=http://192.168.56.195:8080/fedora/objects/islandora:8/datastreams/JP2/content&svc_id=info:lanl-repo/svc/getMetadata   Which returns the metadata fine  When configured to use https the url looks like this.   http://192.168.56.195:8080/adore-djatoka/resolver?url_ver=Z39.88-2004&rft_id=https://192.168.56.195:8443/fedora/objects/islandora:8/datastreams/JP2/content&svc_id=info:lanl-repo/svc/getMetadata   which fails  Event this https://192.168.56.195:8443/adore-djatoka/resolver?url_ver=Z39.88-2004&rft_id=https://192.168.56.195:8443/fedora/objects/islandora:8/datastreams/JP2/content&svc_id=info:lanl-repo/svc/getMetadata Fails  I think this is more of a fedora - djatoka problem then islandora but if we had a work around or fix it would be great.  This is with a self signed cert.  We need a test env with a cert issued by an authority to test some of these issues against.

title: Purging through collection/book manager fails when not logged in as user 1
description: I have found four scenarios where purge fails when logged in as a user other than user 1 (even with all permissions set):  1. Manage This Collection > Delete Members of this Collection 2. Manage This Collection > Delete Collection 3. Book > Manage > Permanently Delete Page from this Book 4. Book > Manage > Permanently Delete this Book  In each case the object disappears from the Islandora interface but a SOAP error calling purgeObject gets thrown. The object is still listed in the Fedora Admin client and in the Collection Manager, but the user cannot interact with it: further purgeObject errors are thrown, and Fedora cannot find the object in the Admin client.

title: Creating new books causes occassional whitescreens
description: Sometimes adding a new book causes a whitescreen, but the book still gets created. The behaviour is somewhat inconsistent, but it can be reproduced in the latest version of Islandora by creating a few book objects one after the other.

title: Solr: enforce 0 setting for soft limit
description: Added a tweak to enforce the 'soft limit' setting better. The description to use the soft limit states that 0 disables the soft limit, but it didn't seem to work.  Added to pull request: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/65  Probably needs a fix for D7 as well.

title: Tuque library uses an API-M call for an API-A type request
description: When the content of a Datastream object is requested (which is an API-A request), there is first a call to populateDatastreamInfo(), which attempts to retrieve the full history of a datastream. This request, however, uses API-M.  The problem emerges when an object may have a POLICY datastream that permits API-A but which denies API-M (i.e. other than to administrators). Then, when a non-administrator tries to simply view the object, the request is denied.

title: Add or Modify QUERY option in collection manager requires help text
description: This should reference relevant documentation so users can seek out additional information about the purpose of this option.

title: Added RSS display profile
description: Added an RSS display profile to islandora_solr_search. For a couple RSS elements defaults are provided, and for other fields, there is a small config page added with some fields to fill out. For the items, mostly it would be a solr field. (dc.title for example for the title element), but for an enclosure element a datastream ID is required, so an url to that datastream is created.  For now the title and description of the channel element uses a default, but it's possible to add values for copyright, managing editor and webmaster.  both the ::rssItem() and ::rssChannel() methods can be overridden to take full control.  I could add a textfield for every possible RSS element, but for now that might be a bit much?  Here's some background on some basic RSS elements: http://feed2.w3.org/docs/rss2.html  Pull request: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/65

title: the default mods_to_dc.xsl doesn't crosswalk mods:dateIssued to dc:date
description: When editing content I noticed that the date I had entered in a mods:dateIssued element wasn't appearing in the dc:date element after saving.  I believe the issue is with with current mods_to_dc.xsl located here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_content_model_forms/blob/6.x/transforms/mods_to_dc.xsl . I've attached a transform that works for me, but should be tested. Donald

title: XML Forms Schema API Fatal Error.
description: PHP Fatal error:  Call to a member function storeMatch() on a non-object in /home/nbanks/sites/si-islandora.si.local/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/schema/InsertOrderMap.inc on line 184, referer: http://si-islandora.si.local/admin/content/xml/form/EAC-CPF%20Base%20Form/view  Error occurs when attempting to determine the insert order of the following chunk of EAC-CPF Schema.  <xs:element name="identity">   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" minOccurs="0" ref="entityId"/>     <xs:element ref="entityType"/>     <xs:choice maxOccurs="unbounded">      <xs:element ref="nameEntryParallel"/>      <xs:element name="nameEntry">       <xs:complexType>        <xs:sequence>         <xs:element maxOccurs="unbounded" ref="part"/>         <xs:element minOccurs="0" ref="useDates"/>         <xs:group ref="m.nameEntryAuthorizedorAlternative"/>        </xs:sequence>        <xs:attribute ref="xml:id"/>        <xs:attributeGroup ref="m.entryLanguageAttributes"/>        <xs:attribute name="localType" type="xs:anyURI"/>       </xs:complexType>      </xs:element>     </xs:choice>     <xs:element minOccurs="0" ref="descriptiveNote"/>    </xs:sequence>    <xs:attribute ref="xml:id"/>    <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang"/>    <xs:attribute ref="xml:base"/>    <xs:attribute name="localType" type="xs:anyURI"/>    <xs:attribute name="identityType">     <xs:simpleType>      <xs:restriction base="xs:token">       <xs:enumeration value="given"/>       <xs:enumeration value="acquired"/>      </xs:restriction>     </xs:simpleType>    </xs:attribute>   </xs:complexType>  </xs:element>  Notes: Before attempting to fix this particular issue, I think it would be prudent to write a collection of Unit tests, to ensure that schema's are processed correctly.  The algorithm at play uses recursion heavily and is tricky to debug.  The presence of Groups maybe the cause of problems since they aren't currently supported.   I'm gonna guess 3 days to write the tests and also fix the problem.

title: Solr: variable date ranges, date slider/graph, date picker, exposed result limits, sorting
description: Some improvements for islandora_solr_search D6: - added functionality to render variable date range facets. A new date range is calculated based on the current date filter - added a tool which replaces the date range facets with a slider and graph. - added a date range filter as two text fields with optional jquery datepicker. - backported sorting (with block) from islandora_solr 7 - added exposed result limits as links

title: add configuration to allow admins to tell islandora to verify ssl peers or not.
description: add configuration to allow admins to tell islandora to verify ssl peers or not.  this would affect islandora 6 and 7.

title: ZIP compression on second page load
description: I've seen this in a couple places when we output XML or JSON and try to not output any of hte drupal stuff to the screen. On the second page load drupal will try to send a zipped version.

title: Remove IMT references from pageCModel
description: From Alan:  The file, the class and the method for displaying the page view has referenced IMT for historical reasons. This these three things should all be renamed, and the content model updated to access the renamed logic.  The files have been updated - These changes will break pageviews on existing installations unless the pageCModel is updated in the islandora admin panel. Our documentation should mention this.

title: Update the Tuque API to use Fedora 3.6 getDatastreams
description: The REST API in Fedora 3.6 started to allow you to make a call to getDatastreams. This is documented here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/FEDORA36/REST+API#RESTAPI-getDatastreams  We can use this to optimize how many calls we need when load an object. Currently we are loading getDatastreamHistory, but we probably want to get all the datastreams instead.   The first step in this would be to break the API out into different versions based on the version of Fedora, and then add the new getDatastreams function to the API class for the correct Fedora version. This allows us a lot of flexibility going forward.

title: Update the Tuque Error handler to deal with new Fedora Error Reporting
description: Fedora 3.6 did this: Updated REST API Validation failure response codes. If a REST API management operation results in a validation failure (e.g. ingest FOXML validation, validation failure via the DOObjectValidator module) the HTTP response code is now 400. Previously Fedora reported a generic Server Failure 500 response code. The response body indicates the nature of the validation error.  There is an error handling class attached in Tuque, that we should update so it parses errors differently in the new version of Fedora.

title: Islandora Drupal module does not appear to work for subdirectory installations of Drupal
description: From our experiments, the Islandora core module for Drupal 6 (haven't yet tested for Drupal 7) does not appear to work with a subdirectory installation of Drupal (i.e. your-site-domain.edu/drupal). This probably results from the use of the $path variable, which would of course include the subdirectory, in many of the controller switching points, inside the module. To replicate this, first install Drupal in s subdirectory of a site, and configure the $base_url in the settings.php for your site, so that Drupal works. After setting up the Islandora module, attempt to add a child collection to the islandora:root collection.

title: Islandora Solr facet pages
description: I created a new module which allows to easily create facet pages which you can navigate with an alphabetical pager. Part of the code is based on Adam's client-specific module. I made it so that it's easy to deploy and configure.  Code: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_facet_pages  Un-themed example: https://skitch.com/dannyjoris/epb7b/facet-pages-example Admin screenshot: https://skitch.com/dannyjoris/epb5e/facet-pages-admin Block: https://skitch.com/dannyjoris/ec4h1/facet-pages-block (this screenshot doesn't represent the values in the admin screenshot. The block contains all admin values)  Everything is easily themable, also per-path overrides.

title: Make xml_form_builder depend on external extjs module rather than having its own embedded within it.
description: Currently the xml_form_builder depends on its own internal extjs 4.0.1 library. Make xml_form_builder depend on the external extjs module/lib rather than having its own embedded within it.

title: Document FITS Integration
description: We updated all the modules listed in this ticket to include FITS support. We should include documentation about how to work with this. How to installed it, configure it, etc.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Islandora Module (Core),Large Image Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack,Video Solution Pack

title: Tuque all datastream profiles
description: We should try passing the profiles = true flag in 3.6

title: Port RSS secondary display to D7
description: Port RSS display to D7.  D6 ticket: https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-715

title: Download.inc in the Content Model Viewer uses deprecated API-A Lite API.
description: Same issue that was brought up and resolved in https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-548.

title: Added replace_slashes() to link urls
description: Didn't add replace_slashes() to links as well. Fixed in D6 and D7.

title: Handle count responses as part of the query function in RepositoryQuery.php
description: In the risearch interface its possible to do count queries which only return the number of results. It would be nice if we could do this though the RepositoryQuery class as well, currently it only handles sparql responses.

title: Expose FedoraObject datastreams to be used with php array functions.
description: When attempting to use php array functions such as array_keys/array_map with a FedoraObject instances's data streams, I couldn't find a way to do so. It seems as though all iteration must be done via for loops or using SPL Iterators class (Which are not always available).  It would be convenient to be able to get all the DSID's of an object by doing something like.  array_keys($object->datastreams); or array_keys($object);  or to utilize the array_map, and array_walk functions. http://www.php.net/manual/en/ref.array.php  We need discuss and think carefully before adding something like as $datastreams is currently protected and managed by the object, and I don't think it would be a good idea to expose it publicly.  Given the design we may not be able to have this functionality.

title: Add pages to book without being logged in security loop hole
description: http://sandbox.islandora.ca/islandora/book/upload/<pid> is accessible without being logged into drupal.

title: Page sequencing is off when uploading non-zipped pages
description: When uploading pages that are not zipped, whatever file finishes uploading first is considered the first page, second file finished uploading is second page, etc. It ignores the file name sequencing.

title: Appending pages not adhering to sequencing
description: If I add files 1700.jpg and 1701.jpg I get page 1 and page 2. These files are really page 3 and 4 of a book. If I go back and append file 1686.jpg and 1687.jpg and set the start sequence to 1 I get the following...  1 1700 2 1686 2 1701 3 1687

title: D6 solr now has separate permission to view search results
description: D6 solr now has separate permission to view search results. + An upgrade function has been created to copy the permissions from 'view fedora collection' to the 'view islandora solr search results' permission. (If the user hasn't already set permissions manually before doing running the upgrade)  One detail to be considered is that if you have permissions to view search results, but not to view the collection, the links in the search results will always link to an access denied page. Should I make the default search results links conditional on user access?  Pull request: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/80

title: The regex used to validate mimetypes requires a minor change to allow periods.  application/vnd.oasis.opendocument.text fails validation
description: None

title: Form builder fails to load forms with 10+ authors
description: Many scientific publications have 10 or more authors - in some cases many more. Right now we typically store author information in a tab panel, but if there are 10 or more author tabs the form will usually fail to load.  Is there a better way to store and present author metadata without using tabs?

title: Fedora 3.5 and fedora item may not be populating the ownerID attribute properly ->objectProfile->ownerId
description: None

title: Pathing error in audio sp when site isn't in apache DocumentRoot
description: Pull request  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_audio/pull/22

title: o missing from info:fedora in page relationship
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/pull/34

title: fedora item setting ownerId as user id not user name like all the other APIs
description: None

title: We should make sure we are properly escaping solr queries
description: In this commit to the autocomplete solr module Mitch is using a solr query escaping function: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_autocomplete/commit/04e51abfb846b30a869dfe468958e79ab8c614e1  We should be using this function everywhere to escape queries before they are passed to solr in the solr module.

title: Rewrite core permissions handling
description: Need to be able to get permissions from other places, like XACML...  In order to do so, we have to break out of the context of Drupal permissions, and the use of user_access().

title: Implement permissions hook in XACML API
description: Since we have a couple permissions that can be granted via the POLICY stream, we can now allow the UI to reflect these permissions through the new hook_fedora_repository_check_perm().

title: Allow arrays of relationship objects to be provided
description: Objects, as in the "subject, predicate, object" of a triple.  The XACML API is creating a large number of versions of the RELS datastreams, which could lead to both performance and space issues.  This could be greatly improved by allowing an array of objects to be passed (in addition to a single string, to preserve current functionality), so the groups of modifications could happen in a single call/datastream modification.

title: Use new relationship addition of arrays in XACML API
description: ISLANDORA-766 allows us to add arrays of objects for relationships, so let's do it!

title: Functions redeclared in multiple files
description: Looks like some functions get redefined in different files in the Book Solution back, which breaks Drush...  The function islandora_book_create_rels is defined in both the drush.inc and migrate_books.module.

title: XACML module hiding GUI elements when it shouldn't
description: XACML module alters permissions based on the user/roles in the POLICY stream.  When those are not populated in the default permit everything POLICY stream.  We can document and assume a standard global policy and make decisions based on it if there is the default or no POLICY stream.

title: XACML module hiding GUI elements when it shouldn't
description: XACML module alters permissions based on the user/roles in the POLICY stream.  When those are not populated in the default permit everything POLICY stream.  We can document and assume a standard global policy and make decisions based on it if there is the default or no POLICY stream.

title: When installing Islandora via drush without a repository on the localhost enabled the following error is generated.
description: PHP Fatal error:  Call to a member function describeRepository() on a non-object in /home/nbanks/sites/islandora.local/sites/all/modules/islandora/includes/utilities.inc on line 100 Drush command terminated abnormally due to an unrecoverable error.           The administration menu for islandora was not available after this time although the module was marked as enabled.                                                                                                                        After this I tried to uninstall the module I got the same error and white screen via the GUI. I had turned on my fedora repository on the localhost before attempting to uninstall.   Subsequent enable/disables did not produce errors and worked as expected.  We should catch this error and still allow the module to install properly but prompt the user that a working repository must be configured.

title: Access Denied page shown when an Fedora Object doesn't exist.
description: This should probably be a Page not found error.

title: IE7 inline-block bug in islandora-solr-search-limit.horizontal
description: This inline list of items used to limit search results does not have the required fix for IE to trigger haslayout, resulting in a vertical list instead of an inline list for IE7.   bug info:  IE7 only supports inline-block on naturally inline elements, in order to correct this bug, conditional hacks need to be applied for IE7.   fix:  zoom: 1 triggers hasLayout behaviour, and a star property hack is needed for display:inline in IE7.  pull request:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/81

title: FEDORA_MODIFY_STATE permission should not be required to view object Manage tab
description: As reported by Gary Phillips on the list:  In 7.x I have created a role called Submitter, which has the following permissions:  View repository objects and datastreams Add datastreams to repository objects Create new repository objects Edit metadata View Object Management Tabs  However, when I view an object while in this role, I don't see the Object Management Tabs.  However, if I add the permission  Change repository object states  the tabs now appear and I can edit metadata.  I can also change the repository object state, a permission we weren't going to assign to the submitter role.  Moreover, this seems more like a bug than a feature, since it would seem that 'View Object Management Tabs' should give access to the tabs by itself.

title: Islandora 7: Editing an object's MOD in the Large Image Collection results in the image disappearing
description: - Ingested an object into the Large Image Collection - Opened the MOD to Edit.  Changed Title (or you can just do nothing) -  Submitted it - got the following:   Warning: urlencode() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given in RepositoryConnection->addParam() (line 113 of /var/www/html/drupal-7.15/sites/all/libraries/tuque/RepositoryConnection.php).  Notice: Undefined variable: tranform in islandora_content_model_forms_edit_form_submit() (line 191 of /var/www/html/drupal-7.15/sites/all/modules/islandora_content_model_forms/includes/edit.form.inc).  - Went back to the repository>Large Image - Image was no longer visible  - Go to the collections "Manage>Collection>Migrate members" and the image is still listed as being there. - Click on it and it displays

title: form builder bug
description: SI found the following:   "We cant figure out why the below is happening.  The title shows correctly in the hierarchy and in the concept overview and in the xml when you look at it through the manage tab, but when you look at it through the Edit metadata form it takes the title: stone-walled  ovens  and cuts off the  ovens  in the form.  See below.  Any ideas where to look to fix this?  It seems like a form issue."   Nigel's response:   "This is definitely a bug in the form builder. I've just done a quick test and determined that ""ovens"" is responsible. If quotations where not escaped for use in HTML and regular quotes "" were used then you would see it in the form as well. "

title: Trailing spaces aren't being trimmed in Form Builder
description: Trailing spaces and extra lines in form builder fields cause errors when the form is submitted. We should be automatically trimming these fields, but it looks like we aren't (at least in the latest sandbox).

title: error printed when uploading an XACML stream locking out current user
description: In Fedora Item we query Fedora after uploading every datastream.  This is avoidable.  We can re-populate the datastream datastructure in Fedora Item without hitting Fedora and avoid the error being printed to screen.  It is also a performance enhancement.

title: disagreement between content model forms and fedora item on setting OwnerID
description: core makes not logged in users have OwnerID of anonymous content model forms sets it as the empty string.

title: modifying a datastream in Fedora Item doesn't update local datastream structure
description: None

title: Fedora Item's get datastream disemination method squashes errors by default
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/6.x/api/fedora_item.inc#L680 leads to some misleading stack traces, should other parts of the API pass quiet false or should we change the default?

title: Audio: Batch ingest skips wav
description: Uploaded a zip full of audio files (some not supported). The mp3 got through, but the wav did not. It's accepted through manual ingest.

title: Form data not going into MODS
description: This was with the Video SP  It looks like data entered into the form is not making it into the MODs record. Th DC is fine. The screenshot is for an item that had a title and a couple of contributors

title: Video: Batch ingest fail
description: Batch ingester for Video SP failed, although it sort of claims it succeeded. Uploaded a zip with two files that it can handle via manual ingest (mov and mp4) and one that it can't (avi). As you can see, it reports some success, and a lot of SOAP. None of the three files were added successfully.

title: Batch Ingest fails silently on files that are not ingested
description: When uploading a zip of 7 images, some of which were in disallowed types, the Fedora dialogue counted off the upload of all 7, making it appear that they have been successfully added. There is no active indication that they weren't uploaded, short of counting results and finding it short.  There should be some notice when items are not properly ingested from a large batch.

title: PID appears in the MODS datastream on batch-ingest but not when object is added manually
description: This was reported on the list. I have tested and confirmed. Batch ingest objects get PID in MODS. Manually ingested do not:  "When using batch-ingest in, for example, the PDF module, the MODS datastream contains the PID i.e.:   <identifier type="local">islandora:<running number></identifier>   whereas, when  a record is added manually, the MODS datastream does not contain the PID.  The functionality that achieves this in batch-ingest seems to be the islandora_batch_ingest/xslt/dc_to_mods.xsl transform that is called in addition to the mods_to_dc.xsl transform.   I was wondering if this inconsistency is a bug resulting from the constraint imposed by using xml forms, where only one transform can be associated with each form, or if there is some way around the problem?"

title: Video: Two upload options in ingest form
description: When the Video Solution Pack is enabled, the option to upload a video at the beginning of the ingest form is still there (in addition to the "Upload Files" button at the end of the form), possibly prompting users to upload files twice.

title: Video: avi files not accepted
description: The upload option without the Video Solution pack enabled claims avi as an allowable file type, but the mimetype on standard avi files is rejected:  The uploaded file's mimetype (video/x-msvideo) is not associated with this Content Model. The allowed types are: video/quicktime, video/mp4, audio/mp3, audio/x-aiff, video/m4v, audio/ogg, video/ogg

title: Solr having issues with date settings
description: warnings appearing when running a Solr search: warning: strtotime() [function.strtotime]: It is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the date.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of those methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier. We selected 'America/Anguilla' for 'AST/-4.0/no DST' instead in /var/www/html/drupal-6.26/sites/all/modules/islandora_solr_search/IslandoraSolrResults.inc on line 637. warning: date() [function.date]: It is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the date.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of those methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier. We selected 'America/Anguilla' for 'AST/-4.0/no DST' instead in /var/www/html/drupal-6.26/sites/all/modules/islandora_solr_search/IslandoraSolrResults.inc on line 637.  The search is still successful, so marking this trivial - the warning could be ignored safely.

title: Genre recorded as "Select a Genre" instead of blank when not selected.
description: Manual ingest. MODS is grabbing the phrase "Select a Genre" when no genre is selected. DC is taking this same phrase and making it the "type".  <dc:type>Select a Genre</dc:type>

title: Lack of submit button creates a trap
description: With Video Solution Pack, the "Upload a File" button is replaced by the create object button once the file is in - but, if the file cannot be saved successfully for some reason, the "Upload a File" button comes back, with no way to remove the file already there, and no way to submit the form after fixing whatever error caused it to fail (in my test, trying to upload a file through the other upload option) without uploading something else. The user is trapped.

title: black thumbnails
description: Thumbnail generation on the PDF SP may have an issue. The black thumbnail is from a pdf with a single line of content, created using MS Word. See attached.

title: XACML policy "set permission" fail jumps back to view instead of staying on XACML page
description: Just some confusing behavior. If the user tried to set XACML permissions that do not include herself and the admin user, the permissions fail with a nice red warning about the dangers of getting locked out. The warning is useful, but it should remain on the relevant tab (Child Policies) and not jump the user to the View tab

title: Book Page "Append or Insert Pages" all uploads fail
description: Trying to feed it tifs and jpgs, and it chokes. See attachment for error message.

title: Advanced Solr search choking on wildcards
description: Searching any term with a * returns this error:  Fatal error: Call to a member function getRawResponse() on a non-object in /var/www/html/drupal-6.26/sites/all/modules/islandora_solr_search/IslandoraSolrResults.inc on line 989  Back button also shows the errors seen in the attached screenshot.

title: Warning when adding tags to large image
description: The following warning appears when adding tags to a large image:  warning: function_exists() expects parameter 1 to be string, array given in /var/www/html/drupal-6.26/includes/form.inc on line 1066.  Tags are still added.

title: Remove "Create Digital Page" from release
description: This function does not work yet. The placeholder needs to be removed from the release.

title: OCR not working in release tester
description: Not getting any OCR on tiff ingests. This is blocking resolution of https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-695

title: Re-label Book Content models in Add form
description: To make it clear which content model links to which viewer: IA Book ->  Book (Internet Archive) Book -> Book (Large-Image)

title: warnings and mangled images found in basic solution pack
description: This might be the known Drupal bug here: http://drupal.org/node/375062

title: SOAP Error on getDataStreamDissemination
description: Testing with authenticated but non-admin user who should be able to add objects to a collection. The Add button is missing, and this error keeps occurring: Error trying to call SOAP function "getDataStreamDissemination". Check watchdog logs for more information.

title: Remove / Get functionality of FedoraRelationships fails when passed NULL predicate URI
description: When accessing the remove and get properties through Tuque a NULL predicate URI will make the getXpathResults function fail.   https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/pull/34

title: Change help text on Datastreams and MIME types section
description: Currently says: " Enable XACML Restrictions on DSIDs and MIME types"  Which does not make it explicit that what's being restricted is viewing (I think?). Change to:  "Enable XACML Restrictions on viewing DSIDs and MIME types"

title: Incorrect module packaging makes installation from .tar.gz difficult
description: This is from a github issue that was created by a user here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/issues/15  This bug affects most of the modules listed here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA710/Release+Notes+and+Downloads Issue:  Modules cannot be installed using admin/modules/install because they are not packaged properly.  For example, the name of the parent folder in the .tar.gz file is: islandora_solution_pack_collection Because of this, Drupal searches for islandora_solution_pack_collection.info, which does not exist. Solution:  Ensure the parent directory in the .tar.gz has the correct name. In this case, changing the name to islandora_basic_collection works fine.  OR  Change the name everywhere, not just the parent folder.

title: create script to validate the drupal filter xml
description: a simple shell script to validate the drupal filter xml against a dtd or schema.  Or just create dtd or schema that others can use to validate the filter xml however they see fit.    see google group post by Hardy Pottinger titled "script to verify drupal-filter.xml?"

title: Solution pack now diffing datastreams not just reporting on metadata.
description: Before now objects would appear to not need re-ingest when the datastreams were changed.  This is still an issue in D6. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/221

title: Rename XACML CHILD SECURITY stream to distinguish from POLICY stream
description: Just a minor label change to make things more clear when there is a Child Security stream alongside a Policy stream. Right now both are labelled "Xacml Policy Stream"

title: "restrict your search results to a particular namespace" missing from Solr config admin
description: Missing a documented option in /admin/settings/islandora_solr_search   Possible this is just something wonky with our test environment. Ticketing to look into it.

title: Can't mange book with a large number of pages
description: PHP Fatal error:  Allowed memory size of 134217728 bytes exhausted (tried to allocate 25487091 bytes)  If there is a min. memory limit, it should be in the book sp config page with the current and what is reccomended.  I had a look at a demo server where the book sp could manage large books and the memory limit is set to unlimited? Seems wrong?

title: Removing a form does not remove the association
description: Removing a form does not remove the association. The unremoved associations will still be used in the dropdown when choosing to edit a datastream.

title: pulled the latest code and can no longer load the configure screen admin/islandora/configure
description: islandora menu hook says the admin form is here "admin/islandora.admin.inc"  $items['admin/islandora/configure'] = array(     'title' => 'Configuration',     'description' => 'Configure settings for Islandora.',     'page callback' => 'drupal_get_form',     'page arguments' => array('islandora_repository_admin'),     'file' => 'admin/islandora.admin.inc',     'access arguments' => array('administer site configuration'),     'type' => MENU_NORMAL_ITEM,     'weight' => -1,   );  but that file no longer exists.  I believe it should be updated to point here: includes/admin.form.inc  but I don't have acces to the naming convention doc so I'm not 100% sure if this is correct or will not change again.

title: FITS module produced empty TECHMD DS
description: I'm uploading the apache error log and the file that i used to create the empty DS.

title: Cannot load collection tab on large collections.
description: Cannot load collection tab when viewing collections that have many items, i think the migrate members and delete members are choking the collection tab on large collections.  This means that you can no longer ingest objects into said collection as the whole tab will not load.  Issues exists in our drupal 7 module probably exists in drupal 6 as well.

title: Islandora 7 1.0 : Spelling error on Islandora "General Configuration" page
description: The title of the dialog box that appears at the following URL is misspelled as "General Configuarion"  http://collections-dev.dhinitiative.org/#overlay=admin/islandora/configure  It should probably be "General Configuration".

title: PID not available in theme layer for returned results if not specified
description: basically... - if you are using the fields template - you don't have pid in the returned fields list - you limit returned fields to what you specify  The results with throw a wall of red because it's trying to build a fedora item with no pid  Leaving unassigned for committers meeting.   https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/96  42e220c8a0810123fb6415f15609b15b4a109472
