title: Video missing display datastream returns 'currently being processed' message
description: Cosmetic: A video that is missing its video display datastream instead permanently displays the "The video you uploaded is currently being processed. Please check back shortly." message, which is misleading.

title: Video SP derivatives call should replace libfaac with another encoder.
description: Libfaac is proprietary and is thus being removed in ffmpeg. We should find a encoder to replace libfaac such that we do not have to add external repos/workarounds to create derivatives out of the box.

title: Minor edit to MARCXML user interface - spelling
description: Very minor change - the User Interface for the MARCXL module uses the term "MarcXML". This should be "MARCXML". The acronym should always be capitalized.

title: "edit tags datastream" permission - obsolete?
description: Since everything do to with tagging had been removed, does this permission still need to be there? It's one of the core fedora_repository module permission.

title: Islandora Solr in D7
description: Not able to succesfuly search URIs.  Get bad request error. Manualy filtering the query in url works ie. islandora/search/PID%3A%28*%29?f[0]=RELS_EXT_isMemberOfCollection_uri_ms:%22info:fedora/islandora:root%22  Danny's going to add info, so assigning to him.

title: transform in islandora_importer fails to crosswalk dateCreated
description: This XSLT in the d7 batch ingester called islandora_importer has an issue. https://github.com/discoverygarden/islandora_importer/blob/7.x/xsl/mods_to_dc.xsl  It doesn't crosswalk the  mods <dateCreated> to dc <date>.  What would be nice is for this module and others that replicate the xslt pull from a common one.  How does it compare with this one in the xml forms module? https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/transforms/mods_to_dc.xsl

title: Edismax documentation task
description: 3.1 and higher uses Edismax, lower is dismax. [13-02-07 3:34:33 PM] Jordan Dukart: edismax was added in as in option in using solr_search [13-02-07 3:34:37 PM] Jordan Dukart: in 7. [13-02-07 3:34:52 PM] Jordan Dukart: http://wiki.apache.org/solr/ExtendedDisMax if you want to use it in development it's just changing the type in the url.

title: Submitting a form
description: 1 - without a submit button in your form definition, there's no way to preview the output of a form 2 - adding a submit button in your form definition gives you an extra button on the ingest process. clicking this button during ingest causes the process to fail. 3- simular issue when updating metadata. 2 buttons. the submit from the form definition does nothing. (returns to the previous page)

title: Failure while reinstalling solution pack objects
description: Objects are purged; however, there is a Drupal message regarding "failure to purge". This seems to cause the subsequent reinstallation of objects to fail.

title: Problem with collection manager menu item not returning proper path.
description: Listed under Islandora core because there is no entry for Collection Manager 7.x in the selection box above.  Line 54 in basic collection manager 7.x release contains the following line:   'page arguments' => array(current_path()),  While I understand the intent, in my case after flushing caches the current path seems to be stuck on:  admin_menu/flush-cache  Which is not the path I think you are looking for.  Also the call to islandora_collection_management_wrapper for which this menu item refers to is expecting 3 arguments. The first of which is never used in the method and second and third (which are) are never sent any values. This is verified by line 54 which only sends 1 parameter and looks to be an incorrect one at that.

title: White screen when viewing islandora repository
description: When trying to view the repository at domain.com/islandora I get a blank white screen. The list of Islandora modules I am using are from the Islandora Release Candidate:  islandora_solr_search islandora_solr_views islandora_solution_pack_audio islandora_solution_pack_collection islandora_solution_pack_image islandora_solution_pack_pdf islandora_solution_pack_video islandora_xml_forms objective_forms php_lib tuque  All installed on a fresh version of Mint Linux.

title: Fix for 7.x-release problems with configuring solr default display, facet settings
description: From the User list:  "I believe others have had the same problem I've had in 7.x-release when adding solr fields in admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr; the symptom was getting an ajax error when hitting the 'add' button after selecting a new field in 'default display settings' or 'facet settings'  Our problem turned out to be caused by settings in the development module admin/config/development/devel - setting 'Error handlers' to 'Standard Drupal' fixed it for us.  'Standard Drupal' and 'Krumo Backtrace' together interrupts the ajax call.  The response displayed by krumo is popping up a notice, which appears to be mostly harmless:   An AJAX HTTP error occurred. HTTP Result Code: 200 Debugging information follows. Path: /system/ajax StatusText: OK ResponseText: Notice: Undefined variable: solr_url in islandora_solr_admin_settings() (line 78 of /etc/drupal7/all/modules/islandora_solr_search/islandora_solr.admin.inc)."  https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en&fromgroups=#!topic/islandora/JrKFH_srzFE

title: white on ingest when no form association exists
description: When there's no form association for a particular content model, the ingest process fails with a 500 error.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/270

title: Problem adding datastream to collectionCModel
description: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/islandora/ZBcbX8ppOqQ/discussion  Notice: Undefined index: dsid in islandora_add_datastream_form_validate() (line 160 of /etc/drupal7/all/modules/islandora/includes/add_datastream.form.inc). Notice: Undefined index: dsid in islandora_add_datastream_form_submit() (line 187 of /etc/drupal7/all/modules/islandora/includes/add_datastream.form.inc). Method Not Allowed  This looks to be a bug in the source code, that came about via: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/commit/1e594543c9a845eefc2fc863de7ddccad0c3fbba

title: Checksums are maintained in NewFedoraDatastreams when the content changes
description: Came to light recently with copying datastreams between objects...  Some datastreams were being regenerated (JP2s, TNs and the like).  When they were copied, the checksum settings were copied... When we set the content, we do not wipe the stored checksum (can we assure that the content is always added before checksums, so we can always wipe the checksum when setting the content?).  Seems like this should only affect NewFedoraDatastreams, and possibly only when they exist in NewFedoraObjects...  Anyway...  The result of this that I have seen, is that the NewFedoraObject containing the NewFedoraDatastream fails to ingest, due to the mismatch between the content and the checksums.

title: Checksum autogeneration is not supported when ingesting NewFedoraObjects
description: If a "checksumType" is given without a "checksum" on a datastream, Fedora should autogenerate the hash for the data; Looks like this mechanism is broken with NewFedoraObjects.  It may be due to providing DIGEST="none" in the FOXML, while Fedora expect the "digest" attribute to be absent...

title: Option to supply text file for PDFs without saving as FULL_TEXT Datastream should not be available
description: Currently, the option to index but not store a supplied text file for PDFs appears to be available (user can enable "Allow users to upload text file with PDF" without enabling "Store extracted (or supplied) text"). However, if text is supplied but not stored it will be lost on re-index, so this option should not be allowed.

title: innacurate parameter name and documentation
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/utilities.inc#L446  Doesn't just take a namespace it also takes a PID.

title: new VM islandora 7.x-1.1 - Internet Archive Bookreader doesn't show the buttons properly
description: The Internet Archive Bookreader (in the new VM, Islandora 7.x-1.1) didn't show the buttons properly. (reason: missing BookReader.css) Workaround: After copy /var/www/html/BookReader-master  to  /var/www/html/drupal-7.21/sites/all/libraries/bookreader  it works well.  An option could be the modification of the library_path for the bookreader - but where is it?  Any ideas?  reagrds,  Michael

title: Continuous creation of filepointers for php://stdout used in getRequests.
description: Formerly were opening, and leaving open, a file pointer for php://stdout when getRequest was called. In batch ingests/migrations when the ulimit of the system was reached we'd have too many file pointers open and things would break.   Now statically open a php://stdout to handle this.  https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/pull/54

title: Error when replacing the DC data-stream with the exact same content.
description: We get this error when trying to override the datastream. I tested it in the Islandora sandbox and it throws the same error without updating (see attached for screenshot). Checking the watchdog the error is:  ERROR 2013-03-26 22:35:40.212 [http-8080-9] (FedoraAPIMBindingSOAPHTTPImpl) Error modifying datastream by value org.fcrepo.server.errors.GeneralException: XML was not well-formed.  In this test, the xml file was downloaded directly from Islandora in the Detailed List of Content, and without making changes was overridden. When you dl xml from Islandora it has a space at the beginning, which is the bit about "Content is not allowed in prolog." fedora is complaining about. But even when you remove that space, overriding the datastream does not work and it throws the same error.   Issued Discovered Here: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/islandora-dev/z4BvUecbL-o

title: Collection children don't get created correctly unless XML Forms is enabled
description: Its possible to create objects that have no 'hasModel' relationships with the islandora_basic_collection if you do not have islandora_xml_forms enabled.  We should make islandora_basic_collection provided the form for selecting an new object's content model, rather than XML forms. I don't believe we have to remove that functionality from islandora_xml_forms, since once the object has a content model I don't think the XML forms will prompt the user to select a model.

title: Allow users to sort tabs in XML Form Builder
description: Currently, there is no way to sort tabs (in tab panels) in XML Forms. This is problematic because in many cases the order of the tabs matters (e.g. for author names - 1st author, 2nd author, etc.) and the only way to change the order right now is to manually change the data on each tab.   We should allow users to drag tabs back and forth to sort them (or something similar).

title: Collapsible/Collapsed settings in XML Form Builder cannot be unset
description: There are settings for 'Collapsible' and 'Collapsed' under 'Advanced Form Controls' in XML Form Builder. These function as intended, but once they have been set they cannot be unset for a given element. Unchecking either/both option(s) and saving the form fails to disable either option and both remain checked when you revisit the settings page.

title: Info/fulltext/etc overlays broken
description: In the Islandora Internet Archive Bookreader, clicking to bring up any of the overlays results in a white rectangle, with a coloured edge along the bottom.  Seems to be due to a conflict with Drupal "colorbox" module--or some CSS it adds in any case--which causes float issues.

title: Quotation marks aren't saved/displayed properly in repeatable tag fields
description: If a value with quotation marks is entered into a repeatable tag field in an XML form, the first quotation mark and any characters that follow it are not saved in the XML output. This only happens if you click the '+' button to store the value and clear the field so a new value can be entered.

title: Add autocomplete functionality to Tag form elements.
description: Add autocomplete functionality to Tag form elements.  https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/islandora/clr_UtEYjbM   The tags are a custom element type so they are not textfields even though the when they are rendered to html they contain one. I'm unsure of how difficult this task would be, though I would guess one just need to take the autocomplete logic from inside of Drupal theme_textfield function here:  http://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes%21form.inc/function/theme_textfield/7  And incorporate it in the Tags and Tag logic below:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/elements/includes/Tags.inc https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/elements/includes/Tag.inc

title: Can't Uninstall Islandora via Drush
description: The following modules will be uninstalled: islandora Do you really want to continue? (y/n): y PHP Fatal error:  Class 'IslandoraTuque' not found in /home/nbanks/projects/default/site/sites/default/modules/islandora/islandora.module on line 727 Drush command terminated abnormally due to an unrecoverable error.                                                                                                                               [error] Error: Class 'IslandoraTuque' not found in /home/nbanks/projects/default/site/sites/default/modules/islandora/islandora.module, line 727

title: PDF not created
description: PDF not created in book SP on ingest when option is selected. Tested on sandbox and client site.

title: TN is broken after refreshing datastreams
description: None

title: In metadata forms the datepicker element creates a visible empty div at the bottom of the page.
description: This may have to do with jQuery UI code being included both in Drupal core and in the form elements module.

title: Refactor Collection Ingest
description: Make collection ingest use ingest steps rather than its unique ingest process.

title: Ampersands in field values not escaped properly
description: Ampersands in XML Form field values cause an error when the form is submitted:  Warning: xml_form_builder_transform_document(): unterminated entity reference Ampersand Test in xml_form_builder_transform_document() (line 205 of /var/www/html/drupal-7.21/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/builder/includes/associations.inc).

title: Fedora_Item::ownerId is not populated correctly for existing objects upon instantiation
description: On an existing object that has an owner (verified though fedora admin interface) the ownerId member of fedora object is not being populated:  "module_load_include('inc', 'fedora_repository', 'api/fedora_item'); $pid = "some:pid"; $object = new Fedora_Item($pid); echo $object->pid;  I get the "some:pid" of the object, but with echo $object->ownerId; I do not get any result. Any more idea???"   As Per Discussion Here: https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/islandora-dev/J_6Nb9QC8YQ

title: Implement hook_file_mimetype_mapping_alter
description: I came across a mime type not supported in the drupal mime type list.   We use the custom islandora mimedetect class for many things, one of them not being saving file uploades.

title: Botton control bar missing on IA Viewer
description: this line is throwing an error   https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_internet_archive_bookreader/blob/7.x/js/islandora_book_reader.js#L718

title: Use top level collection name in breadcrumb and menu item
description: display top level collection name in breadcrumb and menu item title /islandora   instead of "Islandora Repository"  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/348

title: Updating jQuery breaks XML forms
description: With "jQuery Update 7.x-2.3" module enabled, xml forms ajax calls error out.  jQuery Update jQuery 1.5.2 and jQuery UI 1.8.11

title: Allow hiding/display of GUI components to reflect user permissions
description: Similar to the fedora_repository_check_perm() (and associated hook_fedora_repository_check_perm()) in Islandora 6, it is desirable to have a hookable access callback method, in order to allow other modules (such as the XACML API) to affect displays in Islandora 7.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Book Solution Pack,Islandora Module (Core),Large Image Solution Pack,Newspaper Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack,Solr Search,Video Solution Pack,XACML Editor

title: Form Builder: "add/copy/paste/delete" disappears in safari.
description: At intermittent times, the elements management div seams to disappear in form builder when running in safari.

title: Islandora link title doesn't match breadcrumb if link is customized
description: If a user customizes the islandora repo link, the customizations don't apply to the breadcrumb  menu_get_item('islandora'); doesn't return the customizations or the mlid.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/348  1 - change menu item islandora title to title callback to get root collection label. this way the link title, breadcrumb, and page title would all match. this may be a performance hit, because we'd be hitting fedora to get the root object label on every reload, even if we're not in islandora.  2 - use menu_get_active_trail(); sorta works. If the user adds a new menu item pointing to a islandora object, the breadcrumb doesn't display the customization because /islandora isn't in menu trail when viewing that object  3 - query the db to get the mlid to get islandora and then use menu_link_load($mlid) to get the proper info for the breadcrumb

title: Add XSLT selection option for islandora d6 batch module
description: What would the best approach be for adding a xslt selection to batch ingest in d6?  Currently it handles MODS or DC and applies an xslt depending what's ingested.  Do we always need a MODS ds in d6?

title: "About Collection Policies" link in collection manager is stale.
description: Currently pointing to: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA112/How+to+Manage+Collection+Policies  Should point to: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA711/How+to+Manage+Collection+Policies

title: Anonymous role in Drupal Servlet Filter
description: The incorrect role is being used in the Drupal Servlet Filter. The role used in Drupal is "anonymous user", but the filter uses "anonymous".

title: PDF SP Derivatives have wrong mime type
description: $dest in islandora_pdf_create_jpg_derivative => /tmp/islandora-41.TN.jpgTz4Bwa  when mime detect is used, it can't determine the mime type because of the temp name.

title: Can't upload book pages because externally referenced files no longer exist
description: Any D6 sites using the book sp, won't be able to add pages.

title: Manage Datastreams Tab fails to render with an exception if XACML denies the user access to a single data-stream.
description: To Test:  * Add a dummy data-stream UNACCESSIBLE to the test object (the content is unimportant). * Add the attached policy to a test object. * Change the site permissions such that your non-adminstrator test user can to access "Manage > Datastreams". * Login as a non-adminstrator user that has access to  "Manage > Datastreams". * Navigate to "Manage > Datastreams" on the test object.  The following exception occurs:  RepositoryException: Unauthorized in RepositoryConnection->parseFedoraExceptions() (line 227 of/home/nbanks/projects/default/site/sites/all/libraries/tuque/RepositoryConnection.php).

title: Child collections and objects don't get XACML
description: When this option is selected, "All children of this collection (Existing and new)." children don't get the xacml applied to them

title: When associating forms the uploaded template file is ignored on ingest
description: When making an association with a form and a content model, the user can upload a template document that should be used to pre-populate the form.  Seems that the template gets uploaded correctly and remains stored correctly but it isn't used when the ingest form is displayed.  I've attached a sample form and sample template. If it was functioning correctly it would populate the title field on ingest.

title: islandora_datastream_alter() not getting called when ingesting NewFedoraObjects
description: When a datastream is added to a NewFedoraObject (before it is actually added to Fedora), the datastream is not being passed through the islandora_datastream_alter().  Letting it pass though the alter is desirable, so thing like https://github.com/ruebot/islandora_checksum/pull/1 can happen.

title: Can't scroll pane when drag sorting items in XML Form Builder
description: The panes under More Advanced Controls in the Form Builder are scrollable, but the scroll doesn't work when drag-sorting items in the pane. So if you have more than 6 items in the list (see screenshot) you can't scroll the pane up or down when trying to drag-sort the contents.

title: PID search in SOLR advanced search
description: In D6 were able to use the PID as a searchable field in the Advanced search and it allowed the full PID, e.g. islandora:387.   In D7, this search gives an error. To get my result I have to escape the colon, e.g. islandora\:387

title: "Features" integration for Solr config
description: Allow configuration of Solr fields to be extracted out into a "Feature", to facilitate moving configs around... 'Cause database dumps are bad, 'mkay?

title: Check if image solution pack will still render an images OBJ data-stream if MEDIUM_SIZE data-stream is missing
description: Check if image solution pack will still render an images OBJ data-stream if MEDIUM_SIZE data-stream is missing  Spawned from this google group post:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/BgnrDHud9j0  Probably we should still display the OBJ data-stream?

title: Bad MIMEtype detected for PREVIEW and TN datastreams
description: An incorrect (or too general, anyway) MIMEtype can be detected on PREVIEW and TN datastreams (application/octet-stream), which can result in odd behaviours like: * images appear to load, but when they finish loading, they disappear  This seems to be due to the use of drupal_tempnam(), which can add additional characters to the end of the file name to make it unique--effectively breaking the extension so attempting to detect the type of the file from the filename breaks.

title: Objects added via batch ingest store MODS as inline instead of managed
description: [From the mailing list]: Objects created via batch ingest store MODS as inline instead of managed. We should be consistent and always store MODS as managed.

title: The Drupal Filter does not currently escape the database url
description: The Drupal Filter does not currently escape the database url before attempting to connect to the Mysql database, which can cause problems if the user name or password has '%' symbol within it.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_drupal_filter/blob/master/src/main/java/ca/upei/roblib/fedora/servletfilter/DrupalAuthModule.java#L219-L220

title: islandora_solution_pack_video has incorrect dependencies release 6.x-13.1
description: Spawned from this conversation:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/b19SoM4UnBE  islandora_solution_pack_video should declare it's dependency on yui_uploader not yui. Also the YUI repository here https://github.com/discoverygarden/yui should be forked to islandora's github account. As well as be included in the next release or the next hot-fix for 6.x-13.1.

title: Wrong namespace on ingested books after page ingest
description: From the user list: https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en&fromgroups=#!topic/islandora/z3rODTBjGVk  This has been reproduced on the current sandbox (7.x-1.1)  "I created a new repository called "Test Book Repository" as a child of Book Collection. I set it up to use the namespace "TESTrepository". I created a book called "First Test Title" and it was given the namespace of TESTrepository. Then I created "Second Book Title with pages", which has one page. Both the book and the page have the namespace TESTrepository. Then, when I created my third book "Third Book title", it was given the namespace islandora. So, it appears that something happens when pages are ingested that causes the namespace to revert to islandora for all items ingested after that."  Does this still occur with 7.x-1.2?

title: improve solution pack islandora_get_viewers function
description: Allow sp's to have multiple mimetypes when selecting a viewer  eg: page object: image/jp2 or application/pdf  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/solution_packs.inc#L679  switch $mimetype to mixed or array param type

title: Duplicate records
description: While using islandora oai tool we get only 20 unique records, all other records are duplicate. we have over 100000 records in the islandora. we are trying to harvest the records using islandora oai provider 7 to vufind. we tried to increase the number of records in oai provider module, but not getting more than 20 unique records. any help in this is highly appreciated...

title: Exposing always 20 duplicated records on OAI-PMH repository
description: I have 5000 records in my repository. I am trying to expose content (its metadata) as an OAI-PMH repository using the islandora OAI Provider 7.x. The OAI Provider always providing 20 duplicated records per request while trying to expose metadata.   Your help would be greatly appreciated.

title: Verify that books search is still functioning correctly
description: Came up on the google groups:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/ZJkYhF-9oos  I checked the sandbox and it doesn't work there.

title: islandora_scholar importers ignore the pid namespace configured by the collection manager.
description: islandora_scholar importers ignore the pid namespace configured by the collection manager.    If  the collection solution pack is installed and a user sets a namespace for the ir:citationCModel for a collection this namespace will be used when you ingest an individual object.    If you use one of the importers it ignores the configured namespace and always uses the ir namespace.  The importer probably should use the same namespace as the normal ingest process.

title: google_scholar module causes a white screen if a mods dateIssued field exists but can't be parsed as a date
description: google_scholar module causes a white screen if a mods dateIssued field exists but can't be parsed as a date.  For instance we have a citation with a date of 2013-Fall 2012 which datetime can't parse (obviously we need to correct the data) but if the islandora_google_scholar module is enabled and we try to view the citation we get a whitescreen.  If we disable the islandora_google_scholar module the citation loads fine.

title: When adding a PDF to the PDF SP, the generated TN and PREVIEW datastreams don't have the correct mimetypes
description: When uploaded a PDF to the PDF Solution pack, the TN and PREVIEW datastreams that get created have an application/octet-stream mimetype assigned instead of image/jpeg.

title: Unable to manually add a TN ds to a large image sp image.
description: When trying to manually add a TN datastream to an image adhering to the Large Image SP cmodel, I get the following error:  Error message Only files with the following extensions are allowed: bin.  Tested on my local and on the Islandora sandbox and get the same error. dm

title: Video SP Mime type
description: mime type doesn't change even if ogg ds is passed to viewer  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_video/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L54

title: If a user purges and re-ingests a source datastream (OBJ) the derivatives are not automatically updated.
description: Came about from the discussion here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/IW6836huOLg

title: Add native JP2 support to large_image, ocr, solution_pack_book
description: There are three pull requests that, together, allow for native JP2 support in the Large Image solution pack, the Paged Content module (for books) and the OCR module.  Allow solution pack to accept JP2 files natively by dltj   Pull Request #83   Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/pull/83  Handle JP2 files natively when ingesting by ZIP batch by dltj   Pull Request #113   Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/pull/113  Handle JP2 files natively when performing OCR by dltj   Pull Request #31   Islandora/islandora_ocr https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/pull/31

title: Option to regenerate derivatives
description: Some discussion of this here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/IW6836huOLg  Currently, when updating/replacing the OBJ datastream, other derivatives are not automatically updated. A rough fix is to delete all the derivatives first then replace the OBJ datastream, which will force the creation of new derivatives, but there should be an option available to the user to force derivatives to refresh without deleting them.

title: Sort Types list alphabetically in Form Builder
description: From the lists. This is for types such as tabs, tags, datepicker, managed_file,etc:  "Also, is there any chance the Types could be ordered alphabetically?  It is a very long list to hunt through. "  https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en&fromgroups=#!topic/islandora/3FIDzU79wZY

title: Drush command deletes isSequenceNumberOf relationship
description: The drush command to update isPartOf to isConstituentOf also deletes the isSequenceNumberOf$escaped_pid  where bug was introduced https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/pull/17  Line #124 https://github.com/MorganDawe/islandora_solution_pack_compound/commit/5a24b8b1efcbbfd8f1dbfa65050f68ee09cd2146#diff-8f91fa5b16d98c9146f77e23dc35f519R124

title: ZIP Importer cleanup
description: Derived from conversation: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/7OyRhoEfg2I  Presently, the ZIP importer does not explicitly delete the uploaded ZIP file, letting the fact that they're temporary managed files allow them to get deleted when cron runs.  We could probably add in a new static method to our IslandoraImportObject class which gets called when ending the batch (the default functionality would probably be no-op), and override in ZipBatchImportObject to let it explicitly delete the file.

title: Make IA Book Reader Use the metadata hook eg. solr metadata display
description: add logic to   https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_internet_archive_bookreader/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L89  to see if this   islandora_retrieve_metadata_markup  returns anything

title: XML form throws errors after changing <titleInfo><title> elements
description: Just a report. I edited an existing form with an existing form association.   For the title it had an xml form element that was <titleInfo><title>%value%</title></titleInfo> I split that into separate form elements. <titleInfo> and <title> My form broke on ingest or edit as a result.  The issue was related to the form's association and the original element specified for the title element in the association. I updated that and the form worked as expected.

title: Update islandora_xacml_editor's default Solr fields
description: Update the default islandora_xacml_editor fields to correspond to dgi's default Solr repository as this seems to be what's being used in many cases. The values that existed previously were corresponded to old XSLTs.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/pull/72

title: A misplaced hook.
description: https://github.com/willtp87/islandora_xacml_editor/blob/7.x/islandora_xacml_editor.module#L112

title: Tuque caching of objects on purge
description: Tuque was potentially caching objects on purge meaning that calls to access a purged datastream were taking place and making Fedora churn out an error as well as breaking the flow of execution of code.  Fixed: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/452

title: JQuery 1.8 and islandora_solr_search admin page not compatible.
description: Page shows a blank "default dialog" box stuck in top left corner of screen and type-ahead drop down lists for solr fields are not functioning.

title: Clipper functionality for OpenSeadragon breaks in 1.0.0.
description: Clipper functionality throws a JS error specifically on line https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_openseadragon/blob/7.x/js/islandora_openseadragon.js#L54.

title: Upgrade path needed for Newspaper SP
description: The islandora-rels-ext:isSequenceNumber changed from optional to required here https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/commit/cb21502df746c7b64fc3cbc2638d5e48ef384c82#diff-2d69368f59ba81d5635cd8274dd66090L81  Some previous versions of the newspaper sp didn't populate the islandora-rels-ext:isSequenceNumber for issues. Upgrading to the latest version will break the newspaper display (issues without islandora-rels-ext:isSequenceNumber won't appear)

title: Wrong MIME Type for Matroska video format
description: The DS-COMPOSITE-MODEL datastream of the Islandora:sp_videoCModel object seems to me to have the wrong MIME Type associated with the MKV (Matroska) video format.   Current: <dsTypeModel ID="MKV" optional="false"> <form MIME="video/m4v"/> </dsTypeModel>  I think the correct MIME Type should be "video/x-matroska" according to  http://matroska.org/technical/specs/notes.html.  Better <dsTypeModel ID="MKV" optional="false"> <form MIME="video/x-matroska"/> </dsTypeModel>

title: Newspaper SP, page-level RELS-EXT MIME type
description: In the sandbox7 I was examining the RELS-EXT of the page-level objects in the Newspaper SP and noticed that they are assigned the MIME Type "text/xml".  I think they should be "application/rdf+xml" in order to be consistent with the other SPs.

title: Lossless jp2 creation failing
description: Lossless tick in admin was having no effect, also lossy conversion was degrading some images too much. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/pull/91

title: API change
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/pull/91#discussion_r10166853

title: Add support for Fedora 4
description: Flesh out a project for Fedora 4.

title: Colorbox windows from IAV are not closeable
description: The fulltext/info/share dialogs (which use "colorbox") are broken... They can be opened and moved around, but they cannot be closed.

title: Data model issue in XACML
description: An inconsistency in a relation where it can be either a URI or a literal was introduced.  We should write an update hook to normalize.  The REL was originally a literal, however the opportunity to make this more sane as a URI should be taken.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/pull/66/files#diff-3d53ecd41459ba57aad8bdf9aa0422adR374  The CRUD code around this REL will need to be updated.

title: Islandora Importer hotfix cleanup - The audio content model name includes "-" and has upper case characters that break the hook call to create derivatives.
description: Clean up this (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_importer/pull/31) hotfix. It should use islandora_invoke_hook_list to do the escaping and calling automatically per Adam Vessey.

title: Date granularity issues in "from" and "until" parameters when quering Solr
description: Spawned from the post here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!searchin/islandora/oai/islandora/NyRI8SwSgdM/kGPAzyxmpksJ

title: ListSets verb does not respect excluded content models
description: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!searchin/islandora/listsets/islandora/D4dTyGaNZxY/Q9lMIFCy7UoJ  When performing a ListSets request the RI query does not take into account restricted content models as defined in the module's configuration.  Relevant code snippet: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_oai/blob/7.x/includes/request.inc#L1247-L1261

title: slandora XACML Editor RELS-INT datastream deletion broken since Tuque wrapper caching fix
description: When we fixed datastream caching in this commit: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/commit/4040b5997d8044faac8accfeb2f07ed309cfa087 we inadvertently broke the RELS-INT deletion when a datastream is purged in XACML.  We should do the Tuque hackery way of instantiating the datastream again deleting the RELS-INT and not ingesting it to get around this or implement the islandora_datastream_alter hook to do so the same thing.

title: Bug found in Islandora Checksum: 500 error in batch
description: From Mark Jordan:  "Bug found in Islandora Checksum: 500 error in batch  User action: Applying retroactive checksums  Occurs when: 1) there are 0 objects in a collection or 2) the user hasn't enabled checksums.  Fix: Add $operations = array(); to line 105 of islandora_checksum.module  Tested: Drupal doesn't error out in either 1 or 2 above, it just applies batch to 0 objects and reports this to user.  I can open a PR that applies the fix."

title: BagIt is invoked and throws error when adjust collection policy
description: When adjusting collection policies on collections, BagIt is invoked when update collection policy is clicked. See attached recording on behaviour.

description: The below merged pull request breaks *nix OpenSeadragon functionality.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_openseadragon/pull/27#issuecomment-38593692

description: List of files presented to user on Bag creation repeats filenames if more than one plugin was selected.

description: IslandoraXacmlEditorQuery displays warning when child object is not accessible by the user.

title: Various RC1 VM issues - see description and comments for all of them
description: * solr indexing doesn't seem to be configured for MODS * the path to kdu_compress has changed and should be updated. Correct path is  /usr/local/bin/kdu_compress * No default viewer is associated with the Audio SP so the default thumbnail displays after ingest, but no way to pay it. Enabling the JWPlayer for the SP works. http://localhost:8181/#overlay=admin/islandora/audio * Give the VM more RAM * Tesseract version - 3.02.02 * Djatoka troubles. When I save settings on the OpenSeadragon config page, it says  that /adore-djatoka/resolver "does not seem to be a functioning Djatoka server" * Install FITS

title: Deprecated functionality being used.
description: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_book/blob/7.x/includes/manage_book.inc#L32  object entry needs to be updated to objects=>array(object,object).

title: enabling Javascript Aggregation in Drupal breaks Islandora JWPlayer viewer in latest RC
description: On the latest RC VM, if Javascript Aggregation is enabled in admin/config/development/performance it breaks the Islandora JWPlayer module.   dm

title: BagIt is fired by default on object creation
description: Bags are created on object creation unless the admin settings form is saved. Issues is probably inappropriate default settings.

title: Islandora PREMIS Anonymous AuthZ denied
description: When permission is granted to 'anonymous' to view PREMIS, authorization is denied. The following is printed on the screen:  "Error retrieving FOXML required to generate PREMIS: 'Unauthorized'"  In addition, the following errors show up in fedora.log:  1. Accessing the object: https://gist.github.com/ruebot/15a92517d7462dcfea16 2. Clicking PREMIS tab: https://gist.github.com/ruebot/849496fe06d1987fca8e  These are the policies: https://gist.github.com/ruebot/30b3f6701c5ebc56d1ce  I have verified this on the most recent VM for RC1.   You can view the error in action here: http://digital.library.yorku.ca/yul-173820/huron-street-school-christmas-play-not-used/view_premis

title: Module READMEs hosting images on Imgur as opposed to Github wiki
description: The screenshots for configuration should be hosted internally on the Github wikis for the modules as opposed to an external service like Imgur.  This hits pretty much every module that's been updated with the new README normalization.  [~nruest] will know about this for future committers.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Book Solution Pack,Collection Solution Pack,Importer,Internet Archive Bookreader,Large Image Solution Pack,Newspaper Solution Pack,OAI Provider,OpenSeadragon,Paged Content,PDF Solution Pack,Solr Facet Pages,Solr Search,Video Solution Pack,Video.js,XML Sitemap

title: Raw file (dng) support for Large image SP
description: pull request https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/pull/102

title: READMEs missed during format changes
description: In the recent README format change many module READMEs were missed.  Most repo level READMEs were changed.  This is primarily about sub module READMEs.  A simple audit and cleanup should take care of this.

title: Islandora OAI does not "walk" recursively for Books/Newspapers.
description: When a ListRecords/ListIdentifiers request takes place with a specified set it's expected that the request "walks" down through all descendants of the root object. Currently, we only walk down objects with collection content models.

title: hocr derivative generation fails when using tesseract 3.03
description: Tesseract 3.03 changed the hocr file extension from .html to .hocr.  Our code looks for the file with the .html extension.  Some more information is available here https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/tesseract-ocr/yY7Dmy27CjI

title: Delete drupal variables on uninstall.
description: At the time of this ticket no Drupal variables are deleted on Islandora's uninstall.  All Islandora's variables should be deleted on uninstall.

title: Solr Metadata - Dates
description: Add the ability to format date fields.

title: Solr Metadata - text filter
description: Add the ability to format fields with a text filter. For example, if the content of a field is a URL, then it should automatically turn into a link to said URL. Possibility hook into the standard Drupal text filters?

title: Solr Metadata - RDFa
description: When a user switches over from the default DC metadata display, they lose the automatically embedded DCterms RDFa. We should add the ability to define RDFa terms for Solr metadata fields. There was similar functionality in Drupal 6 with CCK. You could define RDFa elements for specific CCK fields. This could be a possible implementation model.

title: Internet Archive Bookreader - Zoom issues
description: From Branimir Kolev, at Islandora Camp UK.  "For example, there is a need while zooming by using the buttons of IABV in page view, to call from djatoka higher compression level(s), i.e. deliver on demand higher resolutions. The built-in capabilities deliver just scaling of the image. Another thought, which can boost performance is, while loading images in thumbnails-view of IABV, to use the built-in TN-datastreams of the book-model; it would be a means to allow user to orientate quickly in content. Actually, the standard resolution images used for the page-view are fetched in thumbnail-view, which takes longer."  tl:dr Bookreader appears to zoom in on the same low-resolution image.

title: Can't get out of full screen mode
description: If you click the full screen option, you can't get out of it without hitting the back button. Escape key doesn't work either.

title: Delete terminology when managing collections

title: Proposed solution for relation cleanup on object purge
description: Currently when an object is purged relations to it may persist. In some cases we have adopted adding a submit handler to purge pages to handle relationship cleanup.  This is a less than full and reliable solution.  We should adopt a drupal cron that initiates a batch that eats on a queue of purged objects to clean up such relations. This is in addition to the generic traversal hook adoption, it is not a replacement; it would catch errors in that system but would not be immediate.

If the Newspaper Solution Pack is set up to use the Internet Archive Bookreader for issues and OpenSeadragon for pages, when you click on the full screen icon from the display of the issue, it does not display the image. When I view the source of the page, I see this toward the bottom:
Loading the Internet Archive BookReader, please wait...

title: allow admin to specify recipients of embargo email messages
description: It would be useful to have an option in the embargo settings/administration panel to configure the list of email addresses for those that should receive embargo notices.  It looks like it is in the code, but not exposed in the interface?  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/4396c8a2bd214e738bc8d3583770a8d6081b1347/modules/islandora_scholar_embargo/islandora_scholar_embargo.module#L271-L298  Donald

title: Allow granting authenticated users more permissions on their own objects
description: Not sure if this belongs in Scholar or Core, but Scholar permits users to manage Embargo on their own objects (i.e. those that they've deposited), and this is the only example of this sort of permissioning in Islandora currently. For better IR-like functionality, would be very helpful to be able to grant users other CRUD permissions on objects/datastreams which they've deposited. I don't believe this should be too difficult as the only "hook" that's theoretically required is the Fedora "Owner" property on a given object, which appears to be functioning as it should (e.g. line 108 in https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/7.x/modules/islandora_scholar_embargo/islandora_scholar_embargo.module).  For reference, please see http://lib-hf1.lib.sfu.ca/islandoraperm.png -- notice that "Manage embargo on own objects" near the bottom is the only such permission that can be applied to only a user's own objects; ideally, editing metadata, replacing or reverting datastreams, and removing objects would also have a separate "only own objects" permission to be granted to authenticated users. As it is, we've effectively only been able to grant the CR- permissions and not the -UD ones to authenticated users because this distinction isn't respected.

title: Maintain citeproc

I suggest we bridge the repo to git and create a fork under Islandora.

title: Add support to form builder to specify the namespace of the root element explicitly
description: The EML standard requires that it's top level element be namespaced but none of it's child elements are to be namespaced.   https://gist.github.com/nigelgbanks/a46d3385591cddaab448  To support this the form builder will have to be able to set the namespace as shown in the attached screenshot. At the moment though this yields errors. See the second screen shot for a description.

title: Handle LOC source issue
description: We have spent considerable time collectively dealing with LoC transforms scattered throughout our code that we have decided to not modify and maintain as they are from upstream.  I suggest that any that we are unwilling to have diverge from our code base. They can be downloaded and added as a managed file at install time instead.  We should also add the ability to upload custom xslts to everywhere we use these. Much of the functionality for xslt storage/retrieval can be pulled from forms: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/143

The work that has been done on this so far: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/154 while this is being worked on I suggest no one use any of the broken builds past #149.

Examples:   Lafayette: http://digital.lafayette.edu/collections/eastasia/pa-koshitsu/ia0002  Island Newspapers: http://www.islandnewspapers.ca/islandora/object/guardian%3A19140716-1  Chronicling America: http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn97070614/1914-07-17/ed-1/seq-1/

title: Checksum recursion
description: Checksum is causing a recursion when updating objects resulting in MANY versions of datastreams if a datastream is modified.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_checksum/blob/10484ca5b976eeae239b70ed1fc505d3d5693cac/islandora_checksum.module#L30-L34  irc notes: < avessey> alter would trigger an alter would trigger an alter...  < avessey> May actually have to check in the $context['params'] bit which gets passed along. < avessey> (As in, the property on the AbstractDatastream object likely won't have been updated on the second "step" of the recursion) < avessey> (Second, and so later steps, that is...)

title: checksum initialization

title: Replace datastream - allowed file types
description: Since https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/pull/522 was merged, the allowed file types to replace are identified based on the mime type identification of the file being replaced. Not, what is allowed for the datastream by the particular solution pack.  For example, if one were to attempt to replace an OBJ datastream that is a tif, the file would be correctly identified as an image/tiff (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/edbeb19a3957aeca7762ada635d35ce78cc9face/includes/mime_detect.inc#L151-L152), but the uploader only allows the user to upload a tiff. Not a tif. See: https://www.dropbox.com/s/51zl15pjpbe0497/Screenshot%20from%202014-07-25%2014%3A31%3A21.png  Shouldn't the allowed extensions for a datastream replace draw from the object's solution pack? Not the identification of the mime type being replaced? For example, what if a user uploaded an mp3 file as the OBJ for a Audio Solution Pack object, but later had a higher quality wav file to replace it with. In that scenario, the file would not be able to be replaced.

title: fully support setting models array with an array
description: Currently this wont unset a model.

title: Get PUID from FITS and populate the ds->format property and related PREMIS elements
description: This feature enhancement is relevant to both the FITS and PREMIS modules.  Datastreams have a property dsFormatURI (via tuque, ->format), which https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/FEDORA37/Fedora+Administrator documents as "Optionally, you can provide a format identifier for the datastream. Examples of emerging format identifier schemes found in PRONOM and the Global Digital Format Registry (GDRF)".  The PRONOM Format URI is available from the FITS output in  identity/externalIdentifier/@type=puid element:  <identity format="JPEG File Interchange Format" mimetype="image/jpeg" toolname="FITS" toolversion="0.8"> <tool toolname="Jhove" toolversion="1.5"/> <tool toolname="file utility" toolversion="5.09"/> <tool toolname="Exiftool" toolversion="9.13"/> <tool toolname="Droid" toolversion="6.1.3"/> <version toolname="Jhove" toolversion="1.5">1.02</version> <externalIdentifier toolname="Droid" toolversion="6.1.3" type="puid">fmt/44</externalIdentifier> </identity>  On ingest, we could pick out the PUID and insert it into the datastream's Format URI property as info:pronom/fmt/44, which is the standard form of the PRONOM URI. On PREMIS generation, semantic unit 1.5.4 (Format) can be populated with relevant data from the PRONOM entry.

title: OpenSeadragon Overlays integration
description: We at Lafayette College Libraries are currently working to integrate the OpenSeadragon Overlays feature ([http://openseadragon.github.io/examples/ui-overlays/]) with SVG selectors embedded within RELS-EXT triples:  (For the Object with the embedded selectors...) {code} <rdf:RDF xmlns:fedora="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/relations-external#" xmlns:fedora-model="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#" xmlns:islandora="http://islandora.ca/ontology/relsext#" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">   <rdf:Description rdf:about="info:fedora/islandora:68912">     <islandora:hasLanguage>en-US</islandora:hasLanguage>     <islandora:isPageOf rdf:resource="info:fedora/yohe:640"></islandora:isPageOf>     <islandora:isSequenceNumber>1</islandora:isSequenceNumber>     <islandora:isPageNumber>1</islandora:isPageNumber>     <islandora:isSection>1</islandora:isSection>     <fedora:isMemberOf rdf:resource="info:fedora/yohe:640"></fedora:isMemberOf>     <fedora-model:hasModel rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:pageCModel"></fedora-model:hasModel>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="oa:SvgSelector"></rdf:type>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="cnt:ContentAsText"></rdf:type>     <cnt:characterEncoding xmlns:cnt="http://www.w3.org/2011/content#">utf-8</cnt:characterEncoding>     <cnt:chars xmlns:cnt="http://www.w3.org/2011/content#"><?xml version="1.0"?> <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="1804.00" height="1113.00" viewPort="0 0 1804.00 1113.00" version="1.1">     <rect x="1110.00" y="1138.00" width="1804.00" height="1113.00"/> </svg> </cnt:chars>   </rdf:Description> </rdf:RDF> {code}  (For the Object targeted by the selectors...) {code} <rdf:RDF xmlns:fedora="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/relations-external#" xmlns:fedora-model="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#" xmlns:islandora="http://islandora.ca/ontology/relsext#" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">   <rdf:Description rdf:about="info:fedora/yohe:640">     <fedora-model:hasModel rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:bookCModel"></fedora-model:hasModel>     <fedora:isMemberOfCollection rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:yohe"></fedora:isMemberOfCollection>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="oa:SpecificResource"></rdf:type>     <hasSource xmlns="http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#" rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:yohe"></hasSource>     <hasSelector xmlns="http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#" rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:68912"></hasSelector>   </rdf:Description> </rdf:RDF> {code}  Please note that failed attempts were made to embed the SVG selectors as XML literals.  Any more robust a solution would be greatly valued.

title: Solr metadata -- decode_entities
description: Solr search properly decodes html entities for metadata fields values on the results page. Solr metadata should do the same.

title: Remove XACML editor dependency from Islandora Paged Content
description: Islandora Paged Content contains a dependency on the XACML Editor which is not in the module .info file nor in the documentation, which can be seen here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/0c45c9e523fbb7df99d2c1754730b52b8a13c83b/includes/manage_pages.inc#L782  In some cases (when using the zip importer for example) the ingest process will fail if XACML editor is not present.   This dependency should either be documented or removed. Some discussion of how to remove it has taken place on this now-closed Pull Request. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/pull/60

title: when solr metadata display is configured, an error is displayed on object ingest
description: A user has configured a display for a content model using the Solr Metadata module. When a user adds a new object that is configured with the display, an error is produced - see attached image.    The issue is a result of the object getting displayed before solr has a chance to index it.    I wonder if changing the order of ingest operations might help resolve this - eg. index MODS in solr, transform to DC, index DC in solr, create derivatives, yadda yadda  Confirmed using sandbox.  Donald

Basically it fails to find the type because it's assuming its inline:  https://gist.github.com/nigelgbanks/147d121a05322f231418  Searching its children where it should first find it's definition. Improvement would allow the label pattern to be built from the available form components (like using Tokens or Replacement Patterns in Drupal).

title: when manually adding or replacing a TN with the Video SP I get an error message.

I've tested this on islandora sandbox as well and get the same behavior.  I've attached a screenshot.  The issue is similar to https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-917 and I wonder if it might effect other solution packs in the same way?  dm

title: Suggested change to Scholar full record display
description: This is a small thing. There's a pair of labels when viewing a full scholar citation record - Metadata and MODS Metadata. Image capture attached.  Do our user's care or understand what either of these labels mean?   Would it be more appropriate to change the Metadata label to Details and hide the second MODS metadata label ?   Could they be removed or classed so that they could be hidden?  The code for the Metadata label is here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/1f226b5aa76f0e11eb1c7eea4fd69995907f21ea/includes/utilities.inc#L196  The code for the MODS Metadata label is here:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/e83b72e873ecb99b25b9e2181d858bb7c6f3d046/includes/coins.inc#L353

title: Tab Panel Field UI options can be confusing
description: I've heard this reported a couple of times about the tab panel field in the XML Form Builder so thought I'd document it.    The Add button in the tab interface can be confusing and often users mistake Add for a Submit action.    I've attached a wireframe that proposes a couple of different approaches.  The first and I think it would be preferred is to add a Tab with a + symbol. That is a common interface pattern (eg. in browser interfaces) for adding another tab - the user selects the tab with + symbol and a new tab panel is generated. The other is to simply change to wording on the button to something that explicitly references the action - New Tab.  Donald

title: XACML - Parsing methods unrealiable
description: If the xacml datastream isn't well formatted (extra spacing or line breaks), the editor is adding invalid methods to the policy thus causing fedora to ignore them.  correct urn:fedora:names:fedora:2.1:action:id-getDatastreamDissemination incorrect urn:fedora:names:fedora:2.1:action:id--getDatastreamDissemination  Adam Vessey suggested.... "Purposing we force our own list of methods as we don't handle custom methods anyway. "

title: Batch Import for binary object content model
description: The binary object content model is a great solution for getting "packages" of stuff into Islandora/Fedora. One of the way that many people package stuff is through zip. It would be great to be able to batch import a zipped file of metadata xml and their corresponding zip files into the binary object content file.   The primary reason for this request is that much of the research where I work is saved in zip files. We're looking into the scholar module for research data and it would be a great time saver to be able to do this.

title: Delete collection only deletes the first 10 child objects

The rest of the items remain active and therefore appear in search results, but are orphaned from any collection so they do not appear in the browse display.  We noticed that if we raised the number here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/blob/63bfc5043bbcf2e1f5263ed8549fd5fb888c4f9d/includes/batch.inc#L178  from 10 to some larger number, the process would delete that larger number of items. title: Option to expand information displayed for the grid view
description: I have modified islandora_solr_search a bit and would like to suggest a change. See here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/185/files  My motivations: When I first started using the Grid view in Solr search, I was very confused as to why it didn't respect the field settings that seemed to be allowed.  Running the grid display results through the utility functions and updating the template allows it to use the fields defined in Default display settings under Solr settings.  The way I implemented this gives the option to expand the information displayed for the grid view. It would look exactly the same as it did before if the title field alone was added without a label in the Display fields section.

title: Solr admin 'x' button on modal windows causes issues
description: Some odd behaviour when using the 'x' button to cancel out of modal popup windows on the Solr admin configuration screen. If one: - moves a field within a set of fields (e.g., when multiple fields exist in the 'Default display settings', 'Sort settings', 'Facet settings' sections, etc.), then - attempts to configure one of the existing fields via the 'configure' button, bringing up a modal popup window, then - rather than saving any changes (whether or not they were made), uses the 'x' button to cancel out of the modal window, then - saves the Solr configuration,  the order of the fields is not saved properly; it either reverts to where it was, or, in the case of a larger list, becomes jumbled.

title: Multiple restricted content models breaks OAI
description: As found on the list: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/pS2w9O27gS4. Is an issue with the carriage returns not being stripped away before we parse it.

title: islandora_xml_forms: self_transform not recognized
description: We are trying to apply cleanup self-transformation to mods. The forms are built-in through a custom module.   This is the form definition:  ```     'mymodule_article_form' => array(       'content_model' => 'nal-model:Article',       'form_name' => 'Article form',       'dsid' => 'MODS',       'title_field' => array('titleInfo', 'title'),       'transform' => 'mods_to_dc_naldora.xsl',       'self_transform' => 'cleanup_mods.xsl',       'template' => FALSE,     ), ```  I have attached the relevant section of the interface.  The variable table has this entry: xml_form_builder_use_default_dc_xslts | i:1;  The self-transformation are not applied, because in the builder/xml_form_builder.module script, $run_transforms evaluates as False.   I have applied the attached patch, which fixes the problem. Is this the correct way, or is there something in the configuration that I was missing?   Also, self_transform is only half documented in the api. I have attached another patch for that.   Please let me know if these changes should get committed. I'd fork the repo and issue a pull request.

For details, see discussion on Islandora Google Groups forum: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/5rYpp1ysQus  This does not occur with object-level embargoes or manually-lifted embargoes.

title: Islandora OAI module $earliest_datestamp can be truncated (and invalid)
description: When a Fedora Object's last modified date ends with a 0 the itql query that retrieves the object's date gets the values with the 0 chopped off. This is a problem for the -5 parameter to drupal substr.  More detail: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_oai/pull/58  When this happens it creates OAI validation problems.

title: Zipfile importer leaves zipfile contents mess in Drupal's "Public file system path"
description: From what I can ascertain, Importer is utilizing Drupal's defined "Public file system path" instead of Drupal's defined "Temporary directory".  My Drupal's "Public file system path" is littered with the contents of zipfiles imported into the system.  DC record*.xml, MODS record.xml, image objects, etc.   Please see attached screenshot.  From other support threads, I understand the Importer deletes zipfiles using Drupal's cron.   But apparently it is leaving the contents of imported zipfiles untouched in Drupal's "Public file system path".  Questions:  Shouldn't the module be programmed to clean up zipfile contents and thus it's mess?  Why isn't the module programmed to utilize Drupal's "Temporary directory" path?    Temporary files should be placed with other temporary files.  If file contents cleanup routines don't exist within the current software, we could create our own automation to take the tempfile trash out.  The problem with that strategy is, zipfile contents are apparently programmed to extract into Drupal's "Public file system path", making discernment of what's temporary and what's not temporary difficult...

Press "Save configuration" button  File Information Tool Set is then found, green check appears, then after save process fully runs, valid system path disappears, unable to locate File Information Tool Set error re-appears.  Screencast of issue: http://screencast.com/t/USPYid3ZcEj

title: Surface the checksum checker results
description: Migration of issue at https://github.com/mjordan/islandora_checksum_checker/issues/4 to JIRA. [~dmoses] description of enhancement:  Something that @ppound did with his vault module was display the 'health' of the object by adding a column in the Manage > Datastream tab for the object. That might be something we'd like to consider. see: https://github.com/ppound/cirrostratus_assimilate/blob/dcb923749185ab4b9e0ed8da0774fa2e0c108986/islandora_vault.module#L91-L141 ... @ppound may have suggestions about how to accomplish this... It would also be useful to index or push to RELS-EXT the results of a checksum check ... then an admin could run a Solr or ITQL query to return any checksum operations that failed and then act on them.  [~markj] Respoded:  I like this feature a lot, but have to ask how crowded this display would become if both the vault and checksum checker modules were enabled. Also, WRT querying RELS-EXT, the fixity checks generate a lot of data; if we were to update RELS-EXT, I'd like to think of ways of not recording every check but instead just the results of the latest check, or something like that. Another approach might be to store results of fixity checks in a database table and then use Views to provide a UI to the data.  I agree that being able to query for mismatches is an important feature. Let's use this issue to brainstorm this a bit before we write any code.  Also, currently, admins get an email if Checksum Checker detects a fixity mismatch.  And [~ppound] responded to that:  The vault code was written against a very early version of islandora version 7 so there maybe better ways to modify the datastreams table now? Vault does it in a preprocessor not sure if we now have hooks to enable this or not.  As Mark stated it could get crowded if several modules added columns to this table.

title: When FITS TECHM reports that submitted file isn't valid, provide feedback to user
description: During testing I had a look at the datastreams generated.  When reviewing the TECHMD ds it provided information that the uploaded file wasn't well formed (see snippet below).  I'm thinking that FITS should provide some sort of feedback as part of the ingest process or summary of the event? Or ensure we're indexing the TECHMD so that we can query.  <filestatus><well-formed toolname="Jhove" toolversion="1.5" status="SINGLE_RESULT">false</well-formed><valid toolname="Jhove" toolversion="1.5" status="SINGLE_RESULT">false</valid><message toolname="Jhove" toolversion="1.5" status="SINGLE_RESULT">Unexpected error in findFonts java.lang.ClassCastException: edu.harvard.hul.ois.jhove.module.pdf.PdfSimpleObject cannot be cast to edu.harvard.hul.ois.jhove.module.pdf.PdfDictionary offset=1771</message></filestatus>  Donald

title: Utilize defined temporary directory for temporary file operations on serialized bags to reduce unnecessary storage allocation on versioned filesystems
description: If the output directory for serialized bags is a versioned filesystem, islandora_bagit creates unnecessary versions while conducting temporary file operations.  If using existing 'Temporary directory for unserialized Bags' path is undesirable, I suggest a new 'Temporary directory for serialized Bags' setting, or just employ one temporary work directory setting for both kinds of bags and be done with it.  Regardless, the desired effect is: conduct temporary file operations related to serialized bags in well defined temporary path, then write final output to defined serialized bag output directory.  Subsequently, when 'Create Bag on object modification' setting is employed, bag modification temporary tasks should also be conducted in defined temporary path, not final output path, again to reduce unnecessary versions when using a versioned filesystem.  The attached screenshot shows the versioning result of only two bagit operations: 1. initial bag creation 2. bag update after metadata update

title: Get a WSOD when using xml form with template and changing tabbed template values.
description: Scenario:  1. Create new form / copy form in form builder. 2. Associate new form with model. 3. Select template to associate with model (upload the mods data from another record to make it simple)  - ensure mods data has multiple data for one of the fields that uses tabs (such as the name element). 4. Create new islandora object with model. 5. Select new form as type of form. 6. Remove one of the tabbed elements. 7. Continue with rest of form and continue to end.  If you follow these steps, you will get to the last step and when you finally click to ingest the new record, you will get a WSOD. When I did this with a basic image, I got the following errors:  [Wed Oct 01 17:59:53 2014] [error] [client 71.92.218.79] PHP Fatal error:  Call to undefined function xml_form_builder_ingest_form_undo_submit() in /var/www/html/docroot/includes/form.inc on line 1513, referer: http://dpldams.dev.chillco.com/islandora/object/islandora%3Achillco_isp_large_image_collection/manage/overview/ingest?irtsid=islandora%3A4724 [Wed Oct 01 20:15:41 2014] [error] [client 71.92.218.79] PHP Fatal error:  Call to undefined function islandora_basic_image_image_upload_form_submit() in /var/www/html/docroot/includes/form.inc on line 1513, referer: http://dpldams.dev.chillco.com/islandora/object/islandora%3Asp_basic_image_collection/manage/overview/ingest?irtsid=islandora%3A4814  If I suppress some of these, I then start getting warnings such as 'islandora object not found), etc.

title: scholar content model namespace should be islandora

The Scholar solution pack is the only one that doesn't follow this practice. I think in the next iteration of the module, that should be changed. When controlling a site using namespaces it means that the ir: namespace needs to be included.   The content models affected include the ir:citationCModel and the ir:thesisCModel.  Donald

title: Video Playback in JW Player
description: NOTE: It is unclear if this is just a configuration issue that I haven't been able to sort out, my only solution was to edit the PHP code. If it is more a configuration issue, please feel free to close the ticket.  Issue: When attempting to play the derivative MP4 of a Video in JW Player, the Video Solution Pack sets the derivative URL (within the "theme.inc" file) as:      $video_url = url("islandora/object/{$object->id}/datastream/$viewer_dsid/view");  See: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_video/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L48  Attempting to load this URL in your browser throws a 404 error. In comparing with the Audio Solution Pack, the derivative audio URL ends with the datastream ID (rather than the fedora method of "view"). See: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_audio/blob/7.x/islandora_audio.module#L170  Solution: I ended up fixing the issue on my install by replacing the "$video_url" line with:      $video_url = url("islandora/object/{$object->id}/datastream/$viewer_dsid", array('absolute' => TRUE));  (which more closely matches how the Audio Solution Pack handles the derivative URL).

title: Deletion support for OAI

The problem is when that institution is a content hub for DPLA. In the case of the UNC folks, they do not work with feeds that don't support deletion.  It also makes it difficult to work as a content hub for DPLA. Would it be possible to add this functionality to Islandora's OAI?   Thanks for considering.

title: Islandora Solr Geographical display profile missing required module

The Foundation should possibly request the transfer of this module so that it can be included in future releases. Or maybe the geographic profile work should be pulled out into its own submodule?

title: SQL errors resulting from functions being passed wrong parameters from menu callbacks

title: Apply IP restrictions on collection to members of the collection
description: IP embargo/restrictions placed on collection objects don't get applied automatically to members of the collection, e.g., if the user knows the direct URL of a child object, the object is accessible regardless of the parent collection's embargo.    One solution would be to do a db query against the islandora_ip_embargo_embargoes table within islandora_ip_embargo_islandora_object_access() to get embargoes on the object's parent collection and enforce them.    We'd be happy to put some resources on implementing this feature.

title: Make thumbnails of embargoed objects themable
description: Currently the thumbnails of embargoed objects have the hard-coded (in js/embargoed_images.js) word "EMBARGOED" laid over them. It would be useful if implementers could theme these thumbnails. Also, some licensed vendor content (for example) doesn't allow thumbnails to be displayed to non-authorized users, and being able to theme them would allow the use of a placeholder/generic image for embargoed objects. Using a generic thumbnail could be an admin option that could be implemented without theming.    We'd be happy to apply some resources to implementing this feature.

title: Objects not showing up in most collections
description: In the VM appliance downloaded from http://islandora.ca/downloads on Nov. 17, objects are showing up in the collection browse pages for the Book, Newspaper, and Compound collections but not the others. I can confirm that these collections do contain objects by  querying the Resource Index directly. For example, querying the Audio collection gets me three member objects.    curl "http://localhost:8080/fedora/risearch?type=tuples&lang=iTQL&format=CSV&query=select%20%24object%20from%20%3C%23ri%3E%20where%20%24object%20%3Cfedora-rels-ext%3AisMemberOfCollection%3E%20%3Cinfo%3Afedora%2Fislandora%3Aaudio_collection%3E"  "object"  info:fedora/islandora:2  info:fedora/islandora:49  info:fedora/islandora:104    Queries against the Newspaper, PDF, and Web Archive are all showing one child object.    Probably separate issue, but might be related: When trying to view conent from the two books, I only see the message "Loading the Internet Archive BookReader, please wait... " This message doesn't change (I left it for over an hour to test).    In all cases I was logged in as admin. I did change the VM's config to use only 3 gigs of RAM but running free and top show that the machine is not maxed out so i don't think it's a resource issue.

title: Excessive file operations during derivative generation
description: I've observed the following during derivative generation:    1. export OBJ file from Fedora, place in defined Drupal temporary directory  2. generate derivative TECHMD  3. ingest TECHMD  4. delete OBJ and TECHMD from Drupal temporary directory    5. export OBJ file from Fedora, place in defined Drupal temporary directory  6. generate derivative TN  7. ingest TN  8. delete OBJ and TN from Drupal temporary directory    9. export OBJ file from Fedora, place in defined Drupal temporary directory  10. generate derivative JPG  11. ingest JPG  12. delete OBJ and TN from Drupal temporary directory    13. export OBJ file from Fedora, place in defined Drupal temporary directory  14. generate derivative JP2  15. ingest JP2  16. delete OBJ and JP2 from Drupal temporary directory    Suggestion: utilize a Fedora-esque <param name="uploadStorageMinutes"> function to allow the OBJ to to be stored long enough to generate all derivatives.

title: Print icon/functionality
description: We have found that the current print icon showing in 1.4 does not work as expected in the newspaper solution pack.   Instead of being able to print out a page (or pages), when you click on the print icon, it instead brings up another window with the metadata details instead and you can only print the metadata, not the page(s).     We thought we could just hide this print icon but it turns out to be part of the Islandora core stack, and we don't want to make any changes to it b/c of that.  We also thought that maybe in place of the print icon we could have a tab that says "Details" on it.  When you click on "Details," it would take you to the metadata for the newspaper - which would be useful for users to be able to view as well.     We would be interested in seeing a "quick print" function for the Islandora Newspaper Solution Pack.  This would be a button (a tab) that you could click and then print out a page or multiple pages of the entire newspaper issue.       See Google thread: https://groups.google.com/forum/?hl=en#!topic/islandora/OUbRzLNFD10

title: destination_dsid should be optional
description: API docs for hook_islandora_derivative() and hook_cmodel_pid_islandora_derivative() indicate that the destination_dsid  key in the return array is optional. But, when I don't use it my hook implementation, I get the following error when I try to view the list of datastreams on an object ingested by my module:    Notice: Undefined index: destination_dsid in islandora_islandora_datastream_access() (line 1953 of /var/www/islandoradev/sites/all/modules/islandora/islandora.module).    Are the docs incorrect or should the code at that location be checking for something else?

title: Make Islandora breadcrumbs xacml aware
description: Current breadcrumbs implementation always displays the first parent object (collection), but does not take in account if this object is viewable by the current user. When XACML policies are in place, this leads to "permission denied". The correct behaviour would be to hide collections not currently accessible to the user. This also permits to obscure a full tree of parent objects like temporary collections used only for importing batch objects.  Also, the current query is still using legacy ITQL.

One suggested solution was to use a solr query instead of a sparql query.     Creating this ticket so it stays or our radar.

title: new hook to islandora's API to enable solution packs to add predicates to breadcrumb
description: Current breadcrumb implementation uses a rather statical list of predicates to define which parent ship relations should be displayed. Moreover, the existing list of predicates are in no way ordered, so we always get the first added one to an object, which generally defaults to "isMemberOfCollection". Proposal: lets add this hooks to Islandora's api:  hook_islandora_get_breadcrumb_query_filters()  and hook_islandora_get_breadcrumb_query_filters_alter()  and define as return an array consisting of predicates + a associated weight argument for each.   When building the breadcrumb, we are getting right now the first element of the sparql result. Instead, we could map to the passed filter predicates + it's weight, reorder the result based on this and then get the one with a lower weight.  This way solution packs can give their own predicates a higher priority and, e.g, we could display compound relations directly in the breadcrumb.
component: Collection Solution Pack,Compound Object Solution Pack,Islandora Module (Core)

An example of what I see coming back from the query:    "object","sequence","label","issued"  info:fedora/floradora:19,1,test issue 1,2014-06-30  info:fedora/floradora:19,1,test issue 1,null  info:fedora/floradora:23,2,test issue 2,2014-11-27  info:fedora/floradora:23,2,test issue 2,null  info:fedora/floradora:27,3,test issue 3,2014-12-16  info:fedora/floradora:27,3,test issue 3,null
