title: XACML relations not being set correctly
description: Due to a disconnect between how users and roles are acquired for writing POLICY datastreams and the entries reflecting them in the RELS-EXT(/-INT), it was possible for the set of relationships written to be a subset of those written to the POLICY.    This issue would be likely to manifest as objects with XACML viewing restrictions showing up in lists of results of users/roles who do not have access to view them, and so getting 403s(/404s?) when trying to access them.    This issue should only affect POLICY streams written with the XACML API directly--those written with the "editor" UI should be fine, due to validation the editor performs (requiring the user enabling the viewing rule to be selected)... This issue may potentially affect POLICY streams written with the "Scholar Embargo" module.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/pull/109  A pull with an update hook still to come.

title: islandora_batch failing to import MARCXML
description: islandora_batch's documentation refers to MARCXML support:    "For the base scan, files are grouped according to their basename (without extension). DC, MODS or MARCXML stored in a *.xml"    Utilizing the usual batch file basename matching convention, I conducted batch imports tests of PDFs and matching MARCXML.    Results:  * PDF objects were ingested successfully.  * No evidence found for successful MARCXML import:    MODS is empty:  <mods:mods xmlns:mods="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3" xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">    <mods:titleInfo>      <mods:title></mods:title>    </mods:titleInfo>  </mods:mods>    DC is devoid is metadata, except for correct identifier:  <oai_dc:dc xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd"><dc:title/><dc:identifier>islandora:X</dc:identifier></oai_dc:dc>    Strangely, newly ingested PDF objects do not show up in defined parent collection...  The objects are however accessible directly, if you know their PID...   Objects still do not show in their parent collection after a Fedora Resource Index rebuild operation.    Ingest of two different types of MARCXML were attempted.  One is a "collection" model, traditionally used for collections (even though there's only one record in the attached example).  The other is a "single record" format taken directly from LOC website verbatim (see attached "sandburg" file set)    Attached are two different zipfiles containing my actual test records.

description: islandora_batch's documentation refers to MARC binary support:    "binary MARC stored in a *.mrc"    Utilizing the usual batch file basename matching convention, I conducted command-line drush batch import tests of a PDF object and it's matching MARC binary .mrc metadata. Results:  * PDF objects were ingested successfully.  * No evidence found for successful MARC binary import:    MODS is empty:  <mods:mods xmlns:mods="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3" xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">    <mods:titleInfo>      <mods:title></mods:title>    </mods:titleInfo>  </mods:mods>    DC is devoid is metadata, except for correct identifier:  <oai_dc:dc xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">    <dc:title></dc:title>    <dc:identifier>islandora:X</dc:identifier>  </oai_dc:dc>    Attached is my test zipfile.      Note: testing via web-based interface gives same result, except title field is populated with pdf filename:    <mods xmlns:mods="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3" xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">    <titleInfo>      <title>sandburg</title>    </titleInfo>  </mods>    Ingest of the PDF object, minus MARC binary processing, did happen successfully. The following error lines were observed in drush's islandora_batch_ingest stdout:     log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationUtils).  log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.  log4j:WARN See http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig for more info. Test object:  http://imgsrc.hubblesite.org/hu/db/images/hs-2003-11-a-full_tif.tif  (285.99 MB)    Please review the following discussions for complete details:    FCREPO-944  https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/FCREPO-944    Stephen Bayliss' analysis of FCREPO-944:  https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/FCREPO-944?focusedCommentId=20401&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-20401    NegativeArraySizeException: Stress Testing Islandora Using Hubble's Greatest TIFFs:  https://groups.google.com/d/topic/islandora/AS8GPGgn3Ow/discussion    Adam Vessey's analysis:  https://groups.google.com/d/msg/islandora/AS8GPGgn3Ow/B9_8RcHFFVAJ    Github: Bag is not created for an object:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/issues/8    The link above mentions Fedora 3.6.2 being effected.    On FCREPO-944, Benjamin Armintor "Started a feature branch. Needed to upgrade apache-codec to have access to Base64InputStream"  https://github.com/fcrepo3/fcrepo/commit/2f67dd6334a025cd56ee162b70b48b2b30023e4c    The issue can be nullified by discontinuing use of islandora_bagit's plugin_object_foxml.inc, or custom plugins which export FOXML.

title: islandora_solr_metadata silently fails if filtered_html does not exist
description:
islandora_solr_metadata depends on text format filtered_html: theme/islandora-solr-metadata-display.tpl.php: theme/islandora-solr-metadata-description.tpl.php:

theme/islandora-solr-metadata-description.tpl.php:

Come to find out, the hard way, it is absolutely possible for a Drupal 7 installation to be missing the filtered_html text format. Found a clue in watchdog: Missing text format: filtered_html. Possible reasons filtered_html would not exist: 1. filtered_html text format may not be installed during Minimal Drupal install http://drupal.stackexchange.com/questions/76184/adding-missing-input-formats-after-minimal-install 2. Administrator issue (human error) https://www.drupal.org/node/1337158 Suggest utilizing function filter_formats (or similar) to test for existence of filtered_html and alert user visibly if it does not exist. https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/modules!filter!filter.module/function/filter_formats/7

title: Internet archive book viewer auto-play flips last page back and forth after using auto-play once

However, it will not go past the last page.  In other words, the last page continues to flip back and forth.      We noticed this in Islandora 7.1.4.       We would like it to be able to continue flipping back through to the first page.      Thanks very much in advance!

title: Finer granularity needed for "Administer Solr" permission
description: Currently, the "Administer Solr" permission is too broad.  It should be possible to assign "Display profiles" to an archivist or designer while the true systems administrator retains exclusive access to the "Solr index" and "Solr URL" configuration.    Suggestions for discussion:    "Administer Solr" should have exclusive access to the "Solr index" configuration, located at:  admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr    Solr settings:  admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings    Should "Administer Solr" have exclusive access to the "Debug mode" setting?    Additionally, "Query defaults" and "Required Solr fields" could fall under a true systems administrator role as well.    In summary, finer granularity is needed for the the "Administer Solr" permission in order to delegate configuration tasks to appropriate roles within an organization.      Today, the broad permission covers from "Display profiles" to "Solr URL", which are distinctly two different tiers of configuration.   The first is cosmetic, while the latter is mission critical and highly volatile.

title: Remove dependency on jquery_update Image Annotation
description: Either change the code to not be dependant on later versions of jQuery or include the jQuery it needs with noConflict.

title: RepositoryQuery.php exhaust memory on large SPARQL Result xml parsing
description: Current RepositoryQuery.php implementation, https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/blob/1.x/RepositoryQuery.php#L37-L69  loads the whole result document into memory using a simplexml element and iterates over it's children using foreach in two nested loops. This behaviour works well for small-medium results or when the answer is limited to a few 1000+- responses. But on large queries, this triggers quick memory exhaustion inside the foreach structure.  Since php 5.1.x XMLReader() is enabled by default. It enables huge xml files to be parsed element by element with minimum memory usage.

title: islandora_solr_search Admin configuration will not accept valid HTTPS islandora_solr_url

Valid URL can be accessed directly from localhost as well.    includes/admin.inc seemingly contains http-only references in function:  islandora_solr_get_solrconfig_xml()    lines:  2034  2035  2038  2041    Lines 2032-2033:     // XXX: The Solr URL should be made to contain the URI scheme in the actual      // configuration.      if (strpos($solr_url, 'http') !== 0) {        $url = "http://$url";      }    Code comment says:  "The Solr URL should be made to contain the URI scheme in the actual configuration."    I do not see any URI scheme that includes a hostname in my:  https://hostname:8443/solr/admin/file/?file=solrconfig.xml    Suspicious Line 2041:        islandora_solr_resolve_xincludes($xml[$solr_url], (strpos($solr_url, 'http') === 0 ? '' : 'http://') . $solr_url);    Chocked full of http but no https; it's appears http is hardcoded...

title: newspaper issue Prev/Next navigation does not follow order of date issued
description: For newspaper issue objects, the Prev/Next navigation follows the order of isSequenceNumber from the RELS-EXT, rather than ordering navigation by dateIssued from the RELS-EXT.    isSequenceNumber is assigned sequentially as issue objects are created, so Next goes to the next issue that was created, which is not necessarily the next issue according to dateIssued.    If the user did not create issues following the exact order of date issued, then Prev/Next appears to jump from one issue to the next in a confusing way.

title: Seeming double deletion of tmp files in ocr batch.

title: Both newspaper issue and page views broken if there is no viewer configured.
description: Both issue and page views broken if there is no viewer configured.   For the issue page we should at least see the list of pages as thumbnails, for the actual pages we should fall back to showing the JPG.

title: hook_islandora_basic_collection_build_manage_object does not handle indexed elements
description: Currently, the islandora_basic_collection_build_manage_object hook places tabs into the collection management page wherever it feels like. This would be wonderful, except that currently, the only way to designate the index of elements on the page (most notably pagers) is to hard-code them. This means that depending on what modules are enabled that implement this hook, the indexed elements could overlap or be out of order.    It would be better to have all tabs be sorted by weight [at the time they are called|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/blob/7.x/includes/manage_collection.inc#L25-36], and then determine the index afterwards.

title: Allow users to reorder newpaper issues.
description: Add two management forms for newspapers that allow user to manually reorder issues, in the same way we do for pages. Also add a form to auto order all issues based on date issued.

title: Simple workflow module does not respect namespace restrictions in multisite
description: We are running a multisite Islandora 7.x-1.4 that uses a single Fedora.     When using the simple workflow module, administrators from a multisite with namespace restrictions enforced are able to see all inactive objects in Fedora regardless of namespace.    The simple workflow module should respect namespace restrictions on a site if namespace restrictions are enabled.

title: Solr search facets return 400 bad request if / or " is in the facet value

title: Creative Commons element does not parse International licenses correctly
description: This was built for licenses with a specific jurisdiction (ie. Canada) which have an additional "part" of the URI.    New CC licenses are all International and do not include this jurisdiction part.    When editing an existing metadata record this causes an error to be thrown and the existing license to be incorrectly parsed. Leading the user to re-select their desired license or end up with the default.

title: Deleting agregate objects don't transverse the graph.
description: When deleting objects via "delete members from this collection", if one of the objects is a collection it's children don't get deleted. Thus leaving you with many orphaned objects.    1 - parent  2 -- child (delete me via 1 interface)  3 --- grandchild (3 doesn t get deleted when deleting 2 from 1)    If current functionality is desirable for some users, there should at least be an option to allow transversing the graph when deleting.    This should be implemented using the "generic traversal hook" to work across all aggregate objects. To prevent inconsistent behavior we should implement on all modules at once.

title: solr facet date range doesn't respect facet min. limit setting

title: IP Ranges with leading zeros
Create an interface to clean up relationships to a deleted object.
description: Related to issues posed by https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-999 and https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1210, when an object is deleted, relationships that point to it may remain in the repository. While in some cases this should cause a deletion cascade (such as nested collections, as mentioned in ticket 1210), in the general case you may or may not want to delete related objects.     I propose a management interface accessible after an object's deletion or purge, that searches the triplestore for all relationships to the deleted object(s) and lets the user select whether to delete the relationship, the related object, or leave the target-less relationship in place.

title: Replace TN datastream function requires PNG while system generates JPG
description: One part of the system generates JPG thumbnails, but another part of the system only accepts PNG thumbnails, when replacing TN datastreams.    This behavior presents a logic problem for me, so I'm filing it the in hopes of commiseration from others.    The issue effectively thwarts reuse of existing object's JPG thumbnails as a drop-in replacement for collection folder thumbnails.      Currently, to route around the issue, one must download an object's JPG thumbnail, open it in a graphics program and save it as a PNG for the system to accept it as a TN datastream replacement; a completely unnecessary workflow in my honest opinion.    If the consensus can be achieved that PNG is the preference, maybe the system should generate PNG thumbnail derivatives instead of JPG.  That way, one could reuse PNG thumbnails for collection thumbnail replacement.       Today, one part of the system generates JPG, while another part of the system forbids JPG.    It's reminiscent of Sony Music producing formats that Sony Electronics equipment does not play.  http://archive.wired.com/wired/archive/11.02/sony_pr.html

title: focusing on a newly crearted tab in ingest/edit form
description: hy    when you create a new tab in a tabpanel via the add button, the new tab (1) gets created and appears to the right of the first tab (0) but the the focus is still  on the the first tab (0) ... which is a bit unpractical because you need an additional click to focus that tab so you can enter data in it, it is also impractical because users by automation start to enter data not realizing that they are still on the first tab and overwrite data of the first tab with the data intended for the second tab    to illustrate, the default is a tabpanel with a single tab (which is in focus since it is the first and only tab)    ---------------  (0)  ---------------    then when yo click the add button a second tab to the right is created but the focus is still on the first tab    ---------------  (0) 1  ---------------    so i need an additional click to get the second tab in to focus    ---------------  0 (1)  ---------------    i would like it to go back to the old principle where the new tab gets into focus    ---------------                                            ---------------  (0)                   ---- add new tab ---->       0 (1)  ---------------                                            ---------------    this problem is not present when you downgrade jquery via the jquery_update module to version 1.5 (but then other problems arise)

title: Advanced search collections option
description: Recently I was asked to look into implementing a collections dropdown for the islandora_solr_search advanced search block. I started to work on it then I was turned onto:    https://github.com/discoverygarden/islandora_collection_search    That DGI module already does everything and then some =) However, that left me with some questions. Does the DGI module necessarily preclude an implementation directly in islandora_solr_search? Is the functionality not generally useful enough anyway to be included in "core" and not require an external, non-Foundation dependency or custom implementation?    So, two things:    1. Is there value in a feature request for a collections dropdown in the advanced search block of islandora_solr_search? Is that something that would add value to the community as part of that module? If no, then please feel free to close this ticket and look no further =)    2. If yes, then here is what I came up with so far:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/compare/7.x...mark-cooper:adv_srch_coll    Which makes the functionality optional. A key implementation issue is of course descendant object relationships and there is handling for that, but not for page content model objects without some indexing / reindexing assistance (which the DGI module appears to do with bonus gsearch integration [I haven't tried to use it], but would otherwise be up to the implementer here).    So perhaps the approach is too naive / compromised? I'm a newbie to the Islandora code so won't be upset at all by that judgement -- for example I'm not clear if it's even conventionally acceptable to include basic_collection in solr_search as I've done. If it's unworkable then remove all references to 2. and leave the feature request open (assuming it wasn't already closed due to 1.).    Best,

title: Create Bag on object modification loop possibly caused by users who rarely logout
description: Observed in dblog a bag being generated over and over again; the same bag was being generated practically every minute for over 24 hours.    I was working on batch cleanup issues during this same timeframe and had cleared data from the batch tables.  I believe the clearing of batch data effectively eliminated batch as the source of the issue.    Started reviewing islandora_bagit.module code to increase understanding, and landed on:    function islandora_bagit_create_bag_on_shutdown() {    if (isset($_SESSION['islandora_object'])) {      islandora_bagit_create_bag($_SESSION['islandora_object']);      // Clear this variable in the session so the Bag isn't generated again.      unset($_SESSION['islandora_object']);    }  }    Examined my drupal's session table, examining each of the session's BLOBs, and found a session containing references to "islandora_bagit".    I deleted the session in question, which is attached to this issue.  Sure enough, the bag in question stopped generating in the observed looped fashion.    Putting two and two together, I realized function islandora_bagit_create_bag_on_shutdown() is supposed to run on logout, but I had not actually logged out.  I had just shut my laptop and went home, came back in the next day and picked up where I left off, all without logging out and in again.  Typical behavior...    After observing the same bag being generated at a frequency of practically every minute for over 24 hours, I believe it's possible for a bagit loop to happen, due to the user not logging out and possibly due to factors with the data stored in the session.    I examined the offending object's foxml in the objectStore and it's datastreams, and the files were not being updated in the continuous manner that should logically trigger an object modification event; I don't believe the file's last modified dates were a factor in triggering the bagit loop.    I suspected checksum checking and PREMIS events to be triggering the export event, due to audit stream updating, but my research proved that was not the case.    I believe the key is the user wasn't logging out, which of course did not trigger unset($_SESSION['islandora_object']);    The export loop kept looping in a odd way however, which may have something to do with the session data technique/methodology.    For the object in question, I certainly do have an odd number of revisions on RELS-EXT and POLICY datastreams; maybe an errant XACML function is polluting the waters of understanding...  I certainly did not manually update RELS-EXT 30 times, nor POLICY 15 times...    I updated the policy containing the object once (1) yesterday, but not 29 additional times...

If an object is shared between two collections, the user is still able to purge that object using Manage > Properties > Permanently remove ...  the object from the repository.    This may be a documentation task.  Ideally when purging there should be a message to the user letting them know that the object will be removed from all collections if shared.    dm

title: No method to generate/regenerate PROXY_MP3 after original ingest
description: Use case:    1. Ingest lightweight, metadata-only record, minus audio OBJ  2. Later in time, when audio is finally processed and ready, add audio OBJ to existing object datastreams  3. Generate PROXY_MP3 datastream after audio OBJ is added/updated    Problem with #3...  Cannot find any method to generate/regenerate PROXY_MP3 after original ingest.    If there is a known method to generate PROXY_MP3 after an OBJ ingest/replacement, please advise.    In summary, one must have audio ready and included at time of initial batch ingest or system will not allow generation/regeneration of PROXY_MP3 datastream.

title: Top-level key in render array for Islandora object is null
description: Within implementations of hook_islandora_view_object_alter(), $rendered contains a top-level key that is empty (NULL) when invoked on a non-collection object:    {code}  Array  (      [] => Array          (              [#markup] =>  <div class="islandora-basic-image-object islandora" vocab="http://schema.org/" prefix="dcterms: http://purl.org/dc/terms/" typeof="ImageObject">    <div class="islandora-basic-image-content-wrapper clearfix">            <div class="islandora-basic-image-content">  }  {code}    When invoked on a collection object, the key is ''Collection View":    {code}  Array  (      [Collection View] => Array          (              [#markup] =>  <div class="islandora-basic-collection-wrapper">      <div class="islandora-basic-collection clearfix">  {code}    When hook_page_alter() is invoked on a normal Drupal node, the render array has no top-leve key:    {code}  Array  (      [#show_messages] => 1      [#theme] => page      [#theme_wrappers] => Array          (              [0] => html          )  {code}    Is it intentional to have a null key in the render array for a non-collection object? Also, the render array for the normal Drupal node doesn't have an extra array between the root of the render array and the keys containing #markup, etc. while Islandora's render arrays do have an intermediate array. Is that also intentional?

title: Separate permissions or modules for menu and xml_form_builder functions
description: Today, enabling module results in enabling two distinct functions:    1. islandora_marcxml_menu()  2. islandora_marcxml_islandora_ingest_steps_alter()    Sometimes the marcxml_menu function is all that is desired.      In this use case, islandora_marcxml_islandora_ingest_steps_alter() becomes an annoyance.    But maybe at some later date, the islandora_marcxml_islandora_ingest_steps_alter() function becomes desirable again.    It would be nice to be able to enable/disable each function, on an as-needed basis.    It might also be a nice improvement to have a means to associate the islandora_marcxml_islandora_ingest_steps_alter() function with a particular object model, instead of it broadcast interjecting itself on all object model xml forms.    As it stands today, one must disable the entire module to stop islandora_marcxml_islandora_ingest_steps_alter() from interjecting.       Today, the xml form hook behavior presents an annoyance, because we're not using the function today.  But tomorrow we might need the function...    I'd rather have a means to stay in sync with the community, than ever have to consider manually commenting out the function with every update.

title: Whitescreening on Compound Object Creation

Navigate to "manage/compound" and "ADD CHILD OBJECTS/ Add child objects as part of this compound object/Child Object Pid/Label"  3. Find PID & Save:    What happens to me:  Whitescreens. I press Refresh and page loads with the following error:  "Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in islandora_compound_object_update_parent_thumbnail() (line 303 of /var/www/drupal/htdocs/sites/all/modules/islandora_solution_pack_compound/islandora_compound_object.module). title: RELS-INT managableBy relationships created wrong when ingesting a datastream after an object is created with a POLICY defining the datastream.
description: When adding a datastream to an object that has an XACML POLICY defining restrictions on it after ingest the resulting isManageableBy RELS-INT statements are not added in the correct ontology namespace: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/blob/7.x/api/islandora_xacml_api.module#L160-L169

title: XACML Editor adds unused isManageableBy relationship for datastreams in the RELS-INT
description: Under a specific condition RELS-INT relationships are created for isManageableBy on datastreams which are never used.
