title: Bibliographies are not sorted
description: When doing some test exports of citations as PDF and RTF, the generated list of citations is not sorted in any manner.  Sorting can be dependent on the style, so I'm not sure if this is something as simple as "sort citations by the <namePart type="family"> field.

title: Clarify categories of export formats for citations
description: When exporting citations the options are divided into two categories:    Bibliography  * RIS  * RTF  * PDF  Bookmark  * CSV    RTF and PDF make sense to me as bibliography formats and HTML as a format would be useful if that can be an option. CSV and RIS are machine formats in my mind.  Not sure if Bookmark as a label makes sense.     Don

title: Compound objects block does not appear for any user except User 1
description: Compound objects block does not appear for any user except User 1.    I don't believe it's a permissions issue, because even users with "Administer compound object relationships" permission cannot see the block.    Visibility settings for block are wide open, not restricted.    Searching for anyone else who was experiencing the block issue, I found a 8/9/14 Islandora Group posting:  https://groups.google.com/d/msg/islandora/6jsjcrz-43Y/H7vR66ugsocJ    Have tested some cutting edge code updates below, but block issue wasn't resolved, so I felt it prudent to open new, specific issue.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/commit/a83e369a6d86e2946ca374fcb665a9b88e229f44#diff-dacfa496dcdc86ad0174e734682f128b    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/pull/70/files

title: clean up collection policy xml
description: clean up collection policy xml    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/pull/138

title: Proposal for Autocomplete framework
description: It would be really useful to be able to configure your own autocomplete callbacks.    I think there ought to be a more general autocomplete framework in Islandora core that modules currently implementing their own autocomplete (such as Entities) can hook into. I think you should be able to specify what field to search, and what field to return (e.g. search on label, but return pid), and specify any filters (e.g. search only objects with islandora:collectionCModel).     Here's what I think we could do with it.  https://roblib.mybalsamiq.com/projects/bowingdownhome/prototype/Islandora%20Autocomplete%20Mockup?key=36aa3868b79b2357b4e91f44f70672b4de81fa34    This could totally be done as a code thing, using an API or hooks. But for bonus points, I think it's be super cool to have a config screen where a (clever) admin could configure their own autocompletes. Any of this would require a bit of documentation, about what field types are good for autocomplete (text, not string), and huge warnings that if you search on A and return B you'd better make sure that A is sufficiently disambiguated. <rant />    As mentioned by Will P on the call, DGI's islandora_authority also implements an autocomplete, but if I understand it correctly it populates several elements of a form (such as the associated 'uri' attribute in a mods tag while you autocomplete on the value), and must be processed through Objective Forms. This is a more complicated case than I'm thinking of.

title: Entities SP's autocomplete contains hardcoded solr fields
description: See https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/includes/callbacks.inc#L64-L79

title: RI dislikes tab character in object label
description: RI will not release a object label predicate if it contains a tab character at the end of the string (didn't check for other positions).    No amount of purging, re-ingesting (with the same PID), or updating the object would get the RI to release the label. I had to rebuild the RI to fix the issue.    Updating via object properties  <info:fedora/islandora:9> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "label with tab\t" .  <info:fedora/islandora:9> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "label with no tab" .    Updating via form builder  <info:fedora/islandora:97> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "nigel form label with tab\t" .  <info:fedora/islandora:97> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "nigel form label with no tab" .    Fedora Admin  <info:fedora/islandora:3113> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "test in fedora admin with tab\t" .  <info:fedora/islandora:3113> <info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label> "test in fedora admin with no tab" .

title: Scholar PDF configuration does not include a viewer option
description: In the Scholar module admin, there is a PDF configuration tab.  This mirrors the options in the PDF Solution Pack, but does not include the option to select a viewer.  It would be useful if Scholar incorporated the viewer framework.  Community feedback requested - https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/o6G9UTVMy6s  Donald

title: Add options for embargo updates
description: When setting an embargo on a Scholar citation on of the options is "Item to be embargoed" (Object-level embargo, PDF). When updating the embargo this option isn't available and user may want to change from Object to PDF only embargo.  To accomplish this now, the embargo has to be lifted and then reapplied.  Images attached.  dm

title: Add Managed Embargoed Items tab to Scholar admin
description: It would be helpful if the management of embargoed citations was integrated with the Scholar module.  Currently Islandora Scholar Embargo is accessible via Islandora > Solution pack configuration > Islandora Scholar Embargo and a sub-tab there Managed Embargoed Items.    It would be handy to have the Managed Embargoed Items sub-tab as part of the Scholar Module Admin. Or rename the label Islandora Scholar Embargo to Scholar Embargo so that it falls after Scholar.  dm

title: Compound SP config - Hide and filter Solr results
description: More of a question.    How are these configuration options different in the Compound Object Solution Pack?    1. Hide child object in Solr results (a checkbox)  2. Solr filter query (a solr field )    Image attached.  dm

title: Islandora Compound Object Navigation should scroll?
description: I'm not sure if a scroll would be appropriate here, but if you had a large number of child objects associated with your parent object, the display may be a little odd.  The other issue is that the default block only supports a vertical display which is fine in the sidebars, but not in the content areas.  Will test the JAIL version of the block as it may address these issues.    dm

title: Adding a child to a compound object results in the child object no longer displaying in its original parent collection.
description: After adding a child object to a compound object, the child object no longer displays in its original collection.  The isMemberOfCollection RELS-EXT in the child object is still present, but seems to be ignored.  Here's the RDF of the child object:  <rdf:RDF xmlns:fedora="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/relations-external#" xmlns:fedora-model="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#" xmlns:islandora="http://islandora.ca/ontology/relsext#" xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#">    <rdf:Description rdf:about="info:fedora/islandora:261">      <fedora:isMemberOfCollection rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:sp_large_image_collection"></fedora:isMemberOfCollection>      <fedora-model:hasModel rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:sp_large_image_cmodel"></fedora-model:hasModel>      <fedora:isConstituentOf rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:266"></fedora:isConstituentOf>      <islandora:isSequenceNumberOfislandora_266>1</islandora:isSequenceNumberOfislandora_266>    </rdf:Description>  </rdf:RDF>    To replicate:  1. create compound object in the default compound object collection  2. associate child object  3. check the child object's original collection    dm

title: Unchecking option in Compound Object Solution Pack seems to have no effect
description: By default in the Compound Object Solution Pack the option:    Only allow compound object to have child objects associated with them    does not seem to have any effect on objects in Islandora. For example if unchecked and I select an object, I would expect to see the option to add a child object, but I don't ... I only see the option to add the object to a parent object.  Which is the same behavior when the object is checked.    What's supposed to happen?    dm

title: Child objects orphaned
description: When a user is managing their collection (collection object > Manage > Collection), selects the Delete members of this collection option, and selects a collection object to delete, the collection object is deleted as expected, but this leaves any children of that deleted collection object orphaned.    I'm not sure what the best approach might be but some options might be:  * replicate the function that deletes the collection and all its children  * don't delete collection objects in that interface and point the user to the Properties > Delete Collection option    Don

title: facet object label hitting tomcat request size default limit
description: when using the facet object label replace functionality, the QP request to solr was growing in size for each facet value. eventually exploding the request size.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/226  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/227

title: Silent fails in importers
description: PMID and DOI and maybe the others are failing silently when given invalid/unsuported input. @see https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/pull/187

title: Citeproc shouldn't try to render dates it doesn't have
description: Now that cite-proc is its own thing, finally we can do something that's been driving me nuts for ages!    Attempting to view a citation that has date content cite-proc can't render results in:    Undefined property: stdClass::$date-parts in render() (line 971 of /var/www/drupal7/sites/all/libraries/citeproc-php/CiteProc.php)

title: Solr views UI becomes un-usable when solr has a large number of fields
description: When solr has a large number of fields, the views admin UI becomes un-usable.    The root of the issue is drupal views doesn't page the fields data, instead it pulls everything at once causing the browser to crash. The issue isn't the luke request handler. It has no issue returning 5000+ fields.    2 options come to mind.    1- submit a patch to drupal core to page field data  2- create a solr settings interface to select which fields are available to views (or all solr related functionality) so we're not dealing with a copious number of fields. In my case 5600 fields (dgi basic solr config XSLTs).

title: Deleting a collection only deletes first 10 children
description: only the first 10 objects are deleted when deleting a collection via collection -> manage -> properties -> delete    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/blob/7.x/includes/batch.inc#L178

title: Advanced search defaults to title (change to configurable option?)
description: In the advanced search block, the default option is set to title.  It does not appear that we can change this without editing Islandora core code.   Would it be possible to change this to a configurable option?  In other words, we would like to be able to change the default option from title to another term, for example format.      See attached document for more details/screenshots.     Thanks in advance.

title: Add $associations to $elements in theme('islandora_solr_metadata_display', $elements)
description: Currently, islandora_solr_metadata_get_associations_by_cmodels() is called twice, once from within template_preprocess_islandora_solr_metadata_display() and once prior to that in islandora_solr_metadata_display_callback(), where theme('islandora_solr_metadata_display', $elements) is called. If we remove the call to islandora_solr_metadata_get_associations_by_cmodels() from the preprocess function and add $associations to $elements, we get two benefits: 1) one less database call and 2) other modules that don't associate Solr metadata viewer configurations with content models, like Islandora Context, can generate their own $associations to pass into theme('islandora_solr_metadata_display', $elements).

title: paged content pages aren't deleted when deleting parents from collection
description: when deleting paged content parents via "delete members from this collection", the children aren't deleted.

title: inefficient code for compound block displays
description: the code for block displays is fairly inefficient.    eg.     get parts to determine first child https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/blob/7.x/islandora_compound_object.module#L253    get parts again to determine siblings    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/blob/7.x/islandora_compound_object.module#L627

title: Find Collections autocomplete is case sensitive
description: When searching for collections, the autocomplete function is case sensitive. This is fine for the default Islandora collections such as "Basic Image Collection (islandora:sp_basic_image_collection)" because when it searches both PID and Label, words capitalized in the label are lowercase in the pid. But for custom collections which camel-case their PIDS such as "My Custom Collection (foo:myCustomCollection)", the query 'custom' will return no results.

title: Breadcrumbs slowing down large repository
description: Our repo has about 160k objects with 1.6M datastreams. With breadcrumbs enabled, objects load between ~12-20 seconds. With them disabled, objects load between 3-5 seconds.    Breadcrumbs are an integral part of the user experience, as is page load times. Using a drupal contrib breadcrumb module isn't viable as islandora doesn't represent inheritance in a way that is visible to drupal.

title: compound child with 2 parents
description: If a child is part of 2 compounds, one can never get to the second parent from the child.

title: errors when updating xacml module
description: errors when updating xacml module. rels exist for non-existent datastream    PR https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/pull/115

title: "Enable search navigation block" in Solr Search causes OpenSeadragon to error and results in non-display of large images when images are accessed through search results
description: 1. /admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings    2. Enable search navigation block setting at bottom    3. Do a SOLR search for any known large image    4. Click large image search result    5. Errors and non-display of large image    URIError: malformed URI sequence  http://server/sites/all/libraries/openseadragon/openseadragon.js?no37n8  Line 1623    TypeError: $.TileSource is undefined  http://server/sites/all/modules/islandora_openseadragon/js/djtilesource.js?no37n8  Line 54    TypeError: $.TileSource is undefined  http://server/sites/all/modules/islandora_openseadragon/js/djtilesource.js?no37n8  Line 37    I believe islandora_openseadragon errors when trying to deal with the extra variables being passed to it by the islandora_solr_search_navigation variable:    http://server/islandora/object/islandora%3A123?solr_nav[id]=s%C7%D3%BD%BDo%91%3F%1E%DE&solr_nav[page]=0&solr_nav[offset]=3

title: Bag is not generated for "islandora:root" object on install, nor can one manually generate the bag
description: Observed a freshly wiped system, bags automatically generated for solution pack's required objects:    bag-uncc-islandora_sp_audioCModel.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_binaryObjectCModel.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_sp_basic_image.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_collectionCModel.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_sp_large_image_cmodel.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_compoundCModel.zip  bag-uncc-islandora_sp_pdf.zip    ...but no bag for the "islandora:root" object.    My thought is it might be important to have "islandora:root" bagged up, to preserve the repository's configuration and relationships.    When trying to manually create the "islandora:root" bag, error:    An AJAX HTTP error occurred. HTTP Result Code: 200 Debugging information follows. Path: /batch?id=475&op=do StatusText: OK ResponseText: Creating Bags | J. Murrey Atkins Library Skip to main content You are hereHome Creating Bags     No errors seen in PHP.log.    The functionality to generate a bag for "islandora:root" just may be altogether missing.

title: Remove deprecated variables from theme.inc
description: Newspaper SP's theme.inc file contains a bunch of @todos indicating code that needs changing after the release of 7.x-1.5. Viewing a newspaper page results in whole bunch of the following error:    "User deprecated function: The "content" variable has been deprecated in the preprocessing phase as of 7.x-1.5. Please update your theme code to interact with "content" during/after the processing phase. in IslandoraNewspaperDeprecateString->__toString() (line 431 of /var/www/html/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/theme/theme.inc)."

title: Add default namespace declaration to filter-drupal.xml
description: filter-drupal.xml doesn't currently contain a default XML namespace declaration. However, in order to validate filter-drupal.xml using the schema at https://github.com/mjordan/drupal_filter_validator, a namespace declaration is required. Background ticket is at https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-821.    Adding the namespace declaration 'xmlns="http://islandora.ca"' to the document element (to get <FilterDrupal_Connection xmlns="http://islandora.ca">) should pose no backward compatibility problems.

title: XACML Editor compatibility issue with Islandora Scholar Embargo Module
description: When new XACML policies are applied to all items within a collection, the new collection-level policies overwrite existing embargoes on individual items within that collection (applied using the Scholar Embargo module), altering the fields in the XACML policy datastreams and RELS-INT datastreams for those items.

title: Replace datastream function apparently doesn't recieve "success" signal back from Fedora and the browser just spins
description: Object > Manage > Replace datastream    Example: replace existing MODS datastream    Function is successful, one can watch Fedora's log and see the success in real-time.    But module apparently doesn't receive the success signal back from Fedora and the browser just spins.    Eventually, something happens behind the scenes (like some kind of timeout) and attached error is produced.    Error is a misnomer however, because the datastream replacement operation absolutely did work behind the scenes.       If you open the same object's datastream management in another tab, you will see the datastream's version has increased and everything is fine.       Fedoragsearch sees the datastream update also and updates successfully.

title: mapping of <part> element in DOI and PMID importer
description: More of a question.  The MODS guidance has an example Article in Serial record - http://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/v3/modsjournal.xml - and the <part> element (volume, issue, paging) is in the <relatedItem> tag.      When importing a DOI the <part> element is in the <mods> element instead of getting mapped to the <relatedItem> tag.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/7.x/modules/doi/includes/utilities.inc#L278     Wondering if this was intentional or an error? Same happens when importing a PMID.     Donald

title: Add option to append object URL to redirect URL
description: Add option to append Islandora object URL to the redirect URL, as per https://groups.google.com/d/msg/islandora/IQKn2IqoTfY/FjbV-SP--pQJ. This would support using Ezproxy to control access to Islandora objects.

title: Cloning Tabs and SubTabs in Forms
description: I've come across a problem with dynamically creating tabs in forms.    Let's say that we have some Form with Tabs element (only one TabPanel on start), and in that first TabPanel there is a child SubTabs with only one TabPanel too (like a default state).  Both Tabs have their Add button for adding more TabPanels in each Tabs.  Now if I add some TabPanels in SubTabs, so that I have one main Tabs element with one TabPanel and in it SubTabs element with a few TabPanels,   and wish to create additional TabPanel in main Tabs element by clicking Add button, it will just copy all elements, in this case SubTabs element with all additionally added TabPanels in SubTabs.    As I needed, not to copy all, but to add new main TabPanel with SubTabs element with only first (one) TabPanel in it, I've created additional code in:  file: xml_form_elements.modul  in function: xml_form_elements_form_element_tabs_ajax_add()  after: $new_tab = clone $tab;    i have added:      $myTab = $new_tab->toArray();   foreach($myTab as $k1 => $v1) {    if (is_array($v1) && $v1['#type'] == 'tabs') {     foreach($v1 as $k2 => $v2) {      if (is_numeric($k2) && $k2 != '0') {       unset($new_tab[$k1][$k2]);      }     }    }   }    that iterates trough array representation of $new_tab and deletes (unset) all TabPanels except first one [0] in $new_tab;    Maybe there is a better way to do this or to implement it in new version,   and maybe do it recursively so it works for n levels of SubTabs, not just first one like in this example?

title: Entities autocomplete doesn't return all results when not given a query.
description: When navigating to [host]/islandora/entities/autocomplete/scholar the code seems to suggest you should be searching with MADS_title_mt:* but instead solr hears MADS_title_mt:scholar*. Also holds for /department, /last_name, or /disambiguated.    (where $mappings[$type]['title'] is your solr field e.g. MADS_title_mt):    $qualifier = $mappings[$type]['title'] . ':*';    $path = request_path();     if ($path) {      $path_array = explode('/', $path);      $stub = end($path_array);      $qualifier = $mappings[$type]['title'] . ':' . $stub . '*';    }

title: 'metadata_prefix' hardcoded as oai_dc in handler.inc line 124
description: None

title: Invalid argument in theme.inc
description: On HEAD. we are using entities sp for our custom MADS form. When viewing the object the following error is displayed:  Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in islandora_entities_preprocess_islandora_person() (line 49 of /var/www/projects/sites/all/modules/islandora_solution_pack_entities/theme/theme.inc).

title: thumbnail image link is broken in solr metadata display for person in entities
description: On HEAD. The thumbnail image link appears broken in solr metadata display of a person. 'TN' datastream does exist and can be viewed.

title: "Document Version" States are Confusing/Inaccurate?
description: The labels and values used in the radio button sets to describe the 'version' of the citationCModel PDF datastream seem to be confusing and could be ordered in a more meaningful way.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/b717d00d2eb939279dfc666df0ba849c7738cf8f/includes/pdf_upload.form.inc#L43-L52    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/76d1abf798bf9843e274db36dc68b7f18e3c2f38/includes/upload.tab.inc#L163-L173    I am making an assumption that the intent of this selector refers to the state in a typical peer-reviewed publication process. If that isn't the case, then please ignore the following:    Although 'Pre-Publication' could loosely be considered as synonymous with 'Preprint', 'Postprint' generally means 'Post-Review-Pre-Publication'.    Suggestion:    PREPRINT / Preprint  POSTPRINT / Postprint  PUBLISHED / Published  OTHER / Other    It would be trivial to change the labels and send over a PR, but the values being stored in the MODS also reflect inaccurate data. This could require an update hook/data migration/etc. Is that too onerous?    I would love to do the heavy lifting here once the community decides on a path forward.

title: Citation exporter calling out to old CiteProc
description: Citation export attempts to instantiate CiteProc in the old fashion which causes things to error.

title: setDescription fails for Managed DC on collections
description: When making a listSets request if the DC record that is being output for descriptions is managed it'll have an extraneous XML version tag which will blow up the XML output. Spawned from: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/rTHJHS8ljmk

title: Automatic regeneration of DC when MODS is replaced, and vise versa.
description: When MODS datastream is replaced, the DC derivative datastream is not automatically regenerated.    One should not need a contributed module, like islandora_generate_collection_derivatives, to manually handle this.  It's a system and thus it deserves a systematic, automatic approach, which is human friendly.    System should have a definition for authorative metadata, in our case MODS is authorative and DC is derivative.  Other installations may be the opposite, with DC authorative and MODS derivative.   Without such a definition, the system will not know the preference.    Based upon the preference, the system should automatically create derivative metadata formats when the authoritative format is replaced, edited, or changed.    In the same exact vein as derivative regeneration when an OBJ is replaced, metadata needs the same automatic regeneration treatment.

title: Add rotation controls to Islandora OpenSeadragon
description: Newer versions of OpenSeadragon have rotation controls enabled. Therefore, we can allow repository administrators to enable rotation controls should they choose to do so.    See example here: https://digital.library.yorku.ca/yul-93185/chimps-owned-kurt-petzold-not-used

title: Collection description ignores linebreaks
description:
Collection descriptions are populated by dc:description, if that field has a value. Longer descriptions, especially those transformed in from mods:abstract will frequently contain line breaks for readability. The \l's are ignored in an HTML world, and should be replaced by
tags.

title: Add Drupal actions for emailing and logging on checksum mismatch
description: Hard-coded emailing and logging should be implemented as optional actions, Site admins could optionally enable these instead of using the hard-coded logic.    This would require define a checksum mismatch as a trigger, which would provide the added benefit of exposing that event other action modules.    While we're at it, provide a hook so that other modules could be notified that a mismatch has been detected.

title: <meta> tags are not generated for thesisCModel objects
description: When I create a thesis object I'm expecting <meta> tags to get populated in the <head> of the HTML based on this code here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/7.x/modules/islandora_google_scholar/islandora_google_scholar.module#L233-L239     Can someone confirm ?

title: Add <meta> tags for different citation formats
description: For indexing / discovery in google scholar we may want to include some format specific tags.  Potential highwire tags are outlined here:  https://scholar.google.ca/intl/en/scholar/inclusion.html#indexing     I'd suggest that if we have a thesisCModel object we should also add   * citation_dissertation_institution   ** /mods:mods/mods:name[@type='corporate'][mods:role/mods:roleTerm = 'Degree grantor']/mods:namePart (that might work?)    If it is a conference proceeding (use the <genre> element to test?)  *  citation_conference_title    There are others that should be reviewed for inclusion.    dm

title: Form Builder won't save AJAX info
description: At the bottom of "Advanced Form Controls" there's a checkbox for AJAX. I selected it and filled out the child fields, but after selecting a different field then and navigating back into the field I'd added AJAX to, the AJAX box is unchecked and the values are not saved.    I've tested on two boxes but would appreciate if anyone could corroborate.

title: --content_models="comma-separated list of content models" doesn't work, creates havoc
description: Setup:  A directory containing a mixture of both TIFs (islandora:sp_large_image_cmodel) and WAVs (islandora:sp-audioCModel)    My test directory contains three (3) TIFs and one (1) WAV, and matching MODS xml metadata for all files.    Instructions:  drush help islandora_batch_scan_preprocess:    Options:   --content_models                          A comma-separated list of content models to assign to the objects.    Command:  drush -v --user=user --uri=server islandora_batch_scan_preprocess --content_models=islandora:sp_large_image_cmodel,islandora:sp-audioCModel --parent=parent:pid --namespace=namespace --parent_relationship_pred=isMemberOfCollection --type=directory --target=/path/to/directory/containing/both/tif_and_wav_files    Result:  The three TIFs have microphone icons.  When object is accessed, the text "array" displays on screen.   Drupal watchdog: Notice: Array to string conversion in drupal_render() (line 6030 of /mnt/island1-documentroot/includes/common.inc).    RDF shows two different content models being present in one object:  <rdf:RDF><rdf:Description rdf:about="info:fedora/test:44"><fedora:isMemberOfCollection rdf:resource="info:fedora/test:36"/><fedora-model:hasModel rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:sp_large_image_cmodel"/><fedora-model:hasModel rdf:resource="info:fedora/islandora:sp-audioCModel"/></rdf:Description></rdf:RDF>    Drush errors:  WD islandora: Failed to ingest object: test:47code: 500message:      [error]  javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException:  org.fcrepo.server.errors.ObjectValidityException:   Exception occured: Failed to ingest test:47.                         [ok]    Warning: unsupported audio format    Fedora errors:  ERROR 2015-06-22 13:25:30.697 [http-8443-14] (DOValidatorImpl) VALIDATE: ERROR - failed Schematron rules validation.  org.fcrepo.server.errors.ObjectValidityException: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>  <RESULT xmlns:foxml="info:fedora/fedora-system:def/foxml#"          xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">     <foxml:datastream>        <ASSERT>Datastream must have a datastream id. (foxml:datastream: value of ID is missing)</ASSERT>     </foxml:datastream>  </RESULT>    WAV object does not ingest at all.    Summary:  If --content_models="comma-separated list of content models" is supposed to work in the straightforward manner that is documented, it really seems not to be working correctly.    Instead, the system and subsystems get mightily confused and disoriented when more than one content model is present in the content_models variable.

title: Solr Metadata: Separate field config, add ability to truncate field output in display.
description: * Rework configuration storage and retrieval to allow for more.  * Rework GUI to have field configuration on a separate screen.  * Title callback for field config and some descriptions.  * Little bit of JS shenanigans in order to show/hide truncated portions.  * Add bit of validation, to attempt to prevent craziness.

title: Allow filtering of DSIDs to apply checksums to
description: My use case is to only worry about certain datastreams (the original/archival ones) as many are just derivatives.   So allow me to choose to only apply checksums to those datastreams.

title: Retroactive query does not get book/newspaper pages in the collection
description: When applying Islandora Checksum retroactively, it only grabs objects that have a isMemberOfCollection relationship to the collection.  Compounds, books and newspapers have more complex relationships.

title: Attached XMLform causes looping behavior on client side and errors logged non-stop in Drupal's watchdog
description: CAUTION: When the attached form is edited, it causes a looping behavior on the client side, which can be observed in Firebug's net panel and Drupal's watchdog.       The net traffic is comprised of the following errors, which are being logged in Drupal's watchdog:    Notice: Undefined index: #options in form_select_options() (line 2777 of /mnt/island1-documentroot/includes/form.inc).    Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in form_select_options() (line 2784 of /mnt/island1-documentroot/includes/form.inc).    The looping, client side behavior grinds the web browser into an effectively unusable state.    The issue is probably caused by an incorrect form element, but determining which element to blame is very difficult, especially when the looping behavior is grinding the client-side into the ground...    It would be nice to determine the cause, so the module could be modified to defend or prevent looping errors.  The client-side program also needs the ability to point out precisely which element is causing an error.    There are also other examples where an element error is happening, but the archivist building the form isn't presented any helpful information to find the source of the error, because the client-side doesn't communicate errors effectively and the Watchdog error message is ambiguous:    Recoverable fatal error: Argument 3 passed to Create::append() must be an instance of DOMElement, instance of DOMText given, called in /path/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/Create.inc on line 168 and defined in Create->append() (line 307 of /path/sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/Create.inc).     A programmer can determine after reviewing the module's code there's probably a parent value missing somewhere, but where?  Which element?

title: Implement ability to sort facets at module config level
description: See: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/-sO_VrHBIQg    It would be useful to be able to implement facet sorting in Islandora Solr. This would implement facet.sort in the search query string, as per https://wiki.apache.org/solr/SimpleFacetParameters#facet.sort.

title: If "Force include a link to the object within Islandora" variable is checked for metadata prefix "oai_dc", XML Parsing Error: prefix not bound to a namespace
description: Without namespace defined, XML parsing error occurs when OAI URL is set to: metadataPrefix=oai_dc    Code exploration:  includes/handler.inc (line 185)    #stock original, results in XML parsing error  $link_element = $dom->createElement("$field", $object_url);    #brad hack, eliminates error, but really needs smarter logic utilizing $params['metadata_prefix']  $link_element = $dom->createElementNS('http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/', "$field", $object_url);

title: Content model labels are confusing to users. Collection policy should allow configurable labels for when the user has to choose a cmodel.
description: I have users very confused by the screenshot below. Admittedly, they only have to parse "Collection" vs "Audio snippet" but the excess verbiage leads to constant confusion.    Since it's custom to name our content models with a lot of words in them that users really don't need to see, could we instead configure a 'label' in the collection policy for each allowed content model, that would show up in the select list in the screenshot below?     Another example, if this isn't convincing:    Would you rather choose between:     "Islandora Large Image Content Model" or  "Islandora Basic Image Content Model"    vs.    "Image (tiff)" or  "Image (jpg/png)?    And one more reason to do this is that Drupal variables can be translated for multilingual users; object labels cannot.

title: Islandora Scholar needs citeproc-php library
description: Islandora Scholar seems to require the Islandora/citeproc-php library to be installed. This is not documented (that I could find).    I was test ingesting a thesis and ended up at a WSOD, apache log shows:    PHP Fatal error:  Call to a member function render() on a non-object in /var/www/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_scholar/modules/citeproc/citeproc.module on line 105, referer: http://localhost:8000/islandora/object/ir%3AcitationCollection    Line 105 is the return of function    function citeproc_bibliography_from_object($style, $raw) {    $citeproc = citeproc_get_citeproc_php_instance($style);      return $citeproc->render($raw, 'bibliography');  }

title: No Drupal permissions for "Administer Islandora OAI"?
description: I may be blind, but I don't see any Drupal permissions for "Administer Islandora OAI"...    With it's File Management function, I surely would like to hand over configuration of the handler to an Archivist.   Went and looked for a permission to do just that, but I don't see one.

title: a trailing space in a form identifier breaks the form
description: When adding a new form element to a form ... if the identifier has a trailing space, then the form doesn't populate the element with values. And it effects all the elements that follow.  Donald

title: About Collection Policies points to old documentation
description: When viewing the Collection sub-tab, there is a link "About Collection Policies" which points to an old version of the documentation.  I've done a pull request to update that:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_collection/pull/152     Longterm I'm wondering about linking to documentation in general.  It might be useful to have a path that references something generic instead of a specific version number?   eg.   https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA715/How+to+Manage+Collection+Policies  to  https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA/current/How+to+Manage+Collection+Policies    Maybe that is possible already?  Donald

title: Solr metadata display not displaying field data
description: Running on HEAD, I've enabled islandora_solr_metadata instead of Dublin Core metadata. When I enable Islandora Solr Metadata, the display changes and returns field labels, but the fields are empty.

title: Make JAIL block use a template
description: The JAIL version of the compound object navigation block is created in the includes/blocks.inc so you have to fork the repo to modify it.    It would be nice is to be able to have access to preprocess functions and templates like the other navigation block.    Actually, what would be _really_ nice is to have a single set of templates and preprocess functions and modify the output only based on whether you are using the JAIL library or not.

title: no point in returning many objects when we only need one
description: PR https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_oai/pull/69

title: Add PDF.js as a viewer option for Scholar
description: It would be helpful to have a consistent viewer approach for content models that include a PDF as a datastream.  Could PDF.js be added as a viewer option for both the islandora:citationCModel and the islandora:thesisCModel in the Scholar module?  Thanks,  Donald

title: ZIP Importer regression causing supplemental non XML datastreams to be missed
description: Due to how the ZIP Importer MIME type matching was changed in: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_importer/pull/26/files any supplemental, non-primary non-XML (that's a mouthful) files will no longer be constructed.    Take for example a ZIP representing a PDF object to be ingested containing:  test.pdf (A PDF)  test.xml (A MODS XML file)  test.txt (FULL-TEXT for the PDF).    The resulting object would have the OBJ and MODS datastreams constructed but the FULL-TEXT would be ignored based upon how this regressed.

title: Command-line batch ingest does not respect COLLECTION_POLICY nor XACML POLICY
description: Command-line batch requires --namespace because it does not respect COLLECTION_POLICY, where the namespace setting is already defined.    Even worse, command-line batch also subverts XACML, a.k.a. the Object POLICY datastream.    Objects ingested via command-line batch will not receive a POLICY datastream, despite the existence of a POLICY datastream being configured to apply itself to all new objects ingested into a collection.    Archivists will assume their POLICY is being applied as specified, when the truth is, the POLICY is absolutely not being applied when objects are ingested via command-line batch.       To be safe, an archivist has to manually re-apply the XACML POLICY to an entire collection, post-ingest of new objects, despite the POLICY already being in effect.

title: Scholar creates physicalDescription fields that are overwritten by the default MODS form.
description: From [~jacobsanford]  "The upload form (and methods) provided by includes/upload.tab.inc#islandora_scholar_add_usage_and_version_elements_to_mods() add elements to the MODS datastream :    <mods:accessCondition type="use and reproduction">author</mods:accessCondition> <mods:physicalDescription authority="local">PUBLISHED</mods:physicalDescription>    This form will attempt to render those elements when building the form, duplicating the PhysicalDescription block for input.    Adding XPath selectors to the avoids the READ method grabbing the unrelated elements on form build."    His initial pull request.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/pull/168    This was backwards breaking, so I made some changes to try and fix it.    From my PR on his PR.  "As discussed in March 26, 2015 call, this is my suggestion to move @JacobSanford's PR along without by backward breaking.    Adds a field to the MODS form to display any incorrectly entered <mods:physicalDescription authority="local"> sub-elements.  This is done by using a fake mods element mods:physicalDescription_bad.   This is then removed using a new self-transform XSLT registered against the thesis_form."    My branch  https://github.com/uml-digitalinitiatives/islandora_scholar/tree/jareds_fix

title: Huge slowdown on views counting massive numbers of objects
description: It appears that on views doing COUNT aggregation on fields with extremely large numbers of objects (100k+), there are massive load times. This affects theislandora_batch_sets view, as well as the islandora_usage_stats view (which isn't core Islandora, but still).    The query views is doing for batch is as follows:    ```  SELECT islandora_batch_set.id AS id, users_islandora_batch_set.name AS users_islandora_batch_set_name, users_islandora_batch_set.uid AS users_islandora_batch_set_uid, islandora_batch_set.created AS islandora_batch_set_created, COUNT(islandora_batch_queue.id) AS islandora_batch_queue_id  FROM   {islandora_batch_set} islandora_batch_set  INNER JOIN {users} users_islandora_batch_set ON islandora_batch_set.uid = users_islandora_batch_set.uid  LEFT JOIN {islandora_batch_queue} islandora_batch_queue ON islandora_batch_set.id = islandora_batch_queue.sid  WHERE ((( (users_islandora_batch_set.uid <> '2') )))  GROUP BY id, users_islandora_batch_set_name, users_islandora_batch_set_uid, islandora_batch_set_created  ORDER BY islandora_batch_set_created DESC  LIMIT 100 OFFSET 0  ```    I'm guessing it's the LEFT JOIN where things are going south.    If it's views's handling of COUNT-style aggregation that's the problem, we may have to stop relying on it?

title: Create a FCREPO 3.8.1 drupalauthfilter
description: None

title: Command-line batch doesn't work correctly with islandora:sp_basic_image
description: Ingesting islandora:sp_basic_image objects via command-line drush results in confused and incomplete objects and derivatives.    Instead of the original image being stored in the OBJ datastream, it's being stored in the TN datastream in its entirety.   No true TN derivative is produced.    Additionally, no TECHMD datastream is produced, nor is a MEDIUM_SIZE datastream derivative generated.    RELS-EXT, MODS, and DC ingest successfully via command-line batch.

title: ImageMagick module should be listed as a dependency
description: imagemagick is listed in islandora_pdf.info but is not mentioned in the Requirements section of the README.

title: Installation documentation should not be asking people to run simpletest or phpunit
description: Specifically, here:    https://wiki.duraspace.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=68063511#milestone4-InstallingThe"Tuque"library-TestingtheTuqueinstallation    And at several points here:    https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA715/milestone+5+-++Installing+the+Islandora+Essential+Modules    These are integration tests designed specifically to work with Travis-CI and Jenkins and were not meant to test the viability of an installation. A lot of them are unit tests rather than web tests as well, and are not useful to be run on an actual site. In addition, I have a suspicion that people are running these on sites meant to be used for staging or production, which is really dangerous.    We should be pointing people to http://host/admin/islandora/configure to check the connection status. We should also be asking people to test an ingest from the interface themselves rather than running tests, as this familiarizes them with the interface.    The other milestone tests in the documentation seem okay.

title: IAV blows up if book 'info' is a single space
description: IAV blows up if islandoraInternetArchiveBookReader['info'] is just a single space.

title: Update Drupal filter documentation - 3.8.0 filter is ok to use with 3.8.1 filter
description: What the title says.

title: Remove mention of kdu_expand from README
description: The README file mentions 'kdu_expand,' but 'grep -r kdu_expand *' within the module directory only finds this command in the adore.sh and README.md files. If `kdu_expand` is not used, we should remove mention of it.

title: [UIIG] File upload during ingest should be optional.
description: From the UI Interest group (July 22), we discussed the use cases in which people would want to make "skeleton" metadata-only objects even though the digitized files weren't available yet. However, it's been customary to make the file upload mandatory.     Fix would require going through all modules' includes/[file]_upload.form.inc and removing the "#required" => TRUE line from the form definition, then checking whether a file is present in the submit handler.    This functionality already exists in the batch uploader, i.e. you can bulk-create objects from only XML files, so that's a way to have the same effect. But it's somewhat clumsy because you have to create and save the XML to disk first.     I'm curious to know the reasoning for which the file upload was originally made mandatory, if that can shed some light on whether we should do this.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Disk Image Solution Pack,Large Image Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack,Video Solution Pack,Web ARChive Solution Pack

title: Error in XML form Editor  documentation
description: How to Edit/Create Ingest Forms documentation uses as example (text and images) a dc form for which every element name are named like  "dc:elementname".    Currently (since 2013?) Form builder does not allow "colons" in element names. This validation occurs on JS, so it's impossible to create or edit and save a form with colons in their "identifier" value.    Moreover, if you copy an existing form (created by hand or contributed by anmodule) that has elements using "colons", the included XLSTs (the ones that transform from schema versions) replaces all special characters in attribute names that are not allowed in XML for "-". So a form that has colons in element names end with  "-" in the editor.    https://wiki.duraspace.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=68063603

title: Document that RSS Fields are limited by the Solr Display Fields
description: Need to document that all the RSS display fields (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/rss) are limited by the Display Fields (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings) when "Limit results to fields listed above?" is enabled.    This documentation should go into the RSS Item Field-set.

title: Use application/xml rather than text/xml for XML data-streams
description: So many modules are currently using text/xml for data-stream mime-types rather than application/xml. This causes un-needed additional version when those data-streams are modified as they get changed to application/xml in many cases.    We should be using application/xml everywhere as it's the recommended mime-type to use.     Likely this will take a while to audit and test so we can do it bit by bit.

title: [UIIG] Use radio buttons instead of select when selecting Content Model and Forms.
description: During the ingest steps, it would be more friendly to have radio buttons rather than a select list for choosing a content model and a form.     Pros: fewer clicks; user can see all the options at once; can theme it more prettily than a select box.   Cons: unwieldy in the case of having many content models(/forms) available via the collection policy(/form associations), though this is unwieldy in a select list too.

title: Radio buttons, buttons, and checkboxes can't CRUD XML.
description: It's possible to create buttons, radio buttons, and checkboxes via the form builder. But it's impossible to map their values to XML. Screenshot: when 'radio' is selected (same with any of the others), the CRUD values are inaccessible.    Probably a CWF, but want to have this ticket here to document the issue.     It should be possible to get around this by using AJAX or a validate handler to copy the value of this field into a hidden field that's mapped to the desired XML, especially in the case of non-repeated fields. For repeated fields (checkboxes), having this handled at the form builder level would be really nice.

title: Collection grid view defaults to 10 per page.
description: ... which is "broken" because they are displayed four to a line, so a "full" page looks incomplete.     UIIG proposes to change the default to 12 per page.

title: Searching Pagination
description: Hello,    I've identified a bug in the Book Solution Pack (actually, could be any ingestion if my guess is correct).  Attached are two images of searches demonstrating the correct and incorrect behavior.  Currently, both searches identify the documents AND pages where the search term exists, and the search results properly display the page.  However, in the "not working" image you'll notice that while the correct page was clicked in search results, the viewer pulls up the document at the first page (I simply scrolled to that page to illustrate that the term-highlighting did not happen).  You'll also notice that the orange pin is off the left (if you hover, it says page 0).      The RELS-EXT XML file that was created as part of the ingestion process set the Sequence and Page numbers as strings, but it seems integers are required.  Here s an example:         <islandora:isSequenceNumber>page-01</islandora:isSequenceNumber>      <islandora:isPageNumber>page-01</islandora:isPageNumber>     These should be:         <islandora:isSequenceNumber>01</islandora:isSequenceNumber>      <islandora:isPageNumber>01</islandora:isPageNumber>     Those were labeled after the name the directory was called before being ingested.  Unfortunately, you cannot edit the RELS-EXT file.      Since everything else works fine, I think that either an error should not accept and send an error (or, rather, cleanse the field to just an integer) as a part of the ingestion process.  Of course, having the search simply accept and handle "page-01" would also work, but it seems cleaning the data would be preferable.     Thank you!  Adam Traub

title: Add jpg/jpeg support to web archive solution pack for screenshots
description: Currently the WebARChive solution pack is hard coded to accepted only pngs as screenshots datastreams (whose dsid is actually PNG). We should accept other file formats as screenshot datastreams. To do so, we need to address the following:     * Add support for jpeg, jpg to forms  * Update ds_composite  * Update creation logic to use a SCREENSHOT dsid  * Update display / download to use a SCREENSHOT dsid    * Update to only display out PNG if there is no SCREENSHOT dsid (for legacy)  * Update any logic that is coded to $object['PNG'] to $object['SCREENSHOT'] (but fall back on) PNG if one doesn t exist.  * Provide a migration script that will copy PNG into a SCREENSHOT dsid  * Add hook data stream alter on PNG to create a SCREENSHOT dsid with new content.

title: batch import for document SP
description: This is for the Document content model, which is part of the Scholar module (?). I noticed that there is no batch import for this content model yet. This might be difficult as there are several formats that this content model can accept. but it might be nice to have a batch import for at least one.    Thanks for considering.

title: unable to delete a fieldpane if a required field is empty
description: A user adds a fieldpane and then wants to delete it.  If there is a required field in the fieldpane that is empty, it can't be deleted.

title: Add "--output_ingest_set" feature to islandora_batch_scan_preprocess
description: "drush islandora_batch_ingest" supports a "--ingest_set" flag to precisely specify which set to be ingested, but "drush islandora_batch_scan_preprocess" does not have a comparable flag to output the "set ID" after the set is preprocessed.    If this feature existed, it would bring precision to the batch ingest process, instead of the current, broad brush behavior of ingesting all sets the system determines are "ready".    With this feature, it be possible to script islandora_batch_scan_preprocess to hand the newly generated "set ID" to drush islandora_batch_ingest for precision ingest of just the newly generated set.

title: Add drush option for ingesting a zip / directory of just strictly pages of a book
description: There is a UI option to ingest a zip of pages. A drush option would be very handy for large sets of pages.

title: Add Solr config import option
description: Some very good basic Solr configurations are available on Github (discoverygarden and York, for example). As Islandora doesn't come with even a basic Solr configuration, these premade config files are very useful. However, importing these files to your own repository is a complex and difficult task which involves modifying the files if your paths are different, copying the files to the right directories on the server, rebooting various services, and reindexing Solr.    A great feature would be an Import capability within the Islandora GUI that performed all these tasks for the user.

title: "Create Bag on object ingest" option executes directly after successful object ingest and before derivitive generation
description: "Create Bag on object ingest" happens exactly as advertised, directly after successful object ingest and before derivative generation.    If someone desires derivatives in their bags created on object ingest, derivatives have not yet been generated when "Create Bag on object ingest" fires.    [~markj]

title: Form Builder buttons (add, copy, paste, delete) disappear when you click on a form element in Chrome and Chromium
description: Form Builder buttons (add, copy, paste, delete) disappear when you click on a form element in Chrome and Chromium. Works okay in Firefox.

title: "Create Bag on object modification" should be turned off during batch ingest because of behavior...
description: "Create Bag on object modification" should be turned off during batch ingest, because when each derivative is finished generating, a new bag is generated...     Example I have witnessed and can attest to:   1. Generate TN   2. Bag is generated   3. Generate MEDIUM_SIZE   4. Another bag is generated   5. Generate JP2   6. Another bag is generated...     When big data objects are in play, this bug becomes a system killer...     To cope with it, I turn off the option programmatically, prior to beginning a command-line ingest:   drush vset islandora_bagit_create_on_modify '0'    [~markj]

title: Add hook to notify other modules that no search results were found
description: As briefly discussed at the Islandora Con Hackfest, the hooks provided by Solr Search do not fire if the query returns zero results. Use case is to let analytics tools record queries that return no results.

title: Video SP should let you play an MP4 OBJ without creating and storing a derivative.
description: Currently, only the 'MP4' datastream is ever sent to a viewer.    If you are uploading MP4s it seems unnecessary (and processor-expensive) to create and store another MP4.     There is currently an admin option to "not create MP4 derivative", but nothing else gets a chance to be passed to the player.    For this immediate use case, we could check if the MP4 datastream is missing, and if the OBJ is playable, use that instead.

title: Update Usage Stats README to comply with README template
description: None

title: Configure TravisCI for Usage Stats
description: None

title: Ampersand appears double encoded in breadcrumbs
description: Collection labels which contain url-encoded characters get double-encoded when displayed in breadcrumbs.    See discussion here:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora-dev/r67ABZnHNwo

title: Facet Page searches don't honor default query namespace
description: When one clicks a link to perform a search of a MODS element on a Solr Facets Page, say, for all "Authors", the search it performs does not restrict the results to the namespace specified in "Limit results to specific namespaces" in the "Query Defaults" section of "Solr Setting" and thus the result set lists hits from the entire repository instead. I think the default behavior should be for Faces Page searches to honor the specified namespace -- otherwise it is going to show hits outside of that namespace.    Strangely enough, when one clicks on one of those hits in the results set, the search performed DOES honor the specified namespace (which, of course, restricts the search much more), and thus will result in no hits if not found in objects of that namespace.    The solution would be to require the Facets Page searches to honor the "Limit results to specific namespaces" setting at all times.

title: Broken dynamic citations for theses
description: Thesis objects (ir:thesisCModel) don't behave as expected with Scholar's dynamic citations feature. With citation objects (ir:citationCModel), users can select from multiple citation styles in a dropdown list and choosing a new citation style fires an AJAX call for the new citation style automatically. Despite the fact that the dropdown list displays for thesis objects as well, choosing a new citation style does nothing.    After some digging, it looks like the access callback function is hardcoded to only work for citation objects. I modified the code to allow thesis objects to in the following pull request:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/pull/201

title: Can't grab all relationships within a specific namespace on an object
description: Currently can't grab all relationships from a specific predicate URI on an object.

title: Route Scholar Module Display through Drupal's Theme Layer
description: According to the instructions for Solution Pack development found here https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/wiki/Programming-Solution-Packs#display whenever hook_CMODEL_PID_islandora_view_object is implemented a call should be made to hook_theme in order to register the Solution Pack's output with the theme layer. This improvement would grant a Drupal theme the ability to override Islandora Scholar output using islandora-citation.tpl.php and islandora-thesis.tpl.php.

title: Islandora Solr Views can cause PHP timeouts when adding display/sort/filter fields
description: As the amount of Solr fields returned by the luke reaches a certain threshhold the display/sort/filter field addition page begins to slow down and eventually timeout due to the sheer amount of things that need to be rendered. Should likely add three configuration fields that would take a user defined regex to not add certain handlers to those fields that match the regex. This approach would limit the amount of fields present and would likely fix this problem.

title: Pages don't display in Internet Archive Book Reader using Win7, IE9

title: Newspaper collection policy uses "New TIFF" for its content models' default name
description: islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/xml/collection/islandora_newspaper_collection_policy.xml uses "New TIFF" as the default name for both content models (islandora:newspaperCModel and islandora:collectionCModel) it defines. While this label is overridable locally in the default Newspaper Collection's "Collection" subtab, these defaults confuse many users. Should the content model names not be "Islandora Newspaper Content Model" and "Islandora Collection Content Model" respectively?

title: Add Java8 & fcrepo 3.8.1 to TravisCI config for Drupal Servlet Filter

title: drush batch ingests may loop infinitely for some OS distros
description: Apparently, in some distributions (Redhat/Centos for us) if the amount of memory allocated to the batch process does not exceed half of the total memory available to drush it does NOT start a new process for each loop.    It therefore reuses the global $timers variable and causes it to loop infinitely by failing this time check.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_batch/blob/7.x/includes/ingest.batch.inc#L394  while still having more items to process.    Props to DGI to for figuring out why this happens and more importantly why only certain systems.

title: Display metadata on collection objects
description: Similarly as to how ISLANDORA-1191 was handled, add a toggleable optional to display metadata of collection objects.

title: Possible to create same field/content model combination within a Solr metadata configuration
description: Currently it's possible to have multiple configurations per content model defined within Solr metadata. The default behavior when this occurs is to combine all fields present from all configurations to present one output to the user. An edge case is possible where the user can define multiple configurations for the same content model and repeat a Solr field. When this occurs the values for the field present in the last configuration will be used which can lead to unexpected behavior.    Need to add validation such that when adding a Solr field we ensure that the field isn't present already for the content model in another configuration.

title: Form builder not escaping characters in Form Name
description: It is possible to create broken forms (unusable, not editable, not deletable) if inappropriate characters are used in the Form Name.     In my specific case, a user created a custom form called "Custom Student Work/Capstone". The paths generated for working with this form include the slash and makes it impossible to use, modify or delete.    Example: /admin/islandora/xmlform/forms/Custom%20Student%20Work/Capstone/delete

title: PHP and Apache2 Recommended Settings
description: I had already set PHP CLI's php.ini to 'max_input_time = -1', which takes care of command-line originating BagIt operations, ex: command-line batch ingest with "Create Bag on object ingest".    Today our Metadata Librarian was replacing some MODS via the web-interface, which activates our chosen option "Create Bag on object modification".    I took notice of some bags apparently not finishing properly:  {code}  700421650 Aug 25 12:28 bag-uncc-uncc_82.zip.uC5C3m  136452098 Aug 25 12:28 bag-uncc-uncc_97.zip.goy3OR  680425772 Aug 25 12:37 bag-uncc-uncc_89.zip.vyZA0X  355497930 Aug 25 13:18 bag-uncc-uncc_83.zip.FUZFbr  123869903 Aug 25 13:29 bag-uncc-uncc_81.zip.wZvxE2  {code}    ...so I went looking in my PHP error log and found:  {code}  [19-Aug-2015 12:26:33 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [19-Aug-2015 13:37:38 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [19-Aug-2015 15:41:23 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_manifest.php on line 192  [19-Aug-2015 15:48:48 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit.php on line 438  [25-Aug-2015 12:28:23 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [25-Aug-2015 12:28:43 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [25-Aug-2015 12:37:28 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [25-Aug-2015 13:18:55 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  [25-Aug-2015 13:29:01 America/New_York] PHP Fatal error:  Maximum execution time of 0 seconds exceeded in /.../sites/all/libraries/BagItPHP/lib/bagit_utils.php on line 444  {code}    The web-interface utilizes the Apache2 specific php.ini.  So I've now set the Apache2 specific php.ini to:   'max_input_time = -1'    I'm also setting Apache's apache2.conf TimeOut value to Timeout 86400; even the largest bag should be finished after a day (I would hope).    In summary, in an effort to eliminate the errors and ensure success, in both Apache2's and CLI's php.ini's:    {code}  max_execution_time = 0  max_input_time = -1  {code}    ...and in Apache2's apache2.conf:    {code}  Timeout 86400  {code}

title: Checksum discrepency possibily caused by code or low Java memory (betterlogging branch)
description: Branch: betterlogging    Created a test script which runs drush run-islandora-checksum-queue and simultaneously tails fedora.log for as long as run-islandora-checksum-queue is running.    Results:    run-islandora-checksum-queue logged three errors to drupal's watchdog:  uncc:91 returned false  uncc:93 returned false  uncc:94 returned false    direct REST API calls:  uncc:91 <dsChecksumValid>true  uncc:93 <dsChecksumValid>true  uncc:94 <dsChecksumValid>true      Errors:    Undefined index: mismatches islandora_checksum_checker.module:414       [notice]  (captured in attached nohup.out)  Command dispatch complete                                               [notice]    No checksum mismatch e-mail notifications nor verification cycle completion notices were e-mailed out when the command "finished"; the above error may have interrupted the run...    A java.io.IOException happens, but run-islandora-checksum-queue keeps on running afterwards: (captured in attached run-2015-08-26_22/02/29.log)  ERROR 2015-08-27 01:09:24.814 [pool-8443-10] (Message) java.io.IOException:  org.apache.catalina.connector.ClientAbortException: null    No PHP errors were logged.      Theories:    Checksum checking operation utilizes a lot of Java memory, maybe when Java's memory is running low, bad things like false positives happen?    Maybe "Undefined index: mismatches islandora_checksum_checker.module:414" happens when Java's memory is running low?      Attachment Info:    Test script and the results of run-islandora-checksum-queue, drupal's watchdog, and direct REST API calls.    Zipfile contents:    /test-script  checksum-test.sh (test script)  nohup.out (captured stdout including "Undefined index: mismatches islandora_checksum_checker.module:414" error)  run-2015-08-26_22/02/29.log (fedora.log tail while run-islandora-checksum-queue was running)  watchdog-uncc-91-OBJ.tiff (drupal watchdog result)  watchdog-uncc-93-OBJ.tiff (drupal watchdog result)  watchdog-uncc-94-OBJ.tiff (drupal watchdog result)    /direct-rest-output  methodology.txt (direct rest call example)  uncc-91-OBJ.xml (direct rest call result)  uncc-93-OBJ.xml (direct rest call result)  uncc-94-OBJ.xml (direct rest call result)

title: Importing zip file with more than 50 marc xml files

Expected that all the objects to be ingested properly, but it created empty records with label as the filename.    my test zip contained 227 marc files and another of 5000 marc files.    Number of objects getting created in fedora were the same as number of marc files in the zip - but without content.

title: Video SP uses invalid search to valid selected MP4 encoders
description: Entering "libfaac" as the MP4 encoder on the Video Solution Pack admin page gets me the error.  "The selected MP4 codec was not found in ffmpeg. Try using aac or enable the desired codec."    This seems to be because of the grep here:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_video/blame/7.x/includes/admin.form.inc#L131    It relies on 6 periods before the encoder name. But those periods should/could be characters based on   Encoders:   V..... = Video   A..... = Audio   S..... = Subtitle   .F.... = Frame-level multithreading   ..S... = Slice-level multithreading   ...X.. = Codec is experimental   ....B. = Supports draw_horiz_band   .....D = Supports direct rendering method 1    So my relevant line for libfaac is   A..... libfaac              libfaac AAC (Advanced Audio Coding) (codec aac)

title: islandora_xml_forms: Drupal 7.39 breaks autocomplete functionality
description: NOTE: I have created a pull request for this: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/195    Drupal 7.39 came out on August 19, 2015 -- a security release. One of the vulnerabilities it was patching was autocomplete, which was open to cross-site scripting (SA-CORE-2015-003). A new function was introduced (form_process_autocomplete) to "sufficiently sanitize" requested URLs. Autocomplete broke for many modules after upgrading to Drupal 7.39 -- including islandora_xml_forms. This is because the function form_process_autocomplete() is now required as part of an element's "#process" array.    For islandora_xml_forms, this problem only appears to impact autocomplete fields where multiple values can be added. Single-item autocomplete fields seem unaffected by the upgrade.    Autocomplete (under Drupal 7.39) also seems to have a problem with field IDs with numbers in them. The module islandora_xml_forms has been overriding the element ID (which is usually based on the field name: example: formSections[subjects][topic] becomes edit-formsections-subjects-topic) and replacing it with a hash instead (00000000682de34e000000015b767354). As of 7.39, numbers in an ID seem to break the autocomplete functionality, which is why I reinstated the Drupal-built IDs in my pull request. Multi-item fields can sometimes have zeroes at the end of their IDs, which is why numbers are being stripped out.

title: Large Image SP can create bad derivatives of JP2s
description: When creating derivatives, the Large Image SP appends a [0] to the filename of the OBJ.  With a TIFF, this selects the first page, if there are more than one, but with a JP2 it selects the first tile, which may not be the "base" tile.  (It often is the upper left corner, at the lowest resolution.)  An example is attached.    Since it's unlikely the users will be using the Large Image SP for multi-page TIFFs, it seems safe to remove the "[0]", which lets the JP2s be processed normally.  I'll submit a PR.

title: Double urlencoded links break subsequent search facet links
description: islandora_solr_metadata/theme/theme.inc (line 239)'!value' => urlencode(islandora_solr_replace_slashes(islandora_solr_lesser_escape($original_value))),    ...produces badly encoded hyperlinks like so:    original value: North Carolina--Charlotte  encoded value: North%255C%2BCarolina%255C-%255C-Charlotte    Problem 1. %25 represents the percentage character, which seems completely out of place...    Problem 2. 5C is supposed to be there, but it's missing a percentage sign...     Problem 3. %2B is represents the + character, which we shouldn't be seeing, because a space should be url encoded as %20.   URLencoding a + (plus sign) seems like a recipe for destruction...    The result is a badly encoded hyperlink that somehow, generally works on the first click, but the bad encoding information is then passed onto islandora_solr_search 's facet links and renders them useless (no search results due to bad encoding).

title: Solution packs for non-visual items should refer to a 'default' TN rather than creating a datastream.
description: When the TN isn't derived from the OBJ, we're wasting storage by adding the "folder icon" default thumbnail to every object as a TN datastream. Instead,    - each solution pack should come with a default thumbnail for each content model it defines (as is currently the case)   - these defaults should be configurable by content model in the admin interface (so they can be updated/replaced)  - TN datastreams should not be added to new objects by default. Users should be given an option to upload a TN of their choosing in the ingest steps. Users can add/replace the TN of an existing object (as is currently the case)  - if the TN datastream is not available, the display should use the configured default image for that object's content type.   - the Regenerate Derivatives call should not change user-uploaded TNs.    Warning: it's been customary to use islandora/object/PID/datastream/TN/view in many places, such as Views and Solr search results (and more generally, any time an Islandora object is displayed or referred to it's assumed that it has a TN datastream). If we do what's suggested above, these would break. I think it would be desirable for this Drupal path to resolve to the default TN if the datastream is not present. I'd be tempted to change how Islandora's menu callbacks behave, but am wary of making what is essentially a change to Islandora's API.    Split off from ISLANDORA-1096.
component: Audio Solution Pack,Collection Solution Pack,Disk Image Solution Pack,Entities Solution Pack,Web ARChive Solution Pack

title: Importer Ingest Deferral
description: A client has expressed the desire to have importers run via Drush; however, importers are relatively tightly bound to the form API. Instead, we can allow for an importer to run its preprocessing, but defer its batch processing to be run at a later time via drush (or otherwise).    To allow it in importer: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_importer/pull/89  A concrete implementation using the change in importer: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/pull/95

title: Mark custom-uploaded derivatives to not be overwritten on derivative regeneration.
description: Based on ISLANDORA-1096. If the user has uploaded a derivative, probably don't overwrite it with Regenerate All Derivatives. So, following suggestions in ISLANDORA-1096 and related discussion (https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/islandora/sd6NQien5Uc), custom derivatives (i.e. non-OBJ datastreams uploaded via the interface) should have a corresponding entry in the RELS-INT marking them as custom.     (Rosie's note: it would be much nicer to have used the isDerivativeOf relation in the RELS-INT from the get-go, and describe which datastreams were automatically generated rather than which were custom uploaded, but it would be impossible to implement this now with any degree of backwards-compatibility.)     Use cases (from the listserv discussion above):   - custom TNs shouldn't be overwritten with the generic default. (dmoses and jpinto, though see also ISLANDORA-1437)   - cropped JPG or TN datastreams from a large image shouldn't be replaced with full-frame versions (from rosiel)   - if OCR or HOCR datastreams are replaced with corrected versions, they'd be overwritten too. (from mjordan)
