description: This should be template so it runs before anything else.

title: Islandora Populator ingest step should admit where it's coming from
description: Noticed this when I started testing for the release, since the release VM has everything enabled. There's an ingest step associated with Populator (screenshot attached) that gets inserted as the first step every time you add an object through the GUI. It's fairly confusing unless you want it there.    It should have a note right there in the GUI saying that it comes from the Islandora Populator module, where it can be configured, and that it can be skipped.    Also needs to be documented in the wiki, of course. But for the end user, having an ingest step admit where it comes from would be very handy.

title: MARCXML ingest step language could be improved.
description: The help text on the MARCXML ingest step doesn't quite match up with the options available. I propose a rephrase from:    "A file containing a MARCXML record, to be transformed to MODS. Select no file to create a record from scratch."    to     "A file containing a MARCXML record, to be transformed to MODS. Click "Next" to skip this step and create a record from scratch."    Because 'select no file' is a little confusing.

title: Template files don't match theme names
description: The following theme entrys 'islandora_objects' and 'islandora_objects_subset'   utilize the same template file. When theming, one needs to be sure to utilize the theme name, and not the template file names. Would be nice if the template files and the theme names matched up.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/islandora.module#L472  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/islandora.module#L483    Similar issue reported here:  https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-934

title: Solr Advanced Search Block Term Permissions Not Saving
description: In the configuration screen for the Advanced Search block in the islandora_solr_search module (#overlay=admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings) and the "Advanced search block" and 'Sort" tabs changes to permissions in the configure option are not being saved.      https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/pull/247    Pull request has a fix for this bug. The issue was in  the _islandora_solr_handle_solr_field_settings function. The cases for sort and search fields both lack a permissions_enabled option in the configuration options so they were both not holding the permissions when they were changed. The permissions check was just changed from $solr_field_settings['permissions_enabled'] (which was always false) to just $solr_field_settings['permissions']. The options for permissions are getting saved on change now.

title: Document that retroactvely enabling checksums regenerates derivatives
description: Enabling checksums retroactively regenerates derivatives for all objects in the target collection. This is not a bug, since checksums are enabled by implementing hook_islandora_datastream_alter().    We should document this in the README and also add a brief note to the UI for retroactively enabling checksums.

title: Fix Drag-and-drop in Form Builder
description: https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1380 introduces an issue where the config in the JS that loads the drag-and-drop plugin for the tree pane in Form Builder gets overwritten by a second invocation of that part of the config a bit further down, so drag-and-drop is never loaded    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/203 merges both of these invocations.

title: deleting file that does not exist while making derivatives
description: when the derivatives TN and PREVIEW are created, for each derivative the recent log shows the following error:  The file temporary://something-3594.PDF.pdf was not deleted, because it does not exist.    the error can be fixed in two ways:  1.)  diff -r my.site/modules/islandora_scholar-7.x-1.5/includes/derivatives.inc all/modules/islandora_scholar-7.x-1.5/includes/derivatives.inc  202c202  <     //file_unmanaged_delete($file_uri); //funkcije iz kojih se poziva ova funkcija rade upravo ovo  ---  >     file_unmanaged_delete($file_uri);    2.)  function islandora_scholar_add_tn_derivative(AbstractObject $object, $force = FALSE, $hook = array()) {    if ($force || !isset($object['TN'])) {      $width = variable_get('islandora_scholar_thumbnail_width', 200);      $height = variable_get('islandora_scholar_thumbnail_height', 200);      $file_uri = islandora_scholar_get_derivative_source_as_unmanaged_file($object, $hook['source_dsid']);      $results = islandora_scholar_add_jpg_derivative($object, $file_uri, 'TN', $width, $height, $force, $hook['source_dsid']);      // make a condition here if file is already deleted  then dont delete it now       file_unmanaged_delete($file_uri);      return $results;    }  }    function islandora_scholar_add_preview_derivative(AbstractObject $object, $force = FALSE, $hook = array()) {    if ($force || !isset($object['PREVIEW'])) {      $width = variable_get('islandora_scholar_preview_width', 500);      $height = variable_get('islandora_scholar_preview_height', 700);      $file_uri = islandora_scholar_get_derivative_source_as_unmanaged_file($object, $hook['source_dsid']);      $results = islandora_scholar_add_jpg_derivative($object, $file_uri, 'PREVIEW', $width, $height, $force, $hook['source_dsid']);      // make a condition here if file is already deleted  then dont delete it now       file_unmanaged_delete($file_uri);      return $results;    }  }

title: Inconsistent ways of getting object from ingest form after submitting file upload
description: Came across a minor inconsistency.    In most solution packs that offer a 'file upload' step, the submit handler for the file upload form includes the line [1]:        $object = $form_state['islandora']['objects'][0];    but disk image and web archive solution packs (and none other that I've found) use [2]:        $objects = &islandora_ingest_form_get_objects($form_state);      foreach ($objects as $object) { ... }    We should probably standardize to one or the other, unless there's a reason that disk image and web archive may be creating multiple objects simultaneously.    [1] https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_pdf/blob/d8bdb83f555c95be8cbfdeb43be4b4c57008b76d/includes/pdf_upload.form.inc#L74  [2] https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_disk_image/blob/53f61759939860b899b4d8ebdaf98ca4288329ba/includes/disk_image_upload.form.inc#L84 and https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_web_archive/blob/03cb35d6b7b3178d19ca2c8771760e02244774e2/includes/web_archive_upload.form.inc#L111
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Disk Image Solution Pack,Entities Solution Pack,Large Image Solution Pack,Paged Content,PDF Solution Pack,Scholar Module,Video Solution Pack,Web ARChive Solution Pack

title: "Create Bag on object modification" ideas for performance improvements
description: "Create Bag on object modification" is an ironclad method for ensuring preservation of objects, but it is resource intensive.    For example, if one edits the metadata of an object, Create bag on object modification is triggered.  If that object is a large object, say a 4GB WAV object, then a simple metadata edit triggers a 4GB bag export and hangs the web browser until completion.    Instead of holding the web browser hostage, maybe Create bag on object modification can be deferred.  What's truly important is not to lose record of the modification action, so a freshened bag may be produced at some time.  It's when the bag is produced that's an issue, due to the web browser hanging on while the bag is generated.    Using a deferred strategy, bag production could be started via drush at the best time of the day determined by the systems administrator, ex: after everyone has gone home for the day.    A deferred strategy could also solve another related issue, multiple edits on an object per day.   Today, with each metadata edit, a freshened bag is created.  If multiple metadata edits happen to the same object during the same day, the bag will be generated multiple times per day.   If deferred, the bag could possibly be generated only once, just based upon the last record of modification.    Regardless, bag generation should be backgrounded, letting go of the web browser so the employee can continue on with their workday, instead of having to hang on and wait for a large object bag to be produced.  Sure, browser tabs are helpful in this endeavor, but browsers have memory limits too.

title: Islandora_videojs should allow multiple sources
description: The videojs player for islandora expects to get, as parameters, a single 'url' and a single 'mime'.     However the player can, as evidenced by the template, handle multiple <source>s [1].     I propose that we allow for $params to contain an array of url/mime pairs, which would allow for the most 'playable' source to be played depending on the browser/device. This is especially useful when configuring streaming across different types of devices.     [1] https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_videojs/blob/8f91c3807d16738cdd9a8230f425fe4fdcb1f675/theme/islandora-videojs.tpl.php#L4-L6

title: Directory structure for input data is misleading
description: The sample directory structure provided in the README for this module is misleading, and if you import issues using it, the issues don't load properly.

title: islandora-video.tpl.php variable documentation includes wrong variable
description: islandora-video.tpl.php includes the following in its template-level variable comments:    "$islandora_object: The Islandora object rendered in this template file"    However, $islandora_object is not used in the template; $islandora_content is used, but is not documented.

title: Unspecified ZIP file name encodings lead to mangled names
description: Encoding of filenames in ZIPs (and some other archive formats) is a strange beast... Specified as being either UTF-8 or CP437, utilities often ignore and go with the system encoding... Let's allow it to be specified as necessary.    When providing metadata, this likely wouldn't be an issue; however, we use the filename in generated metadata when ingesting assets alone.

title: Islandora Usage Stats For Collection view is double encoding urls
description: The Islandora Usage Stats For Collection view is double encoding the urls in its list, which can break blocks on the subsequent page.

title: Rewrite iTQL queries into Sparql
description: Looking into getting another triplestore into the mix; however, iTQL is Mulgara-specific. Sparql is widely supported; however, I believe Mulgara's implementation has changed across our supported versions--transitive queries may or may not work correctly.    We should rewrite queries into Sparql, with a single core flag to allow some particular queries to continue trying to use iTQL (such as those transitive queries using the {{walk()}} statement) which may not work 100% in Mulgara's Sparql implementation.

title: "Solution packs required objects" page: xml-model processing instruction error
description: When this was found, it showed up PHP 5.3 using Ubuntu 12.04, but it likely affects other versions and distros.    There's an issue where libxml2 throws warnings when a module implementing hook_required_objects tries to add an object with an /xml datastream that implements the xml-model processing instruction.    The exact commit where this processing instruction exception was added to libxml2 exists here: https://git.gnome.org/browse/libxml2/commit/?id=4c4653e587838a2cc78ddc03cb77749198f12c6b    That commit is from June of 2011; compiled versions of libxml2 that are old enough (e.g., the version used with Ubuntu 12.04) may not have this included.    The offending code is [here|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/solution_packs.inc#L585] and [here|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/solution_packs.inc#L589] ... we're comparing the XML of an existing datastream against the XML of a fresh abstract datastream, and because of some Fedora XML-mangling weirdness, we can't just compare strings. Notes on why this is the case are in the comments [here|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/solution_packs.inc#L571-L578].    The likely solution is to add LIBXML_NOWARNING to the loadXML() calls in both spots, since the Solution packs required objects page is not the appropriate place to determine whether or not XML doesn't match spec. Despite the name of the constant, LIBXML_NOWARNING doesn't appear to suppress all warnings, so we shouldn't worry about that.

title: Incomplete comment in mods_to_dc.xsl regarding roleTerm
description: mods_to_dc.xsl that ships with Islandora Batch (and also with Islandora XML Forms and Islandora Importer) contains the following comment:    "When the roleTerm value associated with a name is creator, then name maps to dc:creator[.] When there is no roleTerm value associated with name, or the roleTerm value associated with name is a value other than creator, then name maps to dc:contributor"    However, this note is incomplete, since the XSL code this comment applies to (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/transforms/mods_to_dc.xsl#L97) requires that you also include a type="text" or type="code" attribute in your MODS roleTerm elements. If you don't include this attribute, you don't get a dc.creator. I think this is unexpected behavior for many users.    We discovered this while doing some test batch imports with a name element in our MODS with type="corporate" (which falls into the "no roleTerm value associated with name" category from the note). I haven't tested to see if this issue affects custom MODS edit forms.    At a minimum the comment in mods_to_dc.xsl should be clarified to include the requirement for roleTerm type attributes (which BTW are optional according to the MODS schema), and we should consider documenting some of the subtleties of how mods_to_dc.xsl works on https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA715/How+to+Batch+Ingest+Files.    I'm happy to open some PRs to clarify the comment once we agree that this should be fixed and agree on suitable language. I'll leave it up to the documentation team to consider whether it's worth documenting how mods_to_dc.xsl works outside of the .xsl file.

title: Raise file size limit to 800 MB
description: Current file size limit is 500 MB, but many CD images will be closer to their typical 700 MB capacity. Raising the file size limit to 800 MB should take care of this issue.

title: Change allowable "exx" file type to "e01" etc.
description: The allowable file type "exx" is actually a naming convention placeholder for the disk image file type that the Encase Forensics software outputs. The actual extension is ".e01", if the image is less than 640 MB. If it is over 640 MB, the first 640 will be stored in a file with the extension ".e01", and the next 640 will be ".e02" and the next 640 ".e03" and on and on (see http://www.forensicsware.com/blog/e01-file-format.html). At the very least we can change "exx" to "e01" for the time being-- and perhaps think about providing support for uploading serialized .e01, .e02, .e03, etc. files into one Fedora object (maybe as a .tar or .zip file?) at a later date?

title: Create error message when DFXML output fails
description: Sometimes the output from fiwalk is basically empty, because, for instance, it cannot determine the file system type (see attached). I noticed this happening even with images that were able to successfully mounted and accessed. Either way, a simple error message saying something like "DFXML output failed" would alert the repository manager that the disk image should be examined for other issues. It would also let the repository manager know that there would be no valuable DFXML indexed in Solr.

title: Solr Facet Pages doesn't create facet links to first letter for lowercase terms
description: If your Solr configuration does not set your fields to use a case insensitive match Solr Facet Pages will not generate facet links to first letter for terms in lowercase.

title: Missing include in metadata.inc.
description: This is a bug in the API and can be caused if the function that has been edited is called without any previous inclusion of the includes/utilities.inc file. The error has not been found until now because it is a very rare case that that file has not been included.    Can be resolved by adding the include for utilities.inc.

title: Limit the use of Inline datastreams.
description: Due to the cyclical efficiency gains in ingest scripts coupled with broad and aging hardware platforms we are experiencing degenerative processing capability that results in break scenarios for rapid batch ingests (commonly known as 409 errors).  This is causing operation adversity that can be alleviated by moving from inline to managed datastreams.    This is a continuation of https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-675 .   Instead of just targeting metadata datastreams we should target all inline datastreams.    The specific trouble is that Fedora runs into write locks with the FOXML and 409s under heavy load. Heavy load is determined both by how much work Fedora is being asked to do (both on a FOXML and system level) and the hardware it has available to do it. This most often has catastrophic consequences for rapid batch ingests but in some cases impacts front end single object ingests.

Checksum functions will not activate until save button is pressed once.  Even the retroactive function appears and reports that it has worked after pressing the Enable button, but no checksums really appear on fedora datastreams (checked using /fedora/admin)    Press the save button once, and every function works properly afterwards.

title: Audio Solution pack without LAME installed
description: This enhancement is for work that has already been produced. If the design is not desirable by the solution pack owners, we will redesign and reimplement as they see fit. The goal is to contribute code that solves the issue below.    Currently the audio solution pack requires that LAME is installed. The main issue faced by someone trying to use the solution pack without LAME is that the drupal hook_requirements method of the solution pack uses REQUIREMENT_WARNING which will not allow normal operation of drupal's update.php to update the database - requiring an override. The minor issue is that messages are sent to the watchdog log on every audio ingest.    In this case, someone is not able to install LAME on the Drupal server, but is able to generate the PROXY_MP3 as a derivative to store in Fedora. The desired result is that the Drupal administrator should be able to install the module, use update.php, and the user would be able to use the player that the solution pack uses.    This work has already been done in the following way, but my customer (Smithsonian Institution) is open to redesign and rework by the company I work for:  islandora_audio.module:    included a string constant to indicate that the LAME encoder should not be run  if executable path is set to this string value, no attempt to run LAME or message to the watchdog log on audio ingest includes/admin.form.inc:  include text on form for what should be used in the field that points to the executable to indicate LAME is not installed islandora_audio.install:  if the executable path is set to the string constant, issue REQUIREMENT_INFO as severity instead of REQUIREMENT_WARNING

title: Document "Rules" Functionality

To replicate on islandora_vagrant:    Add a facet field (I used title)  - admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings  Enable facet block  Choose Solr as the Display Generation option  - admin/islandora/solution_pack_config/basic_collection  Compare search results facet with collection facet  - http://localhost:8000/islandora/search?type=dismax&islandora_solr_search_navigation=0&f[0]=dc.title%3A%22collection%22  - http://localhost:8000/islandora/object/islandora%3Aroot?f[0]=dc.title%3A%22collection%22

title: Inconsistent defaults in BagIt configuration
description: {{islandora_bagit}} refers to its configuration variables inconsistently. For {{islandora_bagit_bag_output_dir}} in particular:  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L112-L117  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L350  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L407  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L586  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L799  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L831  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bagit/blob/b4da91dd322b15268f0b8dcef3c0d0f9ce31d457/islandora_bagit.module#L1238    For this one in particular, it should probably be something like: {{drupal_realpath('public://')}} as the default... Should possibly take a look at the others?

title: create documentation for usage stats
description: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA/Islandora+Usage+Stats (assignee will need edit permissions)

title: Book batch directory structure needs clarification
description: Nelson Hart brings up a very good point about:  https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA715/How+to+Batch+Ingest+Files#HowtoBatchIngestFiles-IngestBooks    The directory names for individual pages must be consecutive integers, so the docs should be clear about that.    The README file in https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_book_batch provides a very good example that could be useful in the 7.x-1.6 docs.    I'm happy to do this, but didn't want to assign it to myself until we're actually in this round's documentation process -- but please feel free to assign it to me.

title: Produces low bitrate .mp2 MP3 derivatives

This--in addition to ffprobe and mediainfo characterizations--confirm that audio stream is MP3/LAME-encoded, though files come down with an ".mp2" extension. title: "Create OGG locally" option text unclear
description: Currently it reads:    "Check this box if an optional OGG archival datastream is desired and should being created locally. Please note that OGG derivatives are no longer used within Islandora and this option remains to be consistent."    Here is the (temporary) note that I'm adding to 7.x-1.6 documentation:    " 'Create OGG locally' option is generally not recommended but remains an option for those who want to create their own local audio derivatives. See past documentation [link] for use of ffmpeg2theora in creating OGG derivatives."    What's the background on the OGG/ffmpeg2theora chilling? Little adoption, or just that ffmpeg2theora is a pain?

title: Islandora Sync file field sync filename alter
description: It is sometimes preferable to have more context in file names when downloaded from sync.  This ticket is to allow customization of those names.    https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_sync/pull/25

title: Edit "Content Models, Prescribed Datastreams and Forms" section of Documentation
description: Make the following edits to the Content Models, Prescribed Datastreams and Forms section in https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA/Web+Archive+Solution+Pack:    *islandora:sp-audioCModel SHOULD BE: islandora:sp_web_archive  *islandora:audio_collection SHOULD BE: islandora:sp_web_archive_collection  *Remove the two words "and LAME" from the second sentence of the section  *Add to list of datastreams in WARC Fedora objects:  WARC_CSV               Comma-separated index of the .warc file                 WARC_FILTERED      HTML index of the .warc file  *Remove from list of datastreams in WARC Fedora objects:  TN     Default thumbnail icon for audio objects    Suggestion: do we want to add TECHMD to the list of datastreams? I'm not seeing it on the documentation for the other SPs, but it was being generated with a default-settings bare-bones ingest for this SP (and probably others).    See attached screenshot for a view of the datastreams.

title: Documentation for Google Scholar Search Configuration
description: Documentation needs to be added for the setup of Google Scholar Search Configuration under islandora/solution_pack_config/scholar.     See documentation here: https://wiki.duraspace.org/display/ISLANDORA/Islandora+Scholar

title: Documentation about new PDF.js option
description: Documentation needs to be added for new PDF.js option (see ISLANDORA-1231 issue).

title: When adding child objects to non-compound objects the view displays the child's thumbnail
description: If I uncheck the "Only allow compound object to have child objects associated with them" option in Compound Object Solution Pack I am able to add children to all types of objects (Collections, Large Image, etc.) - as per ISLANDORA-1288. This is great!    When testing ISLANDORA-1288 the one weird thing I noticed is that when I give a Large Image a child object the thumbnail for the parent object is actually the thumbnail for the child object: https://www.dropbox.com/s/i5067yh55zyz0uq/compound_object_thumbnail.tiff?dl=0    It happens even if I uncheck "Generate a thumbnail for compound objects from their first child" in the Compound Object Solution Pack config.    Discussed at 2015.10.15 committers call and agreed that if children objects are being added to non-compound objects Islandora probably shouldn't replace the TN automatically.

title: jwplayer doesn't load
description: After configuring the audio and video solution packs to use jwplayer, the player fails to load in item pages. The console outputs a javascript error:    Uncaught ReferenceError: jwplayer is not defined    from within the player.js code:    jQuery(document).ready(function() {    jwplayer("mediaplayer").setup({      file: Drupal.settings.islandora_jwplayer.file,      image: Drupal.settings.islandora_jwplayer.thumbnail,      width: Drupal.settings.islandora_jwplayer.width,      height: Drupal.settings.islandora_jwplayer.height    });  });    I do see an attempt to load jwplayer.js in the page source, but I think that the file can't be loaded / isn't found.

title: Islandora permissions for replace datastreams and regenerate derivatives are tied together
description: Not sure if this is a bug or an improvement.     If a user has the permission to replace datastreams, the replace link should appear in the Manage display. It doesn't, unless the permission for regenerate derivatives is also checked. Need to confirm on my VM.    dm
