title: Drush installer for videojs-plugin won't run.
description: Drush script won't install videojs library because the URL of zip file (http://www.videojs.com/downloads/video-js-4.0.0.zip) 404's.    Videojs seems to not  provide .zip downloadables of the packaged library of version 5.0, just the source files. They suggest using the cdn or an installer [1].    Therefore probably easiest to include a later version of 4.x    [1] http://videojs.com/getting-started/#download

title: Checksum checker can run as anon and cause infinite loop.
description: If one has management XACML restrictions against the current Tuque's username on an object that is running checksum checker it can error causing an infinite loop during cron. Cron runs as anon and if in the bootstrap process Tuque is instantiated then the user override currently in place will not work. Also, other errors from Fedora could cause this loop.  There are several issues  1. Tuque's user must be reset to user 1.  2. Checksum Checker causes an infinite loop during cron if Fedora errors.  3. Different watchdog errors are not distinguished.

title: Updating a datastream for a multiple CMODEL Object , using XML Form, removes already present CMODEL
description: This merged pull request, https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/pull/117 removes all cmodels that are not explicitly passed to the an object's "model" property (magic). Entities Solution Pack uses two CMODELs for their objects. On ingest, they get a second CMODEL added via hook call.    XML forms uses:     function xml_form_builder_update_object(AbstractObject $object, array $association, XMLDocument $document, $label = NULL)    For updating Objects, called for Edits and Ingest    and at:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/16a0acac6a1247856f2244dc280f94d755c13b47/builder/xml_form_builder.module#L563    object->models is set from the association (assigned form for a cmodel). All existing cmodels are being removed and replaced by one (the associated to the form used to make the editing) braking the ability to have multiple cmodels in an Object and in specific Entities solution pack behaviour.    Since the pull request that originated this behaviour doesn't has a JIRA ticket it would be pertinent to investigate if there could be other places where this new behaviour could break existing functionality.    I made this a blocker because it breaks and/or changes behaviour of already working modules.    Also, it's not clear if we should fix this on the xml_forms side?    How to reproduce:    1.- Create any Entity Solution Pack Object.  2.- Check the RELS-EXT file created (Should have two CMODELS)  3.- Edit the metadata datastream from that object using "edit" button in the datastream view in management tab  4.- Submit the form (update)  5.- Re-check the RELS-EXT. Only one CMODEL present.
component: Entities Solution Pack,Tuque API,XML Form Builder

title: Manage XACML inheritance tab pager/functionality broken
description: When using the "Manage XACML inheritance" tab located at "islandora/object/yourcollectionobject/manage/collection" the tab is broken in a couple of different ways:    - Changing an object's inheritance from an existing collection object to "none" causes a warning to throw https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/blob/7.x/islandora_xacml_editor.module#L390 because "none" is not a valid object.  - The pager defined https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xacml_editor/blob/7.x/islandora_xacml_editor.module#L293 is firstly not uniquely identified (has the same ID as manage collection policy tab), and is not rendered at all on tab     - A byproduct of this is that a user has access to the management tabs but have none of the previous pagers rendered (collection policy/migrate/share) a myriad of theme_pager warnings will throw because of this above defined behavior.  - The fragment used to identify the management XACML tab is not uniquely identified and again is the same as the manage collection policy tab

title: Allow newlines to be rendered in Solr Metadata
description:
Currently, when rendering metadata from Solr, newlines are not rendered in the display. It would be good to have the option to toggle their conversion to
tags, so that they could be carried over to the display as line breaks. We should determine a place to insert an optional http://php.net/manual/en/function.nl2br.php - likely in the theme include - and add a per-field option to the field configuration (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_metadata/blob/7.x/includes/config.inc#L482) that can then be picked up in the _query_fields() method (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_metadata/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L185). It should be turned off on fields by default and assumed to be so in the eventual variable_get() so that existing implementations don't change.

title: OCR search highlighting doesn't check for qf param on solr request handler
description: If the request handler doesn't have a qf param, this function doesn't pick up the user defined field weighting.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/blob/7.x/includes/solr.inc#L23    Here is how the query processor class handles the logic.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/blob/7.x/includes/query_processor.inc#L286-L290

title: Usage stats blows up search results if term is too long.
description: Usage stats doesn't handle large terms or advanced searches very well. I believe it's interpreting the advanced search query as a single term.    PDOException: SQLSTATE[22001]: String data, right truncated: 1406 Data too long for column 'term' at row 1: INSERT INTO {islandora_usage_stats_top_searches} (term, search_total) VALUES (:db_insert_placeholder_0, :db_insert_placeholder_1); Array ( [:db_insert_placeholder_0] => rels_ext_ismemberofcollection_uri_ms:("info:fed

title: PubMed populator generates unnecessary additional Subject blocks in XML form
description: At the end of a PubMed-populated form, 12 additional blocks of Subject, Subject/Geographic Information, and Subject/Cartographics were created. Within these 12 blocks, only 2 of the Subject-Topic fields were populated (with "methods" and "therapy"), and every other field in all the 12 blocks were empty.

title: Add FAQ about Islandora objects needing public access before appearing in sitemap
description: Objects will appear in the XML Sitemap Custom Links table but will not appear in the sitemap if the Anonymous Drupal user cannot access them.  Add a FAQ to the Islandora XML Sitemap documentation to describe this symptom and possible resolutions.

title: Provide options for verifying checksums of a subset of a repository's objects
description: Currently, Checksum Checker does not provide a way to confirm the checksums of a subset of a repository's objects. (It does provide a way to allow admins to have specific datastreams checked, and to define how many objects to check during one job.) The query that gets the current group of objects excludes objects that have a content type of collectionCModel, since that was consistent with my original use case. I would be interested in hearing the types of options that implementers would like to have for verifying subsets of the objects in their repos, such as by collection, by content type, by creation/update date range, etc.

title: batch page ingest in islandora_paged_content does not respect UUID
description: When UUID is globally enabled in Islandora, ingesting objects that are dependent on islandora_paged_content get consecutive PID's. If the repo has mixed objects (some UUID and some with consecutive numbering after namespace) this makes ingesting fail on Fedora's side with  errors like this.    ERROR 2015-10-26 17:55:09.626 [http-8080-6] (BaseRestResource) Unexpected error fulfilling REST API request  org.fcrepo.server.errors.ObjectExistsException: The PID 'islandora:6' already exists in the registry; the object can't be re-created.    Since ::constructObject  is called without the UUID parameter as set in Islandora admin config.     This happens here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/d1a7f02b7b4401197a37463229c68c4222f7512c/includes/batch.inc#L498    and     https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/d1a7f02b7b4401197a37463229c68c4222f7512c/includes/manage_pages.inc#L777    I suspect this behaviour is present in many batch/derivative object ingesting (in other modules too) so we should address this and also investigate further, specially because since this bug is here since some time, we will always end with a mixed PID naming schema for some namespaces / cmodels, even when not intended.    Sadly i have to make this a blocker, since it brakes ingesting and is directly related to how we deal with a global setting in islandora.
component: Book Solution Pack,Newspaper Solution Pack,Paged Content

title: broken images on solr search configuration page when  a site has multiple languages
description: When a site is configured with multiple languages the watchdog images we use to show success or fail for a connection to solr are broken.      These images should probably be loaded with a call to theme_image instead of url.

title: translate solr fields into human readable names for top seach block
description: For advanced searches, Solr field names are stored in the top search db table as is. We should process these field names into their human readable versions when we display the results.

title: Value of 'Number of objects to check per cron run' not respected when using Drupal cron
description: Related ticket: https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1410    With DC as the datastream to check (assumption is that every object has a DC datastream), when I run checksum checker using the 'drush script' method, the number of objects checked is always the same as the value of 'Number of objects to check per cron run'. This is the expected behavior.    However, using the 'Drupal cron' method, the number of objects checked is always *one less* than the value of 'Number of objects to check per cron run.' I am running 7.x-1.6, commit f5051472db128cd779c75168a0665b8b1e05a8b9.

title: update the fgs label when title metadata is updated
description: This may be also be classed as a bug? When the metadata title of an object is updated (eg. /mods:mods/mods:titleInfo/mods:title[0] or whatever is specified in the form association) the expected behaviour would be for the fgs label to be updated to reflect the new title. It doesn't do that at the moment, so the user has to update that data themselves by editing the Properties of the object. Not good.

title: Check all SPs to make sure OBJ is in the correct place in the sequence in dsCompositeModel
description: All solution packs should be checked to make sure OBJ is at the correct place in the sequence in dsCompositeModel    Problem was fixed on basic image, but not on all SPs.    eg: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_image/commit/6856d928a1d383a56cf5e99a220e04a52e1fddf0    We re-discovered the problem on the video sp. No derivates were created when using drush to batch ingest videos. We moved the OBJ above TN and re-tested. The derivates were created with drush batch ingest after adjusting the video content model.
component: Large Image Solution Pack,Video Solution Pack

title: Clarify that islandora_batch bypasses checkbox setting in PDF module
description: The PDF solution pack has an option to allow/disallow users to upload text files with PDFs for index into Solr. Note that this option applies to loading individual objects, not for batch processing: batch uploading PDF content model objects with multiple datastreams (such as uploading an object's PDF, XML, and full-text files through the zip importer) will effectively ignore this checkbox.

title: Allow anonymous owner to not be labelled "Everyone"
description: I added ability to change anonymous owner to not say "Everyone" on lists overview page. In the admin form you can now specify what you want listed as the owner when the list is not assigned to a Drupal user.    Pull request can be found here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_bookmark/pull/88

title: GUI-configurable Simple Search Query Fields
description: Allow GUI-configured {{Query fields}} ({{qf}}; the fields for dismax/simple search) to be preferred over those defined in the selected request handler.    --Use Case--  A user with sufficient permissions but without CLI access may wish to alter the fields over which simple search queries. Currently, this is not possible if the {{qf}} is defined in the selected Solr request handler (in the {{solrconfig.xml}}).    --Technical Approach--  Add a checkbox in the form near the textarea where the current {{Query fields}} fields can be specified, to indicate if we should try to use our GUI-configured fields. Store and use the state of this checkbox to influence where we modify the {{qf}} parameter passed off to Solr.    --Test Case--  * When not checked (default, matches current functionality):  ** With {{qf}} in the request handler, the fields in the {{Query fields}} textarea should _not_ be used.  ** Without {{qf}} in the request handler, the fields in the {{Query fields}} textarea should be used.  * When checked:  ** The fields in the {{Query fields}} textarea should be used, independent of {{qf}} existing in the selected request handler.    --Impact--  Minimal, as this should be additive and preserve defaults.    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Move the UUID var into Islandora proper
description: Move the UUID var into Islandora proper because after the recent changes that is where it is being used primarily. Should be transparent to the end user.      --Technical Approach--    Move the UUID var into Islandora proper. The name of the var will need to be updated for coding standards so we will need a deprecation cycle where both vars exist for some time.        --Test Case--    Check UUID use for regressions both in main single ingest, Drush and importers.      --Impact--    External code will need updating within the next two releases.  We will need a follow up ticket to handle final deprecation at the turn of the next release.      ----  William Panting  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Vertical tabs under "Collection" tab do not retain focus after form submit
description: Under a collection object's "Collection" tab, the "Share members", "Migrate members", and "Delete members of this collection" vertical tabs do not retain focus when the user submits the form that each one contains. On submit, focus is placed on the first tab in the group, "Manage collection policy."    @jordandukart has fixed this behavior for the "Manage XACML Inheritance" tab in https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1515 but question is, does it make sense from a UI/X perspective to have the three above-mentioned tabs retain focus after their respective form is submitted.

title: Ability to hide page objects from Solr search results
description: Currently, the behaviour of Islandora Solr is to display every page object found in a result set as part of the search results. This can be considered undesirable, as often hundreds or thousands of pages can show up in a result set thanks to individual page OCR and other metadata, obfuscating more useful results.    The purpose of this ticket is to:    1) Make it possible to filter page objects from Solr results queries in a simple manner similar to the Islandora Compound Solr filtering query,  2) Make it possible to store consolidated OCR at the book level so OCR search isn't interrupted by this,  3) Provide ways of consolidating the OCR during batch ingest (drush and interface),  4) Provide a way of updating that consolidated OCR if necessary, and  5) Provide a Drush method for updating the OCR of existing objects for sites that wish to use this feature.    --Use Case--  - Sites that store a great deal of books with high volumes of pages may want to be able to only show paged content objects in Solr search results, and not the pages themselves.  - Sites that wish to use this feature may want to update existing paged content objects to this method as well.    --Technical Approach--  The biggest problem here is figuring out how to make sure that OCR can be searched even if page objects are being filtered out. Ideally we don't want to do this in a way that has to read individual OCR datastreams from page objects out of Fedora (e.g., after ingest or during the index process).    The least intensive way of doing this seems to be to attach consolidated OCR datastreams to book objects while the pages are being made by maintaining a consolidated OCR file and appending individual page OCR files to it as they are made. We have precedent for this; it's how aggregated PDFs are currently done.    --Test Case--  This touches a lot of parts of the Paged Content functionality, so any part of Paged Content that creates or creates, updates, or otherwise uses OCR should be checked. We should also check that this doesn't impact existing or new sites that don't want to use this functionality.    --Impact--  Because this will bake functionality into batch ingest (Drush and interface) and into the OCR regeneration, we should ensure that, whenever possible, existing functionality can be maintained - in short, we shouldn't be forcing anyone to append OCR to paged content objects, and the default behaviour should maintain current behaviour.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content
component: Book Batch,Book Solution Pack,Newspaper Batch,Newspaper Solution Pack,OCR,Paged Content,Solr Search

title: FITS metadata display adds multiple identical values for field
description: When building the output array in islandora_fits_children(), the function loops through the tool/field/values in the recursed xml, and is supposed to be testing to see if there are any identical values previously existing in the array at $output[$tool_label][$field_label]. If so, it's supposed to skip adding the new value.    However, the code does not do this. It loops through the existing values at that tool/field, and if **any** of them do not match the current value, it will add the current value:                  foreach ($output[$tool_label][$field_label] as $key => $value) {                    if ($value !== $output_text) {                      $output[$tool_label][$field_label][] = $output_text;                    }                  }  I think a more correct approach would be something like the following:                  if (!in_array($output_text, $output[$tool_label][$field_label])) {                    $output[$tool_label][$field_label][] = $output_text;                  }

title: Independent configuration for SPARQL Query endpoint
description: Tuque should provide an independent configuration setting for the SPARQL Query endpoint on which it relies so that the REST API for the Fedora repository and the SPARQL Query endpoint on which a given Islandora install depends can exist at different endpoints.    This is to support the case of totally externalizing the triplestore so that it exists as a completely separate process from the repository, to help with scaling problems and to prepare sites for migration to Fedora 4, which maintains a much stronger separation between triplestore and repository.

title: Allow raw parameter to be pased to pdftotext extraction
description: Allow for the raw parameter to optionally be passed to pdftotext for text extraction to create more accurate OCR during PDF batch ingesting.    --Use Case--  It's possible in execution that when using the option to extract text directly from paged content (as opposed to using Tesseract) that the user may want to grab the raw text from the PDF. This is a toggleable feature because it exposes an advanced option to the end user that may lead to unexpected results if not used incorrectly. By default, pdftotext extracts text in natural reading order. In edge case documents, where PDF creation tools have made blocks in errorneous order, text extraction will yield unexpected results. As such, this parameter will pull out text in the order that the PDF creation tool wrote it (layout ignored). This is not a valid default option to have due to that PDF creation tools are not constrained to writing blocks in the order they appear and it is up to the PDF reader to render them correctly.    --Technical Approach--  Add an optional parameter to the utility function that calls pdftotext that defaults to the old behavior of FALSE/not including the flag to pdftotext.    --Test Case--  Enable the toggleable checkbox to expose this feature through the paged content admin page located at yoursite/admin/islandora/solution_pack_config/paged_content  Go through the ingest process for a book or newspaper issue object.   Include a PDF file to be processed  Select the extract text option  Select whether to use raw text or not    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: PHP Notice: Only variable references should be returned by reference in array_traverse_path()
description: Started seeing this error after moving to new machine with PHP 5.6:  Notice: Only variable references should be returned by reference in array_traverse_path() (line 55 of /var/www/html/sites/all/modules/php_lib/Array.inc).    https://github.com/Islandora/php_lib/blob/7.x/Array.inc#L57

title: Entities are loaded more times than necessary
description: While doing some work that involves menu pathing, noticed this little gem here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/islandora_entities.module#L624-L637    This approach has a couple of issues:    1) It assumes that a path containing /islandora will also contain /object, which may not be the case for some customizations (specifically those that wish to use their own custom path in place of islandora/object)  2) Even if this approach was repaired, it still represents an unnecessary additional loading of the object on every page to check the content model.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Not really a bug in this case, but you can see the activity when you load an 'islandora/object/PID' page and see that, when the entities module is enabled, Fedora loads the object one more time than it would without entities enabled.    --Test Case--  With this fixed, there should be absolutely no change to the way entities are displayed.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Failed to update DS-COMPOSITE in ISLANDORA-1373
description: ISLANDORA-1373 moved the "screenshot" DSID to SCREENSHOT, however, this was not updated in the DS-COMPOSITE.    Any batch ingests will default to the old DSID.

title: qt param set to 0 in solr facet pages - 400 error
description: If you set your request handler in Islandora Solr settings to "Let Solr Decide", Solr facet pages do not work because the qt param (request handler name) is being set to 0    --Steps to Reproduce--  - set the request handler in solr settings to "Let Solr Decide" and save your settings  - enable solr facet page module and set up a simple facet page  - browse to your facet page, you will see a Solr 400 error.    This change needs to applied to solr facet pages module    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/commit/4ee02ad26782b7032c3f50f5d5944bb26c152bf5    Tagging [~nruest] as the maintainer. I can't add him as a watcher (User 'nhart' is not allowed to add watchers to issue 'ISLANDORA-1540').  ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Readme needs updating
description: Readme does not include mandatory namespace argument and has a mis-leading reference to a --METADATA--.xml file

title: PDF creation flags don't get removed from paged content batches
description: The offending code is right here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/7.x/includes/derivatives.inc#L125    That batch op calls islandora_book_batch_remove_pdf_flag, which is a function that doesn't exist.    This means that the create_pdf flag is not getting removed from paged content batch objects.    I'm recommending a few things here:    1) This function name should be fixed to the actual function name, islandora_paged_content_remove_pdf_flag().  2) In addition, it should not be an extra batch operation, as that just makes it difficult to ensure includes/derivatives.inc is actually loaded when the function is called. Since all islandora_paged_content_remove_pdf_flag() is doing is calling out to $object->relationships->remove(), which doesn't explode if it doesn't find the flag (it just returns FALSE), we could very easily just move it to here somewhere as just a straight call to the function: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/7.x/includes/batch.inc#L192-195 - I've actually implemented it thusly for the OCR stuff: https://github.com/qadan/islandora_paged_content/blob/7.x-ISLANDORA-1533/includes/batch.inc#L299  3) This has likely borked a lot of paged content objects on a lot of boxes. We will need to come up with a drush method to clean up offending RELS-EXTs in existing installs.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Batch ingest a book or issue using the book or issue batch ingest process (drush or GUI). A 'create_pdf' relationship will be left over in the RELS-EXT of the paged content object (the book or issue itself).    --Test Case--  Batch ingest a book or issue using the book or issue batch ingest process (drush or GUI). There should be no 'create_pdf' relationship in the RELS-EXT of the paged content object (the book or issue itself).    Also should test the drush cleanup pretty thoroughly.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Preceeding in Newspaper and Newspaper Issue default XML forms
description: I noticed when working with both the Newspaper MODS XML default form and the Newspaper Issue MODS XML default form that in the type for relatedItem, preceding is spelled wrong. It appears as "preceeding" instead of "preceding". Jared Whiklo answered that this is a sentence that appears in the solution pack (https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/jCjTJGr6dFw). It also appears in the XML default form in more advanced controls/options; of course you can change it locally but it would be great to update the default as this misspelling will create invalid MODS xml.    Thanks

title: Code standards of Tuque
description: Tuque is documented as adhering to the Drupal code standards here:    https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/blob/1.x/CONTRIBUTING.md    but the actual code appears to be not _quite_ all the way there. (Several hundred violations.)    It's possible to attach code style checks to the CI builds, but in order to do that, it would be necessary first to get Tuque "into shape" in this respect. This ticket is to do those two things.    _Code Standards of Tuque_ is the worst name for a Frank Herbert novel.

title: Add hook_islandora_edit_datastream_registry_alter to modify the datastream edit registry after it has been built by hook_islandora_edit_datastream_registry
description: Inside of islandora_edit_datastream create an drupal_alter after the edit registry is built to allow for modifications to the $edit_registry variable before it is rendered. This allows for other module(s) to have more control over what is stored/rendered from the built $edit_registry variable. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/datastream.inc#L296-L298 --Use Case-- Site wants to replace the xml_form_builder_islandora_edit_datastream_registry with a custom edit registry so that the new registry is the only one that exists. This will allow the site to skip having to display a registry selection step and just load the new registry by default. --Technical Approach-- Islandora Module (Core) -Add a hook constant in islandora.module -Add a drupal_alter in islandora/includes/datastream.inc inside of islandora_edit_datastream after $edit_registry is set. -Update logic here to get the first array index regardless of key https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/datastream.inc#L308. -Update islandora.api.php file to include a sample implementation of the drupal alter. XML Form Builder Module -Update the array in islandora_xml_forms/builder/xml_form_builder.module inside of xml_form_builder_islandora_edit_datastream_registry to use a specific key of 'xml_form_builder_edit_form_registry'. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/xml_form_builder.module#L535 --Test Case-- In another module implementent hook_islandora_edit_datastream_modify_registry_alter(). Within the implementation you can have it modify the registry however you see fit. An example implementation: // Assuming there is a custom form accessible through site/islandora/object/%pid/MODS/citation. /* * When editing the MODS datastream for any object with the ir:citationCModel replace any edit registry items with * a customized edit form. */ function hook_islandora_edit_datastream_modify_registry_alter(&$edit_registry, $context) { $object = islandora_object_load($context['datastream_parent']->id); if ($context['datastream']->id == 'MODS' && in_array('ir:citationCModel', $object->models)) { // Unset the entire registry. unset($edit_registry); // Add custom registry which will now be the only registry option remaining. $edit_registry['my_custom_citation_edit_form'] = array( 'name' => t('Custom Citation Edit Form'), 'url' => "islandora/object/{$context['datastream_parent']->id}/{$context['datastream']->id}/citation", ); } } --Impact-- Adding a custom index in the xml form builder registry array: forces an update to the switch statement case 1 logic so that it is not dependant on the index being '0'. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/datastream.inc#L308 ---- Matthew Perry Developer discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: MARCXML not being transformed into MODS through book_batch
description: Even when named --METADATA--.xml, as per the documentation, some MARCXML records are not being transformed into MODS when ingested through book_batch.  This is due to the top level element being a 'collection', when only 'record' is recognized by book_batch.  Both should be respected.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Create a zip with a MARCXML record that has a top-level element that is a 'collection.'  Ingest through book_batch.  The MODS generated during the ingest process should be a dummy record with no information.    --Test Case--  Create a zip with a MARCXML record that has a top-level element that is a 'collection.'  Ingest through book_batch.  The MODS generated during the ingest process should filled with information from the MARCXML record.    ----  Daniel Lamb  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Audio SP: optionally defer to the OBJ datastream if PROXY_MP3 is absent
description: The Audio SP assumes that a PROXY_MP3 derivative _needs_ to be generated for JWPlayer, but this isn't the case for all repositories. In cases where the original OBJ uploaded to the repository is perfectly fine for playing in the JWPlayer, deriving and storing a PROXY_MP3 represents unnecessary space and computation power being used up server-side.    We should make it so that, optionally, the Audio SP will attempt to load the OBJ into the player if the PROXY_MP3 isn't present.    Addendum: I say 'JWPlayer' a lot here, but realistically, the only important thing is mime type; JWPlayer uses the native abilities of the browser to play audio files, so as long as it can be played in JWPlayer, it should also be able to be played in other players, should one make the switch away from JWPlayer in the future.    --Use Case--  Instead of raw, uncompressed archival audio files like WAVs, the audio files an institution wishes to deposit are already compressed MP3s that are suitable for playing by an end user in the JWPlayer.    In this case, compressing a second PROXY_MP3 wastes computation time and energy, and storing it wastes server space and creates unnecessary additional relationships in Fedora.    --Technical Approach--  On the user end, this will involve checking off an option in the admin form to allow fallback to OBJ files.    On the back end, this would involve determining the status of that option, as well as determining whether or not the OBJ is suitable for playback (e.g., looking at the mimetype).    --Test Case--  This should be tested against a bunch of differently-constructed MP3 files. Currently, we run all audio through LAME, which means that we kind of curate the makeup of MP3 files that get sent to the player. We should try to make sure that the solution in place to determine whether or not an OBJ is playable is suitable.    This should also be tested across all popular browsers, including mobile.    --Impact--  If what is mentioned in the test case isn't thoroughly tested, we could be sending unsuitable files off to the player, which could result in any number of things ending in a poor user experience.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: PDF solution pack displays broken image when user lacks access to PREVIEW DS
description: PDF solution pack displays broken image when user lacks access to PREVIEW DS.    --Steps to Reproduce--    Ingest a PDF.  XACML the PREVIEW DS.  Goto the object view.  A broken img is displayed.      --Test Case--    Ingest a PDF.  XACML the PREVIEW DS.  Goto the object view.  No broken img is displayed.      ----  William Panting  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: When deleting a PDF the MODS fields should also be deleted
description: When you upload a PDF it saves the form input as mods_accessCondition_use_and_reproduction and mods_physicalDescription. If you later delete the PDF it should probably remove these mods fields since they are tied to the specific version of the citation that was originally uploaded.

title: Add options for PDF upload form to the admin settings page
description: When uploading a PDF for a citation there are two sections to select "Document Version" and "Use Permission". I would like to have the ability to change the available options for each of these.    It would be nice if the options were set in the admin form so that each institution could decide what to use. For example, we would like to have creative commons licenses added to the Use Permissions section.    I don't mind taking this on if anyone thinks it would be useful.

title: Blank searches through advanced search block always search *:*
description: When you don't enter anything in the advanced search block it should search whatever the default query is set to instead of  *:* (i.e. it should have the same result as a blank simple search)    I will make this change and create a pull request, but I'm curious if anyone is attached to the current way it works. We could also have a toggle to allow the advanced search to remain *:* when blank, if anyone is wary of making this change.

title: Add ability to optionally input full DOI URL
description: Allow for full DOI URLs to be passed into islandora_doi_perform_request so that full DOI URLs can be used when importing DOI records instead of having to use only the CrossRef ID.  This change should still allow for just CrossRef ID to be used.      --Use Case--  Users can now enter DOI in more formats:  http://doi.org/10.1111/eva.12339  http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/eva.12339  doi:10.1111/eva.12339  10.1111/eva.12339  * any of the variants above with extra whitespace in the beginning or end of string.      --Technical Approach--  Add validation as part of the islandora_doi_perform_request to allow for the $id value to optionally be the full DOI URL.    The documentation needs to be updated to reflect the update to $id.  Seems to make sense to update the variable name within the function itself to reflect the change as well. It's important that this function update needs to be able to work without impacting the current method of passing in the CrossRef ID. The description of the doi_populator field should also be updated to to include new examples of full DOI URLs.       --Test Case--  Create an object using the DOI importer using the following DOI format:  http://doi.org/10.1111/eva.12339  http://dx.doi.org/10.1111/eva.12339  doi:10.1111/eva.12339  10.1111/eva.12339  * any of the variants above with extra whitespace in the beginning or end of string.      --Impact--  There should be no impact on the current DOI use case so that it maintains backwards compatibility allowing for the original formats (doi:10.1111/eva.12339 or 10.1111/eva.12339) to continue to work as intended.    ----  Matthew Perry  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Fedora is unreliable under heavy concurrency on single objects.
description: To mitigate the issues with Fedora being unreliable under heavy concurrency on single objects we can eliminate that concurrency.    --Use Case--    This is a general race condition:  Two processes modifying the same object can run across inconsistent errors from Fedora depending on specific operations being performed, how long into the operations the two Fedora threads are and (suspected)Fedora version.    The specific case prompting this improvement is multiprocess derivative generation via islandora_job https://github.com/discoverygarden/islandora_job      --Technical Approach--    Block low level APIM using semaphores.  Use Drupal semaphores as they have great power for Islandora both in Drush and multi-sites and is a proven system.  Make the semaphores toggleable (off by default) because this feature is unnecessary for light use of Islandora.  Make the time a semaphore can be reserved for configurable as this is not a one size fits all.      --Test Case--    This is a race condition relying on the state of more than one system. It is difficult to test and errors will be intermittent.  This race condition theoretically needs at least 2 processors and has been tested on a machine with 3.    Ways to test:  * Manual: Open several tabs on the same object and regenerate its derivatives in all of them. This is the least likely option to cause the collision.  * Script: Write a script that forks PHP where one process ingests a book and the other ingests the first page in that book with a TN DS. Loop this in the shell for increased chance of collision.  * islandora_job: Setup islandora_job with at least two gearman processes.  Ingest a one page book with minimal DSs and a small TN using islandora_book_batch. Loop this in the shell for increased chance of collision.    From the user's perspective it is very difficult to prove success on intermittent issues.  I suggest the use of a debugger to analyse the code paths.      --Impact--    There is negative impact from both increased admin complexity and performance penalty on inadvertent activation of the feature.  The increased admin complexity can be mitigated as much as possible via Drupal states.  The risk of inadvertent activation can be mitigated through documentation in the admin screen detailing the cost/benefit trade off and intended use case.      ----  William Panting  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Metadata is not displayed for newspaper issues when issue viewer is set to "None"
description: When 'None' is selected as the default issue viewer in the Newspaper SP's configuration settings, and "Dublin Core" is selected as the metadata viewer in Islandora Solr Metadata's configuration settings, no metadata is rendered to the browser. The "Details" link is inactive and viewing page source shows no metadata. If "Islandora Solr Metadata" is the selected metadata viewer, the configured fields are rendered as expected.

title: Move PHP_Codesniffer install to install via Composer instead of PEAR
description: See: https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/wiki/End-of-Life-for-PEAR-Installation-Method    We can no longer install PHP_Codesniffer via PEAR due to the above.

title: XML Forms use original form defaults when adding a new tab.
description: Currently form builder forms do not respect the default form values when adding a new tab panel.    --Use Case--  Have the default field values that are set in the form builder editor be respected when adding a new tab and not just on the first tab (during initial form load).        --Technical Approach--  Within xml_form_elements_form_element_tabs_ajax_add after cloning a new empty copy of the current xml form needs to be loaded so that the empty copy will contain only the default values set from the form builder editor. Using the triggering element parents it can get the proper element within the empty form to use in processing the default values.  The closure function to set the default value to NULL needs to be updated to accept the empty form element as an additional parameter and using the current element index it can find the #default_value and use that.          --Test Case--  Requirements: Form builder form with tabpanel that has a field within it that has a default value set.    Example 1:     Default - Collection MODS Form  Within this form the name (tabs) -> 0 (tabpanel) -> type (select) has the default value set of personal.    The first tab when you load the form uses the correct default but as soon as you add a new tab the newly cloned tab will default to corporate as this is the first option in the select box.     With this change when you add the new tab it will load the default value of the initial "empty/new" form and set the select option to personal.    Example 2:    Make a form with a tab panel and set a default value on a field.  When adding a new tab it should always prepopulate with the default value set for that field.    Areas to test:  Ingests  Edits  Form Builder Preview        --Impact--  This will impact the functionality of all XML forms that have tabpanels and default values set.        ----  Matthew Perry  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Small, Perceivable Protections Against Image Theft
description:
While nothing can stop a tech-savvy user from capturing what's on the screen, there may be some small ways to improve the comfort level for content contributors who worry about image theft. One can disable right clicking of images by modifying islandora-openseadragon.tpl.php:
One can disable the clipping function, even on a per-namespace basis using CSS Injector: div.islandora-large-image-content-wrapper.clearfix a#clip { display:none; } div.islandora-large-image-content-wrapper.clearfix a#clip img.img-responsive { display:none; } add only on the listed pages: islandora/object/motorsports* I'm quite sure there are better methods to be had, but little changes like these can help improve the comfort level for content contributors.

title: Display a link to allow for the download of PDF with IABook Viewer
description: When the IA Viewer is used with either books or newspaper issues it should allow the user to download the PDF derivative of the Book / Newspaper Issue if present on the object.    Came from this google group post:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/gTaHFja7Po0

title: Solr
description:
When using the Islandora Solr Metadata Module the Drupal text filter it creates here: http://example.com/admin/config/content/formats/islandora_solr_metadata_filtered_html It specifies that it should "Convert line breaks into HTML (i.e.
and

)", but it does not create those tags. Not sure if this is a bug we can fix or if it's a Drupal text filter issue. This came out of this Groups discussion: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/bQosxnbsjUc

title: Scholar Embargoes XACML collision
description: When a collection with XACML viewing restrictions has the restrictions removed (recursively), Scholar embargoes applied to objects within the collection stop working. The embargoed objects become publicly accessible even though the objects still show up with their original embargo states in the '/admin/islandora/solution_pack_config/embargo/list' menu.    Manually lifting and reapplying the embargo to each object fixes the problem.

title: Islandora OCR missing dependency on Islandora Solr Search
description: Islandora OCR needs Islandora Solr Search to perform many of its functions but is not included in the modules dependencies nor documentation.    Task is to update the modules *.info file to list Islandora Solr Search as a dependency. Then have the Documentation Interest Group update the wiki.    Discussion at the Dec. 3, 2015 committers call was to make this a documentation task, so if my change to code task is un-warranted it can be changed back.

title: XML Sitemap Custom Links include inactive objects
description: As reported by Emily T:    > Using the Simple Workflow Module, Islandora objects that are "inactive" remain suppressed from being viewed through Islandora collections and the Solr search results. However, it appears that our inactive objects are still being added to the Drupal XML sitemap, built using the Islandora XML Sitemap module. As a result, the inactive object pages can potentially be crawled and indexed by Google, making them visible.    [Question about the Simple Workflow Module and the XML sitemap - Google Groups](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!msg/islandora/fY84E_Jwtfc/cNazdPQQDQAJ)

title: Alter Solr Metadata display (parameters)
description: Allow altering of Solr Metadata display/description theme parameters    --Use Case--    We wish to programmatically modify the associations used in the Solr Metadata display, for example, to change based on an arbitrary value in the metadata of the object being rendered. (Using and somewhat similar to ISLANDORA-1296, but avoiding introducing additional dependencies)    --Technical Approach--    Introduce calls using {{drupal_alter()}} before the relevant {{theme()}} calls.    --Test Case--    # Without implementations of the new alters, things should continue to function as-is.  # Implementing the alters, and:  ## Adding an existing config ID to the {{associations}} should cause the fields in the specified configuration to be combined into the metadata display.  ## Setting the {{associations}} to an array containing a single configuration ID should cause it to be the only display used (excepting other implementations of the alter)    --Impact--    Additional flexibility with a negligible performance impact (from the introduction of another hook).    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Islandora's Admin Form is Confusing
description: Improve the Islandora Admin Configuration form (at admin/islandora/configure).     We've been adding options as we needed more config variables without any thought to logical presentation, and the form has become a mix of required, sometimes-used, and special-case options. The default values are not stated in the interface, and there is no way to "reset to defaults". Additionally, the verbiage used to describe the options has not been consistent either in terms of sense (e.g.  positive "show print option" vs. negative "defer derivatives") or voice (e.g. "Use iTQL" vs. "UUID PID Generation").    All of this makes it difficult for a new admin to understand the options they are presented with, and this seems like it's only going to get worse as more flexibility is added.     This was discussed in #1535 [warning: the comments section is book-length], and to quote [~ddavis], "I would think a good admin GUI separates out the required, optional but common, and advanced. This gives the admin a gradual on-ramp."    Rosie's editorial note: part of the reason for this ticket is that I don't think the argument that "having that option available will confuse some users" should be used to prevent a feature from being merged, as in #1535 (where it was) and in #1556 (where it wasn't). Not if there's a use case where it could improve some repositories. This is the agile argument, that it's better to run code and iteratively improve on it than to stall everything until it's perfect (which is subjective and unlikely to come under consensus, anyway).

title: Video Solution pack doesn't resize thumbnails
description: Currently the Video Solution pack doesn't resize thumbnails like the other solution packs do (200x200), leading to odd looking displays.    Came out of Google Group:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/eBXW6uppr8Y    Any worries about changing this behaviour?

title: Usage stats attempts to create a record when none exists
description: Notice is displayed, seems to indicate a problem with logic and creating records when no object exists:    > Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in islandora_usage_stats_pid_to_db() (line 39 of /var/www/html/archivesII/sites/all/modules/islandora_usage_stats/includes/db.inc).    Code in Question:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_usage_stats/blob/5f98f5bbcbc2f1f8bb7e1115d5f7f7e4443fc7a8/includes/db.inc#L36-L41    Came out of this Google Group post:  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/oc9vdrfXq1I

title: When managing objects from a collection, you can only manage 10 children at a time.
description: Within the collection admin screen, when trying to share/migrate/delete members of that collection, there's a hard-coded limit of 10 at a time. It'd be useful to be able to manage this - perhaps as a dropdown that causes an ajax refresh of the list of children, or a configurable variable.

title: Control access to objects with inactive status
description: In discussing how to fix https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1565, the issue of how to control access to inactive objects came up as the root of the problem. Some users may be expecting that a object set to Inactive (by Simple Workflows, for instance), is not accessible to unauthorized users, but it is both mapped by XML Sitemaps and accessible through a direct link.     Controlling access to inactive seems desirable as part of workflows, so this functionality should be added in, probably via Drupal permissions + hook_islandora_object_access().

title: islandora_solr_ping() fails when a port is not specified in the SOLR URL
description: If a port is not specified in the URL to the SOLR instance on the `admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr` page, then luke.inc/islandora_solr_ping() will treat it as an invalid URL.

title: On Scholar pages the theses tab only displays if the scholar also has citations
description: If you create a scholar and then add them as thesis supervisors on a thesis, you will not get the theses tab on their profile page. If you then add a citation, both the citations and theses tabs will be displayed.    Scholars with citations but no theses will have both tabs displayed and the Theses tab displays "There are no theses."    I suspect the simplest fix would be to make both tabs show up when there are only theses to display. I poked around the code a bit and couldn't figure out why this is happening. Someone more familiar with this solution pack can probably figure this out much quicker than I can.

title: DOI importer can't handle ampersands
description: When importing with the DOI populator or importer, ampersands will end fields, cutting off the ampersand and anything following it. For example, an article from the journal "Environmental Science & Technology" will populate the form, but the journal field will contain "Environmental Science "

title: Pass PID with islandora_object_mapper
description: It would be useful to add an objects PID to the return result of the utility funciton 'islandora_objects_object_mapper($object_id)', found here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L261. My reasoning is pure convince while pre-processing the SOLR default display back end (grid view, list view). Implementing '{MODULE/THEME}_preprocess_islandora_basic_collection_grid(&$variables)' will not reveal the PID for each object in the result set (surprisingly). While it is possible to do this with additional theme functions and implementations, it would be unnecessary work for something simple.    --Use Case--  Doing most anything in list or grid preprocess, such as '{THEME}_preprocess_islandora_basic_collection_grid(&$variables)' while using the SOLR display backend. One may wish to construct additional content viewed per object in the grid.         --Technical Approach--  Given how useful this could be, i would like to add the pid to the utility function 'islandora_objects_object_mapper(&$variables)' return array.        --Test Case--  View a collections children grid or list. The extra property 'pid' is available in the objects array      --Impact--  To my knowledge, there would be no negative impact on islandora core. This would simply make custom work a little easier.        ----  Morgan Dawe  Theme Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Conflicting command option with core drush --target
description: The --target option appears to clash (At least in some cases) with drush's --target. Changing it to a non-conflicting option namespace resolves the issue.    PR:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_newspaper_batch/pull/9    Log:  https://gist.github.com/JacobSanford/12612d42080cce324b4b    Thanks,    JS

title: Facet using Solr TrieDateFields are not give range options
description: Solr deprecated the DateField in 4.1 and new TrieDateFields get a type of 'tdate' instead of 'date' which is missed in this admin check    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/blob/7.x/includes/admin.inc#L1940    so you cannot choose to use the range slider for these facets.

title: Function naming causes function to be called as a hook
description: Solr facet pages contains old style function names beginning with underscores such as _islandora_solr_facet_pages_letterer (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_facet_pages/blob/7.x/islandora_solr_facet_pages.module#L136) and _islandora_solr_facet_pages_results (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_facet_pages/blob/7.x/islandora_solr_facet_pages.module#L202).     While normally these would be fine a situation can arise where they get invoked mistakenly when a theme call is ran due to the function naming matching: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_facet_pages/blob/7.x/islandora_solr_facet_pages.module#L66-L81. From a code smell/style perspective this kind of naming has been phased out as well.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Have a theme exist that extends a base theme such as zen, remove zen and watch the fireworks explode (happened on a client box).    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Scholar module - URL field outputs as Solr search, not URL
description: In Scholar profiles, the URL field is being converted to a Solr search rather than just showing up as a URL like you would expect.    For example: http://arcabc.ca/islandora/object/unbc%3A30    After consulting with the IR interest group, I got more information from Jordan Dukart:     "Looks like this is a long lived bug in the implementation imo, see: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/islandora_entities.install#L163-L169 and https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/islandora_entities.install#L120-L125.     "I wasn't involved in the entities part of Scholar but I'd assume that shouldn't be hyperlinking out to a Solr search and may have been a misappropriation of what the hyperlink portion of the Solr metadata schema does.    "probably should be a bug that gets fixed in core as it's incorrect functionality that's existed for over a year, will require an _update hook to fix existing ones as well (not much work either way)."

title: Errant space in jp2:ilyrrates parameter list
description: Errant space here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/blob/7.x/includes/derivatives.inc#L440    Pull request here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_large_image/pull/155

title: Hook implementation in newspaper incorrectly references book
description: The newspaper solution pack incorrectly has a hook implementation that references the islandora_book solution pack module.    If the newspaper solution pack was used where the book solution pack was not enabled the issue ingest step would not be present.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Disable the book solution pack.  Clear the cache.  Go to ingest an issue, not that the issue step is not present.      --Test Case--  The issue step is present with the updated code.

title: Reduce number of query types
description: We have two instances in core modules where we use Fedora's {{findObjects}} call... Similar in spirit to ISLANDORA-1459, just looking to reduce the number of ways in which we perform queries.    * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/blob/32af8201a4ffa22ef4b2c23015f0e02b73fa14ca/islandora_compound_object.module#L328  * https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7b69eb32c25338e1b037b33ca999d69f7d25cbee/includes/solution_packs.inc#L482    --Use Case--    Simplify logic by reducing the number of methods in which queries are performed.    --Technical Approach--    Replace queries with equivalent logic.    --Test Case--    Things continue to work as they do now.    --Impact--    None foreseen.    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Change default device profile for PDF-to-TIFF conversions to 'tiff24nc'
description: In islandora_paged_content_upload_pdf_form() the recommended and default 'Image Format' selection is 32-bit CMYK [islandora_paged_content_upload_pdf_form](https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/7.x/includes/upload_pdf.form.inc#L37-L49).  Kakadu's kdu_compress, as Islandora uses it however, will fail when it tries to process a CMYK colorspace file.  (kdu_compress will create a JPX (JPEG2000 Part 2) file using CMYK colorspace; a JP2 (JPEG2000 Part 1) file cannot have a colorspace other than sRGB.)  That forces Islandora to use the slower ImageMagick conversion routine.

title: Add sorting to the Solr collection display query backend
description: Bit of an inconsistency between the SPARQL and Solr collection display backends - the SPARQL backend uses an ORDER BY to sort the results, whereas the Solr backend just goes by the default Solr sort, whatever that may be.    This isn't really optimal; it means that in order to get an alphabetical (or alphanumerical or what have you) sort into the collection display, you're forcing Solr searches to be alphanumerical as well. Otherwise, your collection display winds up being score-based. It's not a great choice to have to make.    What's more, the way one collection is sorted may not make sense for a separate collection with different metadata that's indexed in a different way.    I'd like to set up the Solr collection display backend to run sorting like this:  * Use a collection-specific sort string if available  * If none is available, use the default collection display backend sort string.  * If that isn't set either, use the default Solr sort.    --Use Case--  An institution would like to use the Solr collection display backend, but would also like to sort their collections alphabetically, or alphanumerically, or by some other scheme, rather than in the same way search results are sorted, without impacting the way search results are sorted.    --Technical Approach--  A slight modification to the existing solr collection display backend would have to be added to include a default sort string, if that's what's wanted.    We should find a way as well to add this to the collection level, e.g, using a relationship on the collection that defines the sort string.    --Test Case--  Switch to the Solr collection display backend for collection queries.    The collection should be sorted on:  * the collection sort string, if it exists  * the default collection sort string, if it doesn't exist  * the default solr sort string, if that doesn't exist either    --Impact--  If it's implemented in the above way, I don't see us running into any problems. By using those fallbacks, it won't mess around with existing installs.    ----  QA (... Dev? RM?) Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Islandora Scholar php library not listed as requirement
description: The above mentioned library is not listed as a requirement for Islandora Scholar to function.   As a result, Islandora Scholar and citeproc modules get installed fine - and can be activated, but until the php library is added to /site/all/libraries an htttp 500 error will occur when trying to create a citation object using citation content model.

title: Expose Tuque connection parameters for configuration
description: --Use Case--    Some parameters were not available for configuration, and we need to configure them.    --Technical Approach--    Add an alter during the construction phase of the connection object to allow the parameters to be set as desired.    --Test Case--    Somewhat of a difficult one... Throwing together a module exposing the important bits.    --Impact--    Negligible performance, greater ability to configure.    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Add Drupal Rules Support
description: Rules event: Bag created    It would also be nifty if there was an event that could be fired when bag creation begins, so the events would effectively be "bag creation beginning", "bag creation finished".    Such rules would be very helpful for archivist's determining the status of a currently running ingest, in a workflow where "Create bag on object ingest" is enabled.

title: islandora Video module simplified installation
description: In an attempt to simplify video module installation I tried this :    START===================================================  sudo apt-add-repository ppa:archivematica/externals  sudo apt-get update  sudo apt-get install ffmpeg    download and install Islandora video.js module  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_videojs/archive/7.x-1.6.zip  NOTE: I installed as module rather than as library.    download and install Islandora Solution Pack Video  https://github.com/islandora/islandora_solution_pack_video/archive/7.x-1.6.zip    Configure Video solution pack as follows:  Viewer - select video.js player  Keep original files after ingest - Checked  Path to ffmpeg executable /usr/bin/ffmpeg  Create .mkv derivative - Checked  Create display MP4 locally - Checked  MP4 audio codec - aac (not libfaac)  Create OGG locally - Checked  Path to Theora executable - ffmpeg2Theora (leave default)  Create thumbnail locally - Checked  Play OBJ datastream if MP4 is not present - Checked  Maximum files size for playing OBJ 500 MB    Specify in /etc/php5/apache2/php.ini (values can vary by setup)  upload_max_filesize=250M  post_max_size=250M  memory_limit=512M    sudo service apache2 reload  sudo service apache2 restart   END=====================================================    This works for me. The only issue is that it creates an error log "video.js not found" - presumably because the video module is looking for it in the /libraries folder. My guess that it might be easier to fix this than to keep the long and complicated video module installation as it currently stands.  Video module tests all pass except two items in .ogg derivative creation. I can live with this.    I am submitting this for your review. As I am not a developer I do not know what/if any repercussions this module installation method may have.    Thanks

title: New hook in islandora.module to replace Tuque object in use
description: A hook for replacing the Tuque object in use will allow for various customizations and overrides to Tuque behavior.

title: Audit Solr calls in Islandora Entities SP
description: A quick search of the code reveals numerous calls to Solr not taking into consideration Islandora Solr defaults.    eg: namespace restrictions    callbacks.inc     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 94:11]   entities_rss.inc     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 73:11]   utilities.inc     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 140:11]     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 215:11]   utilities.inc     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 328:11]   theme.inc     $solr = new Apache_Solr_Service($url['host'], $url['port'], $url['path'] . '/');      [position 126:11]      Each call will have to be examined to determine what defaults it should respect. Perhaps we shouldn't be using new Apache_Solr_Service directly, and using / altering the query_processor class.    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Tags inside tabs inside forms have issues
description: When a form is created that contains tag fields inside tabs, adding a new tab carries over any existing tags (which are first emptied).

title: Breadcrumbs being called superfluous when viewing an object
description: When viewing an islandora object, the title as well as breadcrumbs are being generate a second time that is handled by the title callback present in the menu callback: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/islandora.module#L140-L141.    This happens in other places within the code base as well which do not need to be handled due to the how Drupal handles inheritance through MENU_LOCAL_TASKs: https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/modules!system!system.api.php/function/hook_menu/7.    --Use Case--  View an object, note how the breadcrumbs and title is set.    --Technical Approach--  Reduce the amount of times we are recursing through the RI needlessly.    --Test Case--  View an object, note how the breadcrumbs and title don't change.    --Impact--  Any custom module calling islandora_view_object directly will cease to have their title and breadcrumbs set such as compound: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/blob/7.x/islandora_compound_object.module#L255.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Compound autocomplete validation
description: The compound association form ({{islandora/object/%islandora_object/manage/compound}}) does not sufficiently validate its input, blindly assuming that what has been input is a valid PID for an accessible object.    Found during the testing of ISLANDORA-1586.    --Steps to Reproduce--    # Go to the association form on an object ({{islandora/object/%islandora_object/manage/compound}})  # Enter text(/something which does not match a valid PID) into the "add child" field (do _not_ select an autocomplete result).  # Submit the form. An error similar to the following should be emitted:    {noformat}  Fatal error: Call to a member function get() on a non-object in /var/www/drupal7/sites/all/modules/islandora_solution_pack_compound/includes/manage.form.inc on line 152    Call Stack:      0.0001     648888   1. {main}() /var/www/drupal7/index.php:0      0.5125    9777216   2. menu_execute_active_handler() /var/www/drupal7/index.php:21      0.5127    9781152   3. call_user_func_array:{/var/www/drupal7/includes/menu.inc:527}() /var/www/drupal7/includes/menu.inc:527      0.5127    9781640   4. islandora_compound_object_manage() /var/www/drupal7/includes/menu.inc:527      0.5127    9781808   5. drupal_get_form() /var/www/drupal7/sites/all/modules/islandora_solution_pack_compound/includes/manage.form.inc:14      0.5127    9783208   6. drupal_build_form() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:130      0.5342   10000528   7. drupal_process_form() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:385      0.5381   10102792   8. drupal_validate_form() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:889      0.5381   10103704   9. _form_validate() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:1189      0.5388   10106064  10. form_execute_handlers() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:1459      0.5389   10110776  11. islandora_compound_object_manage_form_validate() /var/www/drupal7/includes/form.inc:1519    {noformat}    --Test Case--    Following the reproduction steps, the listed fatal error does not occur, by either (or ideally both):  * validating the input appears to be a PID  * verify the object has loaded before attempting to access its properties    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: After Islandora 1.6/Drupal 7.41 upgrade, PROXY_MP3 datastream is downloaded to Drupal temp using .MP2 file extension
description: After Islandora 1.6/Drupal 7.41 upgrade, PROXY_MP3 datastream is downloaded to Drupal temp with .MP2 file extension.   Previously, PROXY_MP3 datastream was downloaded to Drupal temp with .MP3 file extension.    Browser throwing warning:  Media resource https://goldmine.uncc.edu/islandora/object/uncc%3A79/datastream/PROXY_MP3/file_name_spoof.mp3 could not be decoded.    JW Player throwing error:  Error playing media: MediaError { code=3,  MEDIA_ERR_ABORTED=1,  MEDIA_ERR_NETWORK=2    JW Player does not support MP2 file extension:  https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:oBLMM56A9K0J:https://support.jwplayer.com/customer/portal/articles/1403635-media-format-reference+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=us    Link for testing purposes (01-28-16 1:17 PM)  https://goldmine.uncc.edu/islandora/object/uncc%3A117

title: Create a module that allows swapping out queries via hooks
description: Currently, SPARQL queries are hard-coded into Islandora in several places throughout various modules to provide things like lists of objects. This hard-ties us to several things - most importantly driving a huge chunk of the site display through the triplestore.    The work done as part of this ticket should accomplish two things:    1. Create a module to provide a user interface and hooks to allow for swapping individual queries out. The module should provide a hook to register queries available for implementation and report them to the user interface; this hook should describe the registered query's required variables and return values. The module should also provide a hook to allow modules to implement registered queries; this second hook should accept anything necessary to trigger a query callback (e.g., file location, callable, etc). The api.php should also describe how a sample callback function may look.    2. Wrap existing queries in a module_exists() call to check for this new module. If the module is enabled, default querying behaviour should be swapped out for results provided by callbacks defined by the query registry.    Doing all of this will provide a simple, integrated interface for managing queries, which should be a marked improvement over the current query management style where query management is either handled in multiple places or is not handled at all due to hard-coding    This ticket does not deal with actually implementing any of the new queries, only to provide the ability for them to be implemented. Once we have this ticket completed and have examples of the hooks in use, we can then set about implementing as many of the queries as we can so we can start to move away from driving the site display using Mulgara.    This will require extensive testing; any queries that are affected by this should be checked to see if existing functionality remains when the module is not installed, and that query-swapping functions correctly if it is. Queries affected should be documented so that this testing can take place.

title: Exclude specified objects from OAI
description: We have certain objects we would like to exclude from OAI harvesting.    Yes, we can use XACML to make an object private, temporally, so it will be omitted from harvesting.   However, such a technique only works well when you have a known, scheduled harvest coming.    The new feature could take the form of a list of namespace:PIDs.    An additional method could use wildcarding *namespace*.      Both could be implemented in a textarea very similar to the way Drupal handles Page Visibility.

title: Scholar embargoes don't respect roles
description: Currently embargoes are implemented by applying XACML policies to objects restricting access to all but administrators and the object's owner. The permission "can embargo any object" provided by the module has the description "User can add or remove embargo on any object in repository", but this is not the case since any role granted this permission is unable to access the object due to the user-centric XACML policy.     FSU has several staff at the graduate school who need to be able to manage embargoes independently on ETDs. We created a low-power "embargo_admin" role with just these permissions, but even with the proper permissions assigned they were still unable to access items with an object-level embargo.    I have submitted a pull request with the code we added to the module at FLVC. It does a check for all all roles with the "can embargo any object" permission and adds that role to the XACML policy. This does not work retroactively though, so objects embargoed under the old code will need to have the embargo lifted and reapplied for the roles to get access.    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/pull/220

title: Batch ingest appends colon to title in DC record
description: I zipped audio, basic image, and PDF files with associated MODS XML files and the resulting objects had colons after their titles. The MODS Datastreams were created correctly, but the colon appears in the DC metadata (and in the collection view).  In the object view, the title appears as the original filename (instead of the title specified in the DC metadata).

title: Batch ingest fails when title contains ampersands (and possibly other special chars)
description: Any record with an ampersand (&) in it fails to load during batch ingesting. Submitter had to strip ampersands from all titles (in a batch of 1550 records) to successfully ingest.    The records ingested use the Thesis content model, though it likely affects others as well.
