title: If dsid for Islandora FITS is not TECHMD, you are unable to regenerate the dsid
description: If the Technical metadata datastream ID variable is set to something other than TECHMD, a user unable able to regenerate the datastream.    See:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_fits/blob/7.x/islandora_fits.module#L65  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_fits/blob/7.x/islandora_fits.module#L82

title: Avoid using the RI to query for pages within books and newspapers
description: Currently querying for pages uses the RI to retrieve a list of pages and their dimensions (if available) for use within viewers and the "pages" tab.    --Use Case--  View an object within a viewer context or through the pages tab/management interface. All pages are currently grabbed using the resource index which can perform poorly on sites that have a large breadth or depth of objects.    --Technical Approach--  Utilize the Solr index to retrieve the pages quicker than relying on the RI. If the Solr query fails to retrieve results whether due to misconfiguration/Solr error/whathaveyou it'll default back to using the RI.    --Test Case--  Toggle the checkbox in the configuration for the paged content module and ensure that the three Solr fields for the "Solr width", "Solr height" and "Solr page sequence" field are configured correctly. Note that the before and after rendering of pages is the same in both the viewer and pages tab.    --Impact--  None.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Wrong double encoding for some $object->labels when used in display
description: Compound solution pack, when working in JAIL mode composites the main object's label and a child one into the page title using drupal_set_title.  This can be seen at:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/blob/7.x/islandora_compound_object.module#L528-L533    This piece of code, part of https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_compound/pull/56    Double encodes entities like "&".  drupal_set_title() by default uses check_plain https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes%21bootstrap.inc/function/drupal_set_title/7 for output  filter_xss() converts & to &  This produces a double "&" encoding.    Since the expected behaviour is to not render HTML in titles (for object labels, because check_plains disallows them, having filter_xss is not a good idea, because that particular function was build to deal with HTML.    Solution (pull to come) is:     `if ($compound_info) {          drupal_set_title(t('@parent - @child', array(            '@parent' => $compound_info['parent_label'],            '@child' => $compound_info['label'],          )), PASS_THROUGH);        }`  Allow @ replacement to deal with check_plain (same functionality as doing a direct drupal_set_title) and make drupal_set_title bypass check plain.    This behaviour is also seen in islandora core, when editing an object label (properties management) and adding html to the label, makes the "delete button" which displays the object label double encode html and entities.  At: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/object_properties.form.inc#L89-L90    The label is passed as @ which already does check_plain and then during theming drupal uses https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes%21common.inc/function/drupal_attributes/7  applying check_plain() again.    Same for the message after label change  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/object_properties.form.inc#L132-L134

title: Align 'islandora_objects_subset' with 'islandora_basic_collection_wrapper'
description: A side-effect of using SOLR to drive the collection display, causes non-display of collection description data:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/commit/ed2b5bc6d40aca9274db9689588647cb4e5affd3#commitcomment-15927838    [~daitken] conducted research into the issue, here are his findings:    "As for the overarching issue, it looks like the legacy SPARQL backend is being run through the 'islandora_basic_collection_wrapper' theme, which is what generates all that fancy metadata, and the newer backends are being run through the 'islandora_objects_subset' theme that gets manually wrapped in metadata - but the metadata wrapper doesn't have any alters for collection objects that mimic how metadata is built for the legacy SPARQL backend."    Source: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/commit/ed2b5bc6d40aca9274db9689588647cb4e5affd3#commitcomment-15979555    Furthermore, [~daitken] says:    "It sounds like an improvement task - something that brings the metadata display when using 'islandora_objects_subset' more in line with the metadata display when using 'islandora_basic_collection_wrapper'"

title: Typo in tip
description: In the following instruction, the word "retractively" should be replaced with the proper spelling: "retroactively".    "Select a collection to retractively enable checksums on."    [See screenprint.]

title: function islandora_get_extension_for_mimetype() should not be used for (mime->ext) lookups
description: function islandora_get_extension_for_mimetype() should not be used for (mime->ext) lookups.  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/mimetype.utils.inc#L17    When used for (mime->ext) lookups, the result is a pure guess:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/includes/mimetype.utils.inc#L28    See issue links below for resulting symptoms and side effects:

title: TECHMD datastream is hard-coded in user messages
description: Following on from https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1606, there are locations in the module where the TECHMD dsid is displayed to the user. These should also use the variable_get() to display the correct name.    ie. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_fits/blob/c1878481635489f42977a224980c8fbfe6dc938e/includes/derivatives.inc#L171    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_fits/blob/c1878481635489f42977a224980c8fbfe6dc938e/includes/derivatives.inc#L185

title: DS-COMPOSITE files specify TECHMD but the dsid could be different
description: The DS-COMPOSITE-MODEL specifies the TECHMD datastream ID in it and is used for derivative creation in batch. If we allow users to change the DSID, then we have to find a way to modify these other XML files.    It brings up the larger question of why we let users change the DSID name of this solution pack and not others?
component: Audio Solution Pack,FITS module,Large Image Solution Pack,Video Solution Pack

title: Take advantage of new GitHub functionality, and setup, and pull request templates for each Islandora Foundation module
description: Creating a ticket since it was briefly brought up on the committers call today.    https://github.com/blog/2111-issue-and-pull-request-templates    This is meant to be a place to start a discussion on if, and if we proceed, how we should proceed in implementing this.    I propose:    * Leave CONTRIBUTING.md in repo root  * Create .github folder  * Create PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md    ISSUE_TEMPLATE.md is basically done in the CONTRIBUTING.md.  PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md is basically done as well (don't have the link handy while writing)    This could even be a newbie ticket if somebody new wants to tackle implementing it. Our, we could use it as a mentoring ticket, and a couple people could tag team it.    Looking forward to discussion :-)
component: Altmetrics,Audio Solution Pack,BagIt,Basic Image Solution Pack,Batch,Book Batch,Book Solution Pack,Bookmark,Checksum,Checksum Checker,citeproc-php,Collection Solution Pack,Compound Object Solution Pack,Disk Image Solution Pack,Drupal Servlet Filter,Entities Solution Pack,FITS module,Importer,Internet Archive Bookreader,Islandora Module (Core),JWPlayer,Large Image Solution Pack,MARCXML,Newspaper Batch,Newspaper Solution Pack,OAI Provider,Objective Forms,OCR,OpenSeadragon,Paged Content,Pathauto,PDF Solution Pack,PDF.js,PHP Lib,Populator,PREMIS,Scholar Module,Simple Workflow,Solr Facet Pages,Solr Metadata,Solr Search,Solr Views,Tuque API,Usage Stats,Video Solution Pack,Video.js,Web ARChive Solution Pack,XACML Editor,XACML Policies,XML Form Builder,XML Form Element: FieldPanel,XML Sitemap

title: Long curl_exec - slow performance
description: If you access TN datastream content directly through url on Fedora server, time of loading image is ~5ms and going through Drupal's datastreams/TN/contents is ~400-500ms+ depending on number of modules loaded (by disabling XML Forms time drastically goes down). Also, directly using tuque library functions in PHP code (not using anything Drupal related), object load time is also ~300ms+.    xdebug trace of $repository->getObject("dummy")->getDatastream("TN")->content shows long period before curl_exec is done executing for http://server:8080/fedora/objects/dummy?format=xml    Major problem we have is long page load time when browsing all objects using islandora solr search.    Our solr-fedora server is separate from Drupal but wget for object from fedora server takes ~10ms.    Any input for optimizing page load time is valuable.

title: Add additional flag to book batch to output the set ID when preprocessing completes
description: Lets the set ID of a preprocessed set be printed out via the drush command when complete.    --Use Case--  Let the set ID of the newly preprocessed set be displayed and potentially used as input in other scripts when preprocessing completes.    --Technical Approach--  Print the set id.    --Test Case--  Preprocess a set of items to be ingested.  The set ID of the set is printed out when complete.    --Impact--  None.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Tuque and 32-bit PHP: Can't ingest files over 2GB
description: For anyone using 32-bit PHP, files over 2GB can't be successfully ingested into Islandora. Note that the 64-bit versions of PHP for Windows still treat integers as 32-bit.    I have two pull requests pending, which offer a potential solution to this problem.  * Tuque 1.x: https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/pull/133  * Tuque 1.7: https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/pull/134    The only JIRA ticket I found that describes a similar issue is https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1178, although the solution at the time was to update the documentation.

title: Add the following predicates to Islandora RELS-EXT Ontology
description: From the Islandora Ontology Audit  inheritXacmlFrom  create_pdf  hasPageProgression  email-admin-when-ingested  book-batched  newspaper-batched  width

title: Add the following predicates to Islandora RELS-INT Ontology
description: Add:  isManageable_by_user  isManageable_by_role  isViewableByRole  isViewableByUser    Change:  height -> height_literal  width -> width_literal

title: Allow for only certain types of Bookmarks to be retrieved from the database.
description: --Use Case--  As Bookmark implements a class based architecture arbitrary custom types can be created. It's possible that we may only want to retrieve certain types of Bookmarks.    --Technical Approach--  Move away from db_query to use db_select such that we can pass an optional condition when specified.    --Test Case--  The "My bookmarks" menu path (islandora-bookmark) still shows all bookmark lists sorted by listids.    --Impact--  None    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: 'Show More / Show Less' on field values with a maximum length
description: 'Show More / Show Less' will produce munged up code when linking a trimmed field value to object page or search results page when configured to be of maximum length. I believe the culprit is here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/blob/7.x/includes/utilities.inc#L356 (wrapping links in links?). I have been able to reproduce this locally, and as the code implies, this only appears happens on display fields that are trimmed to a max length AND linked to a search result or object page. This creates broken or invalid html, and as a result, causes unexpected behavior with surrounding elements. Namely, the show more and show less links not functioning.     --Steps to Reproduce--  1: Add a default display field of appropriate length  2: Click configure  3: Select 'Link this field to the object's page. ' or 'Link the value to a Solr search result.'  4: Expand Maximum Length field set, and select 'Limit length of whole field'  5: Add a Maximum Length less then the characters that would appear in the value of the selected field.      --Test Case--  Follow the steps to reproduce, and ensure the show more/show less links produce valid output, and function as intended.     Tags:  [~jordandukart]    ----  Morgan Dawe  Themer/Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Allow HOCR bounding box rendering from other sources than tesseract
description: --Use Case--  Allow other OCR engine's HOCR to render bounding boxes within IAV and OpenSeadragon.    --Technical Approach--  Strip down the specific tesseract related things we rely upon in HOCR rendering code that aren't actually bubbled up and used in the theme layer for either of the viewers that render it. HOCR specification is varying loose as to what's required and the original implementation used tesseract's output as a basis for Islandora's implementation.    --Test Case--  Books:    Test out HOCR generated via tesseract and have bounding boxes applied correctly when searching for terms within the IAV book.    Newspapers:    From search results from a specific indexed term bounding boxes are rendered correctly on the newspaper page when a result is clicked.    Will provide sample assets of other generated HOCR and a JP2 when I receive an uncopyrighted source copy that I can attach.    --Impact--  None.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Google Scholar Search link fails to render search with no DOI when objects ingested manually
description: In the Scholar module, when "Render Google Scholar Search link" is enabled and the default settings are used, the rendered search is an empty query (q="") for objects that have no DOI, despite the setting to use the title field when no DOI exists. This applies only to objects that were ingested manually (via the form).    The ingest form creates an empty <identifier type="doi"/> line in the MODS XML, which Scholar incorrectly interprets as a DOI being present. If the MODS XML is downloaded, the line deleted, and replaced, the query correctly includes the title field.    This empty <identifier type="doi"/> is generated by the default citation form included with Scholar, as well as custom forms that I created.    Objects with no DOI ingested via batch ingest, which did not include the empty <identifier> field, render the GS query properly - see http://arcabc.ca/islandora/object/unbc%3A6116 for example.    This issue was tested and confirmed on our production repository (at arcabc.ca) and on Vagrant (see attached screenshot).

title: Islandora_batch Does not allow modsCollection root element in drush ingest.
description: Islandora_batch does not allow a MODS xml with the root element of modsCollection to be ingested through drush ingest. The ingest will not fail but the xml will be ignored and a basic MODs datastream that just contains the title taken from the file title will be ingested.     --Use Case--  Will allow modsCollection root elements and not just mods root elements.       --Technical Approach--  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_batch/blob/7.x/includes/islandora_scan_batch.inc#L383-Lundefined  This is the line that is causing the current issue. $s_xml->getName() will not == 'mods' with the root of modsCollection. Allowing both root elements will produce the appropriate MODs datastream.       --Test Case--  Attempt a drush ingest of an object with a corresponding MODs xml that has a root element of modsCollection. The MODs datastream should be populated correctly.     --Impact--  Should not prove to be a risky improvement.       ----  Kylea Jackson  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Optionally store original DSID when using the XSLT populator
description: --Use Case--  When using the XSLT populator a user may want to also create and store the original XML that is being transformed from.    --Technical Approach--  Create and store an XML based datastream containing the original uploaded file's content.    --Test Case--  Create an XSLT populator association and toggle the ability to store the original in the configurable DSID textfield.  Attach a file to transform.  Ingest.  Both the original and transformed datastreams are present.    --Impact--  None.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Fix Broken links to Tesseract in README.md
description: All links to Tesseract in README.md need updating due to the project moving from Google Code to Github.

title: Required Tesseract version number wrong in README.md
description: Line 11 of README.md says:    "Islandora Book Solution Pack currently uses Tesseract version 3.2.2, which can be obtained from the project home page. Lower versions are not supported."    ...but the code says:  {code}  $tesseract_required_version_number = '3.02.02';  {code}  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/blob/7.x/includes/utilities.inc#L52    I believe 3.2.2 is a typo in README.md    I'll gladly fix README.md if someone would like to confirm my findings.

title: Islandora_google_scholar is changing just year dates to current year.
description: In islandora_google_scholar if a date from the mods is currently already in the format of just the year and not y/m/d etc. it will be returned from the islandora_google_scholar_parse_date_foryear function as the current year. https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/7.x/modules/islandora_google_scholar/islandora_google_scholar.module#L179 the DateTime will return todays date and time if just handed a year for $date.     *Steps to Reproduce*  In a MODS xml add dateIssued as just a year and check the source to see the meta tags added by islandora_google_scholar (if enabled). The   {code:java}  <meta name="citation_publication_date" content="">  {code}   will reflect the current year.       *Test Case*  In a MODS xml add dateIssued as just a year and check the source to see the meta tags added by islandora_google_scholar (if enabled). The   {code:java}  <meta name="citation_publication_date" content="">  {code}   will correctly reflect the year entered in the MODS         ----  Kylea Jackson  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: PHP stat cache is inconsistent, causing failures in Tuque
description: PHP stat cache becomes inconsistent, leading to Tuque failures.    This long-standing bug appears to have been uncovered with the Drupal 7.42 release, in which [static caching was added to {{module_load_include()}}|https://github.com/drupal/drupal/commit/f0d59102f528a9c66b1c3355bb6b2ee48f8b0282].    The general flow of code necessary to make this happen, is:  # {{fopen()}} a file  # Perform an operation which performs a "stat" on the file ({{filesize()}}, among others).  # Change the content of the file, which will change the previously stat'd value (deleting from the file, reducing its length).  # Stat the file again; the value will match that from before.    A small test script, to see the error happen: https://gist.github.com/adam-vessey/386494830670a19e0f97    It so happens this flow would occur when generating HOCR, when we strip out the HTML DOCTYPE declarations; however, it appears that the {{is_file()}} check which would always be performed prior to the static caching in {{module_load_include()}} would result in a general wipe of the stat cache, masking the issue.    With HOCR in particular:  # {{fopen()}} a file: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/blob/8c1248bdc29324cee7863d835b22832085763d1d/includes/hocr.inc#L584-L585  # Perform an operation which performs a "stat" on the file: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/blob/8c1248bdc29324cee7863d835b22832085763d1d/includes/hocr.inc#L587 (the {{filesize()}} call)  # Change the content of the file, which will change the previously stat'd value: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ocr/blob/8c1248bdc29324cee7863d835b22832085763d1d/includes/hocr.inc#L588-L591  # Stat the file again; the value will match that from before: https://github.com/Islandora/tuque/blob/5c6bb1c831f52d9bc014729e325a7f731d772d0f/HttpConnection.php#L657    This caused Tuque to tell Fedora that it would be sending more bytes then Tuque had to send, so it would end up with errors as Fedora waits for the rest of the bytes to come in:  {noformat}  WARN 2016-03-08 08:49:48.807 [http-bio-8080-exec-29] (DatastreamResource) Error writing temp stream  org.fcrepo.server.errors.StreamWriteException: Error writing temp stream          at title: Solr settings: Add a confirmation screen before "Reset to default"
description: The Solr Settings page (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings) includes a "Reset to defaults" button, which wipes out all customizations a user has made. Clicking the button resets them immediately, meaning there is a high chance that an administrator could reset the defaults (and lose a lot of work) by accident.    Suggest adding a confirmation dialog beofre the reset button takes effect.

title: --create_pdfs: Add support for creating and storing PDF of entire book
description: After reviewing the following code, I believe all "--create_pdfs" is doing today is setting islandora_paged_content to create a PDF for each page:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_book_batch/blob/7.x/includes/islandora_book_batch.inc#L407-L409    I wish book batch supported islandora_paged_content's option of combining all page PDFs into a single PDF stored in the book object:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/blob/7.x/includes/manage_pages.inc#L140

title: More options for Altmetric identifiers (beyond DOI)
description: It would be really valuable to use Altmetric's capabilities for tracking objects without a DOI, as the current implementation of this module is quite limiting.    Altmetric tracks a number of things as standard: PMID, arXivID, ADS ID, SSRN, RePEC ID, Handle.net ID, and even the URI itself.    API guidelines for fetching details by URI are here: http://api.altmetric.com/docs/call_uri.html    Would be useful to have the module look first at DOI, then if not DOI use X, if not X use Y, if not Y use URI sort of thing... Could possibly recycle the code from the Scholar module's Google Scholar search link generator, which searches by DOI first, and if no DOI then uses Title.

title: Usage Stats' IP exclusion list should allow wildcards
description: For institutions, it would be useful to block entire IP ranges from the Islandora Usage Stats records. In our specific case, being able to exclude 137.149.66.* would save us from typing (and managing) a very long list. Right now, the usage stats module just checks if the IP address is in an array.

title: Nesting level too deep
description: When trying to enable modules an error was generated. This was on a more advanced PHP than usual (PHP 5.5.9):    PHP Fatal error:  Nesting level too deep - recursive dependency? in ...libraries/tuque/Object.php on line 562    Moving to a strict object equality check prevents the recursion.      Steps to Reproduce:  Try to enable solution packs on PHP 5.5.9.  Note that the enable fails with the indicated error.      Test Case:  Apply fix.  Try to enable solution packs on PHP 5.5.9.  Enable succeeds.    ----  William Panting  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Disagreements between hook naming convention and implementation in XML Form Builder
description: Somewhere along the way a disagreement has popped up between the names of XML Form Builder hooks and the actual implementations. For example:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/includes/associations.inc#L156  Refers to "xml_form_builder_get_transforms", whereas  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/islandora_entities.module#L537  Attempts to implement "islandora_xml_form_builder_get_transforms". That's what it used to be called in the .api.php:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/commit/202edf265ec8ff132b34daaac0beec44cf28decd  But that was fixed at some point:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/xml_form_builder.api.php#L32  And even then, this other hook in the .api.php currently uses the islandora_ prefix:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/builder/xml_form_builder.api.php#L17  Point being is we should get this stuff sorted out, because transforms and self-transforms are currently broken    --Use Case--  Ensure consistency with xml form hook names and calling the hooks has no issues.       --Technical Approach--  Make hook names consistent and make sure that changes to them are reflected when hooks are called.         --Test Case--  Ensure that XML Form Builder hooks are named using proper naming conventions, and that implementing them as described in the .api.php functions.     Grep around for existing implementations of these hooks and make sure none of them are broken.    --Impact--  Should not have associated risks.      ----  Your Name  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Adding non-citation, non-thesis objects into scholar profiles
description: Presently, the Entities Solution Pack is hard-coded to extract only Thesis and Citation objects into an associated Person's scholar profiles. (Relevant code here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/includes/utilities.inc#L116-L165)    We propose an  improvement to the Entities Solution Pack, allowing the administrator to select on an admin screen which content models are included in a Person object's scholar profile. Currently only theses and citations are included; this update would provide the option to add (or remove) any of the Islandora content models.    Pieces to consider:  * Under the "Recent Citations" feed, objects could be separated under headings, according to content model  * Additional tabs created for each content model (alongside the Citations and Theses tabs that already exist)  * Tabs should not be visible if there are no objects from that content model (note that right now, tabs are still present even if no content exists - see example: http://www.google.com/url?q=http%3A%2F%2Farcabc.ca%2Fislandora%2Fobject%2Ftru%253A42%2Ftheses&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AFQjCNHjIp_AEUwzAdfwqzCAob8O5FEQHA)  * On the admin screen, administrator should be able to select whether or not to include objects that are children of compound objects  * Admins would have to update their forms to create an author identifier field (or other appropriate field) for the Entities SP to look up. Documentation will be needed so people will know precisely what kind of MODS field the SP is looking for.

title: Enable Islandora Scholar Embargo to integrate with third party modules
description: I need to be able to have embargoes apply to any datastream on any content model, and to groups (categories) of datastreams (e.g. "derivatives", "metadata"), and to have embargoes be applied by user role (see attached screenshots). As I have begun work on this, I have found that I cannot accomplish everything I need with current extensibility of the Islandora Scholar Embargo module.  I will initiate some pull-requests to provide the multiple datastreams capability directly (mentioned in comments, but not built in the current module) and hooks to permit third party modules into various points as needed.

title: Cache the newspaper issue list
description: Use Drupal's Cache API to cache the list of newspaper issues. Preliminary testing on a newspaper with about 200,00 pages shows that caching the issue list can result in page render times that drop from over 30 seconds for the uncached version versus about 50-60 ms for the cached version. I'll wait until after the 7.x-1.7 release to open PRs, but if anyone wants to test they can get the code from https://github.com/mjordan/islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/tree/cache_issue_list.

title: List of months in issue browser should appear next to year
description: In the newspaper solution pack's issue list browse interface, clicking on years that are not near the top of the list (i.e., that are below the browser window's bottom horizon) appears to do nothing. The collapsible list of months and days gets updated to reflect the issues in the current year, but the user can't see it since it is *above* the browser window's top horizon and out of view. The attached screencap (complete with bitmapped misspelling) illustrates.    I think most users expect to see the list of months and issues appear next to the year they click on, a behavior they would have seen if they clicked on a year near the top of the list.

title: Batch commands in drush get really far before failing if arguments are slightly wrong.
description: Small errors in command lines result in hard to diagnose errors - even rejection at the Fedora level.     eg. using ```--content_models=islandora:sp_basic_image_cmodel``` will cause a 400 error from Fedora, which, in the logs, is because the DSID was null, which was actually because the content model didn't exist.     e.g. using ```--type=dir``` complains that ```Error: Call to undefined method IslandoraScanBatch::scanDir() in /var/www/drupal/htdocs/sites/all/modules/islandora_batch/includes/islandora_scan_batch.inc, line 35 ``` which makes sense when you realize it's ```--type=directory```. This is unobvious to diagnose because it was composed into a function variable, scanDir().     Can we validate the options before proceeding with batch preprocess?

title: Document how to handle discrepancies between the code base and https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_ontology
description: Proposed addition to the README:  There may be discrepancies between the ontology as published and the codebase and that these issues will need to be resolved. In this case, a JIRA ticket should be submitted against the ontology and/or codebase.  Strong preference for the existing ontology should be shown in conflicts with new code and strong preference for the existing codebase (as it exists at the time of acceptance) should be shown if a conflict is found with the ontology.

title: ZIP Importer tosses warning when no primary datastream is detected
description: When zip importing a zip (such as the one on the ticket) to a content model where a primary datastream is not matched a warning will be thrown as it's possible a boolean is being attempted to be foreached.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Go to the book collection.  ZIP import the attached zip.  Note how there is a foreach warning thrown.    --Test Case--  Do the above and no warning.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Add auto-remove completed batch set's option to batch module admin form
description: Add a checkbox option to auto-remove completed batch set's option to batch module admin form, defaults to disabled.    --Use Case--  Check the box when processing batch sets.    --Technical Approach--  Add a checkbox to the admin form which will call the function to remove the batch set.    ----  Brandon Morrissey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Solr results field truncation links always displayed
description: Ticket https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1623 create a bug. When field truncation is enabled, the Show More / Show Less links are always displayed regardless if the field was actually truncated or not.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Enable field truncation on a field in Solr display settings.  Set the max length to 200 characters  Complete a Solr search  Fields with a value less than 200 characters will display "Show More"      --Test Case--  Repeat the steps to reproduce  Fields with less than 200 characters should NOT display a "Show More" link      ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Included cleanup XSLTs not removing empty names when roleTerms exist
description: The cleanup self-transforms included with Islandora (i.e. islandora_cleanup_mods_extended.xsl) do not clean up empty parent elements if a prepopulated (but unwanted) child element exists.    Example: http://arcabc.ca/islandora/object/islandora%3A195/datastream/MODS/view#overlay-context=islandora/object/islandora%253A195    Detailed example:     The default Thesis form comes with different Name fields for specific roles, such as Author and Thesis Advisor. The roleTerms are prepopulated, and the submitter fills in namePart.    From the Form Builder:    Parent Tabpanel: <name type='personal'><role><roleTerm authority="marcrelator" type="text">author</roleTerm></role></name>    Child elements:   <namePart type='given'>%value%</namePart>    <namePart type='family'>%value%</namePart>    When filling in the form, for any fields left blank (in this case the Name field), an XML element is created looking like this:  <name type="personal">  <role>  <roleTerm authority="marcrelator" type="text">author</roleTerm>  </role>  </name>    It looks like because the <name> element contains some data (i.e. the populated roleTerm element), the XSLT fails to recognize it as an empty field, and leaves it in the cleaned-up MODS.    I'm honestly not sure whether there's a simple/logical way to make the XSLT understand when a field that contains data is in fact empty. Some possible logic for this specific kind of case might be that if a <name> field contains a <role> but no <namePart>, it should be considered empty.

title: Islandora Batch drush interface throws 401 Unauthorized errors when default front page is an Islandora object
description: Islandora Batch's drush interface throws HTTP 401 Unauthorized errors during derivative generation if Drupal's default front page is set to be an Islandora object's URL (tested with both collection and non-collection object URLs). Derivatives are not successfully created.    This error could be related to the following block of code in islandora_batch.drush.inc:    {noformat}  function drush_islandora_batch_scan_preprocess() {    // XXX: Due to how Drush bootstrapping works, the connection may be created    // without credentials (when your site's front page is    // 'islandora/object/some:object', for example). Resetting to ensure a new    // connection gets created should fix it.    drupal_static_reset('islandora_get_tuque_connection');    $connection = islandora_get_tuque_connection();  {noformat}    Changing the site's default front page to something that is not the URL of an Islandora object results in error-free batch importing via the drush interface, as does enabling "Defer derivative generation during ingest" in the Islandora config options. Also, importing via the GUI does not produce any errors regardless of what the site's default front page is set to.    I noticed this behaviour on an up-to-date Islandora Vagrant.

title: Author meta tags are not in correct order if in an array.
description: When there are multiple authors in the MODs, the meta tags to not keep the order they are in in the MODs which can cause issues with how they are presented on google scholar.     --Use Case--  Multiple authors need to retain an certain order so that lead author and contributors are correct.       --Technical Approach--  Will need to add a weighting to the citation_author elements so that the meta tags respect the ordering from MODs.      --Test Case--  A MODs with an array of authors in a specific order shows the same ordering in the html meta tags.     --Impact--  Should not prove to have associated risks.     ----  Kylea Jackson  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Enhance list of dependencies for JWPlayer module
description: The entry for the "JW Player Module" on the Drupal "Modules" page should show that "jwplayer.js" as a dependency. Currently, there is no indication that this dependency exists.    This is also true for the "Islandora video.js" module, which requires the vidoejs library.

title: Islandora bookmark sets $_SESSION for anonymous users
description: Islandora bookmark allows anonymous users to manage Bookmarks. This behaviour is implemented using global $_SESSION php variable, which to leads to drupal to initialise a full SESSION using  SESSxxxx cookie, (see https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/includes!bootstrap.inc/function/drupal_settings_initialize/7)    same used by Drupal to track current logged in users. This prevents caching systems like Varnish to detect correctly if a page is being viewed  by an anonymous User (and candidate for caching) or by a logged User(different caching strategy if any).    The correct behaviour for this operations could be to use   user_cookie_save() ) https://api.drupal.org/api/drupal/modules%21user%21user.module/function/user_cookie_save/7) which leads to a visitor cookie that does not interfere with caching mechanisms that relay on detecting an active logged user cookie, or relay on other mechanism.  Also, having a drupal session in place for anonymous users adds performance penalties  http://facingworlds.com/drupal-7-bootstrap-explained-drupalbootstrapsession-and-drupals-session-handling

title: JAIL display fails if access is denied to a sibling object
description: Conditions:  * Compound object with more than one child object.  * A child is protected from viewing by an xacml policy.  * The JAIL block is displayed.  * You are viewing one of the other child objects.    "RepositoryException: Unauthorized" is thrown, preventing display of the entire page. It's fine when you view the parent object, but as soon as you click on a child object to try to view it, you get the error.

title: Generate the newspaper Issue listing from Solr
description: In the spirit of improved performance, generate the listing of issues of a newspaper from Solr instead of from the resource index.

title: islandora-object-metadata legend display:none by default?
description: SOLR metadata display does not work out of the box because included stylesheet has metadata display set to "display:none"  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/css/islandora-person.css#L47-L49    I would like the solution pack to work smoother out of the box, so my vote is to make adjustments to the stylesheet and enable metadata display by default.    Please let me know your thoughts:

title: Drupal form element name collides between XML forms and datepicker
description: XML forms defines a datepicker element for use: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/elements/xml_form_elements.module#L54-L59. The Drupal contrib module datepicker also defines a datepicker element http://cgit.drupalcode.org/datepicker/tree/datepicker.module?h=7.x-1.x#n6.    The islandora_usage_stats module requires datepicker to be enabled to use datepicker_views for some date filtering functionality. As such when islandora_usage_stats and islandora_xml_forms are present on the same box install things collide and won't work as expected.    The Drupal date module supplies a date_popup module which provides the same functionality with an added time element. The common thread between islandora_xml_forms, datepicker and date_popup is they all utilize the same datepicker JS functionality so UI wise not much differs.   Similarly using the '#timepicker' => FALSE option on date_popup will render an identical element to islandora_xml_forms datepicker element functionality and all. The problem lies in that these custom properties aren't exposed to be set through formbuilder.    As such I see a couple of potential courses of action:  -Document around this (probably not the best)  -Deprecate and remove the element from islandora_xml_forms  -Rename the existing element within islandora_xml_forms to be unique    Grepping through all of core Islandora none of the forms/anywhere else are using an element type of '#datepicker'. However, some dgi clients do have instances of these in their forms albeit not using islandora_usage_stats in tow.

title: Document the meaning of isPageNumber and isSequenceNumber.
description: Follow-up ticket from ISLANDORA-1473.    The RELS-EXT predicates isPageNumber and isSequenceNumber are used by Paged Content, Book, Book Batch, and Newspaper Batch.     isPageNumber should contain the identifier written on or contained in the page itself, for example, 7, iv, or C3.    isSequenceNumber is used to order items within the paged content model, must be a nonNegative integer (positive integer?).     I believe (though cannot prove) that isPageNumber was functional in Islandora 6, it is never used in any official Islandora 7.x code after being set. The fact that this predicate is non-functional ('deprecated'?  'vestigial'? 'unimplemented'?) should be communicated somehow, perhaps in the ontology.

title: Names with non-lowercase roleterms missing in citations
description: If the roleTerm of a name is not all lower case, the name won't be included in the citation.    eg:  {code:xml}    <name type="personal">      <namePart>Hart, Nelson</namePart>      <role>        <roleTerm authority="marcrelator" type="text">Author</roleTerm>      </role>    </name>  {code}    --Steps to Reproduce--  Find or add a citation object via scholar module  Add an author to the record  Make sure the role/roleTerm is "Author"  The author with roleTerm "Author" won't be included in the rendered citation for the object    --Test Case--  Replace the MODS DS of a citation object with the supplied MODS XML  Prior to the PR the citation will be:  Last, F. (2014). Title about some citation. Some other title. Retrieved from http://someurl.com    After applying the PR, the citation will be:  Hart, N., & Last, F. (2014). Title about some citation. Some other title. Retrieved from http://someurl.com    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Scholar default forms incorrectly use lower-case roleTerm values.
description: The default scholar citation form uses <name> tags with <role><roleTerm authority="marcrelator" type="text"> values of 'author', 'editor', and 'translator'. This is incorrect. The marcrelator vocabulary includes 'Author', 'Editor', and 'Translator'.     The default thesis form also includes 'Thesis advisor' (correct), 'Committee member' (incorrect, not part of marcrelator), and 'Degree grantor' (incorrect; use 'Degree granting institution')    Prior to fixing https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1657, the correct roleTerm 'Author' would cause the author to not appear in the citation. Now that is fixed, I'd like to propose we stop supplying/requiring incorrect marcrelator values in our default form.     Ideas welcome for how we roll this out, especially in the case of the thesis form where the changes are more likely to impact resulting solr fields names.

title: Checksum Not Changing
description: Not sure if this is a bug and/or if it is isolated to 7.x-1.7  Trying to switch from SHA-1 to anything else    Going to Checksum Configuration > Checksum type > change value to another value  Select Collection > click enable  Appears to work. Click Save  Go to collection object > manage > PREMIS  Still original value, no change was was made.   Checked in Fedora and it's the same as the original. It says SHA-1. (Not sure if this mean anything)  Note: The original SHA-1 value is correct it just won't change.

title: Checksum duplicate versions
description: Apply 'RETROACTIVELY ENABLE CHECKSUMS' causes the creation of multiple versions of the derivatives.      Screenshot shows duplicates made and when check under image Datastreams this versions jump from 1 to 3 for most but not all derivatives.

title: apply islandora_solr_replace_slashes to field value
description: If "Link the value to a Solr search result." is enabled on a field, we should be running islandora_solr_replace_slashes on the field value to ensure the link will not blow up.    Steps to Reproduce  - add RELS_EXT_hasModel_uri_s in the solr display settings and enable "Link the value to a Solr search result." on the field.  - complete a simple solr search in the UI  - click on the new linked field value.  - prior to this fix, the link will return a 400 error  - after this fix is applied, the search will return all the objects having which ever model you clicked on.    Test Case  - refer to the 'steps to reproduce'    ----  Brandon Morrissey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: topic fields not appearing in form interface
description: To reproduce:  1. Add an object to a collection using thesis or citation content model  2. During ingest, when you get to the page that asks you to prepopulate metadata, select PMID populator  3. This was tested using 7998669 as the identifier  4. Ingest object and compare its MODS xml to the edit interface    Issue:  Sometimes topics are being generated under /mods/subject/titleInfo/title (which are not appearing in the form edit interface for citation and thesis content models). Topics under /mods/subject/topic appear in citation but not in thesis content models.    <subject authority="mesh">  <titleInfo>  <title>Self Care</title>  </titleInfo>  <topic>methods</topic>  </subject>

title: Islandora / Islandora OpenSeadragon HTTP proxies
description: As per the discussion on the committers list and https://groups.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/islandora-dev/8eSxcOtSlX4/pw_VAFZbAgAJ as context this ticket is an attempt to close the holes that are currently open within Islandora / Islandora OpenSeadragon.    Note: This ticket is created as sensitive, [~manez], [~nruest] or whomever can deem to open it. Similarly, I will push to my fork referencing these JIRA tickets but won't open pulls for the time being.    Changes being made:    Islandora:  -Removing the "download_clip" endpoint from the Islandora module and moving it to the OpenSeadragon module as that's the only place it's actually used.    Islandora OpenSeadragon:  -Changes to what parameters are being passed through the 'clip' $_GET parameter. Previously a fully constructed URL was passed through representing the URL to Djatoka. Now only the rft_id/svc.region parameters for Djatoka will be set on the clip ID as well as the dimensions of the current image. Any other parameters passed through 'clip' $_GET parameter will be ignored (https://github.com/jordandukart/islandora_openseadragon/blob/7.x-ISLANDORA-1696/includes/utilities.inc#L30-L85 and https://github.com/jordandukart/islandora_openseadragon/blob/7.x-ISLANDORA-1696/js/islandora_openseadragon.js#L64-L71)  -The URL constructed will use the Djatoka URL configured through the admin page for the module. Note that I tested this with both a relative and absolute URL.  -Downloading a clip will only occur if the 'clip' $_GET parameter constitutes a valid URL otherwise will drupal_access_denied and watchdog if not. (https://github.com/jordandukart/islandora_openseadragon/blob/7.x-ISLANDORA-1696/islandora_openseadragon.module#L270-L301)    Compares to reference:  Islandora: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/compare/7.x...jordandukart:7.x-ISLANDORA-1696?expand=1  Islandora OpenSeadragon: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_openseadragon/compare/7.x...jordandukart:7.x-ISLANDORA-1696?expand=1      Lastly, the https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/islandora.module#L157-L165 menu path is only referenced in places in direct conjunction with clipping functionality of OpenSeadragon. Ideally we could pull this out into Islandora OpenSeadragon but this comes with complications. Seeing as it references a theme call in its callback (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/7.x/islandora.module#L684) all implementations (large image/newspaper sps) of this would have to be updated to reference the new islandora_openseadragon prefixed hook. Would have included this in this ticket but there is at least one custom module that has a implementation of this ([~whikloj]'s institution) and there could be more outside of dgi.

title: Allow Solr facets and metadata display to use collection Title field for RELS_EXT_IsMemberOfCollection
description: While Solr facets and metadata display can show the collection an object belongs to, the object label given is "info:fedora/[PID]", which is not a useful display.    Example search results, using RELS_EXT_isMemberOfCollection_uri_ss for facet and display:     FACETS:  Collection  infofedora islandoraroot (12)  infofedora ircitationcollection (6)    METADATA DISPLAY FOR AN OBJECT:   dc.title:  Numerical modelling of airflow within and above forests and forest clearings using computational fluid dynamics.   Collection: info:fedora/ir:citationCollection    Preference would be to display the collection's dc.title field (or similar). Example ways to implement here:   https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/tXWkpx8VVTY    A new field like the one Jared offers in the linked discussion would be a very useful Core feature.      The above results came from Vagrant.

title: Node registry clean up of parent delete action causes warning
description: Introduced in https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1087, when having a delete action that references a node above the parent a warning will appear when cleaning up the node registry.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Use the attached form to create a sample document (or use the attached test XML).  Go delete a nested tag element.  Submit the form.  Note the node gets deleted but a warning is popped.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Enable pretty formatting of XML-forms output
description: I'm using the XML-forms module separate outside the context of the whole Islandora package or FC. So I'm not sure how this influences (if at all) Islandora itself.    Our use case is that we are directly using the output of Islandora XML forms. Using saveXML(). We are also sometimes viewing this output in a text editor, we would like to enable pretty formatting .    $xml_form = new XMLForm($form_state);  $document = $xml_form->submit($form, $form_state);  $document->saveXML()    A PR has been submitted here:  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/pull/223

title: License in composer.json conflicts with LICENSE file

title: Support for jpg, gif, and png
description: I would like to be able to use the large image solution pack to display jpgs in order to take advantage of the openseadragon viewer.    The derivatives.inc seems to support the OBJ datastream being either jpg, gif, or png. I have tried all three and they seem to create all the correct datastreams.    The image upload form, however, limits the upload to tiff or jp2.    I propose we add the extension jpg jpeg png and gif to the extensions array in image_upload.

title: Tuque tests are failing
description: Sometime after Mar 7th Tuque's tests started failing. https://travis-ci.org/Islandora/tuque/builds/116714896 started green but was re-ran as a test and is now red.  The usual cause of this is something changing on Travis's end, but it could be anything we rely on. The goal of this ticket is to analyze this and fix it.  As per usual I don't think this should block any tickets but devs are cautioned to take extra care with merges.  It may be advisable to run the tests locally.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Submit a non breaking change and see all your tests fail.        --Test Case--  Submit a non breaking change and see your tests pass.    ----  William Panting  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Allow Solr sort block to work on collections

title: Whitelist allowed DOI types as opposed to blacklist

There are other types that would be unsupported as we only handle journals and journal articles as of current. Move this to a whitelist instead.    --Steps to Reproduce--  Import the DOI 10.1117/12.2197868  Note that PHP whitescreens with a SimpleXML error.    --Test Case--  Import the DOI 10.1117/12.2197868  Note that instead a drupal_set_message is displayed and no import / PHP error takes place.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Excluding a date facet does not render in breadcrumbs with warning
description: When executing a negative search triggered via a date facet the value for the field isn't rendered.    --Steps to Reproduce--    -Navigate to the Solr settings page (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings)  -Click Facet settings  -Add a range facet of type _dt, a date (for example: mods_originInfo_dateIssued_dt)  -Do not use the date range slider.  -Search for anything  -Click the minus facet link  -Note a warning is thrown and the label displaying the facet isn't rendered beside the (x).

title: Whitelist Embargo Roles
description: This actually already has a pull in place:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/pull/232    Currently, there's no way to add a role to the embargo administrators and ensure that it propagates to new objects. There's no way to update old embargoed items when adding new roles either.    The purpose of this is to establish a subset of embargo administrator roles that automatically get added to embargoed items, and to allow for a way (drush and interface) to update currently-embargoed items with this functionality.    -Test Case-    There's a fairly solid test case on the pull request.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Select to display parent or child metadata
description: Currently compound objects display the children's metadata and not the metadata for the parent. It would be a great add on feature to allow users to select whether to show only the parent's metadata or the children's metadata if this is possible.

title: Pathauto should allow for tokens taken from datastreams.
description: There's a limitation in islandora pathauto that prevents it from being extended to use values of datastream elements in the url aliases.     This limitation is caused by a workaround for ISLANDORA-1073  - i.e. when the label is updated, we have to mock up a fake object to get the tokens from because in all the applicable islandora hooks, $object->label still has the old value. Because of this, datastreams are not accessible when an update to the object triggers an update to the aliases.    workaround here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_pathauto/blob/b4b6a882d29e8f9dc8681b8ea830fd3c1a882f54/islandora_pathauto.module#L122-L134    If we make a more thorough fake object, then it will be trivial to extend islandora_pathauto and make tokens (ie URL components) based on datastream values.

title: Improve breadcrumbs for MODS datastream replace/revert screens
description: When replacing or reverting datastream versions, the user is taken to a new screen (rather than the overlay). The breadcrumbs provided only link to "Home" and not to the datastream's parent object, making navigation inconvenient - particularly when working several child collection layers down.    Proposal is to add breadcrumb links to the View page for the related object (and its parent collections), so that the user can return easily to work.    Issue found in production repository, duplicated in Vagrant.

title: islandora_oai errors when set/collection contains approx. 50 sub-collections (current working theory)
description: Example URL:  http://goldmine.uncc.edu/oai2/oai2?verb=ListRecords&metadataPrefix=mods&set=motorsports_1    We've been continually adding records to the above collection, then requesting harvesting from DPLA.    We now have approximately 2776 records in the set in question, and now islandora_oai is throwing error:    {code}  <error code="noRecordsMatch">  The combination of the given values results in an empty list.  </error>  {code}    In Drupal's php logging, we see the error as:    {code}  Warning: Invalid argument supplied for foreach() in islandora_oai_retrieve_records_or_identifiers() (line 313 of /documentroot/sites/all/modules/islandora_oai/includes/handler.inc).  {code}    In Fedora.log, we're seeing a warning:    {code}  WARN 2016-05-31 15:38:05.095 [pool-8443-8] (TuplesOperations) Found an empty Tuples with bound variables  {code}      *Smaller sets, containing less objects, do not exhibit the issue.*    Looking for more ways to debug this issue...  I will also reach out to any heavy OAI users and ask if they've seen anything like this.    More experiments are needed...    Update:  No apparent errors when OAI'ing each of the sub-collections contained within the parent collection.

title: PREMIS tab displays, but not the content when permission is not assigned
description: I noticed that in one of our systems we've got PREMIS enabled, but only have permission to view/manage assigned to the administrator role.     When I'm logged in as a user with an authenticated role without PREMIS permissions, I see the PREMIS tab, but it doesn't get populated.  Ideally a user without the PREMIS permissions wouldn't see the tab.   Is a small thing, but wanted to document it.  dm

title: Updates for MODS version
description: We made this change to our production server and thought the community might find it useful.     Islandora uses a fairly small number of XSL transforms for converting DC to MODS and vice versa, in addition to other transforms. Unfortunately, the small number of transforms tend to get duplicated across modules.    Example problems include  empty dc:subject elements in the OAI DC  empty dc:subject elements in the DC datastream  duplicated dc:date elements      May need to add this file to the following modules as well to operate without errors:  utkdigitalinitiatives/islandora_batch  utkdigitalinitiatives/islandora_importer  utkdigitalinitiatives/islandora_oai    Pull Request: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_batch/pull/83

title: Add hook to replace breadcrumb generation code
description: The breadcrumbs are currently generated only off of the Resource Index, it would be nice to allow users the option of switching out the core process with a custom one.    This work would add a hook much like the one used in the Basic Collection display. Modules could implement the hook and then the admin screen would give the user a place to select one of the available options.     The current method would remain as the default and fallback method for breadcrumbs.

title: Documentation Improvements
description: Added "module" text to Installation section    Rearranged for workflow:  Folder description before the preprocessing steps. It seemed odd to start processing before the folder structure was even known.     Added 2 examples with additional information on datastream options      Used the Drush command example syntax from Book Solution Pack for consistency  `drush -v --user=admin` vs `drush -v --user=admin`    Pull Request: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_book_batch/pull/59

title: SPARQL Queries do not declare the XSD namespace
description: Due to Mulgara's [automatic definition of the XSD namespace|https://github.com/quoll/mulgara/blob/master/src/jar/query/java/org/mulgara/query/rdf/XSDAbbrev.java#L25:L26], SPARQL queries in a number of places reference XSD without defining it causing issues when switching to a different triplestore, like Fuseki.    This is potentially part of a larger issue in the way namespaces are handled, as the core fedora namespaces (fedora-model, fedora-view, fedora-rels-ext) are also presumed to be defined at the triplestore level.
component: Scholar Module,Tuque API,Video Solution Pack,Web ARChive Solution Pack,XACML Editor

title: Embargo predicates missing from ontology
description: Objects with embargoes from Islandora Scholar have extra RDF metadata in their RELS-EXT datastream (for object embargoes) or RELS-INT datastream (for datastream embargoes). This extra data in is the "islandora-embargo" namespace:    xmlns:islandora-embargo="info:islandora/islandora-system:def/scholar#"    and has the following predicates (identical whether in RELS-EXT or RELS-INT):    If embargo is indefinite:  <islandora-embargo:embargo-until>indefinite</islandora-embargo:embargo-until>    If embargo has expiry date:  <islandora-embargo:embargo-until rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2020-01-22T05:00:00Z</islandora-e  mbargo:embargo-until>    <islandora-embargo:embargo-expiry-notification-date rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime">2020-01-12T05:00:00Z</islandora-embargo:embargo-expiry-notification-date>    XACML in the POLICY datastream actually enforces the embargoes, and I assume that this "islandora-embargo" sub-ontology was created so that embargoed objects could be retrieved via SPARQL.    Since this very specifically Islandora, but not specifically from http://islandora.ca/ontology/relsint# or /relsext#, should it be included in the Islandora Ontology repo? Maybe have its own islandora_ontology/scholar.rdf file?    I'd defer to Nick or Rosie on how/if to include this since they set up the ontologies repo.

title: Pathauto doesn't honour namespace restrictions
description: If you have namespace restrictions enabled, when you bulk-update Islandora Pathauto aliases, it will find objects in Fedora that match the selected content model which are in a forbidden namespace. This is often not an issue unless you have aliases that may overlap, then your desired alias *may* end up with a -0 behind it (to uniqueify it in the case where the undesired alias was created first).

title: hook_islandora_scholar_embargo_users_to_notify_alter is undocumented
description: {{islandora_scholar_embargo_users_to_notify}} [implements an alter|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/25a8b1a248b5d018366832f48471f1584cd50869/modules/islandora_scholar_embargo/islandora_scholar_embargo.module#L354] that doesn't show up in the [.api.php|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/25a8b1a248b5d018366832f48471f1584cd50869/modules/islandora_scholar_embargo/islandora_scholar_embargo.api.php]. This is actually a decently useful alter, because it [directly informs|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/25a8b1a248b5d018366832f48471f1584cd50869/modules/islandora_scholar_embargo/islandora_scholar_embargo.module#L471] the users that are added to embargoes when they are created, and can be used to alter in users that should always be whitelisted, or alter out users that should never be added to an embargo (e.g., anonymous users).    We should document this in the .api.php    We should also document in the .api.php that both this alter and the hook itself inform the user whitelist

title: Implement alt tags on Collections Thumbnails
description: For accessibility reasons, collection thumbnail images should have alt tags included in order to allow sites to pass accessibility checks such as achecker.ca

title: Fields from Solr intermittently not accessible to Views
description: This problem manifests itself in two ways: 1) Solr fields are not showing up for admnistrative users when they try to add a field to a View using the Views GUI and 2) when the view is executed (e.g. block or page is rendered to end user), Solr fields are dropped from the View resulting in a bad handler error message and in cases where the field is configured as sortable, a WSOD to the end user    Tricky thing is that both manifestations of the problem are intermittent and difficult to reproduce. But, I am not the only person to see them. [~rosiel] has also seen it happen and may be able to provide some additional detail that may help track down the issue.

title: Allowing the inclusion of HLS library for Videojs
description: Adding an admin form option to add the HLS library for Video.js.     --Use Case--  This will allow users to use the HLS library for Video.js, refer to: https://github.com/videojs/videojs-contrib-hls      --Technical Approach--  A checkbox will confirm that the user has the videojs-contrib-hls.js file in the video-js file or let them know where they can find it. The js file will then be added and give the user the ability to use HLS videos.     --Test Case--  An ingested HLS video plays correctly using the video.js player.     --Impact--  New version added has been tested, things seem sound.     ----  Kylea Jackson  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Vagrant Build Failing
description: Islandora_vagrant & Islandora_vagrant_base_box pull request are failing due the 'build' submodule.     Note:  Linting: Scripts folder    Pull Requests:  https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_vagrant/pull/105  https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_vagrant_base_box/pull/15

title: Large multi-object updates overwhelm MySQL and break Solr index in multisites
description: This problem cropped up when using the Find/Replace module, but according to discoverygarden seems like it would occur with any bulk update to the repository.    After a minor update to the MODS datastreams on several hundred objects at once, Solr metadata disappeared from many objects in Browse mode - both within the set of modified objects and outside it.    discoverygarden looked into the problem and gave the following diagnosis:  bq. We've narrowed the problem down to the MySQL database connections. Fedoragsearch (application that handles updating Solr) was set to multithreaded. We believe the multithreading was overwhelming the database during the full re-index and so the process was failing part way through. We've disabled the multithreading for now (and completed a re-index successfully) and may revisit the issue in the future if the amount of resources on your system changes.  bq. ... (later) ...  bq. The underlying issue is mysql can't handle bulk updates when all the Drupal filters connections are enabled in Fedora. The connections are required for Fedora to authenticate against Drupal; there is a connection for each multisite and Fedora tests each connections for every request it receives.   bq. We were hoping that disabling the Fedoragsearch multithreading would help, but it clearly still fails under mass updates.

title: Update islandora_solr preprocess hooks to use template_preprocess
description: Update islandora_solr preprocess hooks to use template_preprocess so that modules or themes can override default template variables further down the processing chain. An example can be found here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/blob/7.x/theme/theme.inc#L64.

title: Make Embargoes Reference RELS-EXT/RELS-INT Predicates
description: w/r/t:  Discussion occurring on https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_ontology/pull/5  As well as its related ontology ticket https://jira.duraspace.org/browse/ISLANDORA-1727    Embargoes use a custom predicate URI; this seems to have been done with the intent of being able to embargo both datastreams and full objects without having to determine which predicate URI (RELS-EXT or RELS-INT) is appropriate.    This gives us the problem of having an ontology that's a little more fractured than it should be; our ontology would have to reference a custom URI that is only ever used once, and in a situation where existing RELS-EXT or RELS-INT URIs would be more appropriate.    --Technical Approach--  To fix this, we should:    - Modify existing queries that look for embargoes to search in both the RELS-EXT and RELS-INT, or in whichever one is appropriate for the situation.  - Update the embargo applicator so that it assigns the correct predicate based on whether what's being updated is a datastream or a full object  - Create an update hook that searches for embargoes using the old info:islandora predicate and runs the updated embargo applicator on them    This is based on a cursory glance at the module. We should also dig a little further to ensure that nothing else will break.    --Test Case--  This is a little delicate, so we should:    - Test the update hook against a few dozen embargoes of different types  - Test the existing embargo re-applicator against the same  - Test creating embargoes of different types against both objects and datastreams  - Test lifting embargoes  - Test the embargo management UI    --Impact--  We'd be messing with the way that embargoes are generated, so a thorough check of different types of embargoes is critical to ensure that nobody's embargoes are affected.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Co

title: Form builder: Add notification/confirmation after successful save
description: When editing a form, there is no visible evidence that anything happened after clicking the Save button (unless you click the Save and Preview button instead). User has no indication that the form has successfully saved.    Proposing that a notification box appear above the Form Editor window after a successful save, to let users know that their changes will be preserved if they close the window.

title: add custom text for islandora_ip_embargo module
description: Add a new field for custom text to be displayed on embargoed items. Field is to be added to the admin UI (*/admin/islandora/tools/ip_embargo/misc).    --Test Case--  - In the settings UI (/admin/islandora/tools/ip_embargo/misc) supply a value for text and text color and submit.  - Embargo an object with a thumbnail datastream.  - Check to see if overlay text has been updated to supplied values.    ----  Brandon  Junior Application Analyst  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: SleuthKit install Script for Vagrant
description: scripts > sleuthkit.sh    Error on install  {code:java}  ....  guid.cpp: In constructor 'Guid::Guid(const string&)':  guid.cpp:127:7: warning: 'auto' changes meaning in C++11; please remove it [-Wc++0x-compat]         auto byte = hexPairToChar(charOne, charTwo);         ^  guid.cpp:127:12: error: 'byte' does not name a type         auto byte = hexPairToChar(charOne, charTwo);              ^  guid.cpp:128:24: error: 'byte' was not declared in this scope         _bytes.push_back(byte);                          ^  make[3]: *** [guid.lo] Error 1  make[3]: Leaving directory `/tmp/sleuthkit/tsk/auto'  make[2]: *** [all-recursive] Error 1  make[2]: Leaving directory `/tmp/sleuthkit/tsk'  make[1]: *** [all] Error 2  make[1]: Leaving directory `/tmp/sleuthkit/tsk'  make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1  root@islandora:/tmp/sleuthkit# cd /vagrant/  {code}      Seems to be an issue with the head version of sleuth kit.     https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_vagrant_base_box/pull/14#issuecomment-227242934    Pull Request: https://github.com/Islandora-Labs/islandora_vagrant_base_box/pull/16

title: Disabling the collection object count query breaks pagination

Incidentally, checking it doesn't really give the promised performance gain on the collection overview tab either; the query is done regardless and then simply ignored.    *Steps to Reproduce*  # Check off 'Disable object count query in collection view' on a site's admin/islandora/solution_pack_config/basic_collection page  # Check the view page for a collection that would normally page. The pager should be gone.  # Check the management page for a collection, and visit tabs that would page (share/migrate/delete). The pager should be gone.    *Test Case*  # In all the above cases, the pager should be back and functioning correctly.  # A bit more difficult to test, but on the collection management overview page, the performance gain for disabling the count query should be realized.    ----  QA Dan  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Paging broken in book pages tab
