description: We are increasingly using the query processor class to different drive parts of Islandora sites. With the increased use, we need to add a flag of some sort to determine when the class is being used for a user entered search vs a search that is built up programmatically.    eg: Both great improvements, but are in conflict without some type of context variable / property.    Use Solr to get all book pages https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/pull/110/files#diff-2d69368f59ba81d5635cd8274dd66090R115    Clean up user search results by removing book pages  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_paged_content/commit/c53546b5ab94524c84d3b88bd4141a41bcf65aa7#diff-ff086bad41fe27b7e0f46ecb7e377697R262    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Datastream download filenames issue
description: From our staff users the issue of datastream download filenames has come up.  Downloaded datastream files for various objects in the system are all named something like "0001.jpg" which causes confusion.  Specifically, that each downloaded datastream file get filenames that are descriptive.    Since our solution to this issue was developed locally already, I will create a branch and put my code enhancements in there.  This solution introduces a datastream file naming pattern as well as a token handler for datastream objects.

title: Solr display fields - link to search result creates error when field contains a slash
description: When configuring Solr Display Fields (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/settings), the option exists to link the field's content to a Solr search result. If the content of that field includes a slash ("/"), the search result goes to a 400 "Bad request" error.    The slash is not escaped when the search URL is generated, resulting in this bad request.  Example: the Genre field with content "Dissertation/thesis" goes to the following search result: /islandora/search/mods_genre_mt%3A%22Dissertation%5C/thesis%22    Note the slash in %22Dissertation%5C/thesis%22.    The search works if the / is replaced by ~slsh~ manually.    This bug was tested and confirmed in Vagrant.

title: Tag Field Encodes Twice Instead of Once
description: Islandora XML Forms Introduces unnecessary escaping for the tag field.    Steps to Reproduce:  1) Islandora edits an Object's MODS Datastream.   2) Change a Subject Topic to something with an ampersand.   3) Save the record.   4) Edit the record again. The ampersand is now HTML encoded as & Subsequent saves will double encode the character.

title: Retroactive checksum application times out on very large collections
description: While Islandora Checksum technically applies retroactive checksums using the Drupal Batch API, it doesn't actually batch through them - meaning that it gathers a complete list of items to apply checksums to, and applies them in a single batch definition. This causes timeouts or memory limits to be reached on exceptionally large collections.    *Steps to Reproduce*  With checksumming enabled, retroactively apply checksums to a collection with a massive number of objects. If the amount of time it takes to retroactively apply checksums is greater than PHP's max execution time, the batch will time out and fail. If the size of the batch definition array is greater than PHP's memory limit, it can also be expected to fail.    *The fix*  To fix, we should apply checksums in batch chunks of, say, 10. We should also create a drush script that uses this functionality; that way, we can take advantage of Drush's Batch API magic. We should also complete ISLANDORA-1660 in conjunction with this; the extra time it takes to generate checksums due to derivative generation and hook firing is negatively impacting the amount of time the retroactive batch takes.

title: Allow Checksum Checker queries to target datastreams, lastModifiedDates
description: Currently, Islandora Checksum Checker's RI query to get objects grabs every object, and does so in order of createdDate. While this is functional, it may target objects that have no datastreams to be checked, lessening the efficiency of each cron run. Additionally, by using object createdDates instead of datastream lastModifiedDates, we may not be checking checksummed datastreams that have recently been modified.    **Suggested Improvements**  Because Checksum Checker is currently implemented on many sites, the existing query should not be deprecated, as this would cause checks to be re-done on objects where that may not be desirable. We should simply make an additional optional query that can be used.    We should, however, update the existing query to return only objects that have configured datastreams, and update the checksum validator to make use of the optimizations that would come with such a guarantee.

title: Collection Ingest Steps nav leads to incorrect COLLECTION_POLICY
description: Given the situation where the collection object ingest has a step following islandora_basic_collection (the step where one can enter a PID and adjust the collection policy), if you set the collection policy, navigate forward, then navigate back and adjust the collection policy, the resulting collection object's collection policy is as originally selected, not as adjusted.    *Steps to Reproduce*  * Begin a Collection object ingest.  * Adjust the collection policy.  * Go forward to the next step.  * Go back, and make further adjustments to the policy.  * Go forward, completing the ingest.  * Check the Collection - the COLLECTION_POLICY reflects the original selection, rather than the changes selected when going back and forward.    *Test Case*  * Follow reproduction steps as above.  * Check the Collection and ensure that the COLLECTION_POLICY reflects the last set of selected content models.    ----  Maureen Adams  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Implement page rotate in Bookreader
description: Contributing developer here -- I enhanced the openlibrary Bookreader library (https://github.com/ulsdevteam/bookreader.git) and added a few references in the islandora_internet_archive_bookreader module in order to use the new page "rotate" feature.  I just need an issue key so that I can properly create a fork from the repository and eventually push a change request.

title: Include datastream changes in object modified/derivative hooks
description: There's a long-standing TODO (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora/blob/ab520433c72365b69cfd1804a749e64d27adc853/islandora.api.php#L261) in the Islandora API to pass datastream modified information through to the hook. This information could be further passed through to the derivative generation/alter hooks so they're aware of what parts of a datastream are being modified.    We should do 'er.    **Use case examples**  * Different actions could be taken in a datastream_modified hook based on how the datastream was modified.  * A different derivative generation callback could be applied to a datastream based on, perhaps, a change in mimetype.  * Derivative generation could be shut off in cases where only a label or status or such is being modified.

title: deferDerivatives predicate missing from RELS-EXT ontology
description: Objects with deferDerivatives predicates are missing in the Islanodra RELS-EXT ontology: http://islandora.ca/ontology/relsext#deferDerivatives

title: Drupal 7.5 missing module warning
description: After applying the most recent Drupal 7.5 update, I'm getting a missing module warning [1]. Searching for that module [2] let me to islandora_xml_forms [3]. Not sure if that value is correct or what it should be, but anything I try doesn't seem to make the warning go away. Any thoughts? [1] The following module is missing from the file system: schema _api. In order to fix this, put the module back in its original location. For more information, see the documentation page. bootstrap.inc:1128 [2] sites/all/modules/islandora_xml_forms/api/schema/Extension.inc:module_load_include('inc', 'schema _api', 'Any'); [3] https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x/api/schema/Extension.inc#L9

title: Part should be inside relatedItem in default citation MODS form
description: I think the <part> element should be moved inside the <relatedItem> element in the default citation MODS form.    An example journal article can be found at https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/userguide/examples.html#journal_article. I think it would be preferable to have the form default to this.    If others agree, I can make the change to the form supplied with the Scholar module.    I also asked the question in the Google Group: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/wHZB0KirHIA

title: CModel Naming Consistency
description: # Collection Policies naming convention has 3 options which makes running drush commands frustrating.  sp_NAME OR NAMECModel OR sp_NAME_cmodel    ## List of CModel(s)  * sp_pdf (suggesting pdfCModel)  * entityCModel  * bookCModel  * newspaperCModel  * eventCModel  * placeCModel  * personCModel  * newspaperPageCModel  * sp-audioCModel  * sp_disk_image (suggesting diskImageCModel)  * newspaperIssueCModel  * sp_videoCModel (suggesting videoCModel)  * collectionCModel  * pageCModel  * sp_basic_image (suggesting basicImageCModel)  * organizationCModel  * sp_web_archive (suggesting webArchiveCModel)  * compoundCModel  * sp_large_image_cmodel (suggesting largeImageCModel)  * citationCModel  * thesisCModel    I don't mind putting in the work for this but I want to know if the community would want this? Should a alias be set up to allow the original 'sp_NAME' and a new value 'nameCModel' to help avoid breaking scripts?
component: Audio Solution Pack,Basic Image Solution Pack,Disk Image Solution Pack,Large Image Solution Pack,PDF Solution Pack,Video Solution Pack,Web ARChive Solution Pack

title: PDFs appear blurry in PDF.js viewer
description: Using the attached file, the viewer blurs the PDF. Updating to the latest release (v1.4.20) resolves the issue.    *Steps to Reproduce*  Install and enable the PDF.js viewer  Ingest attached PDF  View PDF in PDF.js viewer    *Test Case*  Remove old version of PDF.js library  Update the Islandora PDF.js module to include this PR  Run drush pdfjs-plugin to install the new version  The rendered PDF should now be clear and not blurry    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Remove the BOM from CSLDateparser.php
description: The first three bytes of CSLDateparser.php (https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_scholar/blob/7.x/modules/citeproc/includes/CSLDateparser.php) are a little-endian byte-order marker. When the file is loaded, this marker is appended to the start of PHP's output buffer.    This is largely benign for a number of reasons, but we should get rid of it anyway due to some edge cases: most browsers can deal with it, but in cases where we're doing things like dumping JSON or XML, less-than-stellar parsers might get confused and barf.

title: Add the object's content model to its Manage page
description: An object's Content Model either has to be inferred or found by looking at the RELS-EXT. There is no way to identify it at a glance.    Proposing that the content model be exposed in the Manage tab, under Overview.

title: Datastream versioning: add option to summarize changes
description: On versionable datastreams (e.g. MODS), like with Drupal revisions, add the option to write a summary of changes made. This would make it easier to revert to earlier versions in cases where many revisions have been made.

title: Add validator to Form Builder
description: When saving a Form Builder form, automatically pass the XML to an external validator (http://www.xmlvalidation.com/ or w3schools or whatever) and warn the user if the form contains invalid XML. This will save a lot of time and errors.

title: Add Edit option for Associations in Form Builder
description: Form Builder Associations can only be created or deleted - there's no Edit button (for cases where you want to change the label field, transform file, etc). If you want to change your association, you need to delete and recreate.    Proposing to add an Edit option (set above Delete in the Options column) so that the association can be updated instead of just deleted.

title: Share/Migrate Object Drop-down menu for target collection should be moved
description: The drop-down menu for target collection when sharing or migrating is off the screen when you actually click the button to share/migrate, making it very easy to accidentally move objects to whichever collection comes first alphabetically. The iCampBC Admin track agree that it would make more sense to move it to the bottom so that it's visible. Screenshots attached.

title: Next/previous buttons on object view pages
description: Requesting a set of Next Object/Previous Object buttons on object view pages. Buttons would go to the view page of the next object within the current collection, allowing users to browse without going back to the Collection page.    Many requests were made for this feature at iCampBC2016.

title: Scholar profile Departments not respecting namespace restrictions
description: On a multisite with namespace restrictions, scholar profiles within a given namespace show "Other scholars in this department" will show scholars outside of the restricted namespace if those person objects use the same department names.    Example: Cynthia Ross Friedman - tru:76  http://tru.arcabc.ca/islandora/object/tru%3A76  Links to Robert R. McGregor - dc:68    In addition to this person being from outside the restricted namespace, the link goes to an invalid page (because their namespace is restricted).    Module should respect namespace restrictions.

title: Incorrect module_load_include calls for files in islandora_solr module
description: Similar to ISLANDORA-1757, some warnings started popping up with Drupal 7.50 on attempting to load files from a module called {{islandora_solr_search}}.    This has been seen in one place, leading to a quick grep through the code. Affected are:  # {{islandora_solr_metadata}} and  # {{islandora_solution_pack_entities}}    h3. Steps to Reproduce    # {{islandora_solr_metadata}}  ## Either add a new field to an existing configuration or hitting {{Save configuration}} should cause it to attempt the {{module_load_include()}} call with the incorrect module name.  # {{islandora_solution_pack_entities}}  ## Haven't dug too deep, but appears to manifest when hitting the [{{islandora/entities/search/%}}|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/7.x/islandora_entities.module#L40-L47] endpoint... but some quick searches do not turn up where it might be used... Could be cruft? Appears to expect a {{GET}} like: {{islandora/entities/search/\[type\]?entities_query=\[query\]}}, where [{{\[type\]}} is one of four|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_entities/blob/418e8a020ddd514f56dbfd3550154b9d1e6deee6/includes/callbacks.inc#L23-L26], and query is a number of terms to query against the configured {{islandora_entities_query_field}} (referring to the Drupal variable).    h3. Test Case    Warnings about a missing module named {{islandora_solr_search}} are not reproduced when running with Drupal 7.50.    ----  Adam Vessey  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Multivalued empties not omitted
description: If a Solr field is multivalued and all values are empty, the "Omit Empty Values" setting is not omitting the field.    *Steps to Reproduce*  - Using a basic image object, replace the DC datastream with the attached DC XML.  - Enable Solr metadata  - Enable "Omit Empty Values" (admin/islandora/search/islandora_solr/metadata)  - Create a Solr metadata profile  - Add basic image content model to profile  - Add dc.relation to profile (assuming you're using https://github.com/discoverygarden/basic-solr-config)  - View the object you replaced the DC datastream on and you will see "dc.relation:" displayed as a label with no value      *Test Case*  - Follow steps to reproduce  - With the attached pull request implemented on your server, you should not see "dc.relation:" displayed in the metadata of the object you replaced the DC datastream on because it is empty.    *Pull Request*  https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_metadata/pull/45  ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Provide admin option to set Luke timeout
description: The timeout on the HTTP request to query Solr's Luke interface is hard-coded to 45 seconds, with the accompanying inline comment:        // Need to set a timeout greater than the default 30 seconds as some indexes      // could contain a lot of fields and the Luke needs longer to respond in      // kind.    We should provide an admin option to allow setting this timeout higher, for very large sites.

title: Collection object isMemberOf itself causes spiralling Solr failures
description: If a Collection object is given the RELS_EXT isMemberOf itself, it causes serious problems with Solr. It throws the collection search graph process into a tailspin and causes the re-indexing process to fail, leaving Solr errors scattered throughout the repository.    This happened on our live site, using some hours to get to the bottom of it.    Proposing that users be blocked from making a collection a member of itself. Perhaps a check when the relationship is set to make sure that the isMemberOf relationship is not to itself, failing and returning the error message, "A collection cannot be a member of itself" or something to that effect.

title: Collection object isMemberOf itself causes infinite loops
description: If a Collection object is given the RELS_EXT relationship isMemberOf itself, it causes infinite loops, evidenced in the breadcrumbs generated on such an object.    Example: collection object "Newsletter Archives" was (accidentally) made a member of itself, resulting in this set of breadcrumbs:  "Home   Browse all collections   ...   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives   Newsletter Archives"    Possible that the issue may also crop up with less direct relationships, such as an opject pointing at an ancestor which points at a descendant.    This looping relationship issue could have larger implications than breadcrumbs depending on settings - see ticket #1774, where the looping causes a Solr crash.    Proposing that users be blocked from making a collection a member of itself. Perhaps a check when the relationship is set to make sure that the isMemberOf relationship is not to itself, failing and returning the error message, "A collection cannot be a member of itself" or something to that effect.

title: Inactive objects show same error as active objects with indexing problems
description: When viewing an inactive object (as an administrator), the object looks no different from an active object when Solr is having problems. You see the object as normal, and in the metadata display area you get the error:  "Document not present in Solr while generating the metadata display for [PID]. Try reloading the page, or contact an administrator if this issue persists."    Because Solr problems are not uncommon, there should be a quick way to differentiate inactive objects from regular objects experiencing indexing problems.    Proposing a Drupal message at the top of the page when viewing any inactive object, saying something to the effect of, "This object is inactive and is not currently indexed by Solr."

title: Save Configuration prompt
description: Hi there, I wonder if Islandora could use a mechanism to prompt users to save their configurations before exiting the configuration window. It could be a reminder window popping up after users click on the X. Sometimes it's easy to forget to do so and then wonder why the configuration is still the same. Thank you for considering.

title: "Sort field for collection query" causes errors, empty collection display
description: Adding a field to the "Sort field for collection query" option in the collection SP, or at the collection level in the collection's "Set Solr Sort String" tab, causes the collection display to show no results and the following error messages to appear:    *  Error searching Solr index "400" Status: Bad Request  *   Warning: array_map(): Argument #2 should be an array in islandora_solr_islandora_basic_collection_backend_callable() (line 409 of /var/www/drupal/sites/all/modules/islandora_solr_search/includes/utilities.inc).    I've tried using "mods_originInfo_dateIssued_dt" and "mods_originInfo_dateIssued_t" as sort fields, and all objects in the collection have these fields.    I've seen this on the Vagrant and on our production server as well. Dumping out the $qp variable in line 409 of the cited file looks like:    {noformat}  IslandoraSolrQueryProcessor Object  (      [solrQuery] => RELS_EXT_isMemberOf_uri_ms:("info:fedora/islandora:sp_basic_image_collection" OR "islandora:sp_basic_image_collection") OR RELS_EXT_isMemberOfCollection_uri_ms:("info:fedora/islandora:sp_basic_image_collection" OR "islandora:sp_basic_image_collection")      [internalSolrQuery] =>      [solrStart] => 0      [solrLimit] => 12      [solrDefType] =>      [solrParams] => Array          (              [facet] => true              [facet.mincount] => 2              [facet.limit] => 20              [facet.field] => Array                  (                      [0] =>                  )                [fq] => Array                  (                      [0] => -RELS_EXT_isConstituentOf_uri_mt:[* TO *]                      [1] => RELS_EXT_isViewableByUser_literal_ms:"admin" OR RELS_EXT_isViewableByRole_literal_ms:"authenticated user" OR RELS_EXT_isViewableByRole_literal_ms:"administrator" OR ((*:* -RELS_EXT_isViewableByUser_literal_ms:[* TO *]) AND (*:* -RELS_EXT_isViewableByRole_literal_ms:[* TO *]))                  )                [sort] => mods_originInfo_dateIssued_dt          )        [islandoraSolrResult] =>      [display] => default      [internalSolrParams] => Array          (          )        [differentKindsOfNothing] => Array          (              [0] =>              [1] => %20              [2] => %252F              [3] => %2F              [4] => %252F-              [5] =>          )    )  {noformat}    The array member "islandoraSolrResult" is the "Argument #2" mentioned in the array_map() warning. As you can see, it's empty in this dumped IslandoraSolrQueryProcessor.

title: Form Builder Installs Fails on Ubuntu 16.04 with MySQL 5.7
description: For context, see: https://groups.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/islandora/ihY1xM-iWs4/U7XBCDpSBgAJ    Ubunt u16.04 ships with MySQL 5.7 which has stronger data integrity constraints.  This means that hook_install fails for xml_forms, and possibly for other modules as well.    We need to audit other install files as well, and consider the ramifications of an update hook, if it entails editing constraints on primary keys.

title: Display "This Object is Inactive" for inactive objects
description: Administrative users should be notified if an object is inactive when viewing.

title: Links for multi-strings values link ONLY to first string value's object
description:
In the Solr Index section of admin config, when the default display settings are configured for a Solr field that is actually a multi-string value, and that field's Linking is configured as "Link this field to the object's page.", it should probably link each results string from the array to the object behind it. For example, in our implementation, we allow an object to be related to more than one collection. So, our Solr field RELS_EXT_isMemberOfCollection_uri_ms will store these relationship. We are expecting to see multiple links, but the result is that both collection names are wrapped with a link to only the first collection's object_url. Additionally, it also seems that the link is made to the object behind the search result -- while the related field value points to another object in the system. This may be outside of the scope of this issue, but an additional option to "Link to URL alias that matches field's original value." would be perfect - and to have the option to override the displayed text by displaying a related field's value. In the search results, the link we currently see for an object that has more than one collection: {{info:fedora/pitt:collection.3, info:fedora/pitt:collection.6 }} What we expect to see for that same object (at least to address the Bug aspect of this ticket): {{info:fedora/pitt:collection.3 info:fedora/pitt:collection.6}} Optimally, (if all configuration options are added for the new link target and optional field to override the link text (in this example with fgs_label_s)) we'd hope to see: {{Pitt Publications
Pitt Nationality Rooms}}

title: Duplicate variable
description: We have a variable here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_oai/blob/634c86e1a78cd7167e705d07bb1ec770fd12d5b1/includes/handler.admin.inc#L42-L48    Which is a duplication of a variable in a parent, required module (islandora_solr_search) here:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_solr_search/blob/7.x/includes/admin.inc#L603-L611    This variable is only currently used in one place:    https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_oai/blob/848e60e34040489a9a1b88e3d62c763c0761271a/includes/handler.inc#L426    There doesn't seem to be any special reason why the islandora_solr version of the variable couldn't be used here.    We should put this variable through a deprecation cycle and move over to using the islandora_solr variable.

title: Race condition when parallel ingesting with XML Sitemap
description: Originally found by [~jordandukart]    When running parallel ingests (e.g., using GNU parallel), It's possible to encounter a race condition where Islandora XMLSitemap attempts to add a sitemap entry using the same ID twice.    This is because IDs in the sitemap table don't auto-increment, and so an ID is generated by +1ing the max sitemap ID. When ingesting in parallel, this can result in the same ID being grabbed at the same time. (see code here: https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xmlsitemap/blob/7.x/includes/utilities.inc#L67-L73).    We should make ID-generation safe.

title: Pass form state through to export callbacks for Bookmark
description: Pass the form_state through to the callbacks for exporting items from a Bookmark list.    --Use Case--  As a developer I want the ability to extend the export functionality of Bookmark with more options than the vanilla export formats allow for (array of PIDs and optionally a style for citation export).    It's possible to form_alter the Solr results and Bookmark form to include additional UI options for the user to select from. The form_state is than required in the callback execution to grab the user choices.    --Technical Approach--  Pass through the form_state in the listing of parameters to call_user_func_array.    --Test Case--  Use an export from Bookmark, Scholar or any other implementation. Export happens as expected.    --Impact--  None. By appending the form_state as the last parameter the existing exporters that rely on the current function signature (Scholar) are not effected.    ----  Jordan Dukart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: update_7001 throws SQL error
description: When updating from 7.x-1.6 to 7.x-1.7, the islandora_solr_update_7001 tries to create the new "islandora_solr_collection_sort_strings" table. This table has "not_null" instead of "not null" and therefore causes the error.    SQLSTATE[42000]: Syntax error or access violation: 1171 All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead    and the update fails

title: Move BagIt's plugins to Drupal filesystem, so customized files can survive module upgrade
description: islandora_oai's request handler uses a "File Management" method which leverages Drupal's filesystem.      islandora_oai uses the following Drupal filesystem directory to store transformation files:    sites/default/files/islandora_oai_xsls    This strategy enables islandora_oai's transformations to survive when the module code is completely updated, because the transformations are not stored within the module's files.    BagIt's internal file storage:  islandora_bagit/plugins

title: Fix default collection image for WARC SP
description: The default image for the Web Archive Solution Pack demo collection has never worked, as far as I can tell. Which doesn't really hurt anything, but we might as well fix it so it matches the other standard SPs.

title: Clean-up Islandora Ontology namespace declarations
description: None

title: Solr nav - stop storing qp object in session
description: Storing the qp object for Solr nav in the session was causing some major db issues.     --Steps to Reproduce--  A bit hard to reproduce since it was a bot indexing a site which caused the issue, but essentially the db session table was growing out of control when a bot was hitting the islandora/search end point.        --Test Case--  - enable solr navigation under solr settings  - place the solr nav block in a region of the site  - perform a solr search  - view an object from the search  - the prev / next / return to search links in navigation block should do exactly what they say. (this pr doesn't introduce any new functionality)    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: Add option to delete ingested objects on batch set
description: This adds a new option to batch sets to delete objects ingested via the batch process.    --Use Case--  Previously, if you wanted to delete all objects ingested via a batch set, you have to do it individually. With the new option, you can remove them all with one click.    --Technical Approach--  We're using a batch to delete all the items in a batch set. :)    --Test Case--  - Create / preprocess a batch using one of the many options. (zip, book, newspaper, etc.)  - Ingest said batch using drush or UI  - After the batch is completely ingested, select "Delete ingested objects" from set menu  - Verify objects are delete by clicking on the PID in the batch set list    ----  Nelson Hart  Developer  discoverygarden inc. | Managing Digital Content

title: "Invalid clip parameters passed" error if base URL path of site is a sub directory
description: Clipper functionality throws an "Invalid clip parameters passed" error if the base URL path of your site is a sub directory.   For example:  http://www.yourdomain.com/siteA/  http://www.yourdomain.com/siteB/  ...  See  https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/islandora/zUjC2xvWWEc  for previous discussion.

title: Solr Search creates breadcrumbs when islandora_render_drupal_breadcrumbs not set
description: In the islandora_solr_search/includes/results.inc function displayResults, it always calls the setBreadcrumbs() method regardless of the Islandora configuration.    It should check the value of "Render Drupal breadcrumbs" (drupal get/set variable name: islandora_render_drupal_breadcrumbs) before creating any breadcrumbs.    Sorry, but I can not say whether or not this is fixed in latest version since it is really not convenient for me to test this in other versions.

title: Download/print button for Large Image CModel
description: There is no link to download or print a complete Large Image via the normal ways a user might view the object. No Download or Print link is available on the object View page.    See this old discussion on the forum: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/islandora/2HDiwzMMYv8/discussion     Requesting an (optional?) Download link to appear above or below the viewer.

title: XSL transform silently swallows errors when reading xslt documents
description: [This code block|https://github.com/Islandora/islandora_xml_forms/blob/7.x-1.7/builder/xml_form_builder.module#L600-L607] does not trap for errors that come from reading the XSLT document:    {code}    if ($transform_path) {      $xsl = new DOMDocument();      $xsl->load($transform_path);      $xslt = new XSLTProcessor();      $xslt->importStyleSheet($xsl);      $document = $xslt->transformToDoc($source_document);      return $document;    }  {code}    The [PHP Manual|http://php.net/manual/en/xsl.examples-errors.php] has a recommended way of trapping these errors:    {code}  libxml_use_internal_errors(true);  $result = $xsl->importStyleSheet($xsldoc);  if (!$result) {      foreach (libxml_get_errors() as $error) {          echo "Libxml error: {$error->message}\n";      }  }  libxml_use_internal_errors(false);  {code}    This manifests itself as a failed call to saveXML because $document is effectively empty.  A cut-down stack trace:    {{PHP Fatal error:  Call to undefined method stdClass::saveXML() in /var/www/drupal/docroot/sites/all/modules/islandora_contrib/islandora_xml_forms/builder/xml_form_builder.module on line 630, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE  PHP Stack trace:, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE  PHP   1. {main}() /var/www/drupal/docroot/index.php:0, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE  ....  PHP   8. xml_form_builder_datastream_form_metadata_form_submit() /var/www/drupal/docroot/includes/form.inc:1519, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE  PHP   9. xml_form_builder_update_object() /var/www/drupal/docroot/sites/all/modules/islandora_contrib/islandora_xml_forms/builder/includes/datastream.form.inc:184, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE  PHP  10. xml_form_builder_update_metadata_datastream() /var/www/drupal/docroot/sites/all/modules/islandora_contrib/islandora_xml_forms/builder/xml_form_builder.module:569, referer: https://librarydams.vagrant/islandora/edit_form/islandora%3A13/PBCORE}}

title: Add local file/PID test for openseadragon admin UI
description: Add a functionality to allow the user to test djatoka against a local free use large image file stored in a new /test directory OR enter in a PID of an existing object stored in the repository. This would act as an alternative for the LOC stable JP2 test.

title: Mysql islandora_solr.install -  $schema['islandora_solr_collection_sort_strings']
description: When running tests for the module - Islandora Solr with Mysql 5.7, the following issue occurs.  I am assuming this issue is isolated to mysql 5.7+ from forum posts similar to this issue.      {code}  PDOException: SQLSTATE[42000]: Syntax error or access violation: 1171 All parts of a PRIMARY KEY must be NOT NULL; if you need NULL in a key, use UNIQUE instead: CREATE TABLE {islandora_solr_collection_sort_strings} ( `collection_pid` VARCHAR(255) DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'The collection PID', `sort_string` MEDIUMTEXT DEFAULT NULL COMMENT 'Sort string for the collection', PRIMARY KEY (`collection_pid`) ) ENGINE = InnoDB DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8 COMMENT 'Table that stores sort strings for collection objects.'; Array ( ) in db_create_table() (line 2720 of /var/www/islandora/includes/database/database.inc). Uncaught exception database.inc 2171 PDOStatement->execute() Exception  {code}    If there are modules that depend on islandora_solr, a general AJAX 200 error may be thrown when running tests for those modules.      The issue is possibly due to the schema definition in islandora_solr.install for islandora_solr_collection_sort_strings.      {code:php}      $schema['islandora_solr_collection_sort_strings'] = array(      'description' => 'Table that stores sort strings for collection objects.',      'fields' => array(        'collection_pid' => array(          'type' => 'varchar',          'length' => 255,          'not_null' => TRUE,          'description' => 'The collection PID Test 1',        ),        'sort_string' => array(          'type' => 'text',          'size' => 'medium',          'not_null' => TRUE,          'description' => 'Sort string for the collection Test2',        ),      ),      'primary key' => array('collection_pid'),    );    {code}    The current definition does state that the primary key should be not null.  However, for some reason the default is being set to be null (as in the error).  Explicitly setting the default to '0' ( 'default' => '0') resolves this issue.

title: Google leads users to OCR datastream, and users are left stranded
description: Labeling this a 'task' since I don't know what else to label it.    Google (and possibly other search engines) indexes newspaper page OCR datastreams, presumably because of the "VIew: Text" link in the newspaper SP's page controls. When a user clicks through from the Google search results, they get to the OCR datastream's content, like http://newspapers.lib.sfu.ca/islandora/object/jwb%3A41722/datastream/OCR/view. Problem is, there is no link from the OCR to the newspaper page's object page. Naive users, by which I mean any user who does not know how to decode Islandora datastream view URLs, are left stranded.    We've had two separate users complain about this. Not sure what to do. If there was a way to add a link to the OCR data on view that would take the user to the full object page, the link wouldn't work anyway since the HTTP Content-Type is text/plain, and browsers don't render markup in content with that content type header.

title: Tesseract was moved to Github. Test scripts depending on former location fail
description: Tesseract project moved from google code to github. Our current test scripts for the newspaper solution pack depend on tesseract. I consequence Travis fails on each pull against this module making our current Release process uncertain.   https://github.com/islandora/islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/blob/7.x-1.8/tests/scripts/tesseract.sh#L11    Solution is simple and a pull against 7.x and 7.x-1.8 will follow.   Probably tesseract's URL will need to be modified also in other modules and maybe in vagrant also(not sure)?

title: MODS extended self cleanup transform does not respect ordering
description: MODS extended self cleanup transform does not respect ordering, in particular for the children of the elements (Version 3.6):    * mods:language  * mods:location  * mods:copyInformation  * mods:name (When using the mods:etal form).  * mods:extent  * mods:cartographics    Reference: https://www.loc.gov/standards/mods/v3/mods-3-6.xsd

title: Travis is failing for PHP 5.3.3 due to PHP_CodeSniffer
description: Some builds are failing in Travis with the error below:    No compatible version of PHP_CodeSniffer was found; you must have 1.3.4 or higher.  Alternatively, you can symbolically link with the following command: sudo ln -sv /home/travis/drupal-7.50/sites/all/modules/coder/coder_sniffer/Drupal  $(pear config-get php_dir)/PHP/CodeSniffer/Standards/Drupal    Seems like we need some additional travis configuration.    Example builds:  https://travis-ci.org/Islandora/islandora_fits/jobs/159343463  https://travis-ci.org/Islandora/islandora_fits/builds/158351188    Compared to other modules that work.  https://travis-ci.org/Islandora/islandora_solution_pack_newspaper/builds/161049947

title: Scholar hard-codes the download link to end in 'citation.pdf'
description: When viewing a citation in Scholar and the PDF is available, the citation that appears (if you have selected a style that shows URL) includes something like:    "Retrieved from http://islandscholar.ca/islandora/object/ir:20242/datastream/PDF/download/citation.pdf"    We don't want every file that users download to be called 'citation (n).pdf', so we've configured the downloaded files to save as [PID]-[DSID].pdf. It has been determined that having a URL ending in "citation.pdf" which downloads a file that is *not* called "citation.pdf" is confusing. We would like to be able to configure what the "canonical download link" to the PDF looks like.

title: Travis failing on pathauto and fits modules
description: Tests are failing in these two modules on PHP 5.3.3 because they use 'drush dcs ...' instead of 'drush coder-review ...' in their travis.yml files.  Try using the 'drush coder-review ...' command from a working module.
